Description: Fermented in large oak barrels and matured on its lees for 12 months, this is an exceptionally rich, textural Pinot Gris boasting integrated accents of toast and vanilla. Yellow apple and pear flavors mingle into a creamy swirl on the palate but are balanced pertly by brisk acidity and a smoky hit of hazelnut on the finish. It's a stately wine that should improve well through 2026.
Name: Franz Keller 2016 Schlossberg Achkarren GG Pinot Gris (Baden)

Description: Elegant and well balanced, this smooth and supple wine has just the right equilibrium between fresh appley flavors, brisk acidity and a good touch of viscosity for a smooth mouthfeel and finish.
Name: Thomas Allen 2017 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Appealing aromas of freshly cut yellow apple and melon lead to full-feeling, plentiful pear flavors. The sense of texture heightens the appeal.
Name: Joleté 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine wraps crisp apple and lemon flavors in a buttery texture that brings in vanilla and nutmeg on the palate and finish. It's a relatively lightweight wine with big flavors that leave a lingering impression.
Name: Boeger 2017 Pinot Gris (El Dorado)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This supple, layered wine offers varietal fruit flavors of apple and pear, but also cuts through the palate with crisp daikon radish, cucumber, celery and cilantro. It's not underripe in any way, but those tart green components lift the finish nicely.
Name: Westmount 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of white peach, lemon balm, citrus and wet stone are followed sleek, citrusy flavors that extend on the long, lemon rind-filled finish. The acid balance kicks it up a notch.
Name: Boomtown 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A pale, pretty light wheat hue, this surprises with exceptional concentration. It's a clean, fruit-driven style, notable for its varietally true scents and flavors of freshly cut pear. A delicate whiff of cinnamon invades the finish; all in all an outstanding bottle.
Name: Kudos 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A spicy wine with fresh flavors of pear, this also carries an unusual whiff of body powder. It's medium in weight and fermented entirely in stainless steel.
Name: Lumos 2017 Logsdon Ridge Vineyard Rudolfo Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pleasantly fruity but rather generic, this all-purpose, everyday white wine may be enjoyed for its balanced flavors of citrus, apple and peach.
Name: Abiqua Wind 2017 Caleb Knorr Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: With a steely nose, this wine becomes lush and voluptuous on the palate, with a medium-bodied take on lemon rind, melon and fleshy guava.
Name: Folie à Deux 2017 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nearly clear in the glass, this bottling smells of bright pear, key lime and a bit of jasmine on the nose. The palate is clean, easy and refreshing, offering simple apple and pear flavors.
Name: Swanson 2018 Pinot Grigio (San Benito County)

Description: Aromas of white flower, peach and tangerine are accented by a whiff of beer hops in this easy-drinking white. It's perfumed aromatics are a touch cloying, but the palate is dry and brisk. Enjoy now.
Name: Landshut 2018 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)

Description: From cantaloupe to green apple to lime, this wine is all about bright fruit, along with some floral characters for good measure. The palate is textural, and the acidity is crisp, offering a mouthwatering sensation. It's screaming to be sipped beside a bowl of Thai curry.
Name: Loveblock 2018 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Showing good character and substance, this medium-bodied wine stands out from the pack of bland Pinot Grigios thanks to its light, earthy aroma. The palate brings full-fledged flavors of white cherry and peach, with hints of flowers that add interest. The texture is firm enough, but also rich and mouthfilling.
Name: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Fresh herbs and fragrant pine aromas lead to a crisp, vivid citrus flavor in this medium-bodied, well-balanced wine. Bright acidity keeps the mouthfeel vibrant while the satisfying fruit and herb flavors linger on the palate.
Name: Brassfield 2017 Pinot Gris (High Valley)

Description: Less rosé-hued than the previous vintage, this Pinot Gris is hard not to like. The highly fragranced nose bursts with aromas of apples, lychees, lime blossoms and a touch of honey. The acidity on the palate is crisp but not searing, balanced by a dry, chalky-textured mouthfeel that finishes with a zing of lime zest that has you reaching for another sip. Drink now.
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2018 The Ned Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This is a ripe, aromatic Pinot Gris that is attractive but feels as though it's spent many hours getting ready for the party. With multiple strains of yeast, full malolactic, lees stirring and other winemaking techniques, it basically has. It's fragrant and buttery, with notes of ripe stone fruit, pear and lemon and a wet stone quality. The palate is viscous in feel, but balanced by lifted acidity and bright fruit.
Name: Jules Taylor 2017 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This is a ripe, off-dry wine that's feeling a little volatile after a few years in bottle. Nevertheless, compared with many of its regional counterparts, there's a fair bit going on. Aromas of fig, peach, melon, almond paste, cloves and salty ocean shell lead into a palate that is slippery and tangy-fruited, a bitter almond note adding interest.
Name: Greywacke 2016 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Copious aromas and flavors of ripe melons, pineapples and pears give this full-bodied wine a lot to like. It is effusive and fruity, not quite sweet but very ripe. The mouthfeel is rich, filling and broad.
Name: Les Belles Collines 2016 Pinot Gris (California)

Description: Medium gold in hue, this is a relatively toned-down Pinot Gris that offers up notes of waxy lemons, yeasty red apples, dried herbs and a touch of honey. The palate is medium bodied and creamy textured with more lemon and honey flavors, accompanied by zippy acidity, however the weightiness feels a little over the top.
Name: Te Pa 2018 Pa Road Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This is a soft and creamy-textured wine, with a mix of light fig, mineral and apple flavors. It's not a fruit bomb, but more of a textural wine that is soothing and easy to enjoy.
Name: Bandit NV Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This wine leads with very fragrant notes of ripe banana, watermelon and red apple that border on being candied. It's likable nonetheless. The palate is textural and fruity, with just enough acidity to prop it up. An easygoing expression of this style.
Name: Mt. Beautiful 2017 Pinot Gris (North Canterbury)

Description: An ultrafragrant Pinot Gris, this wine offers up heady aromas of citrus, guava, pear and peach. The palate is less lifted than the nose, with the fruit sitting a little heavily and wanting more acidity to keep things fresh, and the finish falling on the flat side.
Name: Cottesbrook 2018 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This light-bodied wine is restrained and subtle, starting with a virtually transparent color, then followed by tight apple and pine aromas and tangy, orange-peel and gooseberry flavors. Bolstered with 20% other varieties blended in, this is a refreshing, dry wine.
Name: Leaping Horse 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Concentrated, dry and rather full bodied, this substantive wine offers green-apple and floral aromas, ripe apple and kiwi flavors and a soothing mouthfilling texture.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This wine starts with funky vegetal and nut aromas along with buttered toast. Underneath are tropical, pear and peach fruits, but they're being strong-armed by the reductive notes. The palate is creamy in texture, and the fruit is a touch sour. Still, there's a decent lick of acidity to keep this out of flabby territory. Drink now, but give this time in the glass to blow off and open up.
Name: Wairau River 2015 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This medium-bodied wine is nicely fruity, uncomplicated and easy to sip. It has green-apple aromas, light citrus flavors and a good balance between fresh acidity and ripeness.
Name: Geyser Peak 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This wine comes straight out of the gate with heady notes of ripe peach, pear, grapefruit and honeysuckle, with undertones of ground white pepper and dried herbs. Things go a little flat on the palate. It's an off-dry style, and the sugar sticks out in the form of both sweetness and a viscous texture. It's just barely held up by the acidity, although it could use more. The fruit feels a touch sour on the finish. This would likely improve when well-paired with something like a hard aged cheese.
Name: Giesen 2017 Pinot Gris (New Zealand)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite closed up apple aromas are followed by smoky, medium-bodied flavors. It doesn't all work.
Name: Clone 7 2017 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bold and candy-like wine smells toasty and buttery, tastes like butter and butterscotch and has an earthy edge too.
Name: Eagle Ridge 2017 Private Reserve Estate Grown Pinot Grigio (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An unmistakable aroma of buttered toast marks this full-bodied wine, even before the flavors bring on more toast, light char and a slight astringency in the texture. It makes for a rather severe character overall.
Name: Sera Fina 2017 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Clean, crisp and fresh, this lightly ripened young wine mixes jicama, apple and grapefruit, with a splash of lemon oil. It's an all-around juicy mix of flavors, with good length throughout the expressive finish.
Name: Sarver 2017 Elhanan Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This complex, fruit-driven wine was vinified by the talented Isabelle Meunier at the Carlton Winemakers Studio. Equal notes of apple, pear and grapefruit are annotated with cinnamon spice. The acidity keeps it firm and puts a bit of a sheen on the generous finish.
Name: Lazy River 2016 Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Round and fruity, this spot-on style pushes fresh fruit flavors of golden apple and Bosc pear into the center ring. It's fresh and juicy, unpretentious and ready for immediate enjoyment.
Name: Firesteed 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely light in the glass, this bottling shows tightly wound aromas of grapefruit blossoms, crushed chalk, tangerine pith, wet river stone and sliced pear. The palate offers rounded pear and Gravenstein apple flavors.
Name: Hahn 2017 SLH Pinot Gris (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Description: Hints of honeycomb accent fresh lemon and green apple on the nose here. Dry and medium bodied in style, it's a freshly concentrated white offering crisp pear flavor and sunny squirts of lemon and lime. This is an easy-drinking Pinot Gris with just a hint of grip on the finish. Enjoy now–2021.
Name: Villa Wolf 2017 Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of Key lime pie, candied tangerine and bubblegum are quite joyous on the nose of this wine, which is very light in the glass. It's crisp on the palate and subtle at first until waves of peach and pear flesh slide into the finish.
Name: Hahn 2017 Pinot Gris (Monterey County)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Unusual aromas of lees, mesquite and strawberry lead to medium-bodied fruit and smoke flavors. The smoke influence is intrusive.
Designation: Le Fantôme Sugarloaf Vineyard Rosé of
Name: Finn Hill 2017 Le Fantôme Sugarloaf Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Gris (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: Slight smoke, a touch of sonorous vanilla and lemon brightness on the nose find a very balanced expression on the fresh palate. This is slender but expressive, lemony but round. A rather attractive proposition that rings with bright, lemony freshness and a lovely tinge of smokiness on the finish.
Name: Kracher 2016 Reserve Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Description: A subdued pear juiciness mingles with subtle wood smoke on the nose. The palate is juicier and fruitier than those aromas suggest, but it also has a lovely tiptoe lightness and lemony brightness. This is subtle, light and elegant with a wonderfully juicy finish.
Name: Kracher 2017 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Description: Gentle lemon on the nose has a richer touch of yellow Mirabelle plum. The palate shows real slenderness and juicy, spiky and refreshing lemon. The freshness is cushioned with a little Mirabelle plum juiciness and a lovely phenolic texture. A light, full-flavored and fruity Grauburgunder.
Name: Artisan Wines DI Franz Scheider 2017 Reserve Grauburgunder (Burgenland)

Description: This exceptionally lively, all stainless Pinot Gris has more natural fruit complexity than most unoaked Chardonnays, at half the price. Lime, apple and white peach fruit, along with compelling minerality, make this surefire for seafood, simple poultry and mild cheeses.
Name: Underwood 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Pale gold in color, this wine starts with notes of Band-Aid and menthol. Most of it blows off relatively quickly, however, and to the fore come notes of honeyed apple and pear. The palate is medium to full bodied and creamy, thanks to partial lees stirring. It does border on flabby and weighty, but it's just barely redeemed by a line of acidity. The finish is short and fruity.
Name: Monowai 2016 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a straightforward example of the variety that will appeal to many. It shows broad, simple flavors of apple and pear, but concludes with a bitter sting on the finish.
Name: Kings Ridge 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A simple, straightforward sipper showing bright lemon, peach, ginger and floral notes. The palate is light bodied and fruity, seemingly with a touch of residual sugar to balance the acidity. A refreshing, uncomplicated porch pounder.
Name: Oyster Bay 2018 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vineyard-designated offerings of this variety are an extreme rarity in the state. Citrus, green apple, herb and wilted flower aromas predominate. The palate is light in style, with a textured feel.
Name: Vino 2017 Evergreen Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Ancient Lakes)

Description: This wine offers slightly honeyed tropical and citrus fruits on the nose. The palate adds in biting acidity, a light texture and some heavy fruit.
Name: Oyster Bay 2017 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Description: There are ripe apple, pear and honey aromas here, but they're somewhat masked, seemingly by sulfur. The palate feels equally trodden upon and watery in texture, with some decent acidity, but fruit weight and residual sugar make the wine feel flat and rather two-dimensional.
Name: Fern Ridge 2017 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a simply gorgeous bottle that's loaded with fresh and palate-pleasing flavors of cut pear. Lively acidity with a mix of citrus brings extra life and length, and this will show best if decanted for an hour or two prior to drinking.
Name: Portlandia 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is exuberant in juicy tones of Meyer lemon, peach and wet stone. The medium-bodied palate has a fleshy mouthfeel that will appeal to a wide array of wine lovers.
Name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This 20th anniversary release is a zippy, sassy fruit bomb of a wine. Apple cider, a squirt of grapefruit, and plenty of juicy acidity push the flavors forward and keep the mouthfeel fresh and lively. Drink now–2020.
Name: Carabella 2017 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely ripe flavors of pear and white peach carry a hint of mint. The wine gathers itself into a focused core, buoyed with natural acidity and finishing with a lick of spice.
Name: Sineann 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pinot Gris has been a Lange highlight since the winery was founded in 1987. For the first time, a portion of this vintage was aged in concrete egg. It takes some time to open up, then does so with a burst of a lemon drop flavor. It's a tart and juicy style, with excellent pull through to a long, minerally finish.
Name: Lange 2017 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is best viewed as a rosé, as the three-day cold soak prior to fermentation has pulled a lovely copper color out of the Pinot Gris. It's bright and lively, with spicy cinnamon and a core of baked apple. It lingers nicely, adding pekoe tea and a touch of caramel.
Name: Keeler 2017 Skin Contact Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Here is a very fine example of Oregon Pinot Gris. It pushes fresh apple and pear fruit right down the heart of the palate. It's full bodied and balanced, drinking at its youthful best already.
Name: Cardwell Hill 2017 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bright fruit flavors blend apple and pear with spicy highlights. A hint of lemon rind adorns the finish. All in all, it's a tasty, well-made and totally enjoyable bottle.
Name: Cubanisimo Vineyards 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Some tasters may prefer the Classique to the Reserve, because it's a bit fruitier and more open at first taste. Both are leesy and textural, this one with mineral-drenched flavors of melon and apple. It was fermented and aged in neutral puncheons and stainless steel.
Name: Lange 2017 Classique Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Bright, fresh and balanced, this is a fruity white with bold flavors of baked peach and apricot. A nutty undertone adds a touch of richness and texture.
Name: Benessere 2017 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from a 1979 planting, this crisp, steely wine seems to have been made entirely in stainless steel, to good effect. Stylish apple fruit is highlighted with hints of chervil and parsley, and a twist of lemon peel finishes it off.
Name: Brooks 2017 Brooks Estate Vineyard Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Pinot Gris from the southern region of state can attain a luscious fruitiness not found further north. This excellent wine offers a concentrated Bosc pear flavor that's dappled with cinnamon spice. Any dish featuring pears would be an ideal match.
Name: Earth Song 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: In an outstanding portfolio of crisp, textural 2017 white wines, this is perhaps the most approachable. It's balanced and fresh, though not quite as bitingly tart as the winery's Pinot Blanc, or as crisply defined as the Auxerrois. Nonetheless a fine bottle, with ripe apple and pear fruit in a compact style.
Name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A full, even fleshy wine, which puts a bit of barrel toast (15% was aged in wood) around plump pear fruit. It's well ripened and ready to drink while young and fresh.
Name: Apolloni 2017 L Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Farmed by Dai Crisp (Temperance Hill), this is a soft, lightly oxidized take on Pinot Gris. Round and smooth, with fresh flavors of pear flesh and skin, it carries a hint of cinnamon into the finish.
Name: Brooks 2017 Logsdon Ridge Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A spicy nose with an herbal edge carries a faint impression of petrol, as a Riesling might show. In the mouth the flavors fill in and round out, with sweet pear, white peach, and more of that Germanic hint of petrol. An interesting wine, though done in a style that's atypical for Pinot Gris.
Name: Spindrift Cellars 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Thick, rich and robust in peach, apricot and stone, this is made in a big viscous style with present ripeness.
Name: Andretti 2016 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Solid and expressive, this vintage of Big Fire offers big fruit. Plush pear, apple and peach flavors are underscored by a hint of lime. It's a wine to drink young and slightly chilled.
Name: R. Stuart & Co. 2017 Big Fire Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This tangy, tasty wine will appeal greatly to those who favor highly acidic, lemony whites. The lip-licking acidity conjures up a citrus mix of grapefruit, lemon and orange. It was fermented in stainless and picked at low pH to emphasize the juicy acidity.
Name: Five Fourteen Vineyards 2017 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is quality wine in a can, with no metallic flavor, just pretty, plush flavors of apple, melon and pear. The convenience of cans makes it easy to chill, pack, open and recycle.
Name: Canned Oregon NV Oregon White Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: As with all of the Foris white wines, refreshing minerality and an overall sense of immaculate fruit preservation are foremost. The supporting minerality emphasizes focused flavors of cucumber and jicama through a refreshing finish.
Name: Foris 2017 Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)

Description: Production of this workhorse Pinot Gris tops 66,000 cases, but the quality remains consistently good and the price looks more and more like a bargain as comparable wines creep upward in cost. Precisely layered flavors of apple, pear and white melon comprise the palate, with a gentle touch of spice.
Name: A to Z 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This widely available wine opens with a burst of spiced pear. The flavors flatten out on the palate, giving a one-dimensional feel to the wine.
Name: Erath 2016 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This was fermented and aged in used oak barrels, counterpointing the ripe tree fruits with hints of toasted coconut. It shows good power and length throughout.
Name: River's Edge 2017 Pinot Gris (Elkton Oregon)

Appellation: Naches Heights, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of slightly overripe apple, pineapple and pear are followed by sweet, rich, drawn-out fruit flavors. The palate is enjoyable, but the aromas don't entirely sync up.
Designation: Late Harvest Estate Dessert Wine Wilridge Vineyard
Name: Wilridge 2016 Late Harvest Estate Dessert Wine Wilridge Vineyard Pinot Gris (Naches Heights)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This new vintage is less ripe than the 2016, and tasted side-by-side with the winery's Rock Point bottling it's almost indistinguishable. It's a simple, easy-drinking example of the variety—fruit-driven with flavors of apple and pear.
Name: Del Rio 2017 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: An easy-drinking wine in a lightly fruity style, this pushes no boundaries, but delivers clean flavors of apple and peach. Taste carefully and you may detect a streak of lemon custard sneaking through the finish.
Name: Cedar + Salmon 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Made by Pacific Rim (now owned by Banfi), this is a serviceable white wine. It's varietally true, displaying tones of crisp apple and pear that finish balanced and clean.
Name: Rainstorm 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Pleasantly fruity, with standard apple and pear flavors, this has not achieved the ripeness of past vintages, and it thins out quickly in the finish. That said, it would be fine with unfussy preparations of seafood and poultry.
Name: Rock Point 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas pop, with notes of orange peel, apple, tropical fruit and peach. Plentiful stone fruit and kiwi flavors follow. It delivers a lot of appeal.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: As before, this was fermented in concrete (dolia is the plural of dolium, a large earthenware vessel used in ancient Rome), but somehow this time the wine has been flattened out. There's a flinty character, and skin flavors more than the flesh of the fruit.
Name: Keeler 2017 Concrete Dolia Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Aromas of mineral and white fruit start this off. The tangy palate shows some zest and pop, while this tastes like citrus, melon and apple. Drink now.
Name: Finca la Celia 2017 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Uco Valley)

Description: Tropical fruit and citrus aromas are light and clean. This Pinot Grigio is a bit low on acidity, while pear, papaya and white pepper flavors veer toward green banana on a soft finish.
Name: François Lurton 2018 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Pinot Gris (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Apolloni produces both a Pinot Gris and a Pinot Grigio. While made of the same grape, they are produced in a different style. This one is done in all stainless, though the differences between the two styles seem to center more on ripeness than on vessel. A light tree-fruit tone shows on the nose and palate, giving this a pleasant, simple nature.
Name: Apolloni 2017 Estate Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)

Description: The aromas are quite light, with notes of herb and apple. Lightly styled guava flavors follow. It comes off as a bit faint, but the palate provides some interest.
Name: Marion-Field 2017 The Marion Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Aromas of citrus blossom, lemon juice and apricot lead you in to flavors of peach, melon and lemon rind. The finish is crisp and clean.
Name: Cramele Recas 2016 Legendary Estate Series Pinot Gris (Romania)

Description: Grass and white fruit aromas lead to a soft, flabby palate that lacks acidity. Flavors of melon and grass finish short.
Name: Argento 2017 Cool Climate Selection Pinot Grigio (Argentina)

Description: This straw-colored Pinot Grigio from Romania has aromas of lemon pith, citrus blossom and apricot. In the mouth there are flavors of lemon-lime, peach and melon before the crisp, clean finish.
Name: Cramele Recas 2016 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Romania)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a simple, one-dimensional expression of the grape. Fruit flavors are generic, barely hinting at apple and grapefruit. The mouthfeel is flat.
Name: Chemistry 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: There are aromas of citrus blossom, white flower and peach in this Romanian Pinot Grigio. On the palate there are flavors of lemon pith and white melon with a crisp finish.
Name: I Am 2017 Pinot Grigio (Romania)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A light straw color, with a flat mouthfeel and bitter skin flavors, this offers little in the way of fruit. It's bone dry, generic and short.
Name: Schmidt 2017 Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Tire rubber aromas are at the fore, follow by notes of stone fruit and pineapple. A smoky palate follows, with mesquite notes on the finish.
Name: Wilridge 2017 Acadia Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a succulent, textured white that's vibrant in tones of Meyer lemon and blood orange. The acidity is lively and refreshing, accentuating the fruit without distraction.
Name: Balletto 2017 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with enticing scents of honeysuckle, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of beeswax. The enveloping palate doles out juicy yellow pear, creamy white peach and a hint of citrus, while a mineral note brightens the finish.
Name: Terlato 2017 Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose of this savory white. Smooth and juicy, the enveloping palate doles out honeydew melon, cantaloupe and baking spice alongside a hint of tangy citrus.
Name: Jermann 2017 Pinot Grigio (Friuli)

Description: This is a fruit-driven drop from one of the coolest and highest altitude subregions in Central Otago. Bright passionfruit, apple, pear, lime popsicle and a floral touch lead into a chalky-textured palate, balanced by focused acidity and rich fruit weight. A clean, juicy, herbal finish makes you want to take another sip.
Name: Valli 2016 Gibbston Vineyard Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Grippy, floral and meaty on the palate in stone fruit and key lime, this is a thirst-quenching, dry and deliciously balanced white that's perfect as an aperitif or at the table.
Name: Thirty-Seven 2016 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Light, soft and creamy on the palate, this wine is richly layered in floral aromas of apple blossom and jasmine. On the palate expect high-toned acidity and lovely flavors of honey, apricot and quince.
Name: Ancien 2017 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Carneros)

Description: This tiny-production dessert wine delights in its richly wound layers of cherry, candied orange and rose. Light orange-pink in color, it invites one in and delivers an intense experience buoyed by impressive underlying acidity.
Name: Keller 2013 Late Harvest Pinot Gris (Petaluma Gap)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Baked pear, yellow apple and mature white peach aromas follow over to the ripe, medium-bodied palate. A ginger note accents the dry, fruity finish.
Name: Alois Lageder 2017 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Here's a big, full-bodied Pinot Grigio that offers aromas and flavors of ripe apple, yellow pear and flinty minerals alongside just enough fresh acidity. It closes on a note of candied tangerine slice.
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2016 Soll Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Bright fresh fruit flavors with some good depth highlight this attractive medium-bodied wine. It balances ripeness with crispness and has a lingering fruity finish.
Name: Mark West 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of pear flesh, citrus skins and creamy white fruit show on the nose of this bottling. Broad flavors of poached pome fruit are cut by tangy grapefruit elements, proving quite complex for an often simple grape.
Name: Bianchi 2017 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Aromas evoking toasted oak and yellow stone fruit mingle with a whiff of crushed rock. The round, brawny palate offers toast, ripe peach, baked apple and tangerine alongside a salty mineral note.
Name: Kurtatsch 2016 Penòner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slightly pink shade of yellow in the glass, this fresh bottling offers aromas of red apple and citrus spray on the nose. The mouthfeel is rounded and smooth, carrying flavors of peach, lime zest and a touch of salinity.
Name: Swanson 2017 Pinot Grigio (San Benito County)

Description: Mouthwatering aromas of baked apple, ripe white peach and Bartlett pear follow over to the juicy palate alongside tangy acidity. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Cantina Riff 2017 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: This is an aromatic style that bursts with exotic notes of lychee, papaya and guava. These tones lead into a creamy mouthfeel that shows some ripness and plenty of fruit weight but doesn't go overboard. Not overly complicated but likable nonetheless.
Name: Maude 2017 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Very fruity and fresh, this light-bodied wine shows vivid floral and apple aromas and flavors. It's attractively clean, snappy and straightforward.
Name: McManis 2017 Certified Sustainable Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Straw colored, this is a rich, full-bodied version of Pinot Gris, with a creamy, buttery top layer taking center stage and just barely making room for the white spice and ripe tropical and stone fruit notes. The palate is equally buttery in texture thanks in part to some leftover residual sugar and rich fruit weight. The acidity is enough to lift the palate but it finishes a little bitter.
Name: Tiki 2017 Maui Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This is a straightforward, aromatic Pinot Gris that offers notes of fresh peach and pear that mingle with flowers and honey. The palate slick in feel and balanced by zippy acidity. It's fruity but still dry and makes a satisfying sipper, despite the alcohol feeling a little biting.
Name: Yealands 2017 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Left for a spell on the skins, this pink-hued Pinot Gris could be easily mistaken for a rosé. Delicate and refreshing, aromas of strawberry, peach and mango follow from the nose to the palate. This is a clean, crisp and highly likable wine.
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2017 The Ned Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: A little oniony, salty and reductive at the start, with some swirls in glass this wine offers delicate aromas of lemon and lime. Typical to this variety and style, its texture is creamy, woven nicely between crunchy—if a little austere—acidity and a salty bitter-almond finish. On the premium end both in price and style, this is one for the dinner table rather than for sipping solo.
Name: Peregrine 2016 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: White spring flower and orchard fruit aromas mingle together in the glass. It's round and juicy, offering mature yellow pear and a hint of banana.
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Lightly scented, this opens with aromas of ripe pear and green apple. The aromas follow over to the soft, juicy palate along with a hint of Alpine herb.
Name: Mezzacorona 2017 Tolloy Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Slightly off-dry in style, this offers heady aromas of waxy lemon, nectarine, flower blossoms and a touch of honey. The residual sugar is subtle, adding more in the way of ripe fruitiness and texture than overt sweetness.
Name: Lawson's Dry Hills 2017 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This is a light, floral white that takes on medium-bodied weight and ripeness on the midpalate. Jasmine and apple highlight a viscous finish.
Name: Etude 2017 Grace Benoist Ranch Pinot Gris (Carneros)

Description: This is reductive at first, masked by onion and plastic aromas. It does blow off with some with time in glass to reveal peach, pear and floral notes. The palate is less weighty than the nose suggests although there's some viscosity to the texture that's nicely balanced by tingly, citrusy acidity.
Name: Te Pa 2017 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Straw colored in the glass, this Pinot Grigio has aromas of citrus blossom, white flowers and lemon rind. In the mouth, there are flavors of green apple, pear and white peach. It is well balanced and has a crisp finish.
Name: Giocato 2017 Pinot Grigio (Goriska Brda)

Description: Aromas of orange blossoms, lemon peels and yellow apples are pleasant on the nose. The palate offers ripe orange, lime juice and lime leaves, but the dry finish is astringent and sweeps away those juicy citrus flavors.
Name: Llano Estacado 2017 Signature Series Pinot Grigio (Texas)

Description: The aromas of this medium-bodied wine overflow with apples and peaches, and the flavors are crisp, fruity and clean. The mouthfeel is rather rich for the varietal and backed by a nip of good acidity.
Name: Parducci 2017 Small Lot Pinot Gris (Mendocino)

Description: Beneath a sulfur blanket there are aromas of ripe pear and guava. The palate is slightly creamy texture, but the acidity juts out above it, making the wine seem overworked and a little unbalanced.
Name: Amisfield 2016 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Golden in color, this wine opens bright and fresh on the nose before providing a lush, creamy and fruit-forward experience of indelible ripeness on the palate.
Name: Kenwood 2017 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, green apple and citrus lead the nose. On the simple palate, fresh acidity accompanies pineapple and lemon zest.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2017 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Description: This medium-bodied wine has mild fruit aromas, a very soft texture and fruity, almost sugary flavors. It's a straightforward sipper that could be good for a crowd.
Name: Three Pears 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Light-bodied and simple, this has subdued aromas suggesting mature orchard fruit. Reflecting the nose, the informal palate evokes ripe yellow pear and a hint of dried pineapple before abruptly finishing on a bitter note.
Name: Cantine di Ora 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A leader in Oregon Pinot Gris, King Estate nails this mid-priced entry. A tangy mix of grapefruit and other citrus signals a crisp style. The flavors hit the edge of tropical, showing a bit of pineapple. This is a perfect match to a wide variety of lighter seafood and poultry.
Name: King Estate 2017 Domaine Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is part of the winery's Terroir Series, but oddly, no specific terroir other than the generic Willamette Valley AVA is indicated. The flavors are leesy and balanced among fruit highlights of citrus, lime and papaya, with a strong minerality. Precise and stylish, it's already drinking quite well and should hold through 2023.
Name: Alexana 2017 Terroir Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Sugar cookie and lemon aromas perfume this elegantly structured Pinot Gris. It's medium bodied and dry, with concentrated grapefruit and lemon flavors that leave a pleasant murmur of citrus zest on midpalate. It finishes on lingering notes of crushed mineral and volcanic ash.
Name: Franz Keller 2017 Vom Löss Pinot Gris (Baden)

Description: Aromas of honey and pears are marked by spice, cashew and hops in this deep gold Grauburgunder, or Pinot Gris. The palate is intensely fruity, almost tropical, boasting notes of pineapple and melon, but balanced by a deep mineral undertone and crisp acidity. The finish is moderate in length but edged by a delicate grip of tannins.
Name: Weinreich 2016 Trocken Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: While light bodied and crisp, this is a silk-textured Grauburgunder offering loads of juicy pineapple and tangerine flavors. It's a dry, easy-drinking sip but nuanced by hints of waxy apple and peanut shell. The finish is vibrantly fresh.
Name: Weinreich 2017 Basisweiss Trocken Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though not as ripe as past vintages, this brings appealing flavors of cinnamon-dusted apple pie and poached pear. Sourced from a single northern Tualatin Valley vineyard, its physical maturity exceeds its low alcohol. A touch (11 g/L) of residual sugar rounds out the finish.
Name: Lujon 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Light rose gold in the glass, this wine offers a fresh orchard-fruit aroma, with a riper notion of peach underscored by white blossoms. The palate is less flourished, yet still boasts rounded apple and pear flavors that are balanced by a shot of tangerine acidity.
Name: Raphael 2017 Pinot Grigio (New York)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a textural Pinot Gris, soft and pillowy on the palate, with plump flavors of yellow apple and tangerine. A mild bitter almond-skin note creeps on the midpalate, adding a bit of balance and astringency.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2016 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Apple and pear aromas are up front, along with whiffs of petroleum jelly. The palate is medium bodied, with the concentration seeming to wax and wane throughout.
Name: Primarius 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This falls on the green fruit and herb side of the spectrum, but is nonetheless quite well made. Flavors of cucumber, green apple and wet stone come along with light, fresh green herbs.
Name: Oregon Territory 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Shy aromas of citrus and apple blend with a light plastic tone. This is slick in feel, with green apple and pear holding court, ending on a crunchy apple peel tone.
Name: Glenora 2016 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An aroma of freshly pressed apples and pears greets the nose, with orchard blossoms riding in the background. This is persistent and juicy on the palate, with a rounded red apple flavor balanced by a bright lemony tang.
Name: Hunt Country Vineyards 2017 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe aromas of juicy pineapple and grapefruit shine on the nose and palate. This is light in feel, with a citric kick that brightens flavors of ripe orchard fruit and chalk.
Name: Atwater 2016 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Hints of yellow apple and pear are marked by savory, earthen tones in this light-bodied Pinot Grigio. It's moderate in concentration but offers fresh acidity and a dry, easygoing palate.
Name: Landshut 2017 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Ripe peach and apple aromas are out front, followed by whiffs of tropical fruit. The palate brings dried apple flavors with a lightly smoky finish.
Name: Maryhill 2017 Tudor Hills Vineyards Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: Lightly scented, this informal, light-bodied white opens with whiffs of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The fresh, simple palate suggests white peach and a hint of citrus rind.
Name: Settesoli 2017 Pinot Grigio (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of lees, bruised apple and pear are followed by light, sleek fruit flavors with a tart finish.
Name: Sagelands 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A touch of flinty reduction plays on the nose. The palate then presents bright citrus zest with wonderfully bitter citrus pith as well as a salty intensity that is reminiscent of preserved lemon. All this is couched in ripe expressive pear fruit on a concentrated but sinuous body that seems to have inherent drive. It is the pith and the zest that make this. The finish is dry and lasting. Drink 2025–2030.
Designation: Rangen de Thann Clos Saint Urbain Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Rangen de Thann Clos Saint Urbain Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The alluringly rich nose almost has something of spiced Christmas apple about it. There are hints of sultana, fig and fresh pear, too. Somewhere deeper down, a very pure note of orange peel rises. The palate is just as layered—as rich, as complex. Medium sweetness helps to express all of this opulence but concentrated freshness, of candied rather than fresh zest helps to keep this all in check. Fluid viscosity underlines the generosity and richness of even more. Drink now through 2030.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2011 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A spirited headiness on the nose carries the ripest richest pear notes. The palate amplifies these with a wonderfully high-toned sweetness which is countered by a very concentrated, almost sharp freshness that pervades and refines. The body is rich but compact, packed with richness. The finish is almost cutting, with zestiness but the medium sweetness lasts and lingers. Drink 2028–2030.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2011 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A very aromatic nose sends signals of dried pear and fig with honeyed overtones. There almost is a hint of Christmas fruit cake about it. The palate adds a sharper, more citric streak to temper this evident aromatic richness and manages to pull this back into the fold of off-dry table wines. Concentration and purity are evident, as are power and alcoholic warmth—a warming wine for cold nights with an off-dry finish. Drink through 2028.
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2015 Rosacker Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A rich note of ripe pear dominates the nose, with a hint of bitter walnut coming through on the palate. This is a very rounded, ample wine, with a streak of phenolics and lasting freshness. It carries its slight residual sweetness with ease and strikes a very convincing balance. The finish is just off dry. Drink now–2028.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2015 Spiegel Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe pear and bitter pear pip appear on the nose. The palate takes this wonderfully complex and pleasantly bitter notion of ripe fulsome fruit and presents it on a serenely off-dry but concentrated, powerful and ample body. Freshness provides precision and poise while overtones of that aromatic pear fruit shimmer and tingle everywhere. This is a lovely, rich but elegant wine. Drink through 2030.
Name: Josmeyer 2015 Hengst Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A flinty stony glint precedes the more familiar fresh pear notes on the nose which are tempered with a fine sense of zestiness. The palate goes into full smoothness mode, with beautifully rich pear notes that find their equal in the zesty lemony countering freshness. Alcoholic heat also enters the equation but these elements interact with poise and balance. This is powerful, rounded, but also fresh. The finish is just off dry and long. Drink 2028–2030.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of apricot skin swings in with the ripe juicy pear notes on the nose. The palate scoops this fruity richness up with both a touch of residual sugar and a mellow phenolic earthiness that is reminiscent of almond skin and pear pips. Lemon freshness frames this while some alcoholic heat makes the aromas heady and expressive. This is a big, generous but very balanced and layered wine. Wait for this. Drink 2025–2035.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Quite heady notes of lime marmalade bundle with ripe and juicy pear on the nose before unfolding into an unashamed sweetness on the impactful palate. The inherent power of this wine is undeniable, the body is immensely concentrated, dense with fruit but also with the zestiness of lime which counters the sweetness. A pleasantly bitter, almost pithy and salty texture makes the mouth water and tingle. The finish is medium sweet and packs a real punch. Drink 2025–2035.
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Rangen Clos Saint-Théobald Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The golden hue and ample rich earthy aroma with its juicy hints of autumnal generosity immediately suggest some development. The flavors are evolved on the palate, too. Ripe pear fruit has muted into a rounded mellowness while freshness still pervades this smooth balance. The wine is dry but brings notions of richness and understated power. The finish is dry and wonderfully balanced, still tingling with freshness. Drink until 2030.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2011 Kanzlerberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, fresh and almost lifted pear notes stream from the glass. In the background is a touch of honeycomb. The honey and beeswax notes take over on the medium-sweet palate where their richness also lends a viscous texture to the rounded and concentrated midpalate. Candied lemon zest acts as a counterbalance but this finishes with honeyed sweetness. Drink now through 2028.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2012 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Both juicy Mirabelle and pear entice with their fresh fruitiness on the nose. On the palate it is residual sweetness which amplifies their charms. This generosity and juiciness is tempered with bright lemon freshness. Underlying this is a fine crystalline stoniness which keeps this on light feet despite the medium sweetness and inherent generosity. Drink through 2028.
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Frankstein Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, juicy yellow pear and honey carry the nose. The palate hits with a touch of sweetness that boosts the ripe pear fruit but, it is countered by zesty lemon and a pleasantly bitter streak of phenolics. The result is a rounded, powerful and concentrated wine. Drink now–2028.
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2015 Pfingstberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notions of very ripe aromatic pear stream from the nose with almost insistent headiness. The palate continues in this heady vein with a full boost of sweetness to the rich pear fruit, creating even more opulence. The palate is immensely concentrated, also in freshness, to provide a counterpoint to the decadence of all the honeyed fruit. Everything about this happens at full volume and the finish is long, medium sweet and lasting.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2011 Vorbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose is subtle but sends some heady pear-tinged heat. The palate comes in with perceptible sweetness which boosts an array of juicy russet and yellow pear. An earthy phenolic backdrop provides some counter measure to this generous rounded ripeness, while freshness gives precision to this evolving, powerful but balanced wine. The finish is off dry. Drink now through 2028.
Name: Preiss-Zimmer 2013 Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of baked Mirabelle skin sends both sweet and bitter notions to the nose. The palate takes up this twin charm of fruit and pithiness and lets them play off each other with just enough pear fruit to keep it juicy. The body is concentrated and has a well of real citrus freshness at the core. The finish is still just about dry and beautifully clean. This is lovely now but will evolve. Drink now through 2028.
Name: Boeckel 2016 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A vanilla lick aligns with the ripe pear notes on the nose. The palate shows the rich, rounded and ripe fruit of juicy pears and a hint of marzipan but also lots of lemony freshness that corrals fruit, oak and all of that juiciness into a concentrated, dry and lingering wine. With the oak notes still fresh this will benefit from time in bottle. Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Steinert Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear peel has a lovely touch of grapefruit zestiness. The palate comes in with a subtle, autumnal and demerara sugar sweetness that adds a touch of caramel to the fruit. The palate is smooth and juicy but also harmoniously sonorous. The finish is medium sweet but also zestily fresh. Drink now through 2028.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2015 Kessler Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose is still shy, giving a mere hint of earthy pear but the palate comes alive with juicy fresh ripe,yellow pear. There is a wonderfully poised balance to all of this. There is a fluid medium body and restrained power. All of this gives the impression of understatement since this rounded unobtrusive wine truly delivers with its integral balance and its off-dry finish. Drink until 2028.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Florimont Trois Châteaux Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A gentle hue of russet pear peel on the nose starts to unfold on the palate. The juiciness and the purity of ripe pear flesh become apparent against a background that owes as much to phenolic texture as to concentrated freshness. These elements are well placed to counter the alcoholic warmth. This is rather powerful but also very well balanced with a dry and sustained finish. Lovely now but with the stuffing to evolve. Drink until 2028.
Name: Meyer-Fonné 2016 Kaefferkopf Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose is subtle with hints of green pear, but a zesty edge of lemon already suggests concentration and power. The palate follows suit with a wonderful textured where ripe pear notes are boosted by just a touch of residual sweetness. But it is both alcoholic heat and concentrated lemon zestiness that provide structure and convey a sense of power. This is a full-bodied white coming into its own now. Drink now through 2028.
Name: Paul Blanck 2015 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Smoky hints of both ripe and dried pear have a honeyed edge. The palate comes in with that same honeyed sweetness on a rather concentrated powerful palate. Both lemon notes and lovely phenolic grip give structure. The finish is medium sweet and long.
Name: Wolfberger 2015 Rangen Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle Williams pear on the nose has a lovely earthy saltiness about it. The palate comes in with gentle sweetness that accentuates the pear but also with vivid freshness and a phenolic backdrop that enhances that earthy pity salty feel. This is balanced, elegant and finishes very harmoniously on an off-dry note. Drink now through 2028.
Name: Martin Schaetzel 2015 Schlossberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe notes of russet pear are tinged with lemon freshness on the nose. The palate comes in with concentrated and generous juiciness. Lots of pear fruit swirls and is amplified by spirited warmth, but both these elements are framed with lemon freshness, pulling it all into a balanced, even and just off-dry finish. Drink until 2028.
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2016 Mambourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Ripe and round, this generous semisweet wine is quite different from the average Grigio. It has ripe apple and pear aromas, concentrated fruit and light spice flavors, a broad, almost thick texture and lingering finish.
Name: Lichen Estate 2016 Estate Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: Fresh friendly notes of ripe pear have some green-apple freshness about them. On the palate, that freshness is joined by juicy sweetness, boosting the notes of ripe pear. There is something easy about this—the wine wears its medium sweetness and the opulence this brings lightly. Drink until 2025.
Name: Léon Manbach 2016 Frankstein Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Something zesty and fresh is apparent on the nose. On the palate, this zestiness adds zing to the ripe rounded pear notes which are amplified by a little residual sweetness. The interplay of zestiness and ripe, almost luscious fruit provides fun and moreishness.
Name: Hubert Meyer 2016 Winzenberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of beeswax on the nose leads onto a rather sweet palate where a pithy citrus bitterness and freshness set pleasant accents in the smooth, ripe, rounded and generous fruit. That beeswax notion resurfaces on the long medium-sweet finish.
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2016 Eichberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle apricot mellowness joins the juicy pear notes on the nose. The palate adds both a boost of slight residual sweetness and a guiding pithy phenolic element. Zesty freshness of ripe citrus plays in the background. This balanced, harmonious wine has a medium-sweet finish.
Name: Domaine Mersiol 2016 Frankstein Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe baked and dried pear-notes appear all at once with a deeply fruity allure. The palate boosts these rounded and already sweet notes with even richer honeyed sweetness. The concentration is evident while a chalky backdrop alongside lemon freshness provides some balance to this rich and generously fruited wine. The finish is medium sweet.
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2015 Marckrain Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Very ripe pear notes on the nose have the added charm of ripe Mirabelle plums and a tinge of earthiness. Both these themes are reprised on the palate. Pear and Mirabelle fruit are boosted by gentle sweetness, while the earthiness turns into a pleasantly bitter phenolic streak that is a counterpoint to the fruit. The finish is off dry but fresh.
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2016 Osterberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A very fragrant nose suggests ripe juicy pear and full-fruited pleasure. The palate obliges with gentle, pure and very inviting fresh notes of both green and yellow pear. The juiciness sits well and initially belies the undeniable power at the core of this wine. It wears its concentrated fruit and measured balanced with great charm. The finish is off dry and very refreshing.
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2016 Bruderthal Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The pear notes on the nose are clothed in vanilla-scented creaminess. The palate has a similar richness and a mellow smooth feel that couches subtly sweet pear fruit and a pleasantly bitter phenolic richness. All of this is countered with lemony brightness which defines and freshens. This rich rounded wine has a medium-sweet finish. Drink now through 2025.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Eichberg Trois Châteaux Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A hint of Mirabelle plum plays on the nose before becoming fully fledged on the medium-sweet palate. This flows with a stone fruit flavor that is always tempered by lemon freshness. It's smooth, rounded and fruit-driven, with a medium-sweet finish.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2016 Mambourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle hints of ripe green and yellow pear lead onto a dry but very expressive palate. Ripe and juicy pear flavors are clearly delineated. While some alcoholic heat becomes palpable on the midpalate, the pear fruit flavors are pure and vivid with lots of concentration. The finish remains balanced and dry.
Name: André Kientzler 2016 Kirchberg de Riebauvillé Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A very subtle nose has mere suggestions of hay flowers and yellow pear. On the palate, these are amplified by a touch of residual sweetness and countered by a beautifully bitter, pithy phenolic element while citrus freshness brightens the flavors. This is rounded and fluid but with a compact, harmonious and elegant body.
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2015 Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich fig and almond flavors follow a floral aroma in this full-bodied and mouth-filling wine. Melon, mineral and consommé notes add complexity while the generous texture coats the tongue and creates a lingering finish.
Name: Via Romano 2017 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Hints of spearmint and minerals on the nose and ample ripe-apple and honeydew flavors on the palate add up to a substantial and well-balanced wine. Bright acidity lends a tangy undertone.
Name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Pinot Gris (California)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass with the slightest hint of pink, this wine's aromas are very shy, with just a hint of apple flesh. It's quite zippy and refreshing on the palate, but the flavors are also light, with hints of apple and lemon skin.
Name: Alara 2017 Pinot Grigio (San Benito County)

Description: Aromas of pear, grass, green apple and lemon zest, lead to a flavorful palate full of pineapple flavors, backed by a zip of lemony acidity. It delivers a lot of quality and value.
Name: Sawtooth 2017 Pinot Gris (America)

Description: A light spearmint aroma and lively, subtle spiced-apple flavors make this medium-bodied wine very engaging. It has good lively acidity, a sense of freshness and a clean tangy finish.
Name: Van Ruiten 2017 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: Well done in a light, refreshing style, this medium-bodied wine offers tangy green-apple aromas, fresh citrus and herb flavors and good nervy acidity.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2017 Exploration Series Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy pear, lime skins and lemongrass aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent tension to the palate, where Bartlett pear and soda-like flavors of 7-Up arise.
Name: The Archivist 2016 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of wet cement, apple, lime skin and a hint of flint. There is decent acid and texture to the sip, where light flavors of pome fruit and tangy lemon show.
Name: SeaGlass 2017 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of apple and pear seem difficult to access at present. Dry medium-bodied flavors follow. It's a pleasant if somewhat innocuous offering of the variety, with the concentration at times seeming a bit light.
Name: Milbrandt 2016 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This light and very lean wine smells like fresh thyme and pine needles, tastes very crisp and delicate, has low alcohol and good refreshment qualities.
Name: LangeTwins 2017 Merrill-Johnson Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)

Description: Fresh in feel and a touch sweet, this fruity wine is light bodied and shows flavors of flowers and apples, supported by a soft texture.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: A muddled aroma of lemon and gardenia carries to the light-bodied palate. This is simple and straightforward in its appeal.
Name: Cantina Zaccagnini 2017 Dal Tralcetto Pinot Grigio (Colline Pescaresi)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a decent-quality wine that shows mild apple and canteloupe flavors, a rather soft texture and medium body.
Name: Briceland 2017 Pinot Gris (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Straightforward notes of citrus and apple have a light cabbage tinge on the nose. The palate is light and relatively neutral in flavor, ending on a crisp citrus note.
Name: Citra 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Grigio (Terre di Chieti)

Description: This is a drinkable but very bland wine showing almost neutral flavors, low alcohol and a soft texture.
Name: Oak Grove 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Exceptionally rich, this off-dry wine offers honeyed, candied citrus fruits in a concentrated, almost decadent style. Tangerine and Key lime flavors abound, and the sweetness, though balanced against ample acidity, puts this close to dessert-wine quality. It's as decadently delicious a Pinot Gris as you'll find from anywhere in Oregon.
Name: Seekseekqua 2017 Waldo Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is an exceptional Pinot Gris in every way, starting with ripe round fruit. The deep gold color introduces a lush core of peach, apricot and papaya, along with a light hint of honey. There are ample supporting acids to nicely balance it out, but the overall ripeness and forward-fruit flavors suggest drinking this beauty now.
Name: Bethel Heights 2017 Estate Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A perennial winner, this vineyard designate from a top site delivers lightly peppery, vivid flavors of apple, jicama, melon and white peach. The texture, density and length are exceptional.
Name: King Estate 2016 Pfeiffer Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The Paradox label has the King Estate name intentionally printed upside down, a nod to the unique barrel-aged style. Here, the barrel influence is an asset, cloaking the ripe fruit flavors in light toast. The tannins are smooth and the barrel time has softened the mouthfeel.
Name: King Estate 2016 Paradox Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This memorable wine was barrel-fermented in three puncheons (one new), and put through full malolactic fermentation. Though it's still pulling its components together, these lovely flavors will certainly combine into a terrific white wine with a touch more bottle age. Buttery and taut at the same time, it's got apple, melon and juicy citrus along with the softer malo acids.
Name: Duck Pond 2017 25th Anniversary Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: A change of owners (from King Estate to Foley Family) has not changed the success or style of this high-volume wine. Strikingly fresh, textural and minerally, this offers crisp flavors of celery, grapefruit and lime. Excellent length and mouth-tingling freshness make it a wine to drink over the next year.
Name: Acrobat 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This well-made white wine is fruity and full bodied, with ripe components of freshly cut pear and apple. There's no sign of oak—just fresh clean crisp fruit all the way through. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Chehalem 2017 Three Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is fresh, clean and fruit forward, in the best possible way. It captures immaculate flavors of spicy pear, crunchy apple and white melon, backed with refreshing minerality.
Name: Conveyance 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This mineral-drenched wine is packed with zippy flavors of citrus flesh and rind. It runs the gamut from lemon to lime to grapefruit, with extra texture from high elevation vineyards and native yeast fermentation.
Name: Ruby 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Price is down and quality way up in the new vintage of Coelho's Pinot Gris. Thick and juicy with pear and peach fruit, it was whole-cluster pressed and quickly bottled. This is a wine to enjoy immediately, and chill it a bit to give it some additional bite.
Name: Coelho 2017 Coelho Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Popular and widely available, this opens with a scent of guava, and follows with mixed fruit flavors of guava, apricot and bubblegum. It's forward and palate-pleasing, leaving a light hint of mint at the finish.
Name: Elk Cove 2017 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine has the slightest hue of pink in the glass, and shows aromas of chalk, tangerine pith and botanical elements on the tightly wound nose. The palate is zippy with acidity, offering both red-apple and citrus flavors.
Name: Eden Rift 2017 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A low alcohol, high acid take on Pinot Gris, this pushes crisp green-apple fruit front and center. Apple skin, grapefruit and assorted citrus notes combine, with a juicy tart concentrated finish.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2017 Chalice Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A 50-50 blend of estate-grown and Pfeiffer Vineyard fruit, this is a tasty wine. It offers well-ripened apple and pear notes, with a hint of jicama. The acidity is supportive, though a bit more snap would be optimal.
Name: King Estate 2016 Unity Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The lightly tawny gold hue suggests that this wine should be consumed over the next year or two. The name bears no relation to the recent fires in Oregon. The wine is smooth, ripe and lightly sweet, with flavors of bruised pear, orange liqueur and toasted hazelnuts. It's a rich, almost opulent style.
Name: R. Stuart & Co. 2016 Big Fire Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is a deep-gold color and has spent time in barrel. Dusty tropical fruits join mixed flavors of banana, candied orange peel and Meyer lemon. It's smooth and potent, and should be consumed over the next year or two.
Name: Chehalem 2015 Ridgecrest Vineyards Pinot Gris (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lightly spicy, this crisp young wine delivers just-ripe mixed citrus fruit. There are hints of jicama and white radish also, giving it a peppery finish. Just a touch of residual sugar (5 g/L) offsets some of the piercing acidity.
Name: Ponzi 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Recently bottled, this wine has some faint traces of bottle shock, but offers plenty of potential for further improvement. Crisp apple, iceberg lettuce and wet stone flavors combine. A touch of lemon rind adds interest to the finishing acidity.
Name: Coeur de Terre 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Here's a sharp-edged mix of fruits, mainly pear, peach and yellow plum. It's forward and plump with those fruit flavors, and has seemingly been rounded off with residual sugar.
Name: The Four Graces 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This standard-bearer is the winery's most widely-available wine. It's a solid, fruit-driven effort, with abundant flavors of apple, pear and melon. Crisp acidity adds freshness and definition to the finish.
Name: King Estate 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Much like the previous vintage, this is packed with fresh and juicy flavors of cut pear. It's well defined with ample acidity adding notes of lime and grapefruit. It does seem to flatten out and tail off in the finish, so a little extra chill might be helpful.
Name: Scenic Valley Farms 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lemon cream, honeydew, honeysuckle and toast aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a citrusy boost to the palate, where orange-sorbet and lemon-spritz flavors arise.
Name: Blair Estate 2015 Pinot Gris (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Round and fruity, this pushes plump apple and pear fruit out front in abundance. It's sappy and buoyed with lively acidity, finishing with a splash of tangerine.
Name: Deer Creek 2017 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Joe Dobbes' even-handed winemaking consistently delivers reliably tasty and affordable Wine by Joe white wines. There's plenty of crisp clean fruit, with apple, pear and melon in the mix. A peppery hint of daikon radish adds extra pizzazz.
Name: Wine by Joe 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the David Hill vineyard, this was whole-cluster pressed and vinified in both stainless steel and concrete egg. Floral aromas lead into a light graceful mix of apple, pear and peach. There's a suggestion of residual sugar in the overall fruity sweetness, along with a hint of honey. That helps to round off the peppery phenolics.
Name: Cochon 2017 Cuvèe (sic) Sophie Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a tasty fruit bowl of a wine, with a mix of pineapple, peach and cherry, all jumbled together as you might find in a fruit salad. Done entirely in stainless steel, it's a fine quaffable every day wine.
Name: Fullerton 2017 Three Otters Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a tight lightly peppery wine, with green-fruit flavors of melon, apple and a touch of cucumber. Two-thirds was fermented in stainless tanks; the rest in neutral oak. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Lady Hill 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Cantaloupe and hazelnuts are abundant on the nose and carry to the palate. While round in feel, ample acidity offers proper dimension. The finish is long and nutty.
Name: Flying Fox 2017 Pinot Gris (Shenandoah Valley)

Description: This canned Pinot Gris is crisp, straightforward and enjoyable in its fresh pear and apple tones. While labeled nonvintage, the cans carry a packaging date on the bottom to help savvy consumers confirm their freshness.
Name: Joe to Go NV Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Among the winery's trio of Pinot Gris offerings, this occupies the middle rung. It's a steely herbal style, quite different from the fruit-laden vineyard designate. Here the flavors focus on citrus rind and a touch of bitter seed rather than ripe fleshy fruit. It's a different style, which would accompany simple grilled chicken with rosemary.
Name: Coelho 2017 Renovação Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There's a definitely grassy note in both scent and flavor, very Sauvignon Blanc-like. Fruit flavors hint at sweet fresh pear, with notes of lemongrass. Though a little off-center for the variety, it's balanced and refreshing.
Name: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2017 Rose City Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is smooth and open, affordable and quickly accessible. The loose-knit fruit flavors bring apple and pear, along with a light dusting of cocoa. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Kudos 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This seems to be an unsettled mix of grassy, not-quite-ripe fruit, and enough residual sugar to hide or block some of that herbaceousness. Although the companion Rose City Pinot Gris has some of that same grassiness, here it's more obvious and the sweetness doesn't really help to hide it.
Name: Rascal 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The name of this cuvée refers to the label graphic of a rabbit, which adorns this new series of inexpensive wines from Coelho. Initially intended for a sparkling wine program, this is quite light and tart, with a rather flat mouthfeel.
Name: Coelho 2017 Bunny Cuvée Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A touch of tropical exuberance recalling mango and passion fruit peeks though the subtle vanilla notes on the nose of this wine. The palate reels these in, lending a lovely aromatic fillip of passion fruit to its core of textured, ripe lemon and grapefruit zestiness. It's light but expressive, deep and beautifully complex. Drink now–2028.
Name: Wohlmuth 2017 Ried Gola Pinot Gris (Südsteiermark)

Description: A touch of creaminess, a hint of ivy and lots of ripe pear and lemon fruit: This is the lovely nose of this fresh, concentrated and tangy white. Lemony brightness and zesty texture make it stand out. Enjoy now or hold through 2025.
Name: Wohlmuth 2017 Kitzeck-Sausal Pinot Gris (Südsteiermark)

Description: Round and full bodied, this savory white boasts pear, baked apple and orange-zest aromas and flavors. It closes on a note of toasted hazelnut and a hint of flinty mineral.
Name: Nals Margreid 2016 Punggl Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This fragrant copper-colored wine boasts enticing scents of acacia, Spanish broom, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of wet stone. The elegantly structured savory palate evokes ripe Rennet apple, white peach and orange drop alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Venica & Venica 2016 Jesera Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a rather unique and fascinating wine, starting with aromas of pear galette, peach and apple blossom. There is a lemon-peel tension to the medium-bodied palate but also warmer nectarine and apple-syrup flavors, with a cantaloupe touch that goes into the finish.
Name: Lumen 2016 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: Round and creamy, this has enticing scents of ripe apple, white peach and citrus zest that follow over to the savory palate along with a hint of vanilla. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Muzic 2016 Valeris Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: After a few swirls of the glass, you'll find whiffs of dried wild flower, baked apple and toasted almond, while the round full-bodied palate offers mature yellow apple, white peach and candied lemon slice. A vanilla note lingers on the close while just enough fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Castello di Spessa 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Not at all what most would expect from a Pinot Gris, this wine is rosé in color, has plenty of body despite low alcohol and drinks almost like a Pinot Noir. The watermelon aromas and plummy, earthy flavors accompany a generous texture and nip of tannin. Biodynamic grapes were fermented with native yeast and not filtered.
Name: Donkey & Goat 2016 Ramato Filigreen Farm Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: Pressed wild flower, crushed flint and ripe white stone-fruit aromas delicately come together on this medium-bodied white. Ripe and savory, the fresh enveloping palate doles out mature yellow pear, apple and juicy citrus while a hint of bitter almond signals the close.
