Name: Nals Margreid 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicate scents reminiscent of white spring flower, Alpine herb and pear appear in the glass. On the bright palate, refreshing acidity accompanies mature apple, peach, wild fennel and citrus. A note of flint gives it a crisp, clean close.
Name: Infiné 1939 2016 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Aromas of white spring wild flower, green apple and honeydew melon march over to the ripe palate along with citrus and white peach. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced and bright while a white-almond note lingers on the finish.
Name: Girlan 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Creamy and medium-bodied, this delivers ripe apple, white peach and citrus flavors. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors while a hint of toasted hazelnut lingers on the finish.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Interestingly floral and high in acidity, this white was given three hours of skin contact after the grapes were crushed, the wine then fermented and aged in stainless steel. Wet stone minerality and floral earthiness abound around sizzling freshness and peachy flavor.
Name: Barber 2017 Rougissant Keller Vineyard Pinot Gris (Petaluma Gap)

Description: Delicate, enticing scents of spring wild flower and ripe pear lead the way on this bright refreshing white. Mirroring the nose, the savory, linear palate delivers apple, tangerine slice and a hint of mineral alongside bright acidity.
Name: Pacher Hof 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Oak, coffee and toast aromas lead the nose and carry over the palate along with lemon drop, baked apple and butterscotch. You'll find toasted almond and a subtle hint of alcohol on the close.
Name: Peter Zemmer 2015 Giatl Riserva Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Spring blossom and ripe stone-fruit aromas float out of the glass. The fresh rounded palate offers creamy pear and ripe apple. It closes on light hint of almond.
Name: St. Pauls 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas suggesting white spring flower, citrus peel and ripe white peach lead the nose. The tangy linear palate offers juicy tangerine slice and green apple alongside a white-almond note.
Name: Roeno 2017 Tera Alta Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of ripe orchard fruit and white spring flower. The lively palate evokes mature Bartlett pear and tangerine zest alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Schiopetto 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: A touch of peardrop combines with a rich, creamy notion on the nose of this wine. The palate cuts in with freshness and rich pear fruit. It has a very fruit-driven, textured, medium body with a lovely, tangy, lemon-laced finish.
Name: Steindorfer 2017 Fuchsloch Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Description: Made with extended contact between the grape skins and the must, this copper-colored wine opens with aromas of orchard fruit and spring blossom. The savory palate delivers pink grapefruit, McIntosh apple and tangerine zest alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Attems 2017 Ramato Pinot Grigio (Friuli)

Description: Aromas of toasted almond, ripe yellow apple and pear carry over to the full-bodied round palate. Just enough fresh acidity brightens the ripe fruit flavors.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This crisp, straw-colored white wine has interesting touches of complexity in the mineral and prosciutto aromas and the nice combination of savory herb and fresh apple flavors. It's medium bodied and has lively acidity.
Name: La Folia Winery 2016 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Made with grapes cultivated with biodynamic farming methods, this offers aromas of white stone fruit, spring blossom and graphite. The linear palate evokes apple, ripe yellow pear, lemon rind and flint alongside fresh acidity. A hint of toasted nut backs up the finish.
Name: Alois Lageder 2016 Porer Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Heady aromas of fragrant spring flower and white stone fruit lift out of the glass. On the ripe rounded palate, fresh acidity brightens baked yellow apple and honeydew melon. It closes on an almond note.
Name: Kössler 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Waxy peach and apple soften a medium-bodied build and managed acidity in this estate white, which is aromatic in honey and flowers. Juicy throughout, it finishes in mango and melon.
Name: Cline 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Spring blossom and mature white stone-fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe apple and Bartlett pear while a white-almond note marks the close.
Name: Mezzacorona 2016 Cliffahanger Vineyards Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: The nose is initially quite shy but eventually reveals whiffs of white flower, orchard fruit and a hint of oak-driven spice. On the full-bodied palate, a toasted note accompanies baked yellow apple and a hint of coconut.
Name: Tramin 2016 Unterebner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This bright medium-bodied white offers delicately enticing scents of spring wild flower and orchard fruit. On the linear palate, tangy acidity underscores Bartlett pear and juicy tangerine zest while a hint of crushed stone backs up the clean finish.
Name: Mezzacorona 2017 Castel Firmian Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Green-apple and spring blossom aromas lead the nose. The apple note carries over to the tangy palate along with orange zest while a hint of bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Bortoluzzi 2016 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and honeysuckle lead the nose. On the palate, fresh acidity underscores Granny Smith apple and citrus while a hint of white almond marks the close.
Name: Fantinel 2016 Tenuta Sant'Helena Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of yellow peach and tropical fruit emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers Golden Delicious apple and nectarine with a tangy refreshing finish.
Name: Attems 2017 Pinot Grigio (Friuli)

Description: Aromas of orchard fruit and yellow spring flower delicately float out of the glass along with a hint of baked bread. On the linear palate, bright acidity frames citrus, beeswax and crushed herb.
Name: Borgo Conventi 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of spring flower, beeswax and a whiff of orchard fruit lead the nose. On the round palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe yellow pear, pineapple and honeydew melon.
Name: Bottega Vinaia 2017 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Honeysuckle and green-apple aromas lead the nose. The green-apple note follows over to the medium-bodied palate along with a hint of honeydew melon and citrus zest. It closes on an almond note.
Name: Maso Poli 2016 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This perfumed wine offers pear, melon and flower aromas. The fruit flavors are lighter yet still fresh and juicy. It shows a lovely sense of balance.
Name: Waterbrook 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of ripe white stone fruit lead the nose. The tangy straightforward palate offers mature yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a note of bitter almond.
Name: Castelfeder 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This has aromas evoking wild flower, white stone fruit and toasted hazelnut while on the light-bodied, straightforward palate, fresh acidity accompanies baked apple. It closes on a bitter almond note.
Name: La Rajade 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of oak, toasted nut and a whiff of tropical fruit carry over to the robust palate along with coconut and roasted coffee bean. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Marco Felluga 2015 Riserva Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas suggesting fragrant white flower and exotic fruit lead the nose. Full bodied and fruity, the palate offers mature apple and a hint of honeydew melon alongside a white-almond note.
Name: Marco Scolaris 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This offers delicate aromas evoking green apple and citrus that carry over to the straightforward palate along with a hint of pear. It has a fresh clean finish.
Name: Elena Walch 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Subtle aromas of citrus blossom, orchard fruit and a whiff of crushed herb waft out of the glass. It's fresh and straightforward, offering Granny Smith apple and ripe pear flavors.
Name: Albino Armani 2017 Corvara Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

Description: This has a shy nose but eventually gives away whiffs of mature pear a hint of toasted nut while the fresh, if somewhat subdued, palate evokes suggestions of yellow apple. It finishes on a bitter almond note.
Name: Ascevi Luwa 2016 Ceròu Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of white almond and mature yellow pear carry over to the medium-bodied straightforward palate along with an apple note. It has a fresh, tangy close.
Name: Casata Monfort 2017 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: This easygoing white opens with aromas of mature apple and a whiff of crushed rock that carry over to the fresh informal palate along with a citrus note. Bright acidity perks up the close.
Name: Cembra 2017 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: White spring flower, stone fruit and a whiff of honey lead the nose. On the straightforward palate, a touch of bitter almond adds interest to yellow apple and a hint of citrus.
Name: Kris 2017 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: Spring flower, white stone fruit and whiff of almond come together on this. The aromas follow over to the straightforward palate along with a hint of mature green apple.
Name: Bollini 2016 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: The rather shy nose eventually reveals suggestions of orchard fruit and field flower while the palate evokes mature apricot and yellow apple. A hint of tangerine rind signals the close.
Name: Franz Haas 2016 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Aromas of brimstone and mature white stone lead the nose on this straightforward white. On the crisp light-bodied palate, bright acidity lifts mature Rennet apple and citrus zest while a hint of white almond marks the close.
Name: La Vis 2017 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: The ripe pear notions on the nose of this wine gain a lovely streak of lemony freshness on the medium-bodied palate. Although ripe, it channels its power into lemony freshness. The finish is dry and warm.
Name: Rosenhof 2017 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals whiffs of white stone fruit and a floral note. On the medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity lifts yellow apple, pear and a hint of citrus.
Name: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This offers aromas of ripe yellow stone fruit and a whiff of toast lead the nose. The full-bodied mature palate offers dried apricot, yellow-apple skin and a hint of bitter almond. You'll also detect the heat of alcohol on the close.
Name: Castel Sallegg 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with aromas of jasmine and tropical fruit while the ripe palate offers candied lemon, mature nectarine and dried apricot. Drink soon.
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting ripe pear, acacia and nut. On the simple light-bodied palate, fresh acidity accompanies yellow-apple skin while a note of bitter almond closes the somewhat lean finish.
Name: Colmello di Grotta 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Fruity aromas of citrus and green apple drift over to the simple palate along with a hint of green melon. Bright acidity gives it a refreshing finish. It's informal but well made.
Name: La Vis 2017 Pigro Pinot Grigio (Venezia)

Description: White spring flower and Granny Smith apple aromas carry over to the tangy easy-drinking palate along with suggestions of yellow pear and citrus. It has a clean fresh finish.
Name: Stemmari 2017 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

Description: Citrus blossom and white stone-fruit aromas glide out of the glass. The straightforward palate offers green apple and citrus zest while a hint of white almond marks the close.
Name: Collavini 2016 Villa Canlungo Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: White stone-fruit and spring-flower aromas lead the nose on this simple white. Reflecting the aromas, the fresh fruity palate offers Granny Smith apple and a hint of white peach.
Name: Alta Luna 2017 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas start off quite reduced, making it hard to perceive the fruit. Its tropical fruit flavors are tart and tangy, with a lemony finish. Once the reduction blows off, it moves up a notch or two.
Name: Cavatappi 2017 Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Description: Very appley, fresh and crisp, this wine is light bodied, clean and appetizing. It gives simple refreshment and there's nothing wrong with that.
Name: Gnarly Head 2017 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: This unusual, deeply colored Pinot Grigio (a result of long skin maceration) opens with subdued aromas evoking raspberry jam and warm toasted notes. The brawny, rather evolved palate offers oak, dried cherries steeped in spirits, coconut and a hint roasted coffee beans. The warmth of evident alcohol throws it off balance. Drink now to capture the remaining freshness.
Name: Primosic 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This light-bodied white opens with fruity aromas of banana and honeydew melon that follow over to the fresh informal palate along with a hint of Granny Smith apple. It's simple but well made.
Name: Lechthaler 2017 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: This medium-bodied wine has plenty of ripe fruit flavors. Fuji apple and honeydew melon take center stage, with low-acid and a soft texture.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2017 Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This blush-colored Pinot Grigio opens with aromas of ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of white pepper. The aromas follow over to the simple, informal palate along with fresh acidity.
Name: Casata Monfort 2017 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: With Bartlett pear and almond aromas, this wine offers lemon, Granny Smith apple, cashew and freesia flavors. The finish is a mélange of floral and citrus notes.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2017 Yarden Pinot Gris (Galilee)

Description: This informal Pinot Grigio has subdued aromas reminiscent of orchard fruit and white flower. The light-bodied simple palate shows yellow apple and white peach alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Lechthaler 2016 Torre di Luna Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: This is a light-bodied wine with honest, straightforward and rather light fruit flavors and decent balance. An earthy trace in the aroma gets covered with good, moderate apple and kiwi flavors.
Name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Here's a bright simple white for everyday that offers suggestions of Granny Smith apple, honeydew melon and citrus. Fresh acidity gives it a juicy close.
Name: Canaletto 2017 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This simple wine has subdued aromas suggesting orchard fruit and pineapple. Reflecting the nose, the simple palate evokes green apple and white peach.
Name: Luna Nuda 2017 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Fresh and simple, this offers peach, green-apple and citrus flavors. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish. It's informal and fun and would make a good pour at picnics and large gatherings.
Name: Casa Liliana 2017 Good Pinot Grigio (Venezia)

Description: Lightly scented, this has subdued aromas evoking yellow apple and a whiff of nut. The aromas can be detected on the somewhat diluted, simple palate along with crisp acidity.
Name: Lagaria 2016 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: Honey and smoke are signaled gently on the nose. On the concentrated body they are joined by a pleasant edge of honeyed bitterness pervaded by lemon zest, creating a flavor bomb with numerous focal points. It is all happening on this dry, bundled palate with endless drive. This needs time. Drink 2025–2035.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Clos Windsbuhl Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Superripe fruit on the nose veers between juicy peach and bruised apple. The palate also unites lemon-balm-like freshness with earthy pear peel and peachy, ripe fruit. This trinity is dry but concentrated, energetic and driven. The wine shows power, verve and great length, but this genie should remain in bottle for a little while longer. The peachy hints on the finish promise pleasure. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Zellberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of flinty reduction on the nose still surrounds notes of ripe but tart pear. The palate is dry, linear and concentrated, brimming with energy and force. Citric freshness holds this powerful wine in check. It would be a pity to drink this now. This thoroughbred needs time. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Heimbourg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A restrained notion of pear skin appears tentatively on the closed nose. The absolutely dry palate shows a lively streak of lemon for freshness, but is more about texture, earth and fruit. This wine has ample pear at its core, framed by freshness and a firm mouthfeel. It needs time to reveal its true elegance. Drink 2022–2035.
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Fronholz Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A hint of smoke clings to the fresh pear notes on the nose. On the palate they are joined by bright lemon on a concentrated body that is dry but rich in its linear, straight-laced fashion. This austere but powerful wine promises to be even better with bottle age. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Emile Beyer 2016 Lieu Dit Hohrain Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: An enticing hint of caramelized pear and Demerara sugar plays on the nose. The palate brims with pointed sweetness and intense freshness. All is heightened here, the lusciousness of the pear-scented fruit, plus the zestiness of the candied lemon freshness. The body has a streamlined, bullet-like trajectory that leaves you wanting more of this juxtaposed balance. The finish is extended and sweet. Drink 2025–2035.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Clos Jebsal Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Something vivid and bright gives an unusually light step to this Alsace Pinot Gris. Notes of flesh and skin of ripe russet pear play on the nose. On the dry palate they attain extra purity, guided by lemon freshness. The finish is dry, lip-smacking and lasting. Lovely now, it's sure to develop. Drink now–2030.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Rotenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Lavish layers of vanilla, spice and cashew are exceptionally integrated in this medium-bodied but textural wine. Fresh pear and grapefruit flavors are concentrated but crisp, accented by complex notes of earth and crushed mineral, well as a delicate phenolic grip on the finish. It drinks well now but should improve through 2024, hold further.
Name: Salwey 2014 Eichberg GG Pinot Gris (Baden)

Description: The tell-tale creamy vanilla of oak is immediately apparent on the nose. On the palate, the smokiness of the barrel dominates right now, but pure, fresh fruit lies underneath. Lemon and pear just wait for integration on the concentrated, bone-dry palate. This wine needs time. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Domaine Pfister 2015 Silberberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Smoky, flinty reduction still envelopes the nose. Underneath, however, a wine of great purity and freshness stretches its fruity-fresh balance from ripe pear to vivid lemon. The palate is rich but taut, attaining honeyed overtones but remaining chiseled and bone dry. Intriguing now, it's full of promise. Drink now–2028.
Name: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Roche Granitique Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of ripe Mirabelle plum joins the pear fruit on the nose. The resolutely dry palate holds them tight on a very concentrated, fresh but also earthy body. Taut and clean, this needs a little more time in bottle. The finish is whistle-clean.
Name: Trimbach 2016 Reserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle, herb-fringed pear appears on the nose. The palate is dry and slender but shimmers with generous, bright rays of juicy pear, toned with lemon freshness. This is earthy Pinot Gris, but with an elegant flair. The finish is dry and refreshing.
Designation: Clos des Capucines Cuvée Ste Catherine
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2016 Clos des Capucines Cuvée Ste Catherine Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: With its pale, orange-pink hue and delicately tannic fringe, there's a firmness of structure in this full-bodied wine, that the producer attributes to old vines. The palate is exotic and complex, melding flavors of ripe pear with hints of raspberry, forest floor and spice. Dry and intently mineral, it's a fascinating wine to enjoy now through 2030.
Name: Friedrich Becker 2016 Kalkmergel Grauer Burgunder (Pfalz)

Description: Ripe pear notes have a mellow aura that takes in both baked apple and gentle vanilla spice. The rounded palate has a lovely texture and some residual sweetness that makes the pear and apple notes even rounder. This is as much balanced by gentle freshness as by concentration. The finish is off dry and long. Drink now–2028.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2016 Letzenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Earthy, smoky notes inform the ripe russet-pear fruit on the nose. The palate comes in with real power and concentration but also shows a taut, linear freshness. This big but elegant wine is destined for the table with its concentration and presence. It shows lovely balance and purity throughout, and is sure to develop. Drink now–2028.
Designation: Clos Lisser Monopole Grand Cru Kirchberg de Barr
Name: Andre Lorentz 2016 Clos Lisser Monopole Grand Cru Kirchberg de Barr Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Almost spicy notes of pear tingle on the fresh, aromatic nose. On the palate the brilliance of the pear is accentuated even more with vivid citrus zestiness. The palate remains dry and fresh, while the concentrated body has drive, energy and enduring, almost bracing freshness and wonderful length.
Name: Josmeyer 2016 Fromenteau Vu Par Isabelle Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The pear fruit on the nose is not only super ripe but downright honeyed and edged with smokiness. The palate is resolutely dry but holds baking spice, appealingly bitter phenolics and lots of frshness. The result is a full-bodied white with fruit, power and texture. Smoky oak makes itself most felt on the finish. Drink now–2025.
Name: Bestheim 2014 Exception Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Very ripe notions of juicy pear and wet earth combine on the nose. The dry palate is linear with citrus freshness and rich with pear fruit. This has concentration, body and length, always shimmering with ripe pear. The finish is dry and long.
Name: Boeckel 2017 Midelberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Apple freshness hovers above the glass. Richer pear fruit appears on the resolutely dry palate where midpalate texture does as much to frame the concentrated fruit as lemon freshness. It's a real mouthful, but vivid with freshness.
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A hint of earth wafts above ripe pear notes on the nose. The palate is resolutely dry with a streak of lemon brightness running through the earth- and phenol-tinged palate. This wine is lively, fresh and serious, with a long, bone-dry finish.
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Les Jardins Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose gives little away. The dry palate, however, is a picture of pure, fresh pear, both ripe and tart. Streaks of lemon make the pear even more precise and refreshing on a concentrated but agile body with lovely tension and a refreshing, dry finish.
Name: Domaine Pfister 2016 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Almost honeyed pear shows on the nose. On the palate the pear attains a fresher aspect, just as ripe but brightened by lemon. The palate is concentrated, rich but dry with a textured mouthfeel. Lovely now, it promises more. Drink now–2028.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Earthy, mellow richness shows on the nose and blossoms on the palate. Rounded, ripe pear fruit fills the mouth with sunny generosity while a phenolic edge grounds the richness. Lemon freshness ensures balance. It finishes dry.
Name: Hugel 2015 Estate Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Earth, white currant and dried pear notes make for an intriguing nose. A touch of flint creates a smoky edge that carries onto the dry, concentrated palate where pear and currant are joined by bright, tart lemon. The finish is superclean, lip-smacking and dry.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Turckheim Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, honeyed pear notes on the nose lead onto a palate rich with fruit that is still dry. Lemony briskness frames the rich fruit notes on a concentrated, vivid body. Pear and lemon play off each other all the way on the long, dry finish.
Name: Emile Beyer 2016 Eguisheim Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Russet-pear peel with earthy and fruity notes dominates the nose. The palate comes in with dreamy sweetness, highlighted and framed with ripe lemon freshness, creating a tension between those two entirely fruit-driven poles. The finish is medium sweet but also refreshing and long.
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2016 Herrenreben Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Friendly, fragrant notes of Conference pear have a lemony edge on the nose. They show on the dry but full-fruited body that conveys notions of ripe, yellow pear. There is power here and lovely texture. The finish is dry and long. Drink now–2028.
Name: Paul Blanck 2015 Patergarten Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe winter apple and bruised apple peel on the nose suggest mellowness. The palate follows suit with gentle, residual sweetness that accentuates the ripe richness, while fresh lemon brightness ensures it stays on the off-dry side. This wine is harmonious, rich, textured and long.
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Collection Terroirs Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Smoke, flint, pear peel and earth on the nose promise an intriguing wine. The palate keeps step with rich, almost honeyed pear fruit on the off-dry palate. A creamy freshness counters this, as does the concentrated body. This wine is earthy and smoky from start to finish.
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Lieu-Dit Harth Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, aromatic green and yellow pears waft on the nose. Concentrated and rich, the palate is tempered with a guiding streak of ripe lemon freshness, creating attractive tension as well as harmonious balance. The finish is off dry and long.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2016 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of reduction still plays on the nose but the palate shows ample, ripe pear notes on a dry but concentrated body. The bold fruit holds its own against lemon brightness. This rich but taut wine strikes a lovely balance and has both drive and impact. The finish is long and dry.
Name: Emile Beyer 2016 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Smoky notes of oak dominate the nose. The palate also shows nutty oak richness as well as gentle, ripe pear fruit and sprightly lemon freshness as a bright counterpoint. Full bodied, dry and concentrated, this needs time to integrate. Drink 2022–2030.
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2015 Tokade Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There's an enticing hint of musk accenting flavors of fresh lemon and grapefruit in this dry medium-bodied Pinot Gris. It's a fragrant fruity wine but structured by crisp acidity and a cool mineral finish. Enjoy now through 2026.
Name: Salwey 2016 Pinot Gris (Baden)

Description: The nose is shy but the palate reveals a superclean, dry body with the restrained richness of ripe pear fruit. Concentration, drive, power and sappiness are all contained in this energetic bundle of wine. Lovely now, it's sure to develop. Drink now–2028.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Les Élements Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from vines grafted over to Pinot Gris in 1978, this was wild yeast-fermented in neutral oak and aged another 22 months before bottling. This is fresh on the nose, with lush tones of melon, pineapple, pear and a touch of honey.
Name: Ponzi 2015 Old Vine Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: An almost exotic hint of mango swings along the pear fruit on the nose. The palate comes in with honeyed sweetness, again with tropical overtones. Bright lemon makes the honeyed notes shine even more. This fully sweet wine with lovely balance will be perfect for fruity desserts or salty cheeses. The finish is long and intense.
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2015 Clos des Anges Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from vines planted a quarter century ago, this stainless steel-aged white offers smooth and balanced fresh pear flavors, with refreshing, wet stone-like minerality. Light hints of garden herbs make it a model Pinot Gris with style, length and the ability to age. Drink now–2025.
Name: Durant 2016 Southview Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: From Tasmania's Tamar Valley, this fleshy, medium-bodied Pinot Gris (indicating the Alsatian rather than Italian style) sees 20% fermented with native yeasts, and this make all the difference, adding heaps of interest and layers. The heady nose is a deep well of aromas like honeyed pear, yeasty apple, peach, jasmine and cherry blossom. It's dry yet rich with a fleshy skins-y texture and a long tangy finish that begs for another sip. Drink with buttery shellfish or on its own.
Name: Holm Oak 2016 Pinot Gris (Tasmania)

Description: Ripe pear is beautifully present on the nose and freshness is already apparent. Dry but concentrated, the palate shows clearly delineated, fresh but ripe yellow pear. There is texture to the body and dryness to the long finish.
Name: Domaine Saint-Rémy 2016 Ehrhart Reserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose only gives hints of lemon freshness. The palate adds ripe pear notes, boosted by a dollop of residual sweetness, to the lemon freshness. This results in a rounded, perfectly balanced medium-sweet wine that has both poise and texture.
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2016 Holder Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Almost floral notes encircle the ripe, aromatic pear fruit on the nose. The palate reveals an even fuller notion of ripe, fresh pear, tinged with the tiniest hint of sweetness but finishing fresh and dry. It's appealing and versatile, with a concentrated core.
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2016 Val Saint Gregoire Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ample, ripe Mirabelle plums and yellow pear show on nose and palate. The fresh and slender body adds a touch of sweetness to accentuate the ripe fruit notions, but the finish is dry, clean and fresh.
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe yellow and green pear on the nose are channeled into a fruit-driven, concentrated and dry palate that has as much texture as it has fruit. It's dry and harmonious with rich pear fruit.
Name: Domaine Saint-Rémy 2016 Im Berg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Tinged with an orange-pink hue, this dry medium-bodied Pinot Gris offers delicate red-apple and raspberry flavors accented by hints of toast and nut. It shares the same spicy edge and tannic fringe of the producer's single-vineyard bottling, but with a lighter, brisker touch. Enjoy now through 2021.
Name: Friedrich Becker 2016 Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Description: The nose hints at ripe, juicy pear. This becomes fully fledged on the palate where easy juiciness makes for a fresh and dry wine brimming with rich, clean pear. Concentration adds welcome depth. The finish is just about dry.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2015 Lieu-Dit Schofweg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Russet-pear peel is hinted at on the nose. The palate is light and easy with gentle, ripe pear and lemony freshness. A slightly phenolic texture adds welcome concentration and context. The finish is dry and fresh.
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2017 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Soft notes of pear and lemon are shy on the nose. On the palate zesty citrus flavors get the upper hand, pervading the textured palate with freshness and countering the residual sweetness perfectly. The finish on this lively wine is off dry, refreshing and long.
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A hint of mango and honeysuckle gives the pear-fruited nose a slightly exotic touch. The palate comes in with more ripe, juicy, green pear and refreshing acidity. The finish is off dry and appealing.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2016 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is Pinot Gris at its youthful best: fresh, creamy, leesy and bursting with zippy grapefruit, orange, apple and melon flavors. Made entirely in stainless steel, it is sufficiently rich and ripe despite the relatively low alcohol.
Name: Walnut City WineWorks 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Both fresh and dried pear notes make for an appetizing nose. The palate has juiciness from fruity pear and bright lemon, with the merest touch of sweetness to round out and amplify the fruit notes. A pleasantly bitter hint of phenolics and freshness create a counterpoint and ensure a dry finish.
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There is a creamy, almost floral aspect to the pear aromas on the nose. Powdery creaminess also plays on the palate where both pleasantly bitter phenolics and lively freshness counter the fruit. The finish is dry and lasting.
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2017 Cuvée Melody Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle pear notes on the nose become fuller and riper on the off-dry palate. A pleasant edge of phenolic bitterness counters the fruit as much as the freshness. The finish is refreshing and long.
Name: Paul Blanck 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Both lime and vivid notes of green Conference pear dance on the nose. The palate is light, dry and fresh with a friendly but taut energy. The Conference pear notes last throughout the dry, refreshing finish.
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2017 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Juicy notes of ripe pear on the nose are pure but shy. On the palate they are amplified by residual sweetness to create a light, agile body that nonetheless brims with juicy, friendly pear. It offers concentration and texture, too. The finish is off dry, long and moreish.
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Rotenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There is a creamy freshness to the pear notes on the nose. The dry palate delivers friendly, earthy pear fruit on a rounded body that has phenolic texture and bright freshness. This wine is rich, dry and perfectly balanced. The dry finish sings with lemon.
Name: Hugel 2015 Classic Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of very ripe Mirabelle plum plays on the nose. On the palate, this ripeness is countered by fresh lemon notes. With just a touch of residual sweetness, the Mirabelle notes attain juiciness that accompanies a pleasant backdrop of phenolic texture. The finish is rich but dry.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2016 Les Natures Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose gives the merest hint of ripe pear but the palate obligingly fills the mouth with clean, ripe and juicy fruit and a welcome fillip of lemony zing. There is ample freshness on the light body. The finish is dry and pure.
Name: Léon Manbach 2017 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose is rather subdued but the palate expresses tart but ripe green pear made even fresher by bright citrus notes. Easy and fruity, this wine has a dry but very refreshing finish.
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2017 Cuvée Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Freshly cut, juicy and rich pear dominates nose and palate. This wine is almost is like biting into a really ripe pear with its off-dry nature and crunchy freshness that is nonetheless rounded. It has lovely balance.
Name: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Winery: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar

Description: This wine ain't cheap when compared to others on the market, and it's clearly relying on its famous name, yet this is nonetheless a solid and varietally sound wine. Understated aromas of red-apple skin, stone fruit, and lemon-lime mingle with buttered almonds, blossoms and a touch of honey and white-pepper spice. The palate offers mouthwatering acidity to balance a slightly creamy texture, tied together with apple and spice. It is a solid drop with or without food.
Name: Henschke 2016 Innes Vineyard Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Ripe, easy pear aromas waft into the nose. Likewise, the palate brims with fruit, brightened by ripe, zesty lemon notes. Residual sweetness boosts the flavors but is balanced by citrus freshness to end in a medium-dry finish.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2017 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The shy nose reveals a little zesty lemon. On the off-dry palate, ripe pear fruit conveys friendly generosity. This wine is fruit-driven and joyful.
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Cuvée Engel Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: An earthy touch of russet-pear peel clings to juicy notes on the nose. Juiciness also dominates on the palate with friendly, ripe fruit and guiding freshness. This wine finishes dry but fruity.
Name: Domaine Zinck 2016 Portrait Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe notes of juicy pear dominate on the nose. The palate tones this down but leaves juicy and bright pear notes on a light body with a refreshing, dry finish.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2016 Grande Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Very ripe pear notes on the nose have an earthy tinge and a hint of bruised apple. The palate reverts to ample, ripe pear notes that brim with easy, juicy flair, boosted by a hint of residual sweetness. It's an easy, just off-dry wine with attractive balance.
Name: W. Gisselbrecht 2016 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Crunchy green apple and ripe pear unite on the nose of this fresh and friendly wine. The palate reveals a touch of sweetness that is well balanced by lemon brightness. The finish is fruity and off dry.
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2017 Lieu-Dit Altenbourg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of lemon adds zing to the pear-fruited nose. The same game is played on the easy, ripe, juicy and fruit-driven palate. Lemon defines and brightens the ample and pure pear. The finish is dry and refreshing.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2017 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Tart but ripe notes of yellow pear are joined by hints of yellow Mirabelle plums on the nose. They also play on the dry body where ample lemon freshness makes for a bright, light and very refreshing wine.
Name: Aimé Guthmann 2017 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose gives just a suggestion of earth-tinged pear. The palate adds a pleasantly bitter phenolic hint that tones down the pear notes but accentuates the dryness, texture and freshness. This wine is less fruit-driven but no less expressive.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 The Furst Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Pear fruit on the nose is ripe, juicy and aromatic. On the palate zesty freshness gives those pear notes precision while a touch of residual sweetness makes them even more expressive. The body is light and utterly refreshing, finishing dry.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2017 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Luscious pear notes on the nose almost have a touch of overripeness to them. On the palate sweetness reigns and fills the mouth with ripe, sunny, generous fruit, balanced by lemony brightness. The finish is medium sweet.
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2015 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: It's a wonder what a little time on skins can do for Pinot Gris/Grigio. In this wine's case it adds texture and character (and a slightly bronzed color, of course). Bitter almonds, honey, peach pits, red-apple skins, lychees and white pepper all shine through to the palate which is chalk-textured but full of zingy acidity. Still fairly tightly wound, it'll be interesting to see this wine evolve over the next year or two.
Name: McPherson Wine Company 2017 MWC Pinot Gris (Victoria)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though made entirely in stainless steel, this wine exhibits a lightly toasty character in both the aroma and flavor. Its racy fruit flavors recall cucumber, apple and white melon. It drinks lighter than the alcohol suggests but would be delightful with white fish or poultry.
Name: Sass 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's appealing freshness and minerality overrides all else—in a good way. It's clean and bracing, with citrus rind and grapefruit flavors.
Name: Sokol Blosser 2017 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Tender notes of juicy, yellow pear appear on the nose. On the palate they are tempered with lemon freshness on a light but fruit-driven body. The finish is both dry and very refreshing.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 200 cases imported Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a zesty and fruit-forward wine, offering crisp green-apple and grapefruit flavors marked by hints of spice and musk. It's a straightforward yet refreshingly fruity wine to enjoy now.
Name: Flower Garden 2017 Pinot Grigio (Rheinhessen)

Description: Something creamy and earthy informs ripe pear notes on the nose. The palate echoes this with creamy pear flavors boosted by a smidgeon of residual sweetness, but the wine finishes dry with citrus freshness.
Name: Koenig 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This young Pinot Gris saw enough skin contact to color it a pale copper. Made from estate-grown fruit, it has fresh and pretty cut pear flavors, buoyed with lemony acids. As a testament to its youth, a hint of yeasty bread comes through, also.
Name: Redhawk 2017 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: So pale in color it could be mistaken for water! And it's almost as easy to drink as well. (A dangerous combo!) On the nose, delicate aromas of apples, almonds, white-pepper spice and some leafy undertones thread nicely into the palate which is crisp and prickly with a chalky texture.
Name: The Black Chook 2016 The Chook Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Supple and fruity, this fresh and lively white wine bring scents and flavors of peach and pear. The balanced acidity adds a note of fresh cut orange slices.
Name: Del Rio 2016 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Baked-apple notes add rounded richness to ripe pear flavors on the nose. The palate has the same full fruitiness of apple and pear, boosted by a touch of residual sweetness. Balanced by lemon freshness, this creates a just about off-dry finish.
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2017 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Aromatic, ripe Williams pear is suggested on the nose. Less expressive aromatically, the palate has ample, juicy and easy fruit. The body is light and fruit-driven, and the finish is just about still dry.
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2017 Cuvée de l'Ours Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Distinctly European in style, this steely take on the quintessential Oregon white wine is a no-frills, fruit-driven effort. It will please those who prefer their white wines oak-free and low alcohol, with its clean, pure expression of apple and pear fruit.
Name: Girardet 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: San Bernabe, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling shows candied honeysuckle and pear extract on the nose. It's simple, fresh and easy-to-like on the palate, full of yellow apples, red pears and a decent acidity.
Name: Noble Vines 2017 152 Pinot Grigio (San Bernabe)

Description: The pear fruit on the nose is very ripe. That same richness is also apparent on the light, easy body that could do with a little more definition. This wine is easy, fruit-driven and off dry. Drink soon.
Name: Willm 2017 Cuvée Emile Willm Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Sun-ripened, yellow Mirabelle dominates the nose with its juicy fruitiness. Ample sweetness on the palate accentuates the ripe fruit even more, while bright citrus tempers this into a medium-dry finish.
Name: Bestheim 2015 Anne de K Lieu-Dit Altenbourg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose is all about yellow Mirabelle plums, ripe, fruity and fresh. That same sunny fruit is pure on the palate where lemon brightness adds zip and ease to the off-dry finish.
Name: Willm 2017 Reserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A hint of creamy banana shows amid the pear notes on the nose. The palate has a touch of sweetness to boost the ripe, juicy pear fruit, but the body stays light and fresh. This easy, fruit-driven wine has an off-dry finish.
Name: Wolfberger 2017 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe Mirabelle and juicy yellow pear unite on the nose. They carry right through to the equally juicy, ripe and easy palate. Ample freshness and a certain lightness ripple across the palate. The finish is dry.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2017 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This wine is fleshy in peach, melon and anise, with a bright yet velvety texture that's lush and lasting in moderate acidity.
Name: Keller 2015 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: A subdued nose, showing mere hints of citrus and pear, leads onto a gently pear-fruited palate where lemony brightness and a touch of residual sugar create a fruity, if easy, balance. The finish is just about dry and the body remains light and easy. Drink soon.
Name: Preiss-Zimmer 2016 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite clear in the glass, this bottling from the Goodchild Vineyard shows soft peach, tangerine and a slightly vinous aroma on the nose. The palate offers citrus and tangy apple skins.
Name: Toccata 2017 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Still showing some CO2, this is tart to the point of sour. Its lemon and pear fruit flavors are clean and crisp, with appealing mineral tones.
Name: Vista Hills 2017 Treehouse Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: In a sea of nondescript Pinot Grigios, this shows some varietal character and interest, especially for the affordable price. The nose is appley and honeyed with ripe apricot fruit and pits, pineapple rind and almond paste. It's drier than expected on the palate considering the honeyed nose, and texturally on the oily side, veering into medium-body territory. Drink with spicy Asian cuisine.
Name: Bulletin Place 2016 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Notes of ripe, green pear are subdued on the nose. They are more impressive on the palate where a little residual sweetness boosts them. Lemony freshness balances and creates an off-dry finish.
Name: Robert Karcher et Fils 2016 Harth Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe Mirabelle plum joins juicy pear notes on the nose. The palate has a similar, fruit-driven ease of rich pear flavors and sunny freshness. This easy, light wine finishes dry, despite a smidge of sweetness.
Name: Domaine Mersiol 2017 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a simple, citrusy stone-fruited sipper with something a little chemical, like lemon-scented furniture polish, swirling around. Nevertheless, the palate is balanced and dry with crisp acidity and very slight fruit weight.
Name: Yalumba 2017 The Y Series Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: A rather obvious but likable wine, this has heady aromas of ripe peaches and pears, apple skins and flowers. The palate shows a little residual sugar but overall it's a mostly dry style with a slightly waxy texture. Knock this back with Chinese egg rolls and lo mein.
Name: Yellow Tail 2017 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Broad notes of ripe pear also have a hint of bruised apple on the nose. The palate comes in with easy pear notes that lack definition. This wine is easy and dry, with a slightly bitter finish. Drink soon.
Name: André Kientzler 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear notes have tinges of cream and earth that carry through on the palate where they broaden what should be defined. The body is fruity and dry but the earthy element adds bitterness. Drink soon.
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2016 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Heady aromas of fragrant spring flower and orchard fruit leap out of the glass. On the bright, simple palate, fresh acidity accompanies green apple and citrus notes.
Name: Settesoli 2017 Mandrarossa Jummare Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

Description: This wine doesn't succeed as well as some of Sidewood's others. The oak influence is sweet and on the sweaty side, and it's sitting rather clunkily beside ripe peach, pineapple, apple and lime notes. The palate sees plenty of tangy fruit and a decent lick of acidity, but it's not quite enough to lift some of the textural flabbiness. The oak rears its head again on the finish.
Name: Sidewood 2016 Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)

Description: A fruit bowl of pineapple, peach and watermelon, this is a simple, dry drop that doesn't show much in the way of character or pizazz but won't offend either.
Name: Jacob's Creek 2016 Pinot Grigio (Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Lemon and grapefruit notes are slightly overwhelmed by vegetal ones: tomato leaf, lettuce and wet green leaves. The palate is crisp but balanced with a touch of residual sugar.
Name: Banrock Station 2015 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Structured and savory, this opens with ripe orchard fruit, Alpine herb and toasted oak aromas. The full-bodied palate doles out ripe Anjou pear, pineapple, ginger and citrus zest flavors while a mineral note enwraps the finish. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Elena Walch 2016 Vigna Castel Ringberg Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine's floral and fruity honeysuckle, citrus and green apple aromas practically jump out of the glass. The juicy, medium-bodied palate doles out ripe Granny Smith apple, Bartlett pear and tangerine flavors, alongside a hint of crushed stone. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Erste Neue 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Honeydew melon and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose of this wine. The rounded, medium-bodied palate doles out white peach, nectarine zest and steely mineral notes alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Andriano 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Yellow stone fruit, citrus blossom and tropical fruit aromas take center stage in this wine. The creamy palate delivers honeydew melon, white peach and juicy nectarine flavors, alongside tangy acidity. A mineral note gives it a savory close.
Name: Terlan 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of pear, beeswax and white spring flower take center stage in this lovely white. The medium-bodied palate doles out white peach, citrus and almond flavors, with fresh acidity.
Name: Terlato 2016 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Ripe orchard fruit, acacia and toast aromas lead the nose of this wine. It's round and full-bodied, offering mature yellow apple, ripe Bartlett pear and bitter almond flavors alongside tangy acidity. Drink through 2019.
Name: Colterenzio 2016 Puiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: More fruity and rich than many examples, this wine from a single vineyard in the cool Anderson Valley has a ripe apple aroma, mouthfilling apple and melon flavors and a smooth texture.
Name: North Coast All Stars 2016 Lichen Estate Vineyard Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: This wine's delicate bouquet of white flowers and ripe orchard fruit floats from the glass. The elegant palate delivers white peach, citrus and honeydew melon flavors alongside fresh acidity. A lightly savory mineral note lifts the finish.
Name: Jermann 2016 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's honeysuckle, hawthorn and honeydew melon aromas take center stage while the medium-bodied palate offers green apple, citrus and white peach notes. Fresh acidity brightens the fruity flavors.
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2017 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: This wine's subdued aromas of white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit emerge in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the bright palate offers green apple, white peach and citrus notes. It has a clean, juicy finish.
Name: Colterenzio 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine's intense honeysuckle, jasmine and ripe green apple aromas leap out of the glass. The green apple note carries over to the palate, along with honeydew melon and citrus. Fresh acidity and a hint of mineral lift the fruity flavors.
Name: Peter Zemmer 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This assertive and earthy wine is crisp and nervy, showing lively herb, wet stone and citrus aromas, crisp apple and lemon flavors and a texture that's firmed up by good fruit acidity.
Name: Saint Gregory 2016 Pinot Gris (Mendocino County)

Description: This wine's nose is rather shy but eventually reveals a whiff of spring flower. The simple palate offers mature apple, pear and beeswax notes alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Ca' Ronesca 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This light-bodied wine balances fresh ripe fruit aromas and flavors against good crisp acidity. It has a refreshing mouthfeel that's partly rich and partly tart, and a very clean finish.
Name: Three Thieves 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honey, pear blossom, banana and honeydew aromas make for a fairly reserved but clean nose on this bottling, Bright acidity leads the palate, where ripe Asian pear, lemon bar and guava flavors provide decent verve.
Name: Bianchi 2016 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This wine's subdued exotic fruit and acacia flower aromas lift out of the glass. The rounded, fruity palate offers mature pear and ripe honeydew melon flavors while a banana note marks the close.
Name: Pighin 2016 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Powdery white-fruit aromas are friendly. This is honest on the palate, with some acidic kick and a touch of body weight. Kiwi, lychee and citrus flavors end with a peppery note.
Name: Graffigna 2017 Pinot Grigio (Argentina)

Description: Aromas of lemon and pear drop are of medium intensity on the nose. The palate has an appealing stoniness and a lasting flavor of lemon curd. Bright acidity offers a long, zippy finish.
Name: Rosemont 2017 Pinot Grigio (Virginia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of canned peach, apple and spice that are followed by off-dry fruit flavors. It's a straightforward easy drinker.
Name: Lone Birch 2016 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: Mild white-fruit aromas are generic. This is a lighter-bodied patio white wine with tropical tang. Citrusy flavors are both lean and mild, while this delivers just enough snap on the tail end.
Name: Santa Julia 2017 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: Punchy aromas of citrus fruits set up a simple but snappy palate. Tangy citrus flavors give this light-bodied white a sense of freshness. On the finish, a hint of salt blends with lingering citrus notes.
Name: Argento 2016 Cool Climate Selection Pinot Grigio (Argentina)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Light airy aromas lead to a chunky palate with vegetal weight. Slightly green flavors include a sweet hint of melon. The conclusion is short, without a lot of oomph.
Name: François Lurton 2017 Piedra Negra Alta Coleccion Pinot Gris (Valle de Uco)

Description: This wine is light-bodied and very straightforward in flavor, showing modest apple and citrus aromas and equally light flavors. It feels soft on the palate and carries a hint of sweetness.
Name: Bota Box 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is an extremely fresh, vibrant and lovely wine that should be enjoyed in its utter youth. Clean, chalky and stony aromas of crushed oyster shells, wet shaved marble and the lightest hints of nectarine lead into a racy, mouthwatering palate of wet concrete, grapefruit rind and Gravenstein apple flesh.
Name: Peloton 2016 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Grigio (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From the winery that introduced Pinot Gris to America comes another gem. Pungent aromas suggesting citrus oil and petrol lead to a complex and detailed palate stacked with grapefruit, lemon and pineapple flavors. Leesy minerality contributes to a long, clean, immaculate finish. It would be hard to find a better or more affordable all-purpose summer white.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2016 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Panther Creek has made a truly sensational Pinot Gris this vintage. It's immaculately fresh and clean, with a delicious mix of creamy and crunchy pear and cantaloupe fruit. Backed by appealing minerality, this is one gulpable white wine.
Name: Panther Creek 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Part of an expanding portfolio from NW Wine Company, this is a creamy, leesy take on Pinot Gris. Its rich fruit flavors bring jicama, white peach and cinnamon-dusted apple to mind, with a soft finish reminiscent of unsalted whipped butter. Overall, this delivers exceptional style and grace.
Name: Northwest Ridge 2016 8 Barrel Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This wine is clean, crisp and tasty. Aromas of honey, lime peel and rounded mango lead into a palate that's zippy in bright acidity and grippy in structure. Racy mandarin zest, yellow melon and wet stone flavors carry the palate.
Name: Maddalena 2016 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One of the first 2017s to hit the market, this shines brightly. It's a racy, textural wine with vividly fresh ripe pear fruit and light spice. Drink now.
Name: Second Growth 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Crisp and spicy, this melds apple, pear and white peach fruit with riper, more tropical flavors. It's a versatile style of Pinot Gris that finishes dry despite its 2 g/L of residual sugar.
Name: Coeur de Terre 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight and bright on the nose with citrus and lime blossoms, this stainless bottling also offers slightly warmer aromas of nectarine and peach as well on the nose. There's a hint of grass clipping on the front of the palate, but then it opens toward lemon, lime and tonic water flavors.
Name: Tangent 2016 Paragon Vineyard Pinot Gris (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Nothing stands out here, but it's a perfectly sound and drinkable wine, with round, clean fruity flavors. Apple and pear notes come together, with a touch of pineapple and citrus zest.
Name: Agate Ridge 2016 Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's spicy pear aromas spring from the glass, and the flavors follow. There's a touch of lemon cookie and a bitter seed- and skin-inflected finish.
Name: Siltstone 2016 Blacktail Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Kramer's Celebrate series features non-traditional sparkling wine grapes that are carbonated in tank rather than re-fermented in the bottle. This is light, tart and dry, with delicate hints of spearmint gum and grapefruit. It's a good mixer.
Name: Kramer 2016 Celebrate Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Description: A lovely, substantial white, this offers rocky, floral mineral elements around a medium build of viscosity and relative density. Lemon zest and apricot flavors provide freshness and depth.
Name: Etude 2016 Pinot Gris (Carneros)

Description: Jules Taylor comes through with yet another classy wine, this time in the form of a medium-bodied Pinot Gris with flesh on its bones. Lifted pear, peach and white pepper aromas continue to the palate. Medium-bodied with delicate acidity and a spicy finish, this wine is begging for just about any kind of Asian cuisine.
Name: Jules Taylor 2016 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This Pinot Gris offers aromas of citrus blossom and gooseberry, with flavors of lemon zest, lemon flan and crème caramel. It is balanced on the palate, with a bright but creamy finish.
Name: Domaines Vinsmoselle 2015 Blech-Kleinmacher Naumberg Grand Premier Cru Pinot Gris (Moselle Luxembourgeoise)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Intriguing aromas of apple skin, kiwi, minerals and pear are followed by a fascinating palate that is sleek in style but still boasts plenty of kiwi and pineapple flavors on the finish. It's all framed nicely by bright acidity.
Name: Ross Andrew 2016 Celilo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: This Pinot Grigio offers aromas of lemon grass and lime pith that lead to flavors of grapefruit, and honeydew melon before the clean finish.
Name: Purcari 2016 1827 Pinot Grigio (Moldova)

Description: Flavorful and unusually gutsy for the varietal, this wine has almost meaty aromas, lots of grape-skin and grapefruit flavors on the palate and a sense of density the comes from a little tannin in the texture.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This wine gets its charm from a refreshing mouthfeel and clean light flavors rather than from richness or concentration. It is light bodied, tangy and well balanced.
Name: Montevina 2016 Glass Falls Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Golden hued with a pink tinge, this highly perfumed wine is hardly lacking in the floral and spice department. Apples and ginger mix with butter and toffee, and things continue in this direction on the palate. It's slippery in texture and medium-bodied, with enough acidity to prop it up.
Name: Villa Maria 2016 Private Bin Pinot Gris (East Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Slightly funky aromas of melon, apple and spice lead to full bodied, textured fruit flavors. It finishes with a bitter note that causes a bit of distraction.
Name: Cerulean 2016 Acadia Vineyards Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: This is a refreshing, palate-cleansing wine that blends crisp apple and white peach flavors on a tangy texture that's supported by good acidity. It's light bodied and appetizing.
Name: CK Mondavi 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This is a ripe and rich wine in notes of red apples and tropical fruits, which take a back seat to honey, ginger and an intriguing copper penny tang. There's more of the same tang on the palate but things get pretty heavy and creamy, with little acidity to help freshen things up.
Name: Bird 2016 Pinot Gris (Gisborne)

Description: Medium gold in color, this is a rich, ripe and fleshy version of Pinot Gris. Heady aromas of tropical fruits, bruised apples and pears along with flower blossoms are followed by a creamy, weighty palate that squeaks in just enough acidity to keep things from getting overly heavy.
Name: Sherwood Estate 2016 Sherwood Pinot Gris (Waipara Valley)

Description: Semisweet and very fruity, this easy-drinking wine has floral peachy aromas and flavors and a soft texture with just enough of a citrus component to keep it lively.
Name: California Roots 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Aromas of lemon zest and Granny Smith apple carry the nose and lead the way to a palate of lemon curd and more green apple.
Name: Vini 2016 Veni Vidi Vici Pinot Grigio (Danube River Plains)

Description: This wine has an unusual amount of flavor concentration and body, and it's already well aged. Interesting to smell the honeysuckle and taste the peach and earth flavors while a rich texture grips the palate
Name: Séamus Wines 2014 Pearl Pinot Gris (Lodi)

Description: This is an opulent style dripping with buttered toast, ripe pear, flint and green vegetal notes. The palate is soft and creamy but not without acidity. It's hard not to get sucked into the glass.
Name: Brancott 2016 Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)

Description: This light-bodied wine has a lively, slightly spritzy texture and lots of vivid canteloupe and peach flavors accented by earth and white pepper. It's definitely better than your average neutral-tasting Pinot Grigio.
Name: Van Ruiten 2016 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: A delicious bottle of Pinot Gris from Iris is as certain as a sunrise. This lightly tawny wine brings scents of lemon oil, white flowers and lemon verbena. The lovely fruit pulls in apple, pear, kiwi and a touch of banana, all in perfect balance. In short, this is a thoroughly engaging and versatile white wine.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2016 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Young, big and pleasantly chunky, this flavorful wine is loaded with green apple, tart melon and enough acidity to conjure up gooseberries. Enjoy it now for its exceptional fruit and freshness.
Name: King Estate 2016 Backbone Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a block selection and the highest level effort of the winery's three Pinot Gris. Fermentation was carried out in both barrels and tanks, and that adds some welcome roundness and flesh to the midpalate. Citrus, cucumber and apple flavors come lightly touched with barrel toast. Drink now through 2021.
Name: Winter's Hill 2016 Reserve Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a bright fresh take on the grape, lightly spicy and showing a gentle dusting of cinnamon. The freshly cut pear flavors are perfectly ripe and densely packed.
Name: Sokol Blosser 2016 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: With a nose of melon and almond blossom, this wine offers flavors of green apple, pear and lemon, with soft floral notes. It is bright on the palate yet soft in the mouth, with a citrus finish that is marked by a touch of bitter almond.
Name: Dalton 2016 Estate Unoaked Pinot Gris (Galilee)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The winery makes a trio of Pinot Gris, this one fermented entirely in stainless steel. It's clean and fresh, mountain spring over rock, with green apple and jicama fruit. There's a tension to it, and it's well-defined and taut through the finish.
Name: Winter's Hill 2016 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: This is a chunky wine with fruit leaning to the green (but still ripe) side of flavors. Apple, lime and grapefruit are in play, with a touch of bitter skin flavors also. It's balanced and persistent, with the structure to accompany poultry seasoned with fresh herbs.
Name: Rock Point 2016 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though well made and easy drinking, this has an overall lightness that seems almost too thin. Flavors conjure up snippets of lemon rind, pineapple and honeydew melon—fruity but lacking concentration. It's balanced with mineral acidity, and should be enjoyed while at its most fresh.
Name: The Four Graces 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This unusual wine is a bright strawberry shade and offers intense aromatics and flavors of strawberries and ripe cherries. It was fermented on the skins for 14 days, and one-quarter of the total was whole cluster. This is a tasty wine with some citrus snap to the finish.
Name: Duck Pond 2016 St. Jory Vineyard Skin Contact Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Invigorating freshness abounds in this dry, medium-bodied Grauburgunder, or Pinot Gris. Pristine lemon, apple and pear flavors are cutting and bright, marked by fresh acidity and a delicately textured mouthfeel. It's an easy going quaffer to enjoy now.
Name: Juwel 2016 Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This young, tart and focused wine mixes fresh green herbs, citrus rind, celery and apple components. It's balanced and refreshing, and not notably different, other than slightly cheaper, from the winery's regular bottling of Pinot Gris.
Name: Winter's Hill 2016 Watershed Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and leesy, this all-stainless wine has cucumber, apple and green-melon flavors, done in a light tart refreshing style. Drink up.
Name: Airlie 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasing aromas of almond butter, lemon zest and kiwi lead to papaya, pineapple and other tropical-fruit flavors. It delivers immediate appeal.
Name: Boomtown 2016 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lightly floral, this delicate but quite drinkable wine shows flavors of peavine, lime and pineapple. The fruit is just ripe enough, balanced and clean, with refreshing acidity.
Name: Cedar + Salmon 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Offering classic, varietal fruit flavors of apple and pear, this pleasant wine is lightly spiced and buoyed with supporting acids. It was finished in 5% new French oak.
Name: Melrose 2016 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Here is a light, tart, all-stainless style of wine, with interesting phenolic flavors of pear skin and green apples. Juicy acids bring a citrus component into it as well. It's lively and fresh: a good all-purpose crisp white wine.
Name: Eugene Wine Cellars 2016 b2 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Not quite as concentrated as the previous vintage, the fruit flavors of melon and pear are correctly varietal, yet somewhat dilute. The wine was fermented entirely in tank, and there is just a hint of metal flavoring the finish.
Name: Sweet Cheeks 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Pungent pineapple aromas, along with a hint of kerosene, indicate that this will not be your standard style of Oregon Pinot Gris. The intense herbaceous character dominates, suggesting some of the stylistic terminology that might accompany a particularly biting Sauvignon Blanc. Some 10% was fermented in concrete egg.
Name: Maysara 2016 Arsheen Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Description: An atypical variety for such a southern region, this Pinot Grigio shows some semblance to its brethren in the north, with apple, citrus and blossom tones, yet its missing all of the vibrancy and verve from a lack of acidity. Nevertheless, it's a perfectly clean and simple drink.
Name: Cantine del Borgo Reale 2016 Pinot Grigio (Puglia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of soda water, peach and melon lead to broad, dry, slightly viscous fruit flavors. It's an unusual interpretation of this variety.
Name: Eleven 2016 Sugarloaf Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A light straw color, with a hint of tawny skin, this is a blocky, simple and fruity style, high in alcohol with flavors of peaches. There isn't much to it beyond that one-dimensional fruit, and it finishes short and quick.
Name: Schmidt 2016 Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)

Description: Wet pebbles, nutty roundness, pear peel and a touch of smoke: the aromas in this wine will make you see Pinot Gris with fresh eyes. The palate has a translucent, filigreed slenderness, yet it packs a whole world of flavor. The midpalate reveals a sonorous backdrop of smokiness, against which fresh lemon notes soar. Dry, structured, eleganct and ageworthy. Drink 2018–2028.
Name: Wohlmuth 2015 Ried Gola Alte Reben Pinot Gris (Südsteiermark)

Description: From a vineyard known better for Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this lovely aromatic white is well crafted and fruity, dry with a creaminess to the texture that's beguiling without becoming too much. Lemon, quince and apricot flavors provide a bright, lingering fleshiness that will work deliciously at the table. It spent six months in neutral French oak.
Name: Ancien 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Carneros)

Description: Ripe red apple and orange zest richness create a fresh, appetizing aroma in this wine. The palate comes in with even more freshness, adding green apple tartness and lively, translucent lemon notes, with a pithy, zesty texture. A very original, refreshing and moreish wine quite outside its varietal idiom, it delivers loads of impact and flavor for such moderate alcohol. Bravo.
Name: Meinklang 2016 Graupert Pinot Gris (Weinland Österreich)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a waxy nose of peach and apricot—both dried and fresh—this is a dry, light-bodied wine that dances on the palate in moderately high acidity. Fermented entirely in stainless steel, it remains softly textured and vibrant from start to finish.
Name: Ron Rubin 2016 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: This wine is two-thirds Evergreen and one-third RAF vineyards, both in the Ancient Lakes appellation and all fermented and aged in stainless steel. It's spot on for the variety, with notes of whole Granny Smith apple and green melon. The palate redolent with sleek fresh apple and pear flavors that power through the finish. It's a standout at this price.
Name: Vino 2015 Pinot Grigio (Washington)

Description: Pale gold in color, the nose is a mélange of melon, stone fruit, strawberry leaf and oregano. The palate is full and rich, with an oily texture and flesh, melon fruit followed by a long, slippery finish.
Name: Greywacke 2015 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Floral, this wine offers voluptuously sizable weight and body around a soft texture of lasting acidity. The fruit leans tartly into grapefruit and lime.
Name: Benessere 2016 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

Description: Bright aromas of lime, pear and crushed chalk rise to the nose atop a slight bit of effervescence in this latest release from the actress Drew Barrymore. The sip is bright and playful with lots of fun energy and a compelling texture, proving easy to quaff if simple overall.
Name: Barrymore 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: An intriguing combo of citrus rind, pear juice, coppery penny and toast aromas precede a palate that is rich but with balanced acidity and a toasty finish. A food friendly tipple.
Name: Mt. Beautiful 2015 Pinot Gris (Canterbury)

Description: This is an appealing, opulent wine with a bouquet of watermelon, stone fruit, wild strawberry and white pepper. The palate is full-bodied and viscous in plenty of fruit.
Name: Mt. Difficulty 2015 Bannockburn Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: This rich, medium-bodied wine offers notes of green beans and asparagus in a chili sauce. A buttery, nutty core leads to a slightly bitter, toasty finish.
Name: Carrick 2015 Bannockburn Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Waxy lemon, green beans, melon and wet stone show their faces, if shyly, in this Kiwi Pinot Gris. The palate is slippery in feel, with a tongue-tingling line of prickly acidity and citrus notes throughout.
Name: Tablelands 2015 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely light on the nose, this wine eventually shows pleasant aromas of nectarine and orange peel. The palate is also inoffensive but mild, with poached apple and pear flavors, a touch of seared orange and the taste of a lemon juice on sweet squash.
Name: Firefly Ridge 2016 Pinot Gris (Central Coast)

Description: With a straw-gold hue, this is a creamy, full-bodied wine, with an unusual medley of asparagus, tomato stalk, ginger and lemon notes. On the palate, the acidity is nicely balanced but the style is rather brash and odd.
Name: Loveblock 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: If you're looking for a basic white quaffing wine that's priced to sell but won't wow, this is it. Oily aromas of almond skins come with hints of apple and pear. Modest acidity and nutty, yeasty flavors of salt and bitter melon finish with signs of early oxidation.
Name: Dancing Flame 2017 Ojos del Salado Pinot Grigio (Central Valley)

Description: Briny aromas of seashell include notes of petrol and motor oil. A watery palate is just O.K., while this tastes barely of fruit in front of a bitter-leaning finish.
Name: Lucatoni 2016 Reserve Pinot Grigio (Central Valley)

Description: This excellent wine leads with aromas and flavors of citrus, melon and green pineapple. It's vividly tangy and refreshing, with a saline quality and impressive focus and length. You'll want a case of this one.
Name: Portlandia 2016 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Breakfast tea, grapefruit and orange peel scents and a hint of spiced pumpkin come out of this well-priced sweet wine. With 67 g/L residual sugar and 12% alcohol, it's not shy by any standard. The acid is sufficient to balance out all that sugar, and it's rich enough that one half bottle can provide a dessert sip for a party of four.
Name: Spindrift Cellars 2014 Late Harvest Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pinot Gris continues to be at the top of this winery's releases, as this vintage bursts with exceptionally ripe, fleshy fruit. Tangerine, Meyer lemon and sweet orange notes combine in a juicy mix that leaves a sweet and tangy impression as it unwinds on the palate.
