Name: Willm 2016 Cuvée Emile Willm Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There is a touch of yellow mirabelle plum on the nose. The palate comes in with a more tart note of pith and zest. The slender body unites full fruit and lively freshness in a compact package, boosted by a little residual sweetness that nonetheless lets the wine finish dry.
Name: Willm 2016 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Perhaps it's simply too young, but this latest Pinot Gris from Deer Creek does not show the complexity of recent vintages. It's loaded with fresh apple-juice snap and flavor and a squeeze of lemon. Clean and fruit-centric, there's nothing at all wrong with it, and it's a fine thirst-quencher for a hot summer afternoon.
Name: Deer Creek 2016 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Fresh juicy Conference pear dominates nose and palate. The body is light and flavors are off dry, giving an extra boost to the ripe pear notes. The finish has a fresh pithy edge and is moreish. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, acacia and ripe orchard fruit take center stage while the round medium-bodied palate doles out candied nectarine slices and golden apple.
Name: Masut da Rive 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Tender notes of freshly cut juicy pear appear on the nose. The palate portrays the same appetizing fruit on a taut easy palate. The slight residual sweetness just boosts fruit flavors but still finishes dry.
Name: Robert Karcher et Fils 2015 Harth Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This opens with aromas of sunbaked earth, warm hay and crushed stone. The ripe round palate shows mature golden apple, ripe Bartlett pear and a hint of saline while a note of white almond marks the close.
Name: Colmello di Grotta 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: An almost creamy wave of pear fruit hits the nose. The palate is equally soft and full fruited, boosted by residual sweetness that makes the fruit fluid and rounded. This is countered by ample zesty freshness that has a pithy slightly bitter edge. The finish is just off dry and clean.
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This brings a lively mix of green citrus and green banana, with a light streak of white peach. All in all, it's balanced and fresh, though it falls on the lighter side, despite the generous finished alcohol.
Name: Yamhill Valley 2015 Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Description: Some funk on the nose soon blows off to reveal generously ripe fruit of yellow pear. The palate benefits from a touch of flavor-boosting residual sweetness but the finish is dry. This is full fruited and balanced. Drink while flavors are at their peak.
Name: Frédéric Mallo 2015 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of pineapple informs the ripe pear fruit on the nose with extra tropicality. The palate is a little hot and boisterous but the fruit wins through. There is freshness, too, and a dry finish.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2015 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of yeasty funk still clings to the pear-fruit nose. The palate brims with ripe juicy pear, helped along by some residual sweetness, and is contained by a pleasantly bitter zestiness. The body is slender but rounded and pervasive. A lively freshness lets it finish dry.
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2016 Cuvée Particulière Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Mellow notes of ripe pear and fresh earth combine on the nose. The palate majors in ripe juicy pears, boosted by a touch of residual sweetness. The aromas are fresh and easy. Drink this while they are at their peak. The finish is just off dry.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2015 Grande Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This copper-colored Pinot Grigio (a result of brief skin contact) offers subdued aromas suggesting yellow flower, toasted nut and citrus zest. Aged in barriques, the linear, rather lean palate offers oak, coconut, lemon and a note of bitter nut while a saline note wraps up the finish. Not your typical Pinot Grigio for sure.
Name: Vie di Romans 2015 Dessimis Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: While there is ample pear fruit on nose and palate, bitter pith notes seem to be dominant. Alcoholic heat is palpable on the midpalate. The finish is dry and returns to the fruity pear notes.
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2016 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Done in a fresh and leesy style, this offers minimalistic fruit flavors, but strong suggestions of phenolics such as apple skins, grapefruit pith and lemon peel. The underlying mineral-drenched acidity keeps it lively.
Name: Sweet Cheeks 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Subdued aromas of pressed acacia flower, hay and beeswax take shape in the glass. The mature palate offers ripe yellow apple and a hint of citrus zest alongside a note of toasted almond. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Villa Russiz 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit and banana lead the nose. Bright and straightforward, the palate offers green apple and a nectarine note alongside zesty acidity that gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Attems 2016 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Round and friendly, this opens with aromas of banana and tropical fruit. The scents carry over to the ripe fruity palate along with yellow apple and a hint of lemon peel.
Name: Pighin 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tightly wound, with strong phenolic skin highlights, this shows apple and pear skin flavors, with a slightly oxidized character. Despite its youth, this wine is ready to drink now and should be consumed in the coming year.
Name: Goodfellow 2015 Clover Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Ripe and juicy, this offers aromas of pressed spring flower and yellow stone fruit. On the bright palate, a note of candied nectarine zest accents ripe yellow apple and dried apricot.
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: A little yeasty funk is all that appears on the nose. The palate has an edge of pithy bitterness that stands in contrast to the charming ripe pear that's boosted by a little residual sweetness. This seems a little out of joint but finishes dry with zesty grapefruit notes.
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose is very shy and just gives brief glimpses of pear fruit. The palate is a little dilute but has enough fruit to capture the appeal of pear-scented Pinot Gris. The body is rounded, has a pleasantly bitter edge and finishes dry.
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Cuvée de l'Ours Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subdued aromas of yellow flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of nut lift out of the glass. The palate seems rather evolved, offering suggestions dried citrus zest and a hint of baked yellow apple. It closes on a bitter almond note.
Name: La Boatina 2015 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Pithy zesty notes rise from the glass. The palate has the same lifted, pithy, and slightly bitter edge but some residual sweetness rounds the pear apparent on the palate into fluid fruitiness. The bitter edge remains and the wine finishes dry.
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Both nose and palate display a contrast between rounded ripe pear fruit augmented by residual sweetness and a rather bitter, pithy and phenolic edge. There is freshness here, but heat, too. It seems out of balance.
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2016 Lieu-Dit Altenbourg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Fresh easy notes of pear drop rise from the glass. The very slender palate has lemony freshness but also residual sweetness and a pithy phenolic edge. This is fresh, off dry and just balanced. Drink soon.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2016 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose suggests freshly cut Russet pear peel. The palate, slightly dilute, has a bitter edge and expresses just a little of that ripe pear suggested on the nose. Freshness helps the wine to finish dry. Drink soon while aromas hold.
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Découverte Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This wine has light citrus aromas and flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and yellow peach. Pleasant fruit sweetness marks the finish.
Name: Jidvei 2015 Demi-Sec Pinot Grigio (Jidvei)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas that evoke dried yellow flower and overripe citrus peel. The aromas carry over to the lean brisk palate along with suggestions of lemon, bitter yellow-apple skin and an unusual funky hint of crushed black olive.
Name: Ascevi Luwa 2015 Ceròu Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the reserve-level Pinot Gris, comprised of lots from five different vineyards. Juicy, succulent and quite tart fruit flavors emphasize fresh apples and pears, lightly dusted with cinnamon spice. The concentration and lingering finish prove it worthy of its reserve status.
Name: King Estate 2015 Backbone Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Medium to full in body and off-dry in style, this remains bright and refreshing on the finish thanks to vibrant acidity. Honeycomb aromas give way on the palate to hints of apple, pear, peach and citrus, yet hold onto a savory edge.
Name: Prophet's Rock 2014 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This exceptional release is firm and focused, with lip-smacking acidity. Tart apple and tangy limeade pack the core flavors, underscored with wet-stone minerality.
Name: King Estate 2015 Pfeiffer Vineyards Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is bursting with ripe luscious fruits, a generous assortment of pear, tangerine, apricot and more. It's a big full-bodied and juicy delight, ready right now. Drink up!
Name: Vista Hills 2015 Treehouse Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Half estate, half Pfeiffer Vineyard fruit, this is crisp and racy, with bright intense flavors of white peach and gooseberry. It's bracing, clean and thoroughly refreshing—great for a hot summer day.
Name: King Estate 2015 Unity Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's citrus blossom and ripe orchard fruit aromas lead to a tangy palate. Round and savory, it doles out creamy green apple, white peach and tangerine drop flavors.
Name: Tenuta Luisa 2015 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh, clean and varietal, this pushes fleshy pear flavors with a light hint of grapefruit. The presence in the mouth is full and satisfying, with a touch of honeysuckle, and the juicy finish lingers deliciously.
Name: Scenic Valley Farms 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A dry style with just enough acid to lend focus and length, this is a fine effort from Simon Waghorn, the owner-winemaker. Hints of baking spices and ginger lend nuance to the apple, pear, melon and citrus fruit.
Name: Astrolabe 2015 Province Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Exotic tropical pineapple overtones give an immediate impression of ripeness. The palate confirms that generous fruit but also delivers a lovely phenolic texture and sufficient freshness to keep it lively and appetizing. The finish is lemony and clean.
Name: Kracher 2015 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Description: Full-bodied, rich and a bit sweet, this plump wine offers up hints of honey, cinnamon toast and ripe pear and melon. Drink it before the end of 2017.
Name: Kumeu River 2014 Pinot Gris (Kumeu)

Description: Citrus blossom and orchard fruit aromas lead the way. On the round, medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity supports ripe yellow apple and pear flavors. A hint of citrus zest marks the close.
Name: Castello di Spessa 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Crunchy fresh pears and white grapefruit abound in this pert fruity Pinot Grigio. Despite its light body, it's expansive and silken on the palate, finishing on a crisp lemon-drop tone. Drink now through 2019 to maximize its fresh appeal.
Name: Damiani 2016 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Completing and complementing the winery's extensive portfolio of Pinot Gris, this is the only one that spends time in barrel. As a note to its uniqueness, the King Estate name is intentionally printed upside down on the label. Though there are no intrusive oak-dominated flavors, the technique definitely softens and smooths the wine, eliminating some of the aromatic details and much of the tang. It's ready to drink: lightly toasty, with pleasant apple and pear flavors.
Name: King Estate 2015 Paradox Barrel Aged Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Cinnamon and clove notes accent fleshy fruit flavors of ripe pear and melon in this broad, nearly full-bodied wine. Those attractive spice notes linger on the finish.
Name: Huia 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Mild peach skin and apricot aromas precede fresh and vivid white peach flavors in this dry, refreshing wine. It's well balanced, has enough concentration to keep it interesting and will be very versatile with food.
Name: Domenico 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: A solid effort, this medium- to full-bodied wine boasts attractive hints of cinnamon, ginger and clove, balanced by fresh apple and pineapple fruit.
Name: Toi Toi 2016 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's an inviting textural richness to this rounded silky Pinot Gris. White grapefruit and yellow-cherry flavors are sunny on the palate, accentuated by subtle hints of spice and nuts. Delicate tangerine acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2014 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The barrel time in neutral French oak has softened and polished the edges of this wine. Flavors of green banana and apple carry some grace notes of marshmallow and coconut. It's an interesting, smooth and tasty effort.
Name: Phelps Creek 2015 Reserve Barrel Fermented Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: This wine has a personality that's both crisp and satisfying. White pepper and light earth aromas lead to tempting peachy flavors and an appealing texture that balances tanginess and richness. The blend includes small portions of Chardonnay, Albariño, Gewürztraminer and Orange Muscat.
Name: Estancia 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: White spring flower, ripe pear and grilled herb aromas take center stage in this medium-bodied white. The bright, linear palate offers green apple and citrus flavors, with a hint of clove.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Hay, pressed yellow flower and hazelnut aromas lead the nose in this deeply hued wine. The nutty note carries over to the evolved palate, with fennel and candied citrus zest flavors. It still boasts fresh acidity despite its age, but drink now to enjoy the remaining fruit.
Name: Toros 2010 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented whole cluster in 80% stainless steel, this fresh tart wine is packed with flavors of citrus and apple. It's crisply defined, finishing with a touch of freshly cut herb.
Name: Phelps Creek 2015 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A burst of juicy sweet-tart fruit belies the relatively low alcohol. It's plenty ripe, with a tasty mix of Meyer lemon, pear and peach. It was aged in neutral French oak, and carries the lightest suggestion of toast in the finish.
Name: Grizzly Peak 2015 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A touch of lemon candy brightens this fresh fruity Pinot Gris. It's dry and light bodied in style, offering crisp peach and grapefruit flavors. The finish is pristine but brisk. Drink now through 2019 to enjoy its youthful refreshment.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a tasty and fruity wine. It's front loaded with a juicy mix of apple and fresh sliced pear. Fermented entirely in stainless steel, it fills the mouth with flavor and a pleasing, textural grip.
Name: Panther Creek 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Ripe orchard fruit and pressed yellow flower aromas lead the nose while the medium-bodied palate offers yellow apple and pear flavors. A hint of orange zest lends a tangy finish.
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This is a fruity, tropical rendition of grape, showing guava, papaya, coconut and apple aromas on the nose. The palate packs loads of floral character, with more tropical fruit and bubblegum-like flavors that feel ripe but not sweet.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2016 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is Alsatian in style and almost reductive, with pink grapefruit pith, bitter orange, rounded peach and quinine touches. It's tightly wound on the palate, with high-toned petrol flavors accenting its crisp stone fruit core
Name: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Delicate orchard fruit and hawthorn scents drift out of the glass in this wine. The light, vibrant palate offers green apple and white peach flavors framed by racy acidity, finishing crisp and refreshing.
Name: Kettmeir 2016 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright, with notes of whole cantaloupe, candle wax and ripe sliced banana. The palate is bone dry, with tart, lemony acids providing the structure. Bitters linger on the finish.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2016 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Soft, ripe flavors approximate baked apples or pears laced with cinnamon and allspice, even incorporating a hint of dusty tannin into the mix on the drying finish.
Name: Hillersden 2016 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This broad, mouthfilling wine is simple but satisfying. Melon and citrus notes combine to offer just enough flavor interest, while remaining refreshing on the finish.
Name: Kate Radburnd 2014 Sun Kissed Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Melon, baking spices and citrus pith come together in this medium- to full-bodied wine that finishes with a slightly bitter edge. Drink up.
Name: Goose Bay 2014 Kosher Pinot Grigio (South Island)

Description: This straightforward white has a shy nose, while the lean, simple palate suggests green apple and lemon. Firm acidity gives it a crisp, refreshing finish.
Name: Collavini 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The flavors are an interesting mix of apple and pear, but with notes of pepper, celery and orange. It's a bit flat tasting, but aggressive aeration helps. Though finished dry, there is an impression of slightly granular sugar peeking through.
Name: Second Growth 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This wine's oak and butterscotch aromas follow through to the lean palate, along with hints of toasted nut. Although linear and focused, it doesn't have enough fruit richness to stand up to the evident oak.
Name: Marco Felluga 2013 Mongris Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This wine's flavors maybe take it a step too far into baked apple and pear territory, adding superripe melon to the mix as well. It's full-bodied, silky textured and broad in the mouth, with a touch of warmth on the finish.
Importer: Vinovia Wine Group/ Marisco Vineyards USA
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2015 The King's Thorn Waihopai Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This assertive, dry wine has wet stone and cured meat aromas and tart, mouth-cleansing grapefruit and pineapple flavors. It will make a fine foil for rich foods like fettucine alfredo or fried chicken.
Name: Ironstone 2015 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Delicate sweetness and fresh grapefruit acidity lifts more savory notes of pressed apple and pear in this off-dry Pinot Gris. It's light bodied and easy drinking with a moderately long lemony finish. Drink now.
Name: Adirondack Winery 2016 Break By The Lake Pinot Gris (New York)

Description: This opens with subdued, mature yellow apple, acacia and almond aromas that carry over to the abrupt, tangerine-inflected palate. It has a lean, bitter finish.
Name: La Rajade 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are barely a whisper, with notes of citrus and herb. It drinks dry with lightly concentrated fruit flavors. The variety seems hard to find.
Name: Hogue 2015 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: White spring flower and orchard fruit aromas lead the nose. The lean, rather evolved palate still retains fresh acidity, but drink soon to capture the remaining yellow apple and lemon peel flavors.
Name: Ascevi Luwa 2015 Grappoli Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This has medicinal herb and adhesive bandage aromas that carry over to the lean palate. Racy acidity and a bitter note give it a firm, brisk finish.
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Zesty lemon and grapefruit aromas awaken the senses in this sunny, dry-style Pinot Gris. Plump and pleasantly clingy on the palate, it's balanced with crisp, tangerine acidity and a bite of astringency on the finish. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Villa Wolf 2015 Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Description: In the mouth there's the slightest impression of sweetness, though technically this may be considered dry. In any event it's loaded with pear and apple fruit, lightly spicy and well suited to any number of picnic, pasta, poultry and salad entrées.
Name: Rainstorm 2015 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A pale copper color, this is not a rosé, but it shows the effect of a cold soak prior to pressing, capturing the light blush color natural to the grape. Smooth and demonstrating suggestions of strawberry, it brings up pear-skin phenolics in the finish, adding texture, length and some sassy bite.
Name: Emerson 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Surprisingly silky on the palate, this approachable but elegant Pinot Grigio is a great value. Its punchy tangerine and lemon flavors are crisp and widely appealing, but there's also a nuanced slick of minerality on the midpalate. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Starling Castle 2015 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Rich round fleshy fruit flavors of pear and cantaloupe show excellent concentration. There's a powdered sugary sweetness lurking in the background, not unpleasantly, but this is no bone dry example of Pinot Gris. Drink chilled with cold chicken or light pasta dishes.
Name: Conveyance 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Here is a good all-purpose and widely available Oregon Pinot Gris. It's got classic pear and apple fruit flavors, well balanced against tangy acidity. There's no oak here, but the whole cluster press brings some spicy phenolics.
Name: Eola Hills 2015 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This tilts the fruit emphasis away from peach and into pear, with a slight suggestion of vanilla cream. It's got medium weight and concentration, and it's supple, well integrated, and balanced for immediate consumption.
Name: Winter's Hill 2015 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Plump and mouthfilling, this easy, peachy Pinot Grigio offers forward fruit in a bold yet balanced package. It's a bit dense in body, but crisp acidity refreshes the midpalate. The finish is bright with tangerine notes. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Flower Garden 2015 Pinot Grigio (Rheinhessen)

Description: Zesty lime and pineapple notes lend revitalizing acidity to this fresh, thirst-quenching Pinot Grigio. It's moderate in body, with a lean, steely finish. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Thomas Halby 2014 Pinot Grigio (Nahe)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a challenging wine, but it takes bravery to make Pinot Grigio like a red wine, using amphorae and terra cotta along the way. It's pink, but not a rose. Zesty aromas of tangerine, wet stone and grapefruit skins also show a bit of yeast. There is strong kumquat tang to the sip, which is fairly sour without the ripeness one might expect from the color.
Name: Giornata 2015 Ramato Quattro Bassi Ranch Vineyard Pinot Grigio (San Luis Obispo)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is an easy-drinking Pinot Gris, with light melon and pear fruit. It's well-balanced and lively, with modest concentration.
Name: Gersing 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One of a trio of Pinot Gris offered in this vintage, this has a yeasty beery character. It falls into a generic white wine style, refreshing enough for a warm day's glug, with that yeasty tang reminiscent of a good cold brew. There is not much in the way of varietal expression though, just a bit of apple and pear fruit coming up in the finish.
Name: Winter's Hill 2015 Watershed Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of slightly overripe fruit lead to just off-dry fruit flavors. It lacks a sense of cohesion.
Name: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2015 Rascal Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of wilted white flowers and ground herbs are followed by off-dry drinking fruit flavors, with peanut shell notes on the finish.
Name: Mellisoni 2016 Estate Pinot Grigio (Lake Chelan)

Description: Here's a savory Pinot Grigio that's loaded with character, offering inviting aromas of white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit. The round, medium-bodied palate has just enough weight, doling out ripe Bartlett pear, creamy yellow apple and a hint of juicy tangerine while an energizing mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Terlan 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hailing from an extreme coastal vineyard, this 100% stainless steel aged bottling expertly captures that racy freshness. The nose offers rounder cider and apple juice notes, accented with brown pear and clove, but the palate is even more intriguing: nervy acidity, chalky, limestone-like grip and lean Asian pear flavors.
Name: Derby 2015 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Enticing scents of chamomile, white spring flower and white stone fruit mingle together in the glass. The creamy full-bodied palate doles out ripe honeydew melon, juicy yellow pear and nectarine zest while a ginger note adds depth. A far cry from the many bland Pinot Grigios that flood the market, this one is loaded with personality.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2015 Anger Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Waxy peach-, pineapple- and pear-scented, this fulsome and fresh white offers lively acidity within a complex, medium-bodied framework. From estate-grown fruit, it's a rarity from the appellation and well worth seeking out.
Name: J Vineyards & Winery 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: This opens with aromas of chamomile flower and ripe Bartlett pear. The lively easy-drinking palate offers green apple, white peach and a juicy citrus note alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Andriano 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: White spring flower and apple aromas lead the way on this enjoyable white. The soft fresh palate doles out ripe Bartlett pear, citrus and a hint of mineral that lifts the finish.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This 100% Pinot Grigio opens with aromas of lemon, green apple and white peach that carry over to the juicy palate along with an almond note. Bright acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2015 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, yellow apple skin and a confectionery note. The aromas carry over to the firm palate along with butterscotch and a mineral note but it doesn't have quite enough fruit richness to stand up to the dominant oak sensations.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2014 Sanct Valentin Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of ripe (leaning almost overripe) apple, melon and orange peel are followed by medium-sweet fruit flavors. It needs more acid to stand it up.
Name: Martinez & Martinez 2015 Tudor Hills Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Starting off slightly reduced, this wine has aromas of dried red apple that lead to just off-dry, full apple flavors, finishing bitter.
Name: Latah Creek 2015 DenHoed Vineyards Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: A soft mouthfeel and fresh golden delicious apple flavors make this light-bodied wine easy on the palate. It has crisp and clean flavors all the way through.
Name: The Naked Grape NV Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This simple white opens with aromas of honeysuckle and pear while the easygoing palate offers hints of nectarine and green apple. Fresh acidity gives it a brisk finish. Drink soon.
Name: Famiglia Cielo 2016 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: Barley sugar, butterscotch, demerara sugar and the faintest hint of maple syrup suggest the richness of this SGN right away. The concentrated sweetness is countered with illuminating freshness and holds tons of tangy spice. Wow. This is incredibly concentrated and has an elixir-like bundled energy that seems to be alive. The effect is both mesmerizing and invigorating.
Designation: Clos Saint-Théobald Grand Cru Rangen Sélection de Grains Nobles
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2007 Clos Saint-Théobald Grand Cru Rangen Sélection de Grains Nobles Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose is still shy but already tells of tender sweetness. The palate has a rounded earthy smoky element that grounds the luscious generous fruit of dried pear and supersweet Reine Claude and mirabelle plums. The sweetness of this SGN is balanced and almost fresh, but the intriguing thing is a kind of smoky, dark and mysterious core of stone.
Designation: Clos Saint-Théobald Grand Cru Rangen Sélection de Grains Nobles Larme de Lave
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2007 Clos Saint-Théobald Grand Cru Rangen Sélection de Grains Nobles Larme de Lave Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Utter generosity of both ripe and dried pear is immediately evident on the nose. Notions of sandalwood hover. The dry palate carries that same, generous fluidity at its deep core. There is immense concentration, shimmering with dried, fresh and cooked pear. But there also is a sense of earth, stone and fresh orange peel. The wine seems like a message from another world, , leading you beyond the physical, into a wold of contemplation. The finish lasts and lasts.
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2014 A360P Muenchberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Generosity, expressed by the scent of sun-ripened Bosc pear peel, becomes immediately apparent. The ripe and luscious pear aromatics pervade the palate with their fruity, almost floral charm. There is some residual sweetness, boosting these flavors even more, but balance is struck by shining freshness and a pear-peel texture to finish with beguiling freshness. This is textbook stuff and utterly moreish.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2013 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: An incredibly creamy notion of ripe pear rises from the glass. There are also hints of sultana. The aromatic effect is one of huge generosity. The palate, on the other hand, is taut and medium dry, corralling its richness with pleasantly bitter texture and pervading freshness. There is utter concentration, immense verve and freshness. A delicious and moreish contrast between utter precision and the abandon of generosity. The finish is long, dry and fresh.
Name: Charles Sparr 2013 Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gently perfumed hints of ripe pear almost seem to have a floral dimension. On the palate the mellow, generous and totally ripe pear fruit unfolds fully and gives glimpses of very juicy ripe, dried and baked fruit. All of this richness is countered by lemony freshness. There is an earthy textural element, and more shimmering fruit reminiscent of bottled mirabelle plums. This is generous and just off dry, with a concentrated, convincing and very moreish balanced richness.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2013 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notions of pear emanate from the glass. The palate is equally gentle: ripe pear fruit, balanced by lovely lemon freshness. There is an arresting interplay of residual sweetness and zesty acidity at the core. However, the full spectrum of glorious pear fruit becomes fully expressed on the incredibly long finish. This has immense depth and will hold its poise for a few years yet. Drink now through 2025.
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2012 Hengst Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Heady notes of dried pear mingle with pleasant notes of earth. The palate is totally fluid and concentrated, streamlined with freshness but characterized by a rich luscious vein of sweetness. This is a late harvest to be reckoned with. Concentration and length are impressive and are just now getting into their stride.
Designation: Clos Saint-Théobald Grand Cru Rangen Vendanges Tardives
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2011 Clos Saint-Théobald Grand Cru Rangen Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Generous hints of ripe and dried pear are edged with gentlest vanilla spice and promise a rich palate, which duly follows but remains dry and fresh. All the ripe generous pear fruit is made even juicier by pervading lemony freshness. There is zesty texture, too, and a hint of earth and stone. Both concentration and freshness are impressive. The finish is totally dry and lasting.
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2013 Rosacker Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There is not just a notion of ripeness but almost of overripeness of pear fruit on the nose, accompanied by hints of honeysuckle. There also are hints of sandalwood and gentle vanilla. The palate is cushioned with mellow residual sweetness, making the rich flavors even more rich and generous. A vein of citrus freshness counters this, but this is in the generous, medium-sweet spectrum, oozing fruit and generosity. The finish, nonetheless, is precise and fresh. A great example of mature Pinot Gris.
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2010 Marckrain Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The richest and most generous hints of dried pear and fruit loaf rise from the glass. The palate continues in the same, generous vein with plenty of pear, shimmering and scintillating with juicy, mellow and just off-dry ripeness. This is countered by fresh lemon zestiness and leaves a totally balanced and very lasting impression. There are pleasant highlights of bitterness and that pervasive sense of pear fruit just lasts and lasts.
Designation: Brand Grand Cru Clos de la Treille
Name: François Baur 2014 Brand Grand Cru Clos de la Treille Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The palate is shy and needs air. It also surprises with a rounded pleasant nuttiness, amply supported by generously ripe pear fruit. This is juicy and moreish, with a hint of residual sweetness. Lemony freshness ensures that the finish is just dry. The combination of nuttiness, fruit and freshness is very convincing, harmonious and moreish.
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2012 Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This limited production wine advances the proposition that Pinot Gris can be substantial, complex and at least as ageworthy as the better Oregon Chardonnays. The mix of melon, white peach and lemon zest flavors, with compelling minerality, may inspire some additional cellar time. Drink now through 2024.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2015 Chalice Estate Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pinot Gris really shines at Carabella, as this two-clone blend demonstrates. Ripe pear fruit, along with a touch of Poire Williams, carries through a lovely, persistent, textural finish.
Name: Carabella 2015 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: The nose gives little away and is very shy. The palate, however, is a paradigm on lemony freshness—of textured candied lemon and pear richness and great concentration. All of the richness of Pinto Gris is present, but it is carried aloft by zesty citrus freshness to strike a note of harmonious tangy balance. The finish shimmers with pear, earth and spice.
Name: Domaine Gresser 2013 Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There almost is the slightest touch of lovely Poire William spirit on the nose. This is a lovely pear-scented, dry wine of immense fruitfulness. A homely earthiness counteracts this and makes for a concentrated, medium-dry but mellow palate. The finish is off dry, lasting and mouthfilling. There is something immensely satisfying about this.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2012 Spiegel Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The lift of heady aroma precedes the pear-fruited and herbal tisane-scented nose. The palate is gentle and has that same herbal softness. The fruit is rich with residual sweetness and characterized as ripe pear. This is balanced by zesty, pleasantly bitter citrus. The effect is of harmonious, gentle and generous balance. This mature Pinot Gris is now perfectly à point. Its flavors linger long and pleasantly.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2009 Vorbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Production is only about one-tenth as much as the Willamette Valley cuvée. For a couple bucks more you get a tight, less opulently fruity wine, with compact skin flavors over-riding fruit flesh. Hints of apple, pear and peach accompany a streak of minerality, and the persistence suggests that this will age nicely. Drink 2020 through 2026.
Name: Sokol Blosser 2015 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: A touch of wet stone and wet earth accompanies the scent of ripe pear on the nose. The palate, therefore, surprises with luscious, off-dry peachiness and ample fruit: ripe pears and juicy peaches abound with expressive flavor. Their generosity is met with lemony freshness. This is utterly moreish and seductive with a lemony, just off-dry finish that makes you want to sip again.
Name: Antoine Moltès & Fils 2015 Steinert Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is the first reserve Pinot Gris from the winery—half fermented in stainless, half in barrel. The wine feels as if it's very lightly oxidized, with dusty, tawny apple flavors that recall a good hard cider. Its power is in the persistent, bone dry finish, that never quits. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Carabella 2014 Reserve Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: Maturity gives a bruised apple aroma to the generous mellowness of ripe pear on the nose. The palate is more taut than the nose leads you to expect, but there is concentration and richness and more bruised apple skin texture. Fruit, evolved flavors and freshness make for an intriguing wine. Drink soon.
Name: Domaine Mersiol 2011 Frankstein Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Well differentiated from the winery's Pinot Blanc, this round and fleshy wine offers freshly cut pear fruit with a burst of orange juice and peel. It's bright, lively, spicy and a great all-purpose white wine when you need a break from Chardonnay.
Name: The Four Graces 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A very soft scent of pear rises from the glass. The mellowness of this pear fruit is expressed fully on the concentrated palate. Bosc pear shimmers and is boosted by slight residual sweetness. The finish is off dry, balanced and generous.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2015 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Don't be fooled by the low alcohol—this is fully ripened, finished, dry yet packed with delicious pear fruit flavors. Light suggestions of grapefruit and green apple add interest, and the fullness and freshness of the fruit is most impressive.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2015 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: An earthy hint accompanies the scent of ripe pear on the nose. The palate is diffuse with fruity pear and fresh lemon resulting in a very refreshing, textured wine with some concentration. The finish is lasting and dry.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2014 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a dry, relatively austere wine. It showcases aromas of wet stone and lemon thyme, followed by flavors of pineapple and lemon and a long, citrusy finish. Drink now.
Name: Redbank 2015 The Long Paddock Pinot Grigio (Victoria)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From the warmest vintage on record, ripeness was never the issue here. It's balance and freshness that are the litmus test, and this passes with flying colors. Firm polished apple and pear fruit anchors the wine, with highlights of citrus skin. It's got all you could ask for in an all-purpose, solid and tasty young white wine.
Name: Sokol Blosser 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Here's another super value from this under-the-radar producer. It's viscous and mouth filling, with lush pear and apple fruit. The concentration and fruit purity is exceptional.
Name: Lujon 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Classic flavors of pear flesh, along with a touch of Poire William liqueur, are the highlights here. It's a stylish, clean and persistent wine, that should be enjoyed within a couple of years of the vintage.
Name: Abiqua Wind 2015 Caleb Knorr Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Made with enough skin contact to yield a gentle coppery hue, this medium-bodied wine features aromas of cantaloupe, cherry and citrus. Cherry fruit on the palate is accompanied by vaguely Pinot Noir-like notes of dried bracken and moss, then glides to a long, silky finish. Drink now.
Name: McPherson Wine Company 2015 MWC Pinot Gris (Victoria)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel fermentation gives this a nice, spicy edge around softer flavors of melon and peach. There's a wash of vanilla as well, and as the flavors smooth out through a soft midpalate, a hint of butter comes up and completes the finish.
Name: Arbor Brook 2014 Guadalupe Vineyard Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Crisp and fresh, this comes out with some snap and sizzle from bright acidity. A pleasing mix of apple, pear and melon fruit catches hold in midpalate and continues on into a finish with some phenolic bite and a bitter edge.
Name: Montinore 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented in stainless steel, this is a lip-smacking wine with succulent citrus flavors of lemon and grapefruit. For those who love high-acid white wines, with some snap to their flavors, this is a good choice.
Name: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2014 Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: Just 10% of the blend was aged briefly in Acacia oak, and there's little evidence other than a slight hint of vanilla. What's here in abundance is bright, tart, tangy citrus fruit. It's a fresh and flavorful alternative to Chardonnay.
Name: Apolloni 2015 L Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a light easy-drinking style that fills the quaffable white wine bill quite nicely. It's lemony and tart, with a slice of orange peel for extra interest.
Name: Apolloni 2015 Estate Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)

Description: This wine offers an intriguing dichotomy. While the wine offers ample weight and a plump mouthfeel, the flavors seem underdeveloped, offering hints of wet stone, underripe melon and stone fruit, and tart citrus. Aniseed sneaks in on the dusty, tactile finish.
Name: Henschke 2015 Innes Vineyard Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This was barrel fermented, and picked up a fair amount of oaky flavor as a result. The barrels overtake the light apple fruit, at least for now, but consider this as a fine, inexpensive alternative to Chardonnay.
Name: River's Edge 2015 Pinot Gris (Elkton Oregon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean floral, river stone and Asian pear aromas make for an inviting nose on this wine. There is moderate tension on the palate, where rounded Gala apple flavors meet with honeysuckle, jasmine and grapefruit pith.
Name: SeaGlass 2015 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This uncomplicated bottling is delicate and light, making for easy, pleasant sipping. Lime pith, nectarine and wet clay aromas show on the nose, while the palate offers tension and subtle stone fruit and citrus flavors.
Name: Alma Rosa 2015 Pinot Gris (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Some richness and heft separate this wine from the pack, as it carries ripe white cherry and peach flavors on its soft but just-crisp-enough texture. Its medium to full body gives it a mouth-filling presence.
Name: Montevina 2015 Glass Falls Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This is a relatively simple, fruity quaff, filled to the brim with pears, apples and melons. It's medium-bodied, with a bit of apple- or pear-skin texture that gives it additional interest. Drink now.
Name: Stable Hill 2016 Palamino Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Light aromas of freshly cut, slightly oxidized red apple lead to medium- to full-bodied fruit flavors. It goes down easy.
Name: Rascal 2014 Pinot Gris (America)

Description: Light floral and green apple aromas and ripe apple and peach flavors make this wine tasty and easy to like. It's medium-bodied and soft on the finish.
Name: Three Thieves 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Pear, melon and citrus notes mark this plump, medium-bodied wine. There's a bit of copper hue to the wine's color, and while the finish is long, it also carries a hint of bitterness.
Name: Sidewood 2015 Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)

Description: There's a bit of spritz and very light flavors of fresh pear. A lick of honey winds through and continues on into the finish, offsetting a slightly bitter note.
Name: Harry & David 2015 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: You'll have to look in the very lower left hand corner of the back label to spot the vintage (2015) on this bottle. It's a light simple wine, with delicate flavors of melon and pear. The finish is soft and has a residual hint of paste.
Name: Stolen Identity 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This inexpensive wine is relatively low in alcohol and reasonably refreshing, although pear, melon and pineapple flavors leave a slightly sweet impression on the palate. Drink now.
Name: Yellow Tail 2015 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Pretty decent for a 10-spot, with slightly floral aromas, a hint of ginger and underripe pear fruit. It's medium bodied, with a dry, lightly textured, bitter finish. Drink now.
Name: Oxford Landing 2016 Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

Description: This is a pretty lean, ungenerous version of Pinot Gris. Wet stone and citrus aromas are promising, while the medium-bodied palate delivers lime and underripe stone fruit.
Name: Wakefield 2015 Pinot Gris (Clare Valley)

Description: Gorgeously lifted rich notes of orange zest fill the nose of this beautiful “orange” wine. Fermented on skins, it has all the elegance of white wine, combined with the tannic structure and backbone of red. Made from pink Pinot Gris grapes, this lends itself beautifully to this treatment and leaves us with an intriguing, concentrated, fresh and whistle-clean wine of great expression. Savor its salty orange-scented length.
Name: Meinklang 2015 Graupert Natural Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Description: This impressive white was fermented in equal parts concrete and stainless steel, retaining a lush texture and vibrant minerality. Night-blooming jasmine exudes from the glass before revealing well-defined layers of spiced lemon, peach and white pepper.
Name: Thirty-Seven Wines 2015 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Full bodied, rich and carrying a bit of residual sugar, this is a fine example of the variety's potential in Marlborough. Smoky, grilled-pear notes add hints of honey and melon on the palate, where despite its richness, the wine soars into a long, velvety finish. Drink now–2020, at least.
Name: Greywacke 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Crisp, clean flavors of apple and apricot shine in this medium-bodied, lively and dry white, an ideal companion at the table. A sly finish of lemon peel adds to its refreshment, and it's best enjoyed now.
Name: Les Belles Collines 2015 Pinot Gris (California)

Description: Rich and creamy, this barrel-fermented (in neutral oak) wine has appealing flavors of pear tart, grapefruit and coconut cream pie. The bracing acids compensate for all the lush creamy flavor, and the result is darn near irresistible.
Name: Township 7 2015 Naramata Estate Vineyard Reserve Pinot Gris (Okanagan Valley)

Description: There is a wonderfully aromatic element of something floral and tropical on the nose of this unusual Pinot Gris. The fruit expression is very ripe, reminiscent of melon and juicy pear, highlighted with pineapple and fresh lemon, but there also is ample zesty freshness for balance. If you thought you had tasted all that Pinot Gris has to offer, taste this one, which was created from unpruned vines left to their own devices and bearing deliciously few clusters of delicious fruit.
Name: Meinklang 2015 Graupert Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From one of the few producers to grow and make this variety in the appellation, this was fermented in both neutral oak and stainless steel. It's focused and viscous, with a tropical opening of Tahitian vanilla built around white peach, lemony acidity and a fresh, crisp texture.
Name: Balletto 2014 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: This wine may surprise you with its rich round full-bodied fruit. It's not the racy, high-acid style you might expect from a BC winery–rather it pumps up the flavors with pear, peach and papaya front and center, clean and fresh. Fermentation took place in a mix of oak, concrete egg and steel.
Name: Laughing Stock 2015 Pinot Gris (Okanagan Valley)

Description: Made in a clean, refreshing style, this is a medium-bodied wine that bursts with aromas and flavors of pear, melon and ginger. A pineapple note on the finish adds zest and freshness. Drink now.
Name: Wairau River 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Kim Crawford is the leading Sauvignon Blanc in the U.S., but it turns out Winemaker Anthony Walkenhorst knows a thing or two about making Pinot Gris as well. This dry, medium-bodied wine is partially fermented in acacia barrels. Baking spices, like cinnamon and clove, add welcome nuance to the fresh pear and pineapple flavors.
Name: Kim Crawford 2014 Small Parcels Favourite Homestead Pinot Gris (Awatere Valley)

Description: This plump, dry-style Pinot Gris features plenty of fruit, which ranges from apple to pear and through to pineapple. The finish comes with a cool, refreshing note and ample length.
Name: Yealands 2016 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pristinely fresh apple and pears are cutting and crisp in this dry Pinot Gris. Texturally, it's luscious and expansive, yet maintains a keen balance of acidity as well as a crisp mineral finish. Enjoy now through 2019.
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2015 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Aromas of freshly cut apple and pear are followed by dry fleshy fruit flavors with Granny Smith apple notes on the finish. It's an accessible and enjoyable wine.
Name: Boomtown 2015 Pinot Gris (Washington)

Description: This wine has a touch of perceptible sweetness on its tropical nose, yet tastes dry, showing a straightforward approach to this crisp, coastal-grown variety. Apricot, melon and guava wrap around a lightness of body and texture.
Name: Folie à Deux 2015 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Smoothness and subtlety come with a texture just rich enough to be interesting, without damping down the acidity that makes this light-bodied wine refreshing. It offers flavors of crisp green apple and a touch of pear.
Name: Mirassou 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh apple, lemon and pear flavors are accented by a hint of smoked nuts in this bold, full-bodied Pinot Gris. Rich and a bit creamy in mouthfeel yet balanced briskly, it's a satisfying white with wide pairing appeal. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Ventosa 2015 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: This is a concentrated, voluptuous white, made from mature vines on the producer's estate. It opens in a richness of apricot fuzz, gooseberry and banana, kept fresh by moderate acidity and a flourish of wildflowers and white pepper.
Name: Chalk Hill 2014 North Slope Pinot Gris (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine starts out lightly reduced, with aromas of apple and baking spice followed by a full weighty just-off-dry palate, with a touch of warmth on the finish that adds some bitterness.
Name: Gård 2014 Grand Klasse Reserve Lawrence Vineyards Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Hints of caramelized sugar lend warmth to this fresh fruity wine full of nectarine and grapefruit flavors. It's rich in body with a luscious, mouthfilling cling off set by sunny tangerine acidity. Enjoy now through 2018.
Name: Martha Clara 2015 Island Series Pinot Grigio (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: The pear, apple and apple skin aromas are light. The palate brings just off-dry pear flavors with a full feel.
Name: Sawtooth 2015 Pinot Gris

Description: Is it possible for a wine to taste like a blenderized bowl of fruit salad? That comes close to describing this mix of pear, melon and pineapple. It's medium bodied and seems almost sweet, then finishes clean and refreshing.
Name: Giesen 2016 Pinot Gris (New Zealand)

Description: This wine starts with typical Pinot Gris aromas of apple, pear and ginger, then picks up some citrusy flavors on the palate before ending on a note of orange zest. It's medium in weight, with a dry, silky feel as it glides across the palate.
Name: Kim Crawford 2016 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: San Bernabe, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried lime rinds, wet cement, pear blossoms, honeydew melon and tangerine show on the nose of this bottling that is ever-so-slightly pink in the glass. Honeysuckle flavors meet with ripe pear and apple on the palate that is a tad sweet.
Name: Noble Vines 2015 152 Pinot Grigio (San Bernabe)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is made from grapes grown at the Hop Kiln Vineyard in the Russian River Valley, a project of BR Cohn winemaker Tom Montgomery and winemaker Melissa Smith. It's Chardonnay-like in its grasp of green apple and generosity of toasted oak, medium bodied with a burst of ripe peach.
Name: Monte Smith 2014 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: This is a reasonably rich, concentrated example of Pinot Gris, but one that seems a bit repressed aromatically. It hints rather than suggests at fig, pear and melon, before ending on a weighty note.
Name: Mt. Beautiful 2014 Pinot Gris (North Canterbury)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Zesty red apple and lemon notes are marked by touches of smoke and nuts in this easygoing Pinot Gris. Dry in style, it's not deeply concentrated on the palate but refreshingly citrusy. The finish is brisk and clean.
Name: Glenora 2015 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Made with some skin contact, this ramato-style, pink-hued wine is distinctive in the glass. Apple, pear and berry notes make a quick impact, then fade equally quickly on the finish, leaving the palate refreshed. Drink now.
Importer: Vinovia Wine Group/ Marisco Vineyards USA
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2016 The Ned Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honeydew melon, just-sliced Gala apple and wet-cement aromas show on the nose of this bottling that starts to take on Jolly Rancher sour-apple scents. The simple palate is round and easy to enjoy, with ripe, slightly sweet green-apple flavors.
Name: Bianchi 2015 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Savory, smoky tones lend a shadowy feel to fresh apple and pear flavors in this dry medium-bodied Pinot Gris. It's not deeply concentrated in fruit but refreshing and easy going. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Billsboro 2015 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: This starts out just fine, with promising aromas of ginger, pear and fig. It's plump and reasonably full in the mouth, but the flavors veer toward varnish and banana before settling down on the abbreviated finish. Drink now.
Name: Hillersden 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: With just the tiniest amount of residual sugar, this wine presents as thick and heavy on the palate. A woody, herbal, nutty tone underplays fruitier aspects of peach and pear.
Name: Benessere 2015 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

Description: This follows the standard blueprint for NZ Pinot Gris in its pear, ginger and lime aromas, medium body and apple-pear flavors, but there's a slightly bitter, pithy edge to the finish.
Name: Opawa 2016 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented in neutral puncheons, this is a dense, rich and mouth-coating wine that ups the bar for Oregon Pinot Gris. The neutral wood aging expands the breadth and texture. There's a rich mix of apple, jicama and Bosc pear fruit, lightly touched with wood highlights, and finishing with a lick of buttery caramel.
Name: Lange 2015 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Planted in 1965, these are the oldest examples of this variety in the country. Jason Lett showcases this special fruit in this natural wine with no sulfites added and no cold stabilization. Light gold in color, the crisp apple flavors are forward, the balance is spot on and the finish polished. Drink now through 2020.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2015 Original Vines Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A pretty light gold hue, this wine shines brightly from the first sniff to the last sip. It's clean and dense, with notes of bee pollen and lemon oil, flavors of apple and pear, and a touch of vanilla cookie.
Name: Raptor Ridge 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely from the first sniff on, this is packed with mineral-drenched fruit flavors. Pear flesh and skin dominate, along with suggestions of cucumber and white melon. The leesy minerality is a great palate cleanser.
Name: Cristom 2015 Estate Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Perfectly differentiated from the winery's equally excellent Pinot Blanc, this is a bit fleshier, with fresh flavors of apple and pear. The texture, mouthfeel and mineral-drenched acids all flow into a mouthwatering finish.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Pale in color but rich in flavor, this offers a compelling mix of scents and flavors. Acacia flower, pink grapefruit and Honeycrisp apples lead into a delicious wine with excellent length, balance and texture. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Cerulean 2013 Acadia Vineyards Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A vivid peach color telegraphs that this is not your ordinary Pinot Gris. The wine smells like peach skin and prosciutto, and is light bodied but steeped in exotic flavors of dried flowers, apricot and sea salt. It has a firm mouthfeel, noticeable astringency and an almost meaty character. It's not for the faint of heart, but fascinating.
Name: Donkey & Goat 2015 Ramato Filigreen Farm Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Aromatic, immaculate and showing crystalline clarity, this brings refreshing minerality and perfect balance to light but compelling fruit flavors of apple and pear. Skin phenolics also help to frame the wine, and the persistent length and superb definition are especially impressive.
Name: Elizabeth Chambers 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This racy and leesy young wine offers fresh and crisp flavors of cucumber, celery, jicama and green apple. Despite all the green components, it is not herbal or vegetal, and offers a precise, delicately crafted and ageworthy take on the grape.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2015 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The winery's take on the grape produces a wine reminiscent of an orange wine, or perhaps a particularly striking rosé, though it's labeled as simply white. It's a coppery cherry hue, bone dry, with fruit flavors of dried cherry. Broad and lightly oxidized, it packs a lot of punch, and may be served lightly chilled. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Big Table Farm 2015 Wirtz Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's rare to see a vineyard-designated bottle of Pinot Gris from the state. This one brings light aromas of apple and pear that are followed by dry fleshy fruit flavors. It hits all the right notes.
Name: Nine Hats 2015 The Benches Vineyard Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: What an interesting, unique and minerally wine. Aromas evoke both melon and prosciutto. The texture is dry, even slightly astringent, supporting the subtle but complex flavors like Badoit water, cucumber and lemon.
Name: Sottomarino 2013 Pinot Grigio (Lake County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Impeccably fresh, vivid and textural, this appealing wine brings a mix of orange peel, pink grapefruit and pear fruit. There's a pleasing touch of spice, and all but 5% was stainless-steel fermented.
Name: Lange 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Smooth and graceful, subtle and delicious, this wine comes from an old pro with Alsace varietals and shows a deft touch and great balance. Wonderful peach and Bosc pear flavors mingle on a smooth texture and linger on the finish.
Name: Navarro 2015 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A tangy feeling on the palate makes this light-bodied wine especially refreshing. It has appley, floral aromas and flavors, good acidity and a clean, bracing texture.
Name: McFadden 2015 Blue Quail Pinot Gris (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine smells sweet but tastes dry. Vivid fruit aromas and flavors, and a lively, tangy mouthfeel add lots of personality. It smells like apples and honey and tastes like crisp apples and citrus.
Name: Monte Volpe 2014 Pinot Grigio (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The Laurelwood offers sharp flavors of pine tar, threaded through fresh fruit. Apple and orange are there in abundance, and the piny accents will be an interesting highlight for some tasters, but a distraction for others.
Name: Laurelwood 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and fragrant, with scents and flavors of apple and pear, this moderately fleshy wine has ample acidity to carry it through to a palate-cleansing finish. Hints of minerality add interest.
Name: Del Rio 2015 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Slightly briny aromas akin to orange peel open this citric PG. Dry orange flavors are more or less it, while this holds steady and stays fresh across a standard finish.
Name: Don Rodolfo 2016 Art of the Andes Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: Smooth and fruity, this has a dominant flavor of ripe apple, with highlights of orange candy. It's not off dry, but there is a strong impression of residual sugar, which feels a bit grainy. If you enjoy California Chardonnays with a touch of sweetness, this is a wine you'll like.
Name: Pino 2015 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Young, tight and crisply defined, this offers peach skin, jicama and cucumber flavors, highlights of gin-like botanicals, and a refreshing, palate-cleansing finish.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is bright, fresh and clean, with lots of apple, Key lime and squeezed-citrus touches. Snappy pear flavors show first on the sip, then come riper yellow peach and cantaloupe, all framed by jubilant acidity. There's nothing too complex, but it's a refreshing sipper.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2015 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Quite light aromas of apple and flower blossom are followed by sleek fruit flavors. The concentration seems a bit light.
Name: Vino 2014 Pinot Grigio (Washington)

Description: A mix of floral, tropical and citrus aromas is more than fine. A snappy citric palate is racy and high in cleansing acidity. Citrus flavors are plain and simple, while this is entirely clean and fresh on the finish.
Name: Santa Julia 2016 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All stainless fermented, with the addition of 5% Viognier, this is a solid, if unspectacular effort. It shows pear and citrus and plenty of acid, with appealing freshness. Drink up over the next couple of years.
Name: Hawkins Cellars 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Light aromas like canteloupe and flavors like honeydew melon make this wine fruity and easy to enjoy. It's medium bodied, fruity and smooth.
Name: HandCraft 2015 Artisan Collection Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Fresh green-apple aromas and crisp, lemony flavors make this light-bodied wine appetizing and fresh.
Name: McManis 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of apple, pear and petroleum jelly are followed by crisp acid-driven flavors. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
Name: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Estate Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This offers fresh flavors of pear fruit, with a lightly fleshy mouthfeel. The length and balance are in proportion. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Château Bianca 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This wine has more body and a richer mouthfeel than many of its peers, with mild floral and almond flavors and a touch of butterscotch.
Name: Belle Ambiance 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Melon and citrus aromas are clean and easy, not pungent. This feels good, with limited but solid white-grapefruit and orange flavors. A dry juicy finish tastes mildly bitter but isn't too severe.
Name: Finca la Celia 2016 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Uco Valley)

Description: Almost neutral in flavor, this light and smooth wine is innocuous, crisp and refreshing.
Name: Francis Ford Coppola 2014 Rosso & Bianco Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a neutral, papery white wine, with a flat, rather than lively mouthfeel. The apple flavored fruit is there, along with a touch of licorice, but the freshness seems to have been lost along the way.
Name: Oak Knoll 2014 Cloud Rest Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Most of the action is on the outside of this gaudy bottle. However, this light and slightly sweet wine has appley, floral flavors and a soft, easy texture.
Name: La Catrina NV Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Sulfuric gritty aromas get in the way of fruit scents, which creates a compromised nose. This is spritzy in feel, and thus a bit off-putting. Dilute, slightly bitter and bland citrus flavors finish dry, with soda-like spritz.
Name: François Lurton 2016 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Pinot Gris (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Earthy aromas and savory, herbal flavors make this light-bodied wine taste a little funky. It has good acidity and a fresh texture, however.
Name: Eagle Ridge 2014 Private Reserve Estate Grown Pinot Grigio (Livermore Valley)

Description: Dusty spice notes of ginger and cinnamon accent ripe pear and muskmelon fruit on the nose. This is rich and off-dry in style, with a round, mouthfilling presence on the palate balanced by bright acidity and a lingering note of white pepper.
Name: Amisfield 2015 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Apple peels, squeezed lime, rain on cement, jicama and Asian-pear aromas show on the crisp yet rounded nose of this bottling by actress Drew Barrymore. The palate is quite inviting with broad apple flavors, offering just enough texture and acidity to keep all sorts of wine lovers interested.
Name: Barrymore 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Ripe melon slices dusted with cinnamon on the nose are followed by flavors of melon and pineapple. This is just off-dry in style,with ample weight balanced by crisp, mouthwatering acids on the finish.
Name: Rockburn 2014 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Underlying notes of vanilla soften the aromas of pineapple, grapefruit and lemon zest. Medium bodied with crisp acidity in the mouth, there are flavors of apple and lemon curd in the long finish.
Name: Giocato 2015 Pinot Grigio (Primorska)

Description: This offers a pleasant range of characteristic Pinot Gris aromas and flavors, ranging from pear and melon fruit to gingery spice. It's round in the mouth and offers a faintly silky texture on the mouthwatering finish.
Name: Mt. Difficulty 2014 Bannockburn Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Aromas of white flowers, jasmine, and lemon pith give way to pleasant acidity in the mouth. There are flavors of green apple, lemon curd and pear in the medium length finish.
Name: Budureasca 2015 Vine in Flames Pinot Gris (Dealu Mare)

Description: Pale straw in the glass, this wine has aromas of lemon grass and grapefruit pith that pave the way for delightful flavors of Honey Crisp apples and red grapefruit juice.
Name: Vini 2015 Veni Vidi Vici Pinot Grigio (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pinot Gris has been making inroads in Washington of late and this producer has been leading the way. Pleasing aromas of apple and melon lead to dry full-feeling fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of apple and pear are followed by dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors, dipping a bit in the middle before coming back together.
Name: Wind Rose 2015 Dry White Wine Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Generous, appealing melon, pear and apple aromas are followed by plump but still elegant while well-balanced fruit flavors. It's a bit one note but it hits that note well.
Name: Lone Birch 2015 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: This bottling is easy, light and crisp, starting with squeezed orange and ripe yellow apples on the nose. It's delicate on the palate, with citrus and stone-fruit flavors, just right for an afternoon sip in the sun.
Name: Maddalena 2015 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

Description: Rocky Point, the second label of Prophet's Rock, sometimes approaches first-wine quality. This vintage of Pinot Gris is a bit sweet and broad, but offers luscious hints of apricot, honey and a dusting of dried spices.
Name: Prophet's Rock 2014 Rocky Point Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of pear, white flowers and melon lead to dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors. It doesn't bring much complexity but still offers plenty of appeal.
Name: Anew 2015 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of melon and tropical fruit are light but enchanting. The medium-bodied flavors provide interest and show a pleasing sense of balance.
Name: Jones of Washington 2015 Pinot Gris (Ancient Lakes)

Description: There's a slight note of oxidation in the bouquet that leads to aromas of pineapple upside down cake, apple and Meyer lemon. Flavors of apple pie and canned peaches precede a dry, crisp finish.
Name: Lion-Gri 2014 Golden Land Dry Pinot Gris (Moldova)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Citrus and melon-rind aromas lead to off-dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors. The concentration comes off as quite light.
Name: Waterbrook 2015 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Like most Pinot Gris, this is subdued aromatically, but does unfold on the palate to reveal sweet melon and pear flavors. A burst of citrusy acids on the finish give it a sweet-tart balance that would work well with various spicy Asian dishes.
Name: Rockburn 2015 Devil's Staircase Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The good news is production is way up and quality is as good as ever. A generous jumble of poached pear, crisp apple, lemon curd and wet stone, this ups the bar for Oregon Pinot Gris in this price range. The finish lingers gracefully, rich and creamy, inviting you to take the next sip.
Name: Antiquum Farm 2015 Daisy Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a bright, spicy, crisply defined wine, and an overall supervalue. Clean and fresh flavors of apple and pear come lightly spiced, and are set against refreshing natural acidity. The fruit is sourced from a vineyard block planted in 1978.
Name: Abiqua Wind 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The Pfeiffer Vineyard also contributes fruit for the winery's excellent Unity bottling. Here, its grapes are the whole show, and the wine is focused and substantial. It drills down with precise flavors of peach and pear with a touch of citrus, all showing excellent length and depth.
Name: King Estate 2014 Pfeiffer Vineyards Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Now entitled to use the expanded Willamette Valley AVA, this estate-grown wine is broad, full-flavored and loaded with fruit. Fresh sliced peaches, papaya and melon flavors abound, and a nice touch of citrus lifts the finish.
Name: King Estate 2015 Domaine Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This unusual rosé is all Pinot Gris, picked for thick skins, chewy tannins, high acidity, and given a 36-hour cold soak prior to fermentation. It's a pale salmon/copper shade, full-bodied and juicy, with fruit flavors of peach and citrus. Highlights of hibiscus tea and floral aromatics contribute further complexity.
Name: Antiquum Farm 2015 Aurosa Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The price of this all-occasion white wine keeps creeping up, but the quality stays high, even as production levels push toward six figures. It's lightly spritzy, pale lemon in color, and tastes remarkably like grapefruit, with a gentle dusting of sugar. As fresh as can be, it should be drunk slightly chilled, paired with something like chicken breasts in a citrus sauce.
Name: A to Z 2015 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Ripe yellow-peach and apricot notes shine on the nose and palate of this elegantly structured Pinot Gris. Zesty acidity offers a pleasant counterpoint to a softly clingy texture that lingers luxuriously on the palate. It's dry in style, with a deeply mineral, smoky finish.
Name: Franz Keller 2015 Pinot Gris (Baden)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A workhorse for the winery, this bright and focused Pinot Gris offers pinpoint flavors of melon and pear, with a strong streak of wintergreen. It's refreshing and ultraclean, with fruit flavors front and center through a medium-long finish.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
