Name: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Eichberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This Pinot Grigio offers aromas of fragrant white flower and citrus zest. Its linear, elegant palate shows tangerine, pear, lemon drop and a hint of crystallized ginger alongside bright acidity.
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: Earth and undergrowth flavors are woven through the rich pear tones which begin to shine with great, slightly sweet ripeness when exposed to a little air. The phenolic texture provides a counterpoint, supported by lemony freshness. Lovely balance.
Name: Wolfberger 2012 Rangen Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Lightly perfumed with hawthorn flower and orchard fruit aromas, this linear white offers flavors of green apple, lime and tangerine zest. Crisp acidity supports the palate while a mineral note closes the tangy finish.
Name: Erste Neue 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: A to Z is giving other volume Pinot Gris producers a run for top gun with this superb value. Pear, quince and satsuma-orange flavors come together in a sappy, luscious wine that carries on delightfully through a rich, clean finish.
Name: A to Z 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This opens with a creamy, fresh texture underscored with light minerality. Lime and pineapple sparkle among a wealth of citrus highlights. This almost screams out for Thai food.
Name: Del Rio 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: One of the more structured Pinot Grigios, this opens with aromas that recall white flower, orchard fruit, a whiff of oak and chopped herb. The bright palate offers Kaiser pear, yellow apple, vanilla, candied citrus zest and a ginger note alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2014 Turmhof Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Notes of peel and flesh of Bosc pear pervade nose and palate, there is a core of earthy ripeness but the palate gives the impression of ginger-spiced freshness, tempered by earth. Rounded and beautiful.
Name: Sipp Mack 2014 Osterberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Partly fermented in oak casks, this linear white offers aromas of white flower, pear, crushed rock and a delicate whiff of oak-driven spice. The elegant palate offers creamy yellow apple, vanilla and mineral alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Alois Lageder 2014 Porer Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Attractive aromas that suggest apple, tropical fruit and citrus lift from the glass while the vibrant, elegant palate delivers Bosc pear and mineral. Crisp acidity lifts the silky flavors.
Name: Jermann 2014 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Lovely scents of orchard fruit and apple blossom take center stage. The vibrant, savory palate offers crunchy rennet apple, tangerine and mineral while zesty acidity leads to the tangy finish.
Name: Caldaro 2014 Söll Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of Alpine wildflower and peach blossom unfold on this refined mountain white. The balanced palate offers Anjou pear, yellow apple, mineral, tangerine and white almond coupled with crisp acidity.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2014 Anger Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: A closed nose leads to a very fruity, off-dry palate of rich pear flavors: juicy and ripe but tinged with more grounded notes of fresh earth. This is flowing and rounded but fresh and beautifully textured.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2012 Mambourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe orchard fruit, white and yellow flower aromas blend together on this vibrant, refreshing white. The bright palate doles out crisp Granny Smith apple and a mineral note accompanied by tangy acidity.
Name: Cliffhanger 2013 Vineyards Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Scents of cut grass, tomato vine and a hint of honeydew melon emerge on this tangy white. The crisp palate doles out yellow peach, apple, grapefruit and an almond note accompanied by zesty acidity.
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: An enticing fragrance of wildflower, peach blossom, berry and a hint of white pepper lead the nose. The lively, linear palate offers green apple, pear and toasted almond alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Draga 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Yellow flower, orchard fruit and flinty aromas lead the nose on this vibrant wine. On the palate, zesty acidity brightens crisp rennet apple, pear and a note of preserved tangerine while a steely mineral backs up the finish.
Name: Alessio Komjanc 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Honeysuckle, tropical fruit and pear aromas lead the nose. Made with forty-year-old vines, the elegantly structured palate delivers crisp apple, white almond and mineral alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Weinhof Kobler 2014 Klausner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Pear and spring flower aromas lead the way on this vibrant white. The bright palate offers yellow apple, candied lemon zest and a touch of mineral alongside fresh acidity that leaves a clean finish.
Name: Weinhof Kobler 2014 Oberfeld Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Fermented and aged in large French and Austrian casks, this single vineyard Pinot Grigio opens with aromas that recall oak, yellow apple and candied citrus peel. The round palate offers white peach, vanilla pear, apple and lemon drop alongside racy acidity.
Name: Tramin 2014 Unterebner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of beeswax, elder flower and white orchard fruit emerge in the glass. On the lively palate, zesty acidity energizes creamy white peach, green pear and citrus while a mineral note backs up the tangy finish.
Name: Terlato 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Delicate scents of spring blossom and white peach float from the glass while the elegant, refreshing palate offers mature apple, white almond and orange zest. Energizing mineral and firm acidity drive the finish.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: A rather subdued nose merely hints at ripe pear flavors. The palate is dry, just softly pear-fruited and balanced. There is a subtle, mature heat on the finish that is rather appetizing. Drink soon.
Name: Klipfel 2014 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is richer than most Pinot Grigios. It opens with aromas of toast, yellow flower, vanilla and a balsamic note while the round, full-bodied palate offers baked yellow apple, candied lemon drop, nectarine zest and almond. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy fruit while a vanilla note closes the finish. You can barely detect the warmth of alcohol on the close.
Name: Renato Keber 2012 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: A delicate fragrance of white spring flower, orchard fruit and a hint of light baking spice lead the way. Boasting copper-colored reflections, the lithe palate shows off crisp green apple, nectarine and a mineral note buoyed by racy acidity.
Name: Primosic 2014 Poderi di Carlo Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: White wildflower and Bosc pear aromas lead the nose. The bright, linear palate offers nectarine zest and crisp Granny Smith alongside zesty acidity. A mineral note closes the tangy finish.
Name: Cantina Terlano 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Inviting aromas of toasted almond, pear and a whiff of chopped herb lead the nose on this linear white. The lively palate offers crisp apple, nectarine zest and flinty mineral accompanied by bright acidity.
Name: Mario Schiopetto 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Showing copper reflections, this vibrant wine offers enticing scents of white wildflower and orchard fruit. The savory palate presents poached Bartlett pear, nectarine zest and a mineral note accompanied by firm acidity.
Name: Venica & Venica 2014 Jesera Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of orchard fruit, nut and a light whiff of toast lift from the glass. The medium-bodied, straightforward palate offers pear, apple and a note of lemon drop. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Colterenzio 2014 Puiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This bright, fragrant wine offers aromas of an orchard in bloom, spring flower, peach and a hint of banana. The crisp palate shows crunchy apple, pear and mineral alongside bracing acidity. A light almond note signals the crisp close.
Name: Sturm 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Fermented and aged in large Slavonian oak, this unusual, copper-colored wine opens with scents of wildflower, red berry, baking spice and a balsamic note. The spicy palate is linear and structured, showing ginger, cinnamon, tangerine zest and mineral but not much fruit richness. A white pepper note closes the finish.
Name: La Castellada 2009 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: You'll find aromas of beeswax, white flower and a whiff of orchard fruit on this fragrant white. The lively palate offers crisp apple, nectarine, toasted almond and mineral alongside bracing acidity.
Name: Livon 2014 Braide Grande Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, vanilla and a confectionary note lead the nose while the palate offers mature Golden Delicious apple, butterscotch and walnut skin alongside bracing acidity.
Name: Marco Felluga 2012 Mongris Riserva Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Fresh and balanced, this offers aromas of Spanish Broom, pear and a whiff of flint. The elegant, linear palate delivers crisp apple, nectarine zest and a mineral note alongside bracing acidity.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Fragrant white flower, orchard fruit and a touch of flint lead the nose. The linear, lively palate shows mature apple, nectarine zest and mineral alongside vibrant acidity. The flavors follow through to the tangy finish.
Name: Kettmeir 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Clean and crisp, this opens with aromas of white wildflower, pear and a hint of crushed rock. The lively palate delivers crisp green apple, lime zest and mineral alongside invigorating acidity.
Name: Muzic 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Scents of white flower, pear and a hint of ground almond emerge on this lively white. The vibrant palate offers green apple and a hint of mineral alongside racy acidity.
Name: Castello di Spessa 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of hazelnut, orchard fruit and a confectionary note lead the nose. The bright palate offers crisp green apple and lemon drop alongside zesty acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
Name: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Its mix of heady aromas include chamomile flower, Spanish broom and yellow stone. The bright, fresh palate offers peach, pear, crunchy apple and a touch of mineral alongside vibrant acidity. It finishes crisp and clean.
Name: Cantina Valle Isarco 2014 Aristos Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Green apple and citrus aromas float out of the glass while the bright, straightforward palate offers Bartlett pear and juicy nectarine zest. Tangy acidity leaves a crisp finish.
Name: Petrucco 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Muted scents of orchard fruit and a touch of almond lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers pear, citrus zest and mineral accompanied by bracing acidity.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of green apple and white peach lead the nose and follow through to the zesty palate along with notes of pear and candied lemon peel. Lively acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Meran 2014 Festival Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Pear, honeydew melon and floral note lift from the glass. The bright, no-frills palate offers up crisp apple and citrus peel while lively acidity provides a tangy finish.
Name: Kupel Wieser 2014 Alfio Moriconi Selection Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Hushed aromas of white flower and Bartlett pear come together on this refreshing white. On the palate, lively acidity carries tangerine zest, green apple and peach nectar.
Name: Klaus Lentsch 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: White blossom and apple aromas open on this vibrant white while the racy palate shows Kaiser pear, tangerine and a hint of mineral. Zesty acidity gives it a clean, crisp finish.
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This vibrant Pinot Grigio offers delicate scents of white flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of citrus. The crisp palate shows crunchy Granny Smith apple, green pear and tangerine while bracing acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Collavini 2014 Villa Canlungo Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This has a slightly copper hue and is delicately scented with aromas of hawthorn and orchard fruit. Its racy palate shows subtle notes of tangerine zest, lime and a hint of apple while a mineral note marks the finish.
Name: Primosic 2014 Poderi di Carlo Gmajne Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: White spring flower and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the nose. The lively, straightforward palate shows peach and a hint of bitter almond accompanied by brisk acidity.
Name: Bortoluzzi 2014 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Partially fermented in barriques (20%), this opens with aromas of oak, toasted nut and a whiff of vanilla. The palate offers yellow apple, bitter almond, peach and a hint of tangerine accompanied by lively acidity.
Name: Cantina Cortaccia 2014 Penoner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Citrus blossom and peach aromas open while the zesty palate offers rennet apple, lemon drop and almond. Crisp acidity and a mineral note lead to a tangy finish.
Name: Ascevi Luwa 2014 Ceròu Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: There's a nice weight and intensity to this wine, especially for a grape that is often deemed innocuous and light. Apple and pear skin tones offer tension to the fuzzy-textured palate, with a vein of citrus keeping everything in focus.
Name: 2 Lads 2013 Pinot Grigio (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Nicely fruited with a mix of grapefruit, apricot and melon flavors, this is open and easy to enjoy with a range of dishes. A slight hint of vanilla butter cookie adds interest to the finish.
Name: Ancient Cellars 2013 Gilt Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Fermented and aged partly in oak, this opens with aromas that suggest toast and mature yellow fruit that carry through to the palate along with pineapple and a hint of lemon drop. It's rather lean, with brisk acidity.
Name: Maso Poli 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: White flower, orchard fruit and citrus aromas emerge on this lively white. The bright, crisp palate delivers crunchy rennet apple and lime zest alongside racy acidity that leaves a clean finish.
Name: Cantina Cortaccia 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of white peach, vanilla and toasted oak that carry over to the palate along with candied lemon drop and apple. Zesty acidity gives it a tangy finish.
Name: Mezzacorona 2014 Riserva Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Heady aromas of yellow stone fruit, grapefruit and a touch of light baking spice lead the way. The full-bodied palate shows apricot, yellow peach, mineral and a hint of nutmeg alongside lively acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
Name: Mezzacorona 2015 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Soft and forward, this full-bodied wine is shaped in a buttery Chardonnay mold. Apple butter, spice and caramel components combine in a pleasurable, ready-to-drink style.
Name: Schmidt 2014 Pinot Gris (Applegate Valley)

Description: Vibrant and crisp, this offers delicate aromas of acacia flower and citrus. The bright, linear palate shows crunchy green apple, tangerine zest and a hint of white almond alongside racy acidity.
Name: Kris 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: Lightly scented with citrus blossom and orchard fruit, this racy white offers up delicate flavors of yellow apple and lemon zest. It's linear, with vibrant acidity that leaves a crisp finish.
Name: Castel Sallegg 2014 Pulvernai Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicate but enticing aromas of white peach and wisteria float from the glass. The lively, linear palate shows Granny Smith apple, Kaiser pear, citrus zest and a ginger note alongside crisp—almost crackling—acidity.
Name: Fantinel 2014 Tenuta Sant'Elena Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Scents of white spring flower, pear and a hint of nut come together on this lively wine. The racy palate shows pear, apple and white almond alongside firm acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
Name: Gigante 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Aromas of orchard fruit, citrus and nuts come together on this. The vibrant palate offers lemon zest, Kaiser pear and a hint of stony mineral accompanied by bracing acidity.
Name: Conti Formentini 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Subtle scents of white blossom, citrus and dried herb are delivered to the nose. The straightforward, refreshing palate offers pear and green apple alongside bracing acidity. A mineral note signals the finish.
Name: Elena Walch 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Softly scented, this offers aromas of spring blossom and summer orchard fruit. The luminous, easygoing palate shows pear and citrus alongside crisp acidity. It finishes clean and fresh.
Name: Andriano 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of hay, pressed yellow flower and orchard fruit. The direct palate offers yellow apple skin, toasted nut and a mineral note alongside invigorating acidity.
Name: Poggiobello 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Gold with copper hues, this opens with aromas of wildflower, tangerine zest and a whiff of crushed stone. The vibrant palate offers rennet apple, lime, ginger drop and a hint of mineral alongside mouthwatering acidity.
Name: Primosic 2014 Santa Lucia Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of wisteria and green apple lead the way on this straightforward white. The tangy palate tastes of juicy pear, citrus and a hint of white almond while zesty acidity and a mineral note give the finish a slight lift.
Name: Peter Zemmer 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Fresh and fruity, this lively white offers aromas and flavors of green Anjou pear, Granny Smith apple and white peach. Zesty acidity gives it a crisp, tangy finish.
Name: La Vis 2014 Ritratti Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: There's a distinct roundness to the palate of this Pinot Grigio, most likely from a bit of sur lie aging. Spiced asian pear and crisp green apple meet preserved lemons on the nose and palate.
Name: Bel Lago 2013 Pinot Grigio (Leelanau Peninsula)

Description: Oak, yellow apple and butterscotch aromas open on the nose. The structured palate offers toast, mineral, oak-driven spice and a confectionary note but it's shy on fruit richness. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2013 Sanct Valentin Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicately scented, this opens with aromas of acacia flower, citrus blossom and orchard fruit. The straightforward palate offers Granny Smith apple, tangerine zest and a touch of mineral while tangy acidity provides balance.
Name: Comelli 2014 Amplius Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Yellow wildflower and peach aromas follow through to the fresh, linear palate along with a nectarine note. It's zesty and balanced, with crisp acidity.
Name: Franz Haas 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Apple, wildflower and stone aromas set the tone. The tangy palate offers crisp Granny Smith apple, pear and nectarine accompanied by lively acidity. A touch of mineral closes the finish.
Name: Dürer-Weg 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: The nose of this lively white is a combination of delicate aromas of wildflower and orchard fruit while the bright palate offers tart Granny Smith apple, tangerine and a hint of crushed stone. Vibrant acidity carries through to the crisp finish.
Name: Nals Margreid 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Fresh and lively, this opens with aromas of jasmine, tropical fruit and a whiff of flint. The vibrant palate offers crunchy Granny Smith and candied lemon alongside brisk acidity. A mineral note energizes the crisp finish.
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Delicate but alluring scents of spring flower and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The palate is linear and rather lean but still refreshing, offering pear, yellow apple and mineral alongside bracing acidity. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: St. Pauls 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: The nose opens with aromas of white spring flower and green Anjou pear. The lively, straightforward palate offers crunchy green apple and lime zest alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Cembra 2014 Classici Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Delicate aromas of orchard fruit and whiff of spring blossom lead the nose on this light, refreshing white. Reflecting the cool, wet vintage, the palate is rather lean but still offers pear, apple and a hint of mineral alongside a backbone of bracing acidity.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This bright wine has aromas that suggest citrus blossom and tropical fruit. The lively, slender palate shows crunchy Granny Smith apple and pineapple accompanied by brisk acidity.
Name: Dorigo 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a simple, rather generic white wine. The fruit is clean with an impression of light spice around flavors of apple and pear. It's a useful, all-purpose, fruity quaffer.
Name: Hanson Vineyards 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: White flower, orchard fruit and crushed stone aromas delicately guide the nose. The easygoing palate offers Bartlett pear, apple skin and a hint of mineral alongside bright acidity.
Name: La Tunella 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Bright and refreshing, this easygoing white offers delicate aromas and flavors of white spring flower, Granny Smith apple and citrus. Racy acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: La Vis 2014 Simboli Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of apple, citrus, hay and a whiff of medicinal herb carry over to rather lean palate along with a note of bitter almond. Racy acidity gives it a brisk finish.
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Chamomile flower and yellow stone fruit aromas are the primary aromas. The simple, straightforward palate tastes of yellow apple skin, a hint of white peach and a touch of mineral alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Colterenzio 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Apple, citrus and yellow floral aromas are what hits the nose first. Them they carry over to the simple, zesty palate along with green pear and a note of bitter nut. Bracing acidity generates a clean finish.
Name: Ca'Ronesca 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This fun, copper-colored wine offers aromas of cut grass and Bartlett pear. The simple palate shows white peach and green apple alongside zesty acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
Name: Casata Monfort 2014 Rosé Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Pressed flower, pear and crushed rock aromas lead the nose. The lively palate offers lime, green apple skin and mineral alongside racy acidity.
Name: Fiegl 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of hawthorn and a spring orchard in bloom lead the nose while the bright, straightforward palate offers green apple, bitter almond and a mineral note. Crisp acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Cantina Valle Isarco 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: The nose isn't very expressive but it eventually reveals delicate whiffs of white spring flower and green apple that carry over to the palate along with a hint of citrus. Racy acidity gives it a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Subida di Monte 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This straightforward, refreshing white opens with light scents of Spanish broom and a whiff of crushed stone. The palate is on the lean side, showing crisp apple, pear and a hint of mineral alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Kössler 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This white starts by presenting aromas of orchard fruit, pressed yellow flower and toasted almond. The bright palate offers white peach and crisp pear alongside the bracing acidity that characterizes this vintage.
Name: La Rajade 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This opens with hushed aromas that recall pressed white flower and orchard fruit. The rather lean palate shows raw yellow peach and a touch of acacia honey alongside bracing acidity. A note of bitter almond and a hint of mineral mark the finish.
Name: Livio Felluga 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of pear and a light floral note lead the nose on this simple white. The lively, straightforward palate offers green apple and almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Bollini 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: This straightforward white offers subdued aromas of banana, orchard fruit and wildflower while the slender palate shows tangerine zest, rennet apple and a mineral note. Brisk acidity gives it a crisp close.
Name: Caldaro 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Erath's Pinot Gris is done in a solid, middle-of-the-road style that's quite reliable from vintage to vintage. Apple and peach fruit, lightly spiced, has a buttery streak running through the finish.
Name: Erath 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This rather deeply hued, yellow-gold wine offers aromas suggesting orchard fruit, toasted almond and crushed rock. The palate shows tart apple and green pear accompanied by vibrant acidity.
Name: Marco Scolaris 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This offers delicate aromas of spring blossom and pear while the straightforward palate presents white peach and Granny Smith apple. Zesty acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Tolloy 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with aromas of white spring flower, pear and a whiff of adhesive bandage that all carry over to the raw palate along with unripe apple and a hint of lime. It's rather lean, with bracing acidity.
Name: Borgo Conventi 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Fun and fresh, this informal white offers whiffs of white flower and pear. The straightforward palate presents notes of apple and peach alongside lively acidity. It's not complex, but it is well made.
Name: Lagaria 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Light scents of spring blossom and pear waft out of the glass. The simple palate is rather diluted and decidedly lean, showing hints of apple skin, mineral and brisk acidity.
Name: Tenuta Peter Sölva & Söhne 2014 I Vigneti Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Here's an informal, easygoing white that offers sensations of banana, peach and pear. It's simple and refreshing, with brisk acidity.
Name: Italo Cescon 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Description: Fun and refreshing, this opens with aromas of tropical fruit and a hint of almond while the bright, fruity palate offers green apple and peach. It's simple but well made.
Name: Anterra 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: Lightly scented, this straightforward, easygoing wine offers delicate apple and citrus sensations. It's lean but refreshing, with a racy acidity that gives it a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Castel Firmian 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: You'll find light scents of apple, pear and a dose of wet rock on this brisk white that carry over to the rather raw palate. Racy acidity gives it a nervy edge.
Name: Castelfeder 2014 15 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with aromas of citrus and white flower while the palate offers unripe apple, lime and a bitter almond note. It's on the lean side, with bracing acidity.
Name: Isidoro Polencic 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This opens with hushed aromas of white orchard fruit and spring wildflower. The racy palate shows unripe green pear and a hint of lime alongside vibrant acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
Name: Girlan 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of honeysuckle, white stone fruit and citrus present themselves to the nose while the fun, simple palate shows green pear and a hint of lime. Zesty acidity gives it a tangy close.
Name: Castello della Rosa 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a fun and zingy white that offers aromas and flavors of white spring flower, tart green apple and a hint of mineral. It's simple but well made, with zesty acidity that gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Mezzacorona 2014 Castel Pietra Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Pressed yellow flower and spring orchard fruit are the primary opening scents. The lean palate shows rennet apple skin, lime and a mineral note alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Pighin 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: There's a slight pink hue to this light-bodied white. Citrus focused and a bit blossomy, this is simple and straightforward yet perfectly enjoyable.
Name: Black Star Farms 2013 Arcturos Pinot Gris (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This fresh, informal white opens with subdued aromas of yellow flower and white orchard fruit. The lean, simple palate offers unripe pear, apple skin and a mineral note alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Ileana 2014 Low Carb Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: This informal white offers aromas of citrus blossom and peach while the light, simple palate shows pear, a touch of lime and a hint of mineral. Zesty acidity leaves a fresh finish.
Name: Cesari 2014 Duetorri Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: This presents the nose whiffs of pineapple and wet stone while the lean palate offers rennet apple skin, tangerine and a hint of mineral. Bracing acidity dominates the finish.
Name: Cormòns 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This simple white opens with scents of honeysuckle and ripe orchard fruit while the easygoing palate offers hints of nectarine and green apple. Fresh acidity gives it a brisk finish.
Name: Endrizzi 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Intense but rather muddled aromas of Stargazer lily and air freshener lead the nose along with brief dashes of hay, mature peach and apple. The unusual flowery aroma carries through and dominates the lean palate.
Name: Torre Rosazza 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: This deeply yellow-gold coloured wine opens with mature aromas of nut, flint and dried apricot. The lean palate is also already evolved, offering smoky mineral and yellow apple skin alongside firm acidity.
Name: SalvaTerra 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The winery's regular Pinot Gris approaches 15% alcohol, and this takes it a step farther. Not overly sweet, but identifiably late harvest, the fermentation has been stopped at 60g/L residual sugar, and fortified with some neutral spirit. White Port may have been the concept, but it hasn't really come together in the bottle.
Name: River's Edge 2013 Indulgence Pinot Gris (Elkton Oregon)

Description: Aromas of almond, pressed white flower and crushed stone emerge on this racy white. The palate is less expressive, showing apple skin, mineral and a hint of citrus. It's on the lean side, with brisk acidity.
Name: Zorzon 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: The nose isn't very expressive but you can detect whiffs of adhesive bandage, medicinal herb, apple skin and mineral that carry over to the diluted, rather bitter palate. Brisk acidity underscores the wine's lean character.
Name: Lechthaler 2014 Drago Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: This uber-informal wine has faint aromas that recall pressed wildflower and a whiff of pear. The simple, diluted palate shows hints of apple skin and a bitter medicinal note alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Lechthaler 2014 Torre di Luna Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: The nose informs subtly about slight oak and freshly cut green and yellow apples. The palate is apple-fresh and rounded with a pleasant midpalate weight. Hints of smoke and hazelnut glint happily here and there, making for a very appetizing Pinot Gris—a world apart from the popular Italian style.
Name: Meinklang 2014 Graupert Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright lime skin, grapefruit pith and soda character show on the nose of this tight and clean bottling from the appellation's vanguard vineyard. The sip is all about texture and energy, with pear-skin flavors that are soft but grippy, plus acidity that is strong but never searing.
Name: Tangent 2014 Paragon Vineyard Pinot Gris (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Glimmers of minerality lend elegance to zesty white grapefruit, lemon and pear notes in this dry, full-bodied Pinot Gris. A brisk backbone of acidity balances nicely against a mouthfeel that's succulent and satisfying. Drink now through 2016.
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2014 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While a bit demure in character, this full-bodied, dry Pinot Gris boasts fresh apple, pear and lemon notes. Crisp citrus acidity shines on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Hosmer 2014 Pinot Gris (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of nectarine splashed with warm lemon juice mix with cut pear and ripe red apples on this bottling. The palate shows cooked apples, with slight hints of peach, all quite ripe.
Name: Danza del Sol 2014 Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is all about feel, with light aromas of soda water leading to off-dry, broad-feeling flavors that go down easy.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2014 The Expedition Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Naches Heights, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Red apple, spice and honey aromas lead to medium-sweet fruit flavors. It brings some appeal but the concentration doesn't seem all there.
Name: Wilridge 2014 Dessert Wine Estate Wilridge Vineyard Pinot Gris (Naches Heights)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Planted in 1965, these are the oldest examples of this variety in the entire country. Splendid texture is a defining characteristic, with a yeasty, creamy mouthfeel. Ripe apples and toasted grains come through, as the wine extends through a long and powerful finish. Try it with grilled shrimp and a wine and butter sauce.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2014 Original Vines Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Rich and creamy, this stylish, concrete-egg-fermented Pinot Gris is both muscular and fleshy. Generous fruit flavors combine pear and peach with highlights of orange peel and citrus. The flavors continue through a long, clean finish.
Name: Archery Summit 2014 Ab Ovo Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Stylish and detailed, this exemplary effort showcases a subtle and elegant approach to the grape. Rather than fleshy fruit flavors, it offers focused notes of pear skin, citrus rind and an overriding minerality. It's drinking quite nicely already, and seems built to continue to evolve through 2020.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2014 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The less expensive of the winery's two Pinot Gris, this is in some respects the better wine. Excellent focus pulls crisp flavors of pear, lemon curd and flinty mineral into sharp resolution, and appealing minerality gives the acidity a resonant texture. It all resolves in a lovely, creamy finish.
Name: Antiquum Farm 2014 Daisy Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Massively fruity, this is an apple/pear bonanza, fleshy and almost lasciviously delicious. The huge fruit flavors convey an impression of sweetness, though this is not identified as off dry. It has tremendous density and length.
Name: Trinity Vineyards 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A striking shade of amber/orange, this soft and fruity wine is open and loose knit, with broad flavors of mature, slightly oxidized tree fruits, plus lightly spicy notes of cinnamon and baking spices. It's very well made, but well apart from any standard approach.
Name: Big Table Farm 2014 Wirtz Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This bright and spicy wine refreshes with palate-cleansing minerality. The crisp, fresh-cut pear and apple fruit carries hints of orange liqueur. Drink this while it's in the bloom of youth.
Name: Sweet Cheeks 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This falls sbetween a rosé and an orange wine in its appearance, a pale salmon/copper shade that results from 36 hours of skin contact before pressing. Scents of hibiscus tea and rosewater put a delicate top note ahead of rich, ripe, round and spicy citrus fruit. A strong impression of cinnamon marks the finish.
Name: Antiquum Farm 2014 Aurosa Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Delicate aromas of crisp green apples, pear and white peach abound on this lean but concentrated Pinot Gris. Dry and spry, the palate is honed on minerality and refreshment. Enjoy now for its vitality and youth.
Name: Franz Keller 2014 Schwarzer Adler Pinot Gris (Baden)

Description: Fresh pineapple, peach and blossom notes contrast spicy dashes of saffron, fennel and pollen throughout this Grauburgunder, or Pinot Gris. Cutting lemon-lime notes lend a razor's edge to palate that's supple and rich. It's an elegantly composed wine with a curious, yet intriguing personality.
Name: Thörle 2013 Trocken Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: A chalky slightly saline minerality extends through this lemony fresh wine, accenting plush fruity flavors of apple, peach and pear. It's silky on the palate and refreshing in composure, ideal for elegant and casual entertaining.
Name: Binz 2014 Nackenheimer Kabinett Trocken Pinot Gris (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel-fermented in neutral oak, this is ready to drink, softly flavorful with yellow apple and other yellow fruits, and a warm, autumnal mouthfeel. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Ancient Cellars 2014 Old Mill Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a pretty, light-copper hue, from a small percentage of the grapes being kept on the skins. Fruity flavors of pear and apple dominate, while the acids conjure up suggestions of orange juice.
Name: Omero 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pretty, pale and poised, this offers light pear flavors with a touch of cinnamon. Snappy acidity and a clean, fresh finish all contribute.
Name: Château Bianca 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Offering fine flavor for the price, this release emphasizes spice over fruit, with a sharp, slightly herbal edge. Crisp apple and pear show ginger highlights. Drink this lightly chilled with some spicy Thai food.
Name: Rainstorm 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Whimsically feline packaging aside, this fruity and forward Pinot Grigio does a good job balancing bright luscious stone fruit against refreshing lemon-lime acidity. It's an easygoing, widely appealing dry white at a bargain price. Drink now.
Name: Lucky Neko 2014 Pinot Grigio (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: It might be a good idea to decant this to let the burnt-match aromas blow off. They tend to mask the ripe, round, fruit-driven style of the wine. Apart from that initial funk, it's a pleasant, fruity, quaffable white wine.
Name: Mahonia 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: On the plus side, this is a well-ripened, full-bodied wine, with a mix of pear and citrus. It's lightly spicy and drinking at its peak, broad and just a little flat on the palate.
Name: Henry Estate 2014 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Almost completely transparent, this wine is lightly fruity and perfectly pleasant; there's just not much to it. Traces of apple, pear and white melon come up, quickly running into a short, thin finish.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Herbal and thin, this is not the fleshy, fruity style typical of Oregon Pinot Gris. Dilute flavors of apple and melon are smothered in herbs.
Name: Del Rio 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Concentrated and intense, this wine has a mix of sour lemon and potatoes going on aromatically. It is medium to full bodied, rather than crisp and light.
Name: Merisi 2014 Pinot Gris (Los Carneros)

Description: This wine has a perceptible tawny tone despite its youth, and the scents also seem to suggest that the wine is slightly oxidized. Whiffs of sherry and apple cider lead into a soft, flat, rather dull palate of nondescript fruit.
Name: Hinman 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: The full force of aromatic, dried pear rises from the glass, laced with dried apricot and candied peel. The pear fruit becomes exquisitely clear and pure on the palate, which is profound but slender. The wine is dry but powerful, holding at its core all the ripeness and fruit flavor from brilliant sunlight. It almost warms you from inside and goes on and on. Drink now till 2030.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2013 Clos Windsbuhl Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of orange meet freshly-cut pear flavors, amplified by some residual sugar. The richness of the palate is cut beautifully by a fresh and pure, citric acidity and a wrought phenolic structure which lends pleasant notes of subtle, enticing bitterness. There is something bittersweet about this that is touching and alluring.
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2014 Cuvée Ste. Cathérine Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Honeyed notes of pear promise oriental richness. The palate cuts this opulence, edged with Seville orange spice and a streak of zesty lime. This interplay between baroque and discipline continues, creating a scintillating experience. Enjoy the ride and marvel at all the spicy overtones.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2013 Rotenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Orange peel perfumes the rich pear notes and imbues them with the aromatic spice of citrus foliage and zest. The palate is full of friendly citrus and pear. Despite its texture and rich flavor, it's beautifully slender and light-footed, with an inherent, zesty brightness that makes this wine shine.
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2013 Zellberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, yellow pear, stone and earth are united by a zesty grapefruit perfume. The streak of purity at the center of this is invigorating, with an enlivening backbone of tinkling acidity. This bottling does justice to a difficult vintage—and is all the more alluring for it. Something racy and pure at the core makes you want to delve deeply into this wine.
Name: René Muré 2014 Signature Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Flinty reduction still dominates the nose but this is only a sign of youth in this nuanced wine. It discloses tentative pear blossom and fruit, plus notions of wet earth and candied lime. Above all, a zesty spine of acidity and freshness directs all the attention to a profound, stony core. There is life force here and you know this will continue to evolve.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2013 Calcaire Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Fully ripe, juicy pears glow from the core of this balanced, rounded wine, with an edge of marzipan, bitter almond and a wonderfully textured center. The palate is rich but dry and stays on the side of restraint, despite the fullness.
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2013 Fronholz Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Pear laced with subtle notes of smoke hints at a taut palate. The dryness and discipline of the poised flavors nonetheless allow the ripe, luscious pear fruit to glow and shine. Mouthfeel and texture are reminiscent of pear peel and bitter almond, and echo long after the last sip.
Name: Trimbach 2013 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Funky notes of earth and wet hay join apple and grapefruit on the nose. They come together on a zesty palate that focuses on lemon and grapefruit peel, surrounded by rounder, richer elements of ripe stone fruit, hay and honey. Lovely and very individual, this wine simply grows on you.
Name: Robert Karcher et Fils 2014 Harth Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe stone fruit and herbal spice come together on a very textured, baked-apple-like palate.Tart and sweet impressions take turns and finally hone in on juicy red apple notes. A spine of acidity provides structure and ample freshness, and the clean and dry finish is totally moreish.
Name: Emile Beyer 2014 Lieu Dit Hohrain Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: It takes a while for the friendly, pure pear fruit to show itself. Once apparent, it shines and is wonderfully sunny, light and balanced. Fresh acidity brightens and lifts everything and makes the fruit flavors finish dry with overtones of green apple.
Name: Domaine Ehrhart 2013 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Freshly cut Conference pear turns fleshy on the palate, juicy and full of life and fruit. Despite the juiciness the wine is just off dry and toothsome with structure, poise and a lastingly satisfying pear finish.
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose gives little away but the palate shows plump, rounded, ripe pear, edged with pleasantly phenolic bitterness. The balance is beautifully held. At the basis, something clean and poised leads beautifully to the dry finish.
Name: Sipp Mack 2013 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Sonorous and rounded notions of ripe pear pervade nose and palate. This richness is countered by lovely, fresh and bright acidity, with peppery spice around the edges. This finishes with a pleasant, clean, warm glow.
Name: Leon Beyer 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rounded, friendly pleasures of ripe pear fill nose and palate, along with a pleasant and toning phenolic element and a brightening and enlivening streak of grapefruit zestiness. This goes down far too easily. Look no further for alluring, appetizing fruit.
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2014 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Crisp in apricot, apple and mango, this is a lovely, easy-drinking white made from a vineyard and producer well-known for Pinot Noir. Refreshing and light, yet with complexity and aromatics to spare, it offers ample body, an attractive texture and sharp acidity, finishing with a note of spicy vanilla.
Name: Keller Estate 2013 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Only slight notions of fruit appear on the nose. The palate is softly fruited with ripe pear and tart apple, achieving a beautiful, unobtrusive and quiet balance. This wine may be quiet and understated but it has honesty and a supple drinkability that makes you want more. Subtle notes of orange peel become more convincing with every sip.
Name: Boeckel 2014 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Tender, freshly cut yellow pears and yellow plums play on a rounded, rich and almost oily palate that remains dry but expresses richness in terms of texture and mouthfeel, edged with earthy and nutty notes. This finishes exquisitely clean.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2012 Les Élements Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Not your average Pinot Grigio, this has the depth, body and complexity of a seriously delicious wine. The aromas and flavors resemble honeydew melon, watermelon and ripe peach, while the texture is smooth—almost thick—and luxurious. It will pair well with cheese and even dishes usually reserved for red wines.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2014 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Plump, juicy pear is cut beautifully by lemon freshness that also carries zest and spice, brightening the entire palate. The finish is dry and textured with the zing of the zest.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Freshly cut pear peel and Egremont Russet apples give a textured, pleasantly bitter edge to the opulent and plump pear on the palate. There is balance and earthiness, too, and brightening acidity on the medium-sweet finish.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Trois Chateaux Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Wonderfully apple-scented, just like a freshly cut Cox Orange Pippin, this is dry Pinot Gris with extra verve from the 2014 vintage. Drink soon while its aromas are at their delicious peak.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Slightly floral notes combine the creaminess of jasmine with the fresh scent of mandarin peel. Despite the typical varietal broadness of Pinot Gris, this wine offers an appealing slenderness and a tender balance. Subtle and almost delicate, it conveys a touching edge of florality and lovely seam of acidity.
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2014 Cuvée Particulière Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Apple peel and citrus shyly greet the nose, but the palate is rounder, zestier and full of red-apple goodness. This is crunchy, fruity, lively and refreshing. The dry finish is moreish and the textured midpalate is a bonus.
Name: Domaine Zinck 2014 Portrait Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Orange and mandarin peel illuminate the sunny, pear-fruited character of this rounded and full wine. The fruit flavors have an additional boost from residual sugar, but this is balanced beautifully. Drink soon.
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2013 Cuvée Engel Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Made in a crisp, dry style, this is leaner than many other New Zealand Pinot Gris, marked by its taut texture and subtle notes of almond skin, barely ripe melon and tart citrus. It makes for a refreshing sipper, or a fine foil to delicate fish dishes.
Name: Astrolabe 2014 Province Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Rounded, rich and perfectly ripe pears are countered by spiced, candied lime peel. The two elements oppose each other equally and hold a poised, subtle balance, echoing long into the spicy finish.
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Pure and friendly tart apple and sweet pear fruit are very appetizing. The palate emphasises fruity sweetness but is kept in check and balance. Residual sweetness will make this shine in certain food contexts while the backbone of bright, citric acidity provides a great counterpoint.
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2014 Altenburg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Baked pear and sweet, baked apple make for an inviting opening. The same friendly duet plays on the off-dry palate all the way to the lingering finish. Along the way, there are highlights of zesty lemon and richer hints of honey and melon. It's simple, fun and even a little bit intriguing.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2014 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Off-dry in style (it reportedly contains 12 g/L of residual sugar), this is fairly broad on the palate, offering a mélange of ripe melon and stone fruit accented by hints of ground ginger, cinnamon and pepper on the finish.
Name: Seifried 2014 Pinot Gris (Nelson)

Description: Smoke, egg yolk and pear make for an unlikely but inviting nose. The palate is characterized by fresh, clean and almost tart apple notes that give great freshness. This is very appetizing and echoes beautifully.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Trois Chateaux Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Apple peel and orange rind are hinted at on the restrained nose, with the same aromatic subtlety on the poised palate. The wine holds a lovely, fresh balance between varietal richness and the freshness of the vintage, with notes of honey and baked apple. It's a friendly, fruit-focused and balanced wine with a lovely, lingering finish.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2014 Pfaff Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Light straw in the glass, this wine offers green herbal aromas on the nose, complemented by floral notes and a whiff of sandalwood. Its green apple flavors and strong minerality make for an enjoyable quaff.
Name: Giocato 2014 Pinot Grigio (Primorska)

Description: Rounded and plush, with a subdued mélange of pear and apple fruit and a lovely, rescuing streak of tart apple freshness, this comes together in the end. The opening is broad, rich and medium-sweet, but the finish is illuminated by lemony acid.
Name: François Baur 2014 Herrenweg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Charmingly ripe and aromatic notes of juicy, yellow pear on nose and palate make for an ultrafriendly, easy-drinking and utterly fruit-driven wine. Drink soon to enjoy the amplified pear aromas while they're at their peak.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2014 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: An intriguing blend of juicy pear and tart but ripe apple perfumes the luminous palate that shines with fruit. The apple tartness, boosted by a little citrus, creates a lovely balance on this easy-drinking, little fruit bomb.
Name: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2013 le Berger Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Yellow pear, Golden Delicious apple and a dollop of honey create a fruitful, inviting and friendly opening, countered by lemony freshness that keeps things on the right side of fruity opulence. Drink this wine while its aromas are at their height.
Name: Paul Blanck 2014 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Textured and beautifully balanced pear fruit shows glimpses of marzipan and candied peel on a palate guided by sheer, zesty citrus acidity.
Name: Schlumberger 2013 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There is a distinct hint of ripe, juicy peach flesh amidst all the pear aromas. The palate is less expressive but still full of friendly, appetizing and generous fruit. A seam of citric freshness again allows glimpses of that peach. Drink while these fruity aromas are out in force.
Name: Wolfberger 2014 Signature Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Only very subdued notes of citrus emerge and add a little polish to a rounded, balanced and dry palate. However, a lovely, bundled ray of tangerine zestiness at the core brightens the wine immensely.
Name: Emile Beyer 2014 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rather closed on the nose, this shows plump, sweet pear fruit countered by sprightly, spiky, lemony acidity. This is lively and fruity and easy to drink; enjoy while flavors are at their peak.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Nervy, herbal aromas and vivid grapefruit alongside lemon flavors make this wine stand out from the pack. It is light to medium in body and has a crisp, tangy texture and refreshing finish.
Name: McManis 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Ripe pear on nose and palate is the central theme on this broad-shouldered and richly textured wine. A dollop of sweetness is countered with fresh lime acidity that concludes in ripe accord.
Name: Domaine Zinck 2013 Terroir Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is round and mouthfilling without being fat or blowsy, finishing fairly crisp and dry. Along the way, hints of apple and citrus alternate with almond skin and cinnamon, providing a delicate balance of fruity and savory.
Name: Kim Crawford 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Generous, sweet pear fruit tumbles out over palate and throat, held carefully in check by fresh zestiness. This is about easy fruit and simple pleasure, held in beautiful balance. Drink soon.
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2014 Cuvée Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Very rich, almost overripe pear dominates the palate, which also has a rich marzipan edge. Residual sugar is just about cut by citrus freshness. This is at the cusp of being just a little too much.
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2013 Barriques Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Fresh lemon notes are tinged with smoke and earth on this easy, balanced and dryish Pinot Gris. Ample fruit at the core and an easygoing light touch engender enjoyment.
Name: Vieil Armand 2014 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This medium-sweet proposition takes off on silky wings of lemony freshness. The interplay thus created spells fun and balance. Citric freshness is the decisive, playful, enjoyable factor here.
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2014 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Tasty flavors like Pippin apple and tangy cherry, plus a smooth and lively texture bring a lot of appeal to this light-bodied wine. The combination of crisp acidity, luxurious mouthfeel and bright but subtle flavors is a winning one.
Name: Angel's Cup 2013 Vineyard Selection Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: The wine is almost salmon in hue, but don't let that put you off. Layers of ground cinnamon help provide balance to the broad, ripe flavors of melon, pear and stone fruit.
Name: Brancott 2014 Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)

Description: Very ripe pear fruit is dangerously close to tipping over into cloying richness, almost hinting at cream soda. The palate is less overwhelming. As always, that special streak of Alsace acid saves the day.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Tart and ripe in grapefruit and lime, this is an easygoing quaff with buzzy acidity that will be enjoyable on a summer's day or at a casual gathering. Light, it finishes muted and fast.
Name: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2014 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: Pear, peach and cinnamon notes all mingle easily on the nose of this medium-bodied, barely pink-tinged wine. On the palate, the fruit takes charge, leaving it easy to drink alone, or with simple fish or chicken dishes.
Name: Seifried 2014 Old Coach Road Pinot Gris (Nelson)

Description: Pear candy and citrus peel beckon from the glass. There is a slightly candied edge to the expressive fruit, while the dryish palate shows concentration and warmth.
Name: Martin Schaetzel 2013 Cuvée Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a very drinkable, plump wine probably best served as an apéritif. Hints of pear and honey mark the nose, while the palate blends in hints of allspice, cinnamon and clove. It tastes slightly off dry, but finishes with zesty acids that offer plenty of refreshment.
Name: Yealands 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This medium-bodied wine offers some of Pinot Gris' peppery spice, just enough to enliven the pear and citrus fruit elements. Hints of wet stone add complexity to the aromas, while the spice lingers on the finish.
Name: Lake Chalice 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This wine tastes appley, fresh and crisp, beginning with bright floral aromas, then offering vibrant Pippin apple and citrus flavors. The body is light and the texture smooth but nicely tangy.
Name: Line 39 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: A bouquet of lemon rind, white flowers and peach prepares the palate for crisp, clean flavors of white peach and apricot. This wine is lean in the mouth, with a pleasantly astringent finish.
Name: Cramele Recas 2014 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pear, melon and white peach aromas are followed by rounded tropical-fruit flavors that drink off dry. It's enjoyable but the sugar seems a bit out of place.
Name: Lone Birch 2014 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: Aromas seem blunted, but the palate shows both freshness and fruit. This is balanced and comes out with surprisingly friendly apple fruit, finishing on a fresh note.
Name: Domaine Moltès 2014 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Both nose and palate need waking up. It is only with intense swishing that some apple freshness emerges on the rather broad palate. A streak of tart apple acidity rescues this.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2014 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A pink-meets-tan color is the greeting on this peachy Pinot Grigio that smells like fresh applesauce. A spunky palate of stone fruit and moderate acidity deals additional notes of waxy melon.
Name: Sierra Batuco 2015 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Maule Valley)

Description: This low-alcohol offering exhibits less weight and richness as a result. Still, it's a pleasant, lean white that relies on lemony flavors to provide crisp refreshment.
Name: Brancott 2014 Flight Song Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Freshly cut pear and tropical aromas lead to medium-bodied flavors. The style is clean and well made, with the concentration dipping a bit at times.
Name: Columbia Crest 2014 Grand Estates Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: White wines are extremely rare in this blazing-hot appellation. This off-dry example brings aromas and flavors of dried pears and apples, with the sugar writing much of the story.
Name: Convergence Zone 2013 Drizzle Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Pinot Gris (Red Mountain)

Description: Aromas and flavors like mixed fruit cocktail and a rather soft texture make this a pleasant, easy-drinking wine. Medium bodied and not tart, it seems almost sweet on the finish.
Name: Redtree 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp aromas of Mexican lime peel mix with struck match and cement on this nose. The palate is extremely tart and sour.
Name: Bianchi 2014 Signature Selection Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Dusty, waxy peach aromas lead to a round, oily palate, with just enough acidic verve to keep the wine's pulse up. Mealy apple, petrol and an oxidized note send this towards a waxy-feeling finish.
Name: Concha y Toro 2014 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Pinot Grigio (Chile)

Description: Made in a richer-than-usual style, this wine shows floral and melon aromas, medium to full body, dry honeydew melon flavors and a smooth rather than crisp texture.
Name: Backhouse 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine still seems to be in its shell, showing considerable reduction that persists in the aromas and flavors. It drinks off dry with broad apple flavors.
Name: Convergence Zone 2014 Drizzle Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Pinot Gris (Red Mountain)

Description: This wine starts out quite reductive which provides distraction. Aromas of flowers and ripe pear lead to broad flavors that seem to fall a bit flat.
Name: 14 Hands 2014 Pinot Gris (Washington)

Description: This waxy, stalky Pinot Grigio comes with a can't-miss whiff of corn chips prior to a fleshy, flat palate of bland banana flavors. The dull, chunky finish is on its last legs.
Name: Viña Requingua 2014 Los Riscos Pinot Grigio (Curicó Valley)

Description: A flabby nose of muddled citrus and bruised pear carries to the perceptibly sugary palate. This is a light and lithe Pinot Grigio, best enjoyed in casual settings.
Name: St. Julian 2013 Reserve Pinot Grigio (Lake Michigan Shore)

Description: Blurred edges characterize the non-distinct apple fruit. The palate has edges of bitterness that the residual sugar cannot masks.
Name: Domaine Bernhard & Reibel 2014 Hahnenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This wine strikes a resonant balance among mixed tree fruits, sappy acids and leesy, textural highlights that enliven the mouthfeel. The finish brings on golden raisins and a hint of nut butter.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lightly dusted with cinnamon and baking spices, this is apple pie in a glass. Along with the lovely apple-pastry richness come lighter suggestions of pear and peach. This immaculate and substantial effort should be consumed now through 2017.
Name: Chehalem 2014 Three Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Though not indicated on the label, this is sourced from a single vineyard in the Columbia Gorge AVA. Cool-site flavors abound, from the lemony fruit to the snappy acidity. The wine did not go through secondary malolactic fermentation, yet shows a tasty streak of butterscotch running through its core.
Name: Lachini 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Excellent concentration impresses here, with a full-throttle mix of citrus, apple, pear and peach fruit. Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this spent five months on the lees and offers length and balance.
Name: King Estate 2014 Domaine Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Plump tree fruits carry the weight, with a dash of toast—though the winery notes say the fermentation was 100% stainless steel. It's delicious and ready to drink, now through 2018.
Name: The Four Graces 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is a compelling example of Oregon Pinot Gris. Apple, pear and lemon curd carry the bulk of the flavors, with a lightly peppery lift to the midpalate. The spicy character extends through a pleasing, long finish.
Name: King Estate 2014 Backbone Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Done in a distinctive style that is just shy of over-the-top, this is fermented and aged in neutral oak barrels, and sports near-15% alcohol. Rich, round and ripe, it's lightly buttery, with appealing apple and pear-tart flavors, light toast and impressive power.
Name: River's Edge 2014 Pinot Gris (Elkton Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This young wine needs a couple of hours of breathing time to open up its fruit aromas. Once there, an elegant mix of apple, melon and hints of white peach and jicama carry through, with medium length, to a minerally finish.
Name: St. Innocent 2014 Vitae Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From a Pinot Noir specialist in the heart of the Russian River Valley, this white is equal parts floral and fruity, shy and dry, with a succulent layering of lime, grapefruit and fig. A medium level of acidity wraps itself around a viscous core, keeping the wine fresh on the palate. It's the right kind of weighty, finishing with ginger and honey.
Name: Balletto 2013 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: Light daffodil aromas mix with Key lime pie, soft pear flesh, pressed tuberose and apple blossoms on the nose of this relatively complex wine from an often simplistic grape. There is decent grip on the palate, with flavors of dried pome fruit, pencil lead minerality and a lemony tang.
Name: Maddalena 2013 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Smooth and fruity, this all-stainless effort carries a citrusy tang into the finish. It quickly settles into a good flavor groove, with suggestions of fresh-baked bread.
Name: Winter's Hill 2014 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Like the companion reserve Pinot Blanc, this first-ever effort was barrel fermented and aged a few months in French oak. Scents and flavors of brioche wrap around smooth yellow fruits, leading into a layered, textured finish.
Name: Winter's Hill 2014 Reserve Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Fleshy and floral, this is a delightfully light, dry and tropical wine, with primary characteristics of apple and lime. Refreshing, it'll serve well as a versatile companion on the table or as as worthy apéritif, finishing in grassy fig and pear.
Name: Black Stallion 2014 Limited Release Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly pink in hue, this wine from a Lompoc-based producer offers pink grapefruit and snappy nectarine elements on the nose. The palate is more about texture than flavor, though rose petals, citrus and a tiny bit of minerality keep it interesting.
Name: Flying Goat Cellars 2014 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: Production has doubled and the price has risen in this latest vintage, but Portlandia has yet to land on a consistent identity for its Pinot Gris. This shows apple and pear fruit, showing more than a touch of skin contact flavors, with some bitterness drifting through the finish.
Name: Portlandia 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Peach, pear, melon and vanilla aromas come with an aromatic sensation of wet rocks. Light and lifted on the palate, with honeydew, pear, lemon and stony flavors, this finishes fresh, clean and lightly powdery, with echoes of apple and pear.
Name: François Lurton 2015 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Pinot Gris (Valle de Uco)

Description: This is an intense, oaky and savory mix of ripeness and power. Although the fruit is muted and understated, the wine is full bodied in style and weight.
Name: Benessere 2014 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded melon, grapefruit juice, lemon chiffon, gray slate and a bit of white pepper swirl into a distinctive nose on this wine by the San Luis Obispo-based producer. The palate is tight and bright, though a bit sour with apple-peel flavors.
Name: Stephen Ross 2014 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The impression is that some of the fruit may have teetered on the edge of overripe, as the wine has a grainy, sugary mouthfeel. It's not overtly sweet, just granular, and the pear fruit flavors are lightly honeyed. It's best to drink this by late 2016.
Name: Cardwell Hill 2014 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Just-squeezed lime aromas mesh with riper green and yellow apples and wet stone on the nose of this simple yet quaffable boxed wine. The flavors lack energy, but show familiar apple and lime characteristics.
Name: Jewelry Box 2013 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nectarine, apricot, jasmine blossoms and lots of fresh squeezed Meyer lemon juice makes a delicious nose on this refreshing treat of a wine. It conveys lively, citrusy acidity and apple-rind tartness, offering flavors that last throughout the sip and deep into the finish.
Name: Longoria 2014 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Most of the fruit for this wine comes from this vineyard's 1975 plantings. It brings nuanced aromas of pear and mineral, drinking just a hair off dry, with more than ample acidity to balance out the fleshy flavors. The finish lasts a long time.
Name: Ross Andrew 2014 Celilo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: A dynamic balance between ripe, juicy fruit flavors and crisp acidity makes this medium-bodied wine both refreshing and substantive. It smells like a bowl of sliced melons, apples and grapes. After 79% Pinot Gris, the winemaker blends in Roussanne, Grüner Veltliner and a bit of Chardonnay.
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Gris (California)

Description: Livelier than usual in texture and popping with bright citrus aromas and flavors, this light-bodied and barrel-fermented wine is a great palate-cleanser and will pair beautifully with dishes like raw oysters and herbed goat cheese. It smells and tastes like lemon, lime, green apple and kiwi, and has great balance.
Name: Monte Volpe 2013 Pinot Grigio (Mendocino)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This distinctive wine has a slightly peachy color, which is natural for this varietal. Aromas suggest white pepper and orange zest, while flavors recall peach skin and apricot. A nervy, crisp balance makes it feel lively and refreshing on the tongue, despite full body.
Name: Boeger 2014 Pinot Gris (El Dorado)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine brings a whole lot of appeal with its fresh, lively but rich pear and melon flavors. The balance is spot-on and the flavors linger.
Name: Mercer 2014 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This sleekly styled wine displays aromas of citrus peel, green apple and Bosc pear. The citrus flavors are lightly spritzy, bringing a sense of lightness and freshness. It's perfect for a summer day.
Name: Milbrandt 2014 Traditions Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Styled with vivid peach flavors, this wine is medium to full bodied, very smooth in texture, and showing slight buttery accents on the rich fruit flavors. It has good balance, freshness and some depth, too.
Name: Van Ruiten 2014 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: High-toned and 100% varietal, this ephemeral Pinot Gris was aged in stainless steel and is dry and waxy on the palate. Crisp green apple and lemon flavors are complemented by a mineral underbelly that makes this a food-friendly wine.
Name: Hendry 2014 Hendry Vineyard Pinot Gris (Napa Valley)

Description: Slightly herbal aromas and vivid citrus flavors lend a unique personality to this light-bodied wine. A whiff of just-chopped parsley precedes bright lemon-lime flavors and definite acidity that will help it pair smashingly with all kinds of seafood, salads and light pastas.
Name: Gnarly Head 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Aromas like crisp green apples and flavors of ripe white peaches combine in this fresh-tasting and medium-bodied wine. The texture is lively but smooth around the edges, and the wine is very appetizing.
Name: Montevina 2014 Glass Falls Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Delicious aromas of yellow cake batter, lemon and a touch of butter greet the nose on this wine by Mike Sinor. The palate proves much more delicate than the nose suggests, with yellow pear fruit and rain-on-cement minerality.
Name: Sinor-LaVallee 2014 Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Light and crisp, this offers aromas like peach skin and grapefruit, and flavors like crisp green apple and white peach. A lean, tangy texture make this very refreshing and versatile with food.
Name: HandCraft 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of petroleum jelly, melon and flowers lead to pear flavors with a rounded feel that taper toward the finish. Pair it with shrimp ceviche.
Name: Willow Crest 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: A slightly tawny or pink color, characteristic of this variety's grape skins, helps this wine stand out. Aromas like ripe pears and apples lead to vivid, tangy apple and apricot flavors and rather light body.
Name: Mirassou 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: The touch of pink in the light gold color is natural for a Pinot Grigio, reflecting the color of the grape skins. This has light white cherry aromas, pear flavors and a crisp hint of lemon that brings a tangy touch.
Name: The White Knight 2014 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This fresh, appealing wine is lightly spritzy, with flavors of pear and melon that show persistence.
Name: Anew 2014 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This light-bodied wine brings enjoyment at a very low price. Attractive grapefruit and dried herb aromas followed by citrus and savory flavors make it appetizing and enjoyable. It tastes dry, fairly crisp and well balanced.
Name: CK Mondavi 2014 Willow Springs Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Subdued aromas of red apple and melon are followed by a dry, medium-bodied palate with a tart, drawn-out finish.
Name: Hogue 2014 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: An assertive and substantive wine, this has very peachy aromas, vivid and ripe peach and apple flavors, and a texture that's energized by good acidity. It is light to medium bodied and nearly dry.
Name: Murphy-Goode 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This wine smells like flowers, peaches, lemons and limes and tastes soft and soothing. It's light bodied, easy to sip and styled in a richer and more luxurious vein than many others in its category.
Name: Belle Ambiance 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Reductive on first pour, this wine opens to display aromas of freshly sliced red apple and melon. It drinks a hair off dry, with a fleshy, full feel.
Name: Wind Rose 2014 Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Description: A zippy, lively version, this light-bodied wine smells and tastes like a combo of grapefruit, lemon and peach juices, having a crisp character on first sip, and a rich softness on the second.
Name: Twisted 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of green apple, melon and grape skins lead to fresh, lightly spritzy tropical flavors. It doesn't entirely stand up on its own but should perk up nicely with baked fish.
Name: Boomtown 2014 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine seems slightly past peak with aromas of overripe apple, lees and pear. It's lightly sweet with the concentration not seeming all there.
