Name: Bunnell 2012 Wine O' Clock Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is subtle and almost neutral in flavor, but does have enough crisp mouthfeel to make it taste appetizing. It delivers slight apple-skin aromas and cucumber flavors, light body and a short finish.
Name: McFadden 2014 Estate Bottled Organic Grapes Pinot Gris (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A rich texture and rather ripe fruit flavors make this softer and broader in taste than many of its peers. Flavors like Fuji apple and Bartlett pear are appealing, and the mouthfeel is smooth and easy rather than crisp.
Name: McFadden 2014 Blue Quail Pinot Gris (Potter Valley)

Description: Fruity and slightly herbal aromas and flavors give a tasty character to this light-bodied and slightly sweet wine. It has an agreeable, uncomplicated fruitiness and a soft texture.
Name: Domino 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Production of this barrel-fermented reserve is roughly half of what it was in 2013, and in this instance, less is more. A sleek, sophisticated effort, it's bursting with flavors of pear flesh and skin, set against a wash of stony minerality. It's leesy, long and luscious.
Name: Lange 2014 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Beautifully styled, this wine brings a solid blend of citrus, cucumber, tangerine and melon flavors. The length and balance are there for further aging, but the stunningly good flavors encourage near-term drinking.
Name: Elk Cove 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The finest Pinot Gris to date from Carabella, this complex and textural wine artfully blends apple, pear and stone fruit with additional flavors of melon and peach skin. The balance is spot-on and the length impressive.
Name: Carabella 2014 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Lively and lush, this is lip-smacking good juice. It's dense with apple, peach and melon fruit flavors that penetrate deeply, buoyed by juicy acidity. Pinot Gris this tasty should be enjoyed lightly chilled, while it is in the first bloom of its freshness.
Name: Wy'East Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine shows finesse, driven by its seamless mix of citrus, melon, peach and pear fruits. Immediately delicious, it actually improves by the second day, showing its perfect acid-to-fruit balance. Give it a light chill—not too much—and it's a perfect autumnal sipper.
Name: Owen Roe 2014 Crawford-Beck Vineyard Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Foris consistently produces a meticulously crafted, value lineup of Alsatian-inspired white wines. As with its siblings, this is crisp, detailed and balanced. Apple and pear fruit is lined with citrus rind. Give it a light chill and it will delight.
Name: Foris 2014 Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: More than a slight hint of blush color (suggesting extra skin contact) leads into this broad, spicy, flavorful wine. Highlights of ginger, cinnamon and sweet baking spices adorn rich, mouthcoating pear fruit. It offers an enjoyable, drink-now style.
Name: Lange 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Done in a light, low-alcohol mode, this sports flavors that seem to be moving quickly along the aging curve. Drinking at or near its peak, this opens with slightly oxidized apple fruit, and gains further richness as it winds through a finish with excellent length and flavor. Drink now through 2016.
Name: Treos 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Crafted in an oxidative style, this wine is light brown to the eye, with aromas of toasted nuts and caramelized pineapple. Flavors of hazelnut, toasted almond and lemon sorbet continue through the smooth finish that ends on a zesty note.
Name: Erzetič 2009 Amfora Sivi Pinot Pinot Gris (Goriska Brda)

Description: Soft straw to the eye with pleasing aromas of vanilla and caramel with soft citrus undertones, this wine offers flavors of white peach and green fig. It is somewhat full in the mouth, with a hint of tart nectarine on the finish.
Name: Vino Kupljen 2013 Selection Mon Royal Pinot Gris (Slovenia)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This geeky bottling with 21 days of skin contact shouldn't be confused with the fresh zest expected in a pink wine. Aromas of are similar to an Old Fashioned cocktail, with macerated Maraschino cherries, pulverized orange peels and a touch of smoky bourbon. There's a burst of acidity once sipped, then the wine emerges toward a bitter grip, with more dried cherry and orange peel flavors.
Name: Beauregard 2013 Regan Vineyard Orange Wine Pinot Gris (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Forward, ripe and full bodied, this most pleasurable Pinot Gris is drinking quite well, with fresh fruit flavors of pear and melon. Moderate acidity is just sufficient to keep the fruit from becoming too flabby. The wine was vinted and bottled by Lujon.
Name: Seven Sails 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Here's a solid, standard-issue Willamette Valley Pinot Gris, which is to say, loaded with fresh-cut pear fruit. A generously fleshy palate comes with a slice of honeydew melon and a lemon-wafer finish. It's round, full, forward and ready to drink.
Name: Soléna 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is done in a lightly spicy, lightly toasty style. It's clean and supple, with a mix of apple, peach and melon fruit. Ample acidity keeps it fresh and lively through the finish. It spent six months in a mix of one-third stainless and two-thirds neutral oak.
Name: Lazy River 2014 Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This tasty bottle does not push for maximum ripeness, settling comfortably into a ripe-enough mix of apples, pears and nectarines. There's a dusting of cinnamon and even a little hint of brown sugar, though the wine is definitely finished dry. The balance holds true through a medium-long finish.
Name: Left Coast Cellars 2014 The Orchards Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: From Southern Oregon comes this round and fruity Pinot Gris. It's packed with peach and pear fruit, ripe and forward. Beyond that there isn't much going on. It's simple, fresh and easy-drinking. Enjoy it while it's young.
Name: Cuckoo's Nest 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: With residual sugar at 15 grams/L, this definitely drinks off dry. The fruit is spicy and bright, rounded off with a lick of honey. Apple, pear, lemon verbena and even a suggestion of breakfast tea come through.
Name: David Hill 2014 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The color of light straw, this wine offers a clean aroma of ripe pineapple. It is soft in the mouth, with a flavor of slightly tart lemon curd and a hint of lemon blossom.
Name: Puklavec & Friends 2013 Pinot Grigio (Štajerska)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A big-production, medium-bodied effort, this has noticeable sweetness that softens the acidity. Sweet apple and pear fruit dominate an easy-drinking, approachable, simple but enjoyable Pinot Gris.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Neutral white-fruit aromas of peach, nectarine and melon are welcoming. This quaffer is juicy like orange juice, while flavors of mixed citrus fruits and nectarine finish peachy and lively, with a slight bitterness coming on late.
Name: François Lurton 2014 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Pinot Gris (Valle de Uco)

Description: Initial grassy aromas of hay and wheat usher in scents of peach, melon and saline water. This is a bit pulpy on the palate, but with cutting acidity. Melon, apple cider and nectarine flavors finish with friendly but nondescript white-fruit flavors.
Name: François Lurton 2014 Santa Celina Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: It seems that there has been a dramatic increase in the production of this wine. Gassy and thin, it shows a veneer of slightly sweet apple and finishes with a dusting of powdered sugar.
Name: Coeur de Terre 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Like rose gold in a glass, this skin-fermented Pinot Gris glimmers with complexity. Aged in a combination of French and Slovenian oak, it's lavishly aromatic, penetrating the palate with tones of potpourri and spice, citrus rind and smoked tea leaves. Tart tangerine acidity lends vibe and refreshment through a long, long finish.
Name: Channing Daughters 2012 Ramato Pinot Grigio (Long Island)

Description: Very subtle hints of ripe pear on the nose lead to a citrus-dominated palate that has a pleasant bitter-almond edge and a finely textured midpalate. Nonetheless, the zesty freshness is the main feature of this tricky vintage. This is Pinot Gris but not as you know it—here it has the slender verve of a stony, steep site.
Name: Wohlmuth 2014 Gola Pinot Gris (Südsteiermark)

Description: Having spent no time in oak, this crisp, clean white is resplendent in lemon curd and vanilla, joined midway by additional layers of just-picked peach. Medium bodied, with the right texture to hold up to a range of spicy foods, it offers a vibrantly lively finish.
Name: Swanson 2014 Pinot Grigio (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: This pale straw-colored wine has a bouquet of melon and nutmeg. Flavors of pear, peach, apple, lemon curd and soft spice mingle on the palate into the smooth, lemon-tart finish.
Name: Dalton 2014 D Unoaked Pinot Gris (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of citrus, herbs and nut oil are followed by a full-bodied palate with lightly sweet fruit flavors. It's a fine display of the variety.
Name: Tranche 2013 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lusciously round and rich on the palate, this silken Pinot Gris balances bright apple and pear flavors against a crisp, minerally edge. A whiff of lavender carries through a moderately long, but perfumed finish.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2014 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely concentrated and nuanced with oak, spice and citrus rind, there's a whole lot more than insipid quaffing in store for this Pinot Grigio. Lithe, lean and deeply mineral in style, it's a wine meant for slow sipping and pondering.
Name: Channing Daughters 2013 Pinot Grigio (Long Island)

Description: Medium in weight, this dry, refreshing white from a single-vineyard site holds layers of flavors and complexity. Aromatically it imparts almonds and white flowers in equal measure, followed by honey-tinged tastes of mango and melon. It finishes crisp.
Name: Barber 2013 Rougissant Keller Vineyard Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Aromatic restraint with just a dash of lemony freshness characterizes nose and palate. There is a pleasant midpalate texture and a friendly, bright citrus nerve. This is a rather slender Pinot Gris. Drink soon.
Name: Neumeister 2014 Steirische Klassik Grauburgunder (Südoststeiermark)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of Golden Delicious apples, nectarine flesh, lemon-lime soda and poached pears drizzled lightly with agave syrup show on the nose of this wine made by Mike Roth. The palate offers apple and pear cider along with white peach and a steely, nearly gunmetal minerality.
Name: Piro Piro Piccolo 2014 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Flowers, melon and stone fruit inform the aromas and flavors of this unctuous, weighty and viscous wine, smooth with a lingering taste of ripe peach on the finish. Tiny percentages of Riesling and Gewürztraminer figure into the mix, too.
Name: FlyWine 2013 The Party Starter Pinot Gris (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of hazelnut, mineral and pear lead to off-dry, full-feeling fruit flavors that are stitched up with citric acidity on the finish. It doesn't entirely come together but there's plenty to enjoy.
Name: Ross Andrew 2014 Celilo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Earthy, musky notes lend a savory complexity to this bold, richly bodied Pinot Gris. Dry in style, it juxtaposes crisp white grapefruit and lime flavors against hints of smoked nuts. The finish is brisk and mineral.
Name: Hosmer 2013 Pinot Gris (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This aromatically appealing wine boasts aromas of melon, pear and spice. It drinks dry and is lightly spritzy, with a sleek feel and a tart finish that shows pleasing freshness. Try it with shellfish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2014 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this straightforward quaffer, aromas of pear, melon and apple lead to off-dry fruit flavors with a full feel. The flavor concentration is light but it still provides easy drinking enjoyment.
Name: Goose Ridge 2014 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is rich and expressive, with the grip and texture of a fine Chardonnay—but it's Pinot Gris. Roughly half was fermented in a concrete egg; the rest in stainless steel and one new acacia barrel. The fruit is fleshy but not fat, crisply defined with exceptional phenolic details of citrus skin. The underlying minerality further frames the ripe, tangy fruit, and the three-dimensional flavors expand and extend through a lingering finish.
Name: Archery Summit 2013 Ab Ovo Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine offers very yellow aromas of stewed lemons, pound cake, egg flour, peach blossom, ambrosia melon and even a shy bit of hazelnut on the nose. The fascinating palate shows orange sponge cake, acacia flower, dried papaya, stone fruits and a pithy minerality. Scents and flavors are altogether mysterious yet delicious.
Name: Aequorea 2013 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sadly, this is the last vintage for this single-vineyard Pinot Gris. Oaky, spicy, buttery and rich, its mouthfilling flavors conjure up thoughts of that fabulous baked pear brioche you had at that little bakery in Paris. It's ripe, fleshy and deliciously buttery, and it should be consumed right now.
Name: Francis Tannahill 2012 Jacob-Hart Vineyard Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a honeyed, mead-like character on the nose of this Steve Clifton wine. It also shows buttered brioche, lemon curds and an underlying white rock minerality. Ruby-red grapefruit flesh and ripe nectarine flavors arrive once sipped, and a chalky grip ensues, making for a very dynamic and intriguing wine.
Name: Palmina 2013 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: You'll note the bubbles around the edges of the glass, some remaining CO2 that says “drink me, I'm fresh!” It puts a creamy edge on this fruitbowl of a Pinot Gris, with abundant green and yellow fruits and a slight impression of residual sugar. But what stands out are the flavors of ripe, juicy, just-picked pears. Credit winemaker Jesse Lange.
Name: Durant 2014 Southview Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: This reserve-level effort is crisp and stylish. Fruit flavors mix melon, lime and pink grapefruit, nicely balanced against fresh, textural acids. About 20% of the blend was aged briefly in acacia.
Name: Apolloni 2014 L Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This has a vivid, gold color with just a touch of pink, which makes sense considering Pinot Gris is not really a white wine grape, but a gris or gray shade in between blanc and noir. Aromas are like buttered popcorn, toasted almond and a touch of honey. It is undeniably flavorful, lush in texture and full bodied. The blend is 75% Pinot Gris and 25% Pinot Blanc.
Name: Wargin Wines 2013 Nesserre Vineyards Pinot Gris (California)

Description: The light yellow-gold color is more vivid than usual. Rich aromas are fragrant with floral, honeyed, buttery notes that seem to swell in the flavors as well. This is a full-bodied, creamy-textured wine that amps up the ripeness and buttered-toast flavors to a clearly heard volume, but stops short of blasting.
Name: Maldonado 2013 Los Olivos Vineyard Pinot Gris (Napa Valley)

Description: While zesty and mineral on the nose, this dry Grauburgunder, or Pinot Gris, is ripe and concentrated in yellow cherry and grapefruit flavors. Racy acidity cuts through the sunny palate, uncovering a pleasant bristle of white tea astringency on the finish. Drink now through 2017.
Name: Nauerth-Gnägy 2012 Ng. 2 Schweigen-Rechtenbach Trocken Grauburgunder (Pfalz)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine boasts a lovely, creamy texture and citrusy freshness enhanced by deep concentration. Along with the citrus you'll find apple, pear and melon fruitiness. This is an irresistible summer sipper.
Name: Ponzi 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: There has been an impressive jump in quality over the past few vintages, along with a price drop. What's not to like? This young, lightly spritzy wine is a fresh summer drink with immense appeal. Scents of white flowers, flavors of pears and highlights of tangerines, continue into further flavors of pink grapefruit and clean rock. The low alcohol suggests that there is a touch of residual sugar, but the wine finishes dry.
Name: Deer Creek 2014 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy and still tight, this shows a big-boned style. Penetrating pear fruit flavors are dotted with white pepper, and finished with a hint of water cracker.
Name: Lumos 2014 Logsdon Ridge Vineyard Rudolfo Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost completely clear and crystalline as ice-cold water, this wine from a Santa Lucia Highlands-based producer shows apple blossoms, Asian pear flesh and white rocks on the clean, fresh nose. It's focused and tight on the palate, suggesting apple and pear peels with pomelo pith.
Name: Hahn 2014 Pinot Gris (Monterey County)

Description: Wildflower and lemon zest brighten this dry, citrusy Pinot Gris. Lip smacking white grapefruit flavors flood the palate, along with a hint of bitter almond. It's a revitalizing white that's ready to drink, but also likely to maintain its fresh, primary flavors through 2017.
Name: Franz Keller 2013 Schwarzer Adler Pinot Gris (Baden)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fruity and almost off dry, this appealing wine goes heavy on flavors of spicy pear and apricot jam. A streak of honey runs through, and a hint of wintergreen. It's already drinking well, so dive in.
Name: Raptor Ridge 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Showing a slightly coppery blush hue, this softly aromatic wine has a pleasing muskiness. It's high acid, slightly spritzy, clean and fresh. Though perfectly quaffable, it's not a typical Oregon Pinot Gris.
Name: Siltstone 2014 Blacktail Vineyard Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Smooth and elegant, its fresh citrus and apple fruit flavors are buoyed on firm acids. Despite the high alcohol, the character of this sipper is lithe and light.
Name: Lumos 2014 Temperance Hill Vineyard Julia Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This was the first vintage made at the new winery facility on site. It's a pleasing, lightly ripened wine with flavors of green berry and apple, highlights of pear skin, and an overall approachable, balanced style.
Name: Melrose 2013 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Lush and creamy as soon as it hits the palate, this fine value is packed with flavors of fresh-sliced, just-ripe pear. Hints of apple and tangerine further expand the flavor, and it finishes crisp and clean.
Name: Acrobat 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Chunky and fleshy, this is loaded with spicy pear and lighter melon and tangerine fruits. Full, forward and fresh, it's delicious and ready to go.
Name: Eola Hills 2014 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Refreshing and full of vitality, this Pinot Gris offsets zesty white grapefruit flavor with a sheen of fresh herb and floral notes. It's a dry, elegant wine, with broad appeal and a youthful vigor that should last through 2016.
Name: Villa Wolf 2013 Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Almost as light in color as water, this is a straight-ahead take on the grape, with tropical-leaning aromas of honeysuckle, ripe papaya and boisterous passionfruit. The palate is much grassier in style, showing cut lawn, kiwi, green pears and kaffir limes, with just a touch of lingering tropical sweetness.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2014 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of pear flesh and skin open into just slightly underripe fruit flavors. The wine is balanced and adds tart apple to the pear fruit.
Name: Siltstone 2014 Guadalupe Vineyard Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This is solidly varietal, with a sleek mix of pear flesh and skin. Some tension created between the phenolic bite and tart acidity carries through into the finish. It suggests that a proper match, with a relatively oily fish perhaps, will bring out its best.
Name: King Estate 2014 Signature Collection Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is made in a style that will work well with foods looking for sharp acids, especially shellfish. Lemon rind, light citrus and peppery highlights are wrapped in searing acidity.
Name: Apolloni 2014 Estate Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Young and lightly spicy, this brings crisp flavors of Asian pear to the forefront. It's a straightforward wine, with just a dash of white pepper adding an interesting flavor note.
Name: Kudos 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Light citrus and floral aromas meld with richer, riper flavors and a generous texture. More than just a palate cleanser, this unoaked wine has some depth and is rich enough to hold interest.
Name: La Folia Winery 2013 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Searingly dry, to the edge of sour, this emphasizes mineral and citrus rind over fruit. This austere style might match well with some sausages on the grill to cut the acidity.
Name: Van Duzer 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This smells like crisp green apples, tastes just a bit richer than it smells, has medium body and a touch of crisp acidity. The strong points are the tangy mouthfeel, fruity aromas and overall freshness.
Name: Rebusity 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: A lightly herbaceous aroma and bright citrus flavors make this light-bodied wine fresh and easy to drink. It smells like fresh-cut grass and lemon, tastes like grapefruit and honeydew melon, and feels soft and smooth.
Name: Pepi 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Grassy and herbal, this might easily be mistaken for Sauvignon Blanc. There's plenty of acid evident, with lemony fruit that finishes short and tart.
Name: Archer 2011 Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: An extremely pale color and light fruit salad aromas are followed by fresh, gentle texture and banana and cherry flavors. Light in alcohol, delicate in mouthfeel and short on the finish, it's a mere wisp of a wine.
Name: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: This is an extroverted version of a varietal that can be quite subtle. Aromas suggest grapefruit and pears, while flavors are assertive and citruslike, with an earthy accent. The feel in the mouth is reasonably crisp.
Name: Heartache 2012 Passionate Squeeze Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This medium-bodied wine has very subtle aromas and flavors, a fairly smooth texture, and an ever-so-slightly buttery accent. It offers a slim personality to enjoy.
Name: Insomnia 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An opulence of mouthfeel is highly plump and pleasing in this deeply textural Pinot Gris. It's dry in style, but lush and fruity, drenching the palate in grapefruit and white peach flavors. Nuanced by hints of chalk and oyster shell, it's a complex, satisfying wine brightened with zesty lime acidity.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2013 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Delicate white peach and pear notes perfume this dry, crisply fruity wine. There's a satisfying weightiness to the palate, but tart lemon notes keep it zesty and spry.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2013 Reserve Pinot Gris (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Don't be misled by the low alcohol; there's more than a smidgen of residual sugar in this wine. It works to good effect, adding richness to the fruit and roundness to the mouthfeel. Pear, peach and apricot flavors fill the palate, with generous streaks of honey and tea adding further complexity.
Name: Vista Hills 2013 Treehouse Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Enticing fragrances suggest alpine wild flower, stone fruit and savory herb. The linear palate is loaded with finesse and character, delivering creamy green apple, tangerine, mineral, white peach and mint. It's well balanced with bright acidity.
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: This fragrant white opens with aromas of white spring flower, jasmine, citrus, pear and a hint of alpine herb. The vibrant, elegant palate delivers layers of creamy Granny Smith apple, nectarine zest and steely mineral balanced by bright acidity.
Name: Elena Walch 2013 Castel Ringberg Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This structured, copper-colored wine—the natural color of Pinot Grigio after skin contact—delivers dried red berry, nut, lightly toasted oak, butterscotch, vanilla and mineral sensations. It's an unusual but attractive interpretation of Pinot Grigio.
Name: Vie di Romans 2012 Dessimis Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: This copper-colored wine, the result of extended contact between the just-pressed juice and the grape skins, opens with pretty aromas of wildflower, stone fruit and an herbal note. The savory palate delivers juicy apple, peach, pink grapefruit and a mineral accent alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Attems 2013 Ramato Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Fermented in oak barrels, this has aromas that recall white flower, toasted oak, baked pear and dried apricot. The palate offers butterscotch and mature Golden Delicious apple alongside fresh acidity. Toasted hazelnut signals the finish.
Name: Lis Neris 2012 Gris Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and creamy, this spent time in 80% neutral oak, which smoothed out the flavors. Pear and banana fruit flavors are textural and wrapped in lemony acidity. The creaminess is impressive.
Name: Keeler 2013 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Delicate aromas of white spring blossom, Bartlett pear and white peach lead the nose. The vibrant, refined palate delivers tart green apple, lemon zest and a mineral note alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Borgo San Daniele 2013 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Here's a poised, refreshing white that opens with enticing aromas of spring blossom and stone fruit. The luminous palate offers fresh peach, Granny Smith apple and nectarine alongside crisp acidity. A hint of Alpine herb enhances the clean finish.
Name: Bottega Vinaia 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Fragrances suggest ripe apple, Bartlett pear and a whiff of alpine wildflower. The medium-bodied, linear palate offers tart Granny Smith apple and juicy citrus alongside crisp acidity that gives it a bright, clean finish.
Name: Kettmeir 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Grown in steeply terraced mountain vineyards, this crisp, bright wine has aromas of white spring flowers, chamomile and ripe pear. The refreshing palate offers juicy green apple, citrus and a hint of mineral alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Cliffhanger 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tasted shortly after bottling, this needed some airing to blow off the sulfur. Once open it showed itself to be a palate-pleasing, round and spicy wine, elaborating its pear fruit with notes of orange peel and Meyer lemon.
Name: Hawkins Cellars 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Round and fruity, this is drinking at its peak. Pear and apple flavors carry lighter notes of cinnamon, with a caramel-apple finish.
Name: Keeler 2012 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Actress Drew Barrymore's project with Carmel Road shows aromas of sliced golden and red apples, wet cement and freshly cut grass. It's slightly salty on the palate with a tremendous amount of apple cider-like zing that runs through the whole sipping experience, showing both the floral and bitter flavors of ruby-red grapefruit pith.
Name: Barrymore 2013 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

Description: Aromas of peach blossom and mature Bartlett pear lead the nose on this pretty wine. The crisp palate offers green apple and juicy nectarine alongside bright acidity.
Name: La Cappuccina 2013 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Pretty aromas of white spring blossoms and Bartlett pear lead the nose on this bright, easy-drinking white. The lively palate offers tart green-apple and light mineral notes alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Mezzacorona 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A straightforward, fruit-driven effort, this brings fruit flavors of pear flesh and skin, with a lightly peppery kick. Still young and settling down, this nicely balanced wine is a good spring and summer go-to bottle for picnics and barbecues.
Name: Torii Mor 2014 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Aromas of banana, wisteria and green pear lead the nose on this refreshing white. The bright, juicy palate offers tart Granny Smith apple and citrus zest alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Cembra 2013 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright and savory, this opens with pretty aromas of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The vibrant palate offers crisp green apple and white peach set in a framework of zesty acidity. Sip as a refreshing apéritif or pair it with light first courses.
Name: Alta Luna 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Made in a crisp, zesty style, this vibrant white delivers tart green apple, Bartlett pear and lemon zest. Bright acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Tenuta Luisa 2013 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Aromas of white spring blossom and pear lead the nose on this bright, straightforward Pinot Grigio. The palate offers tart green apple and citrus alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Elena Walch 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, pear and honeysuckle jump out of the glass. The straightforward palate delivers tart green apple, white peach and a touch of citrus alongside bright acidity.
Name: Tenuta Cà Bolani 2013 Superiore Pinot Grigio (Friuli Aquileia)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Scents and flavors of pear and spun sugar highlight this fresh, forward, fruity wine. It's not overtly sweet, but there is enough residual sugar to be perceptible, and to round out the mouthfeel. It's a pleasantly fruity wine for immediate enjoyment.
Name: Bryx 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of beeswax, acacia and honeysuckle lead the nose. The palate offers honey, mature yellow apple and citrus alongside racy acidity.
Name: Masut da Rive 2013 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

Description: Honeysuckle, citrus and a hint of medicinal herb lead the nose. The palate offers citrus, green apple and a confectionary note alongside zesty acidity. A bitter note that recalls an adhesive bandage mars the finish.
Name: Attems 2013 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Aromas of exotic fruit and fragrant white flower lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers tart green apple and juicy citrus alongside lively acidity.
Name: Cantina di Bertiolo 2014 Villa Marchesi Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Description: Aromas of green apple, white flower and citrus lead the nose. The lively, straightforward palate offers pineapple and lemon zest alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Antonutti 2013 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Description: This refreshing Pinot Grigio opens with delicate aromas of white spring flower and pear. The easygoing palate offers green apple and lemon-lime alongside zesty acidity.
Name: La Vis 2013 Simboli Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: This bright Pinot Grigio delivers juicy pineapple and citrus sensations. It's simple and fresh with zesty acidity.
Name: Pighin 2013 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This small-production, estate-grown wine needs more time in bottle to lose some of the beery yeastiness it currently shows. Along with those strong flavors are lighter threads of yellow apple and grapefruit rind.
Name: La Chouette 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This easygoing wine offers aromas of white spring flower and Bartlett pear. The vibrant palate displays crisp green apple, citrus, and a hint of bitter hazelnut alongside racy acidity.
Name: Tenuta Fernanda Cappello 2013 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Description: Bright and easygoing, this offers aromas of orange blossom, citrus and apple that carry through to the fresh palate. It's simple but well made and refreshing.
Name: Esperto 2013 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas on this good-deal wine are simultaneously sharp and soft. Creamy citrus with honeydew melon, honey and white flowers are cut by lime sorbet, kiwi and pear cider. There's a pungent, yogurt-like character on the palate, with flavors of yellow grapefruit rind and a peppery bite.
Name: Coastline 2013 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Light and yeasty, this thin wine has delicate hints of lime and grapefruit. The finish offers a slightly bitter citrus-rind character and some heat.
Name: Reustle 2013 Cana Bloc Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Simple and refreshing, this opens with a light floral fragrance and a whiff of pear. The easy palate offers tart green apple and a citrus note alongside bright acidity.
Name: Cabert 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Description: Aromas of Granny Smith apple, pear and a hint of citrus lead the nose and carry over to the palate. This wine is simple, straightforward and refreshing.
Importer: New England Wine and Spirits Inc
Name: Il Cavaliere 2013 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This all-stainless, low-alcohol effort seems to have a waxy shell around it. Scents and flavors of lemon-oil polish prevail, and it falls flat in the mouth, with little life to the flavors and a hint of bitterness as it finishes.
Name: Girardet 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This informal Pinot Grigio offers light sensations of tart green apple and citrus. It's refreshing, with brisk acidity.
Name: Piera Martellozzo 2013 Terre Magre Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Description: This easygoing, simple wine opens with subdued aromas of white flower and a whiff of orchard fruit. The informal palate offers unripe green apple and a bit of lemon-lime alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Morene Bianche 2013 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The tawny color and slightly oxidized aromas suggest that this is a wine to be consumed as soon as possible. Though the alcohol is listed at a modest 12%, the fruit seems ripe enough. This was a difficult, wet vintage, and there are hints of spoilage in the finish.
Name: Lundeen 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely pungent on the nose, this is quite restrained and balanced on the palate. Aromas of Key lime pie, lemon sorbet and tart passion fruit give way to steely flavors of lemon juice and lime peel, all encased in strong, fresh, lively and fun acidity.
Name: Tangent 2013 Paragon Vineyard Pinot Gris (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Manzonis have farmed the region for about a century, and deliver a refreshing wine in this bottling, with very tight aromas of apple juice and more rounded lemons as well. The palate is framed by a chalky grit, with flavors of light honey, lemon juice and more apple, hovering towards the more tart and bitter range of the grape.
Name: Manzoni 2013 North Highlands Cuvee Pinot Gris (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A substantive wine, this is on the richer and more full-bodied side for a white. With floral, honeyed aromas and tasty, spicy apple skin and cinnamon flavors, it coats the palate with generous flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Navarro 2013 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This takes a rich, complex approach, with spicy, honey-like and almost meaty aromas, ripe Bosc pear and almond flavors and a hefty texture. Medium to full bodied, it has some crisp acidity in the background and a sense of luxuriousness to drinking it.
Name: Balo 2013 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though only making wine since 2007, the Blair family estate goes back nearly a century. This wine shows aromas of grilled lemon peels and squeezed pears, and then delivers an interesting flavor profile that's more rich than lean. Flavors of citrus-topped brioche, yellow apples, yeast and a touch of smoke are presented atop a waxy mouthfeel.
Name: Blair 2013 Meador Estate Vineyard Pinot Gris (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 9% Pinot Blanc and 1% Riesling, this enjoyable wine brings notes of melon and red apple. It's full flavored with a rounded feel that keeps the interest high.
Name: Columbia Crest 2013 Grand Estates Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This aromatic wine features melon, red apple skin and tropical notes. It drinks a hair off dry with a broad, rich feel to the fruit flavors.
Name: Gård 2013 Lawrence Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Moderately aromatic, this suggests melon, grapefruit and pear. It drinks off dry (8g/L residual sugar) with pink-grapefruit flavors and good balance. It keeps you coming back for more.
Name: Sawtooth 2013 Pinot Gris

Description: A fairly substantial white wine, it is medium to full in body, with fresh melon aromas and vivid melon and crisp apple flavors. A plush texture gives it some breadth and length on the finish.
Name: Three Pears 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Freshness and refreshment are the strong points of this well-balanced, tangy, medium-bodied wine. It is light in fruit aroma and subtle in flavor, offering some crisp apple inspiration on the palate and finish.
Name: Three Thieves 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Light and fruity, this smells like cucumbers, honeydew melon and green apple, tastes delicately appley and feels gentle in texture. It's light bodied, low in alcohol, fresh and thirst-quenching.
Name: Francis Ford Coppola 2013 Gia Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though aged in neutral French oak, the wood shows fairly prominently, with vanilla and woodspice out in front of the lees and almond. The flavors are off dry with the variety seeming to get lost between the staves.
Name: Gård 2013 Grand Klasse Lawrence Vineyards Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Mango, papaya and vanilla aromas are lightly tropical and chunky. The palate is plump and fair. Flavors of green melon, papaya and mixed tropical fruits finish steady and with a reprise of leesy, yeasty vanilla.
Name: Argento 2013 Cool Climate Selection Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas suggest green apple and melon. This wine drinks dry with a lightly spritzy feel but the flavor concentration seems lacking.
Name: 14 Hands 2013 The Reserve Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This mild-flavored wine delivers light apple, floral, almond and maraschino-cherry flavors, a smooth, soft texture and medium body. Although subtle, it does develop more complexity in the glass.
Name: Las Positas 2013 Buttner Vineyard Pinot Gris (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine conveys aromas of pear, melon and ale. It drinks off dry with herb and apple flavors, needing more acidity and concentration to keep it all together.
Name: Willow Crest 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: A good choice when the wine needs to be a supporting player and not a star, this has neutral aromas, crisp acidity, lemon and cucumber flavors, light body and a texture that smooths out nicely.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This is a sweet, honeyed wine that's powerful and concentrated. It's full of spice, ripe tropical fruits and pleasurable sweetness. Just behind all this richness lies a great acidity that's so attractive. The wine could be drunk now, but it will be even better from 2017.
Designation: Seppi Landmann Zinnkoepflé Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2012 Seppi Landmann Zinnkoepflé Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Sélection de Grains Nobles, the ultimate in Alsace sweetness from the volcanic soil of the Rangen de Thann, is sure to create a great wine. This really young wine is going to live up to the billing with its opulent honey and mineral character spiced with rich fruits and acidity. It will need many years, so drink from 2019.
Designation: Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Clos Saint-Théobald Sélection de Grains Nobles
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2013 Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Clos Saint-Théobald Sélection de Grains Nobles Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Zind-Humbrecht owns some great Grand Cru vineyards, perhaps none more so than the Clos Saint Urbain. This luscious, rich, sweet wine shows both power and intensity without losing any sense of structure. It's young, needing many years to show off its full potential. Drink from 2018.
Designation: Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2012 Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Planted on volcanic soil, this vineyard with its steep slopes produces impressive wines. This concentrated, deeply powerful wine is structured, powered by superripe quince and lychee fruits. Complex and still maturing, the wine needs at least until 2018.
Designation: Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Clos Saint-Théobald
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2012 Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Clos Saint-Théobald  Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A high-altitude vineyard has produced this delicious, crisp and cool wine. While it has weight and rich fruit, it's the enticing acidity that sets this wine apart. There's a poise to this wine that gives style while not losing any depth of apple, pear and spice flavors. Drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2012 Rotenberg Wintzenheim Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The Wiebelsberg Grand Cru is in Andlau in the north of Alsace. Its terroir, influenced by rocks from the Vosges mountains, gives a strong minerality to this wine. It has structure, a dry heart surrounded by ripe, generous fruits. As any Grand Cru, it needs to age, so drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Gresser 2012 Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: While showing sweetness, this wine also manages to retain great freshness. It's delicious, with bright green plum fruitiness as well as weight and richness. It will be a great food wine, but wait until 2018.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2013 Seppi Landmann Zinnkoepflé Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is rich, full of spicy fruit, apricot juice and white peaches. The fruits are topped by an unctuous honey character that pushes the wine towards sweetness while keeping a fresh flavor in the background. Drink from 2017.
Name: Rieflé 2012 Steinert Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: While maturing well, this wine still promises a considerable future. It is sweet and rich, honeyed almost while allowing room for a touch of dry spice and pepper. It's a ripe wine with depth of flavor and density. Drink from 2016.
Name: Henri Ehrhart 2011 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This beautiful wine is already so balanced and ripe. Rich tropical and yellow fruits are lightly spiced and given a lift with the acidity. Along with that, it offers a more complex texture and mineral character. Drink from 2017.
Name: Boeckel 2013 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Named after the lords of Hattstatt—a word that evolved to Hatschbourg—this wine comes from selected grapes. It's a medium sweet, rich wine with a smooth structure and opulent texture. Lychees and yellow fruits are cut with lime acidity to balance ripeness and freshness. It's a wine to age, drink from 2018.
Designation: Hatschbourg Grand Cru Trésor des Seigneurs
Name: Joseph Cattin 2013 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Trésor des Seigneurs Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This wine has both great richness and a cool, stylish side. It's structured, with a strong streak of minerality as well as as spice and pepper. It has a cool, restrained feel at the moment, waiting for the time to burst out with its complex structure. Hold at least until 2017.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2012 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The heavy bottle is quite unnecessary with this impressive wine that boasts its own richness and weight. Honeyed, smooth with an opulent, rounded texture, it is also so well balanced with its acidity. This beautiful wine will still develop. Drink at its best from 2017.
Designation: Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Clos Saint-Théobald Vendanges Tardives
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2012 Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Clos Saint-Théobald Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Clos Windsbuhl in Hunawihr is the northernmost of Zind-Humbrecht's collection of vineyards. In 2012, it has produced an impressive wine that has all the right spice of Pinot Gris along with acidity and a fresh edge. That gives this rich wine a great lift, with a waft of pear to go with the yellow-fruit flavors. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2012 Clos Windsbuhl Hunawihr Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This perfumed wine is a superb expression of Oregon Pinot Gris, and the best Tikka's ever from Lemelson. Apples, oranges and ripe melons fill the fruit bowl, bright and luscious and accented with perfectly proportioned barrel notes of toasted coconut and almond.
Name: Lemelson 2013 Tikka's Run Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is an intensely spicy wine, full of lychee and peppered pineapple flavors. It's rich, also showing a strong mineral texture. Medium sweet in style, it is packed with ripe fruit with a touch of honey. The aftertaste shows a fresher side. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2012 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rich and full-bodied, this displays much of the complexity of a Grand Cru wine. It also has a strongly fruity character that bursts from the glass. Schoenenbourg is one of the vineyards surrounding the picture-book village of Riquewihr. Age the wine and drink from 2017.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2013 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Monterey Bay fog cools this vineyard at the appellation's northeastern tip. The acidity shines on this bottling, with refreshing aromas that are both ripe with honeydew melon and stark with grass and nectarine. Lime zest and yellow grapefruit spray power the nearly sour palate, making a perfect pairing for oysters and light cheese plates.
Name: Holman Ranch 2013 0.5 Brix Pinot Gris (Carmel Valley)

Description: The biodynamic Letzenberg vineyard has produced an impressive wine that's rich and full in the mouth, packed with ripe white fruits, plums and lychees. A spicy texture gives a dry edge to what is otherwise a medium-sweet wine. Drink from 2016.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2012 Letzenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This single-vineyard wine is made from biodynamically grown grapes. It's rich while still stylish and fresh. Ripe apple fruit flavors are lifted by acidity and given a twist with spice, pepper and hints of tropical fruits. Drink from 2016.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2013 Letzenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: An off-dry character sets the scene for this concentrated, already balanced wine. The Hatschbourg vineyard in the southern Alsace village of Voegtlinshoffen is composed of clay and chalk soil on a southeast-facing slope. It gives exceptional ripeness, as here, a warm and full-bodied wine with great swathes of fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2013 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Just to the west of the Grand Cru of Moenchberg, this small vineyard has produced a rich, ripe and full-bodied wine. It's surprisingly ready to drink, balanced between spice, tropical fruits and just enough acidity. Drink now, although it will also age at least until 2020.
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2013 Lerchenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The exposure of the Brand vineyard is due south, giving its wine richness and a full-bodied character. This Pinot Gris is moving towards sweet as well as rich, with yellow fruits and a smooth texture. It's now mature, a ripe, broad wine that's ready to drink.
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2008 Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The Steinert vineyard, with its dry soil, was first recorded in 1150 by the monks. This gold-colored, wonderfully ripe wine is already showing good aging potential. Tropical fruits dominate what is essentially a dry wine. It's going to develop well; drink from 2017.
Name: Rieflé 2013 Steinert Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rich and packed with spice, this full and rich wine comes from the southeast-facing Zellberg vineyard and has the full warmth of the sun in its flavors. Along with the spice, it offers light acidity and crisp sliced apples. The wine will improve with age, so wait until 2016.
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2012 Zellberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Lightly wood-aging Pinot Gris gives a whole new view of the grape. It adds wood to the natural spice in the fruit to give a cinnamon-flavored wine. The acidity and white fruits are not lost and the wine is likely to go well with food.
Name: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2012 Exception Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: It's best to decant this wine, in order to give it time to express its complexity while smoothing over the aggressive alcohol. Fermented and aged in neutral oak barrels, it tastes of lightly toasted grain, Asian pear, breakfast tea and honey. That lick of honey swirls through the center and out the lingering finish, though the wine is quite dry.
Name: River's Edge 2012 Pace Family Vineyard Pinot Gris (Elkton Oregon)

Description: Rich and opulent, this offers depth of flavor, with intense quince, yellow and tropical fruit, and a spicy, peppery background. It's a full-bodied wine to age at least until 2017.
Name: Cave de Beblenheim 2012 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Unctuous and intoxicating in dried apricot, honey and peach, this is a lovely example of the variety, which is rarely planted in Northern California, let alone on the Sonoma Coast. This shows the grape's promise, offering both crispness and creaminess on the palate and finish.
Name: Keller Estate 2012 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Here's a textbook Pinot Gris, fermented entirely in stainless steel, kept racy and crisp (no malolactic fermentation), with bright fruit flavors of fresh cut pear. It's set in a frame of well-textured acidity,  with a lick of wet stone.
Name: Thistle 2013 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: The granite soil of the Brand Grand Cru vineyard has produced a strongly structured wine that also has richness and ripe fruits. Off dry, it has a hint of honey as well as yellow fruits and pears. The aftertaste brings out the acidity and freshness that balance the wine. Drink from 2017.
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2010 Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: While it's rich, this beautiful dry wine also offers considerable freshness. Acidity cuts easily through the ripe white fruit, pear and red apples, allowing room for spice that provides a contrasting aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2013 Seppi Landmann Vallée Noble Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a fresh, immaculate wine, low in alcohol but complex with mixed fruit flavors of jicama, melon and Honeygold apples. Acids provide the right underpinning without turning sour, and the lingering finish is spot-on.
Name: Vercingetorix VX 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in color, this wine—named after the 1890s regional pioneer Adolph Siot—brings light bubblegum, cut grass, apple and slightly funky reductive aromas. It's lively and acidic on the focused palate, carrying flavors of butter, apple skin and pear skin, with just enough of the fruity flesh attached to broaden the mouthfeel.
Name: Siot 2013 Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: One of the more characterful Pinot Gris for this price, Ara's 2013 offers wet stone and apple aromas, flavors of apple, cinnamon and pear and a long, mouthwatering finish. There's a bit of creaminess on the midpalate and just a hint of dusty texture on the finish.
Name: Ara 2013 Single Estate Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: A dry style of Pinot Gris, this is crisp with some acidity. It also has weight and a solid, powerful core of spice and baked apple flavors. With its structure still developing, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2015.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Drawn from the cool Awatere Valley, this just off-dry wine features exceptional smoothness on the palate. Pear, guava, citrus and cinnamon aromas and flavors finish creamy and harmonious.
Name: Tablelands 2013 Single Vineyard Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: The granite soil of the Holder vineyard lends itself to Pinot Gris, allowing the grapes to keep freshness while adding a rich undertow. This wine is full in the mouth, medium sweet in style and generous. It will age over the short-term, so drink from 2016.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2012 Holder Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This wine is going through a muted stage, not revealing much in the way of fruit or richness. You can feel the weight on the palate, promising generosity in a few years. For the moment, judgement needs to be reserved. Drink from 2017.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2012 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This smooth, rich wine is already very drinkable. It comes from grapes selected to give extra concentration. The wine is lightly spiced, balanced with acidity and apple and peppered pear flavors.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2013 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: As the name Barriques suggests, this wine is lightly aged in wood that adds toast to spice and gives a buttery, ripe texture. The wine is fresh, rounded with a pepper character that comes through strongly at the end. Drink now, but better from 2016.
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2012 Barriques Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Fragrant and rich, but also with acidity and a tight, nervy texture, this concentrated wine has good potential. A single-vineyard wine, it contrasts richness and spice with a fresher character. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Ehrhart 2013 Domaine Saint-Rémy Im Berg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This cool wine features considerable freshness cutting the fragrant fruits. The single-vineyard site of Hohrain is next door to Pfersigberg Grand Cru. The wine is still young and showing textured mineral character. It needs several years to bring out its depth of flavor. Drink from 2017.
Name: Emile Beyer 2012 Lieu dit Hohrain Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This ripe and fruity wine is rich and full in the mouth. It's balanced in acidity and packed with layers of yellow fruits, quince and pears. It will still develop, bringing out a fuller character. Drink from late 2015.
Name: Henri Ehrhart 2013 Réserve Particulière Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This strongly perfumed single-vineyard wine comes from chalky soil. It is crisp, as is the Rieflé style, although the bright apricot and pear fruits have a spicy edge. It could be drunk now in its fresh state, although it will be better from 2016.
Name: Rieflé 2013 Côte de Rouffach Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a sweet wine, rich in spice and lychees. It has a ripe tropical feel while managing to retain freshness. Fragrant and perfumed, it will develop over the medium term. Drink from 2016.
Name: Cave de Hunawihr 2013 Rosacker Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Well-defined, crisp and lightly peppery, this estate-grown Pinot Gris carries no hint of oak aging. Tart apple and pear fruit have just the right bite to sail into a sharp and satisfying finish.
Name: Jovino 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tight and bright, this tasty wine hits the mineral button under tangy lemon flesh and rind. The tart fruit is refreshing, clear and clean through a driving finish.
Name: Wine by Joe 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is a dry Pinot Gris, very mineral in character, with crisp acidity balanced by fragrant pear and quince topped with spice. It's a crisp wine, lighter than usual for this cuvée and fresher at the end.
Name: Domaine Zinck 2012 Terroir Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bright fruit flavors of pear and tangerine light up the palate, set against tangy acids. A versatile, fresh and quite tasty young white wine, it's best enjoyed right now.
Name: Wildewood 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Creamy and fresh, this mineral-driven effort spent no time in barrel, and did not go through malolactic fermentation. The pear and apple fruit is quite clean and lightly minty.
Name: Benton-Lane 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This single-vineyard wine is ripe and rich, with structure and plenty of dense fruitiness. Pears and a touch of lychee give a round texture that is smooth and soft. It's ready to drink, although it will develop well through 2017–2018.
Name: Paul Blanck 2012 Patergarten Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The fruity, fresh aroma continues into the palate. Ripe yellow fruits are spiced and then cut with pear acidity and freshness. It's already balanced, although it will be even better from 2016.
Name: Emile Beyer 2013 L'Hostellerie Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: For an “aromatic” variety, Pinot Gris isn't typically all that aromatic. This one is no exception, offering up just hints of citrus pith on the nose. Yet the flavors are bold and fruit-driven, emphasizing pear, melon and citrus. It's broad in the mouth and off-dry on the finish. Fine to sip by itself, or with Asian cuisine.
Name: Astrolabe 2013 Province Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This bone-dry wine has a soft, ripe touch. It is crisp at the start and at the end, with attractive fresh sliced apple and pineapple fruit flavors. It can be drunk now.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2013 Seppi Landmann Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Situated in Eguisheim, the Emile Beyer winery is based in a former inn, hence the name L'Hostellerie. This wine is rich and very spicy, with a good cut of acidity. Yellow fruits are balanced with citrus to give a ripe, full-bodied wine. Drink now.
Name: Emile Beyer 2012 L'Hostellerie Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Crisp and fruity, this bright and fruity wine has attractive acidity as well as spice and a lightly tangy texture. It's still very fresh and needs time to deepen and become richer. Drink from 2016.
Name: Emile Beyer 2013 Lieu dit Hohrain Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fresh and approachable, this is a light, flowery expression of the variety, sourced from the Russian River no less, that's dry and flavored in fennel, apricot and apple. Medium in terms of weight and body, it finishes refreshingly.
Name: Terlato 2013 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)

Description: The Pfleck vineyard with its clay and limestone soil gives a rich style of Pinot Gris. This wine, with its intense spice and lychee flavors, is typical. It has a crisp edge but the ripe fruitiness and touch of pepper give weight and richness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2012 Pfleck Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Smooth-drinking, this offers soft, mellow flavors of melon and pear. Light but persistent, it's a clean, fresh and appealing selection, best enjoyed now.
Name: Firesteed 2013 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This is a soft, slightly sweet rendering of Pinot Gris, loaded with succulent pear, pineapple and melon fruit. Chill it well and sip it by the pool this summer.
Name: Omaka Springs 2013 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Creamy and fresh, this is made from estate-grown grapes, fermented in a mix of stainless steel and neutral barrels. The fruit flavors blend jicama, melon and pear, with a touch of sweetness. It finishes with a hint of honeysuckle.
Name: Stanton Vineyard 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Crisp and cool in character, this is a bright, fruity wine. Natural spice flavors partner with lime and apple flavors to give a fresh character. It is ready to drink, but will be better from 2016.
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Grown on chalky soil (calcaire), this is a finely balanced, ripe while also elegant wine. It has attractive acidity, a crisp edge and refreshing acidity that provides a fine foil to the more spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2012 Calcaire Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A sweeter style of Pinot Gris gives this wine its round and smooth character. There is spice along with rich tropical fruits and a light hint of acidity. It's a wine to drink now.
Name: Domaine du Manoir 2012 Clos du Lentzenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This dry style of Pinot Gris brings out a strong acidity as well as ripe fruitiness. The wine is structured, tangy with surprising amounts of lemon as well as pear flavors. It is still too young and needs time. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Léon Boesch 2013 Le Coq Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Always producing wines that are dry, Léon Beyer has kept the natural spicy exuberance of Pinot Gris while producing an elegant, crisp wine packed with acidity and just a touch of pepper and spice. Drink now.
Name: Leon Beyer 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This crisp wine has plenty of acidity as well as fruit. It is young to taste, still showing its fresh side that should round out over the next few years. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Allimant-Laugner 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This big, ripe wine is opulent and smooth. With layers of rich lychee and mango fruit flavors, along with spiced pears, this is a delicious, ready-to-drink wine. It's generous to a fault, a great wine to drink with pâtés and spiced food.
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2012 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tart and snappy, the flavors of lime flesh and rind dominate. Some green pineapple pokes through, with crisp acidity underscoring the flavors. The wine was all stainless-steel fermented.
Name: Rainstorm 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is pretty characterful stuff, starting off with slightly wooly, feral aromas accenting more mainstream grapefruit and pear notes. It's not heavy, but comes across as broad on the palate, which also reveals hints of melon and peppery spice.
Name: Mud House 2013 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This has great depth of flavor with its fresh apple and pear fruits and touch of spice. It's off dry while balanced with acidity and a crisp texture. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2012 Les Natures Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Just off dry, this attractive wine has good balance between acidity and fresh white fruits. A hint of spice is all that's needed to add complexity and a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Martin Schaetzel 2012 Cuvée Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This off-dry wine presents a great balance between the spicy flavors and the tropical fruits. It's a lightly textured wine, already accessible, with a touch of pepper at the end along with just enough acidity.
Name: Domaine Jean-Luc Mader 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Soft and diffuse, this offers light flavors of pear with a hint of spice. Done entirely in stainless steel, it's a good, all-purpose white.
Name: Oak Knoll 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Well on the way to sweet, this soft, spicy wine has light acidity and a gentle feel, with just a tangy, mineral edge to suggest some potential. Drink now.
Name: Wunsch & Mann 2012 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: With good acidity, this is a crisp, dry style of Pinot Gris. Plenty of spice and tropical fruits give richness to this fresh wine.
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2013 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Now fully developed, this rich wine boasts spice and generous lychee and mango fruits. Its acidity is light, a reflection of the wine's ripe texture. It's totally ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Jean-Luc Mader 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Round and sweet, this offers apricots, white peaches and a touch of honey. To counter the sweetness, a drier spice core turns it from an apéritif to a food wine. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A new brand produced by the Sparr family, Baumann's fruit comes from Riquewihr. This easy Pinot Gris is soft and medium sweet, with attractive hints of spice and minerality. It's a ripe wine, finished with acidity. Drink now.
Name: Baumann 2013 ClassiQ Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This off-dry wine is highly perfumed and spicy, with enough acidity to balance the bergamot and candy flavor. Attractive depth of flavor gives the wine richness and a full body. Drink from 2016.
Name: Boeckel 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Tight, textured and crisp, this shows the freshness of the 2013 vintage while missing some of the natural spice of Pinot Gris. It's all about sliced green apples lightly brushed with pepper, with crisp acidity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2013 Les Natures Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is an attractively perfumed wine. It has light lychee flavors as well as a tight, dry acacia honey character in the background. The wine is still young with some bitterness from the recent bottling, and should be drunk from 2016.
Name: Domaine Specht 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This soft wine is full of yellow fruits and spiced lemon, with a light, tangy texture. It's rich while having a crisper side. Drink in fall 2016.
Name: Emile Beyer 2013 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Fresh and fruity with attractive berry flavors, this is a soft, medium-dry wine. Light, it makes a fine apéritif wine with its crisp edge and finishing acidity. Drink now.
Name: Wunsch & Mann 2012 Reine Clotilde Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This soft, medium-dry wine has attractive spice and fresh yellow-fruit flavors. It is bright, feeling light with its poised acidity and crisp aftertaste.
Name: Robert Karcher et Fils 2013 Harth Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is labeled as dry, which sums up this crisp and fruity wine. Delicious, refreshing acidity is gently spiced and layered with green apples and quince flavors. It's ready to drink.
Name: Rieflé 2013 Bonheur Convivial Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is an attractive, ripe style of Pinot Gris. Off dry, it is aromatic, lightly spicy over crisper pear and yellow fruit flavors. It's ready to drink.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This perfumed wine is very aromatic and crisp. It's still young, not yet fully integrating the acidity, spiced fruits and mineral texture. Wait until 2016.
Name: Paul Blanck 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This medium-sweet wine is crisp and fruity. Lemon and pineapple are given an edge of spice while preserving total freshness. The wine is light, bright and ready to drink.
Name: Wolfberger 2013 Signature Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The dry character of this wine is emphasized by fresh acidity that cuts right through. The result is an apple-crisp wine that is pure fruitiness without much of the Pinot Gris richness.
Name: Cave de Hunawihr 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: While the alcohol says rich, the wine is in fact fresh and fruity. It's medium dry, although with a drier character from the spice and smokiness. It's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2013 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Limestone vineyards around Eguisheim give this wine its crisp, mineral character. It's fruity while on the dry side, dominated by apple and spiced pear cut with youthful fresh acidity. It will be ready to drink soon; wait for summer 2015.
Name: Domaine Zinck 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a rich, full in the mouth wine. It has some crisp citrus acidity although the main flavors are of ripe lychees and pineapple that are both tinged with spice. It's ready to drink.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2013 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a soft, medium-dry wine, layered with fresh fruits, touches of tropical flavors and good acidity, a reflection of the vintage. It's a bright wine, lightly textured and ready to drink from the end of 2015.
Name: Willm 2013 Cuvée Emile Willm Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This rounded wine has spice, lychee and pineapple flavors. It is light, bright and fruity with a pepper aftertaste, and is ready to drink.
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This soft, fruity, light wine has great white fruits and a cut of attractive acidity. It's crisp, spiced with nutmeg and given freshness by the sliced green apple.
Name: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2013 Anne de K Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: On the sweet side, this light and fresh wine hails from a single vineyard. It has spice and attractive apple acidity, plus a crisp side at the end. This is a bright wine to drink now.
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2013 Pfleck Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Made from organic grapes, this is a lightly spicy wine with balanced acidity. It has fresh apricots, grated nutmeg and a crisp, tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2013 Cuvée de l'Ours Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This spicy, apple-fresh wine has spice, crisp acidity and great fruitiness. It's a perfect apéritif style with its lightness and freshness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Loew 2013 Cormier Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This medium-dry wine offers a drier core of spice and pepper. Around this, yellow fruits and creamed pears come to the fore. The wine is ready to drink now, although it will be worth waiting until 2016.
Name: Charles Sparr 2013 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Towards the dry end of the Pinot Gris spectrum, this is a crisp, apple and pear flavored wine that has a light character. It's fruity, crisp and ready to drink.
Name: Cave de Beblenheim 2013 Réserve Particulière Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Produced from a number of parcels around the village of Katzenthal, this is a fresh and fruity wine, easy to drink. It's bright with acidity, flavored with ripe quince and apple fruits. It's ready to drink.
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2013 Cuvée Particulière Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This wine is soft, rounded and smooth. With just enough acidity to give a fresh character, it is ripe with pear and quince flavors. It's ready to drink, light and fragrant.
Name: Cave de Cleebourg 2013 Prestige Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This attractive medium sweet wine has fresh acidity to balance the soft texture. It's an easy-to-drink wine that's ready now.
Name: Willm 2013 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This soft, rounded wine has gentle ripe fruit flavors while missing out on acidity. It's medium sweet, warm with spice and a rich, full-bodied aftertaste. Drink now.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Light and fruity, this is an attractive off-dry wine. It has a delicate spice character along with yellow fruits that are seasoned with pepper and acidity. Drink now.
Name: Kuehn 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Almost floral glints appear between citrus zest and green pear. This aromatic charm continues on the palate, which is slender and compact but buffered with yeasty generosity. This is immensely enjoyable and extremely balanced.
Name: Wohlmuth 2013 Gola Privat Pinot Gris (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas of this wine from a vineyard in the Corralitos area somehow reflect its orange color (perhaps due to three weeks of skin contact), with orange rose petals and iced rooibos tea, yet with a steely minerality more common in pale white wines. The palate shows pickled plums and stewed stone fruits against a gunmetal backdrop and citrus peel bite. It's unique and very tasty.
Name: Beauregard 2012 Regan Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a very fleshy fruit smell on this wine from west of Paso Robles, with Meyer lemon and barely ripe melon aromas. The palate is nicely wide and ripe, with flavors of lemon-sprayed nectarines but also with elements of honey butter and honeysuckle that are reminiscent of oak.
Name: Derby 2012 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: A lush fruit bowl of a wine, this brings delicious flavors of melon, peach, apple and pear, along with a buttery finish. There are some pleasing spicy highlights, and a residual smack of butterscotch invites the next sip.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2013 Pinot Gris (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas on this wine by Bryan Babcock find an intriguing balance between ripe nectarine flesh and tart stonefruit skins. It's a bit more lush in style than other Pinot Gris of the vintage, quite broad on the palate, with apple-pear flavors, lingering lemon skin bitterness and an acidity that soaks into the tongue.
Name: Babcock 2013 Naughty Little Hillsides Estate Pinot Gris (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: A rather closed nose and tightly-wound aromatics suggest that this will take time to reach its peak. The concentration is there, as is the midpalate weight, hints of smokiness and a tropical aftertaste of pineapple. Try this as of 2016.
Name: Steindorfer 2013 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The wine is quiet at first, but with patience, some red apple and pear skin shine through. The flavors surround yellow fruits, between citrus and melon, presented with a bright, nearly biting acidity.
Name: Avelina 2012 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though not labeled as such, this is a single-vineyard offering from Pontin del Roza Vineyard. It brings notes of apple and apricot, drinking dry with a quite elegant yet flavorful styling.
