Name: Wind Rose 2013 Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Description: This pleasant fruit cocktail of a wine smells like pears and peaches and tastes equally fruity, ripe and smooth. It's medium bodied and soft in texture, yet fresh and clean on the finish.
Name: Gnarly Head 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: It tastes lean and refreshing, with light lemon and green apple in the aroma and flavors, rather light body and a slightly tangy finish. It makes a nice change from the often too-heavy or too-sweet whites in this price range.
Name: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Sweetness, softness and a little carbonation make this drink more like a Moscato. It would make a good dessert wine or accompaniment to cheese, and will be especially good for your non wine-geek friends. Light in alcohol, too.
Name: Sequin 2013 Delicately Bubbled Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: A balanced and lilting 100% varietal white that touched no oak, it's sublime in white peach and garden herb notes, with memorable minerality on the finish. Crisp and refreshing, it's ideal for picnics, beach outings and pairing with light fare.
Name: Hendry 2013 Hendry Vineyard Pinot Gris (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The lovely wines from this pioneering estate, now in the capable hands of second-generation winemaker Jason Lett, are generally priced well below any comparable efforts. Here the texture and minerality evoke surpassing elegance. Lime, grapefruit, a bite of pineapple all come into play, with the depth and balance that suggests several years of life ahead.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2013 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: This is a lush and fragrant wine, instantly appealing with aromas of orange blossom and sweet pear. Quite dry and concentrated, it brings further flavors of citrus, grapefruit and lemon rind as it plays out in a lingering, refreshing finish.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2013 Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Description: King Estate makes several different versions of Pinot Gris, but this belongs at the very top, with pitch-perfect pear fruit at its core. Fresh, textural and brightly racy, it's an elegant and generous wine with a crisp, lingering finish that suggests it will continue to improve through 2020.
Name: King Estate 2013 Unity Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Stylish and complex, with its fleshy pear fruit set in a frame of bracing minerality, this is a wine of lucid clarity. It conveys the depth of looking into a deep, transparent mountain spring, with that same tongue-tickling minerality.
Name: King Estate 2013 Domaine Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tart pineapple fruit, with a lipsmacking lick of lemon meringue pie, a hint of candied orange peel and a slice of apricot all work together in this juicy and complex wine. The concentration is impressive, and the balance keeps it interesting all the way through a long finish.
Name: David Hill 2013 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Good grip and focus are the hallmarks here, showcasing pinpoint fruit flavors of orange, apple and pear. Precision crafting and immaculate acidity contribute to a lingering, refreshing finish, with a gently-rendered phenolic bite.
Name: Winter's Hill 2013 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Fresh and bursting with youthful brightness, this five-vineyard blend mixes apple, pear and golden raisins with a pleasing accent of clover and honey. Everything is in proportion, and the wine has a well-defined, sculpted mouthfeel.
Name: King Estate 2013 Backbone Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely floral fragrances lead into an elegant wine with racy acidity. The clover impression continues on the palate, along with apple skin and white peaches. The residual sugar (10 g/L) is barely noticeable.
Name: Chehalem 2013 Three Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Roughly half the fruit is estate grown. Lush, potent aromatics introduce an impressively concentrated wine, abundant in fresh pear flavor. An orange liqueur highlight adds a sharp, well-defined note to the finish. This wine should develop nicely through 2018 or 2020.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2013 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: White pepper and matchstick come to the fore aromatically in this crisp white that's fuller bodied on the palate than one would expect given the aromatics. Apple and pear give a complex, autumnal fruit presence that leads up to a ripe, creamy finish.
Name: Buena Vista 2013 The Count's Selection Pinot Gris (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and forward, this offers a pleasing mix of lime, grapefruit and pear, lightly spiced. It's a tight, sleek wine, with good supporting acidity and a refreshing mineral streak.
Name: Carabella 2013 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Floral scents, lemon zest, orange and pineapple swirl together, leading into a fruit-powered palate which reaches across the citrus spectrum and into papaya. Flavors are penetrating and the finish tight, so give it extra time to breathe.
Name: Apolloni 2013 L Cuvée Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The longtime Alsatian-focused producer —circa 1983—delivers a wine with aromas of lemon peel, pear juice, lime zest and yellow cake. The palate shows orange blossom sorbet and a lemon zest that lingers from sip to finish.
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2013 Pinot Gris (Central Coast)

Description: Fleshy and fruity, with upfront flavors of orange and pear, this tasty effort is ready for immediate enjoyment. Whiffs of Graham cracker and cinnamon spice add interest through the finish.
Name: Firesteed 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This well-made wine shows an interesting mix of cucumber, lime, pineapple and apple flavors, underscored by racy, mineral-drenched acidity. It's bone dry, textural and refreshing. It's fun to find a low-alcohol, bone-dry Oregon Pinot Gris that fits the region's seafood so well.
Name: Cória 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Whiffs of caramelized sugar and grilled peaches lend a ripe, fruity tone to this otherwise, brash, lean wine. Refreshing on the palate, it's zesty and spry, concluding with a steely, mineral tone.
Name: Binz 2013 Nackenheimer Kabinett Trocken Pinot Gris (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This well-made, attractively priced wine delivers on the light floral characteristics of the variety. A liveliness to the palate makes it seem slightly spritzy, in a good way. Melon, mango and citrus dominate.
Name: Courtney Benham 2013 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ever so slightly pink in color, this intriguing wine begins with aromas of pear cider and sourdough yeast, pulling the nose in for more. It's all nectarine and baking soda once sipped, making for a playful tension between fruit and minerality.
Name: Villa San Juliette 2013 Reserve Pinot Gris (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: As is sometimes the case with screwcapped wines, this wine has a sharp aroma of sulfur when first opened. Let it blow off and you'll find a rather elegant white, with lightly sweet pear fruit, a hint of toast and excellent balance.
Name: Klee 2013 Dampier Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bone-dry and high in alcohol, this wine somewhat cloaks the heat in firm acidity. Fruit flavors favor melon and pear, lightly spiced. You may wish to drink it chilled to up the tang and smooth out the finish.
Name: Chehalem 2012 Ridgecrest Vineyards Pinot Gris (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this is a stainless-steel fermented and aged white. High in acidity, it offers a creaminess to the palate. Flavors of fennel and melon end briefly and satisfyingly.
Name: Madonna Estate 2013 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Carneros-Napa Valley)

Description: Smoky, brambly notes persist from nose to finish on this dry, intensely savory Pinot Gris. Fresh lemon and apple flavors on the palate are concentrated, but finish on a green, vegetal tone.
Name: Blümel 2013 Kirchberg Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: Perfectly serviceable, yet simple and plain, this straightforward wine has crisp apple and pear fruit, with a finish that turns slightly bitter.
Name: Erath 2013 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Full and creamy, this is sizable on the palate with swathes of stone fruit and peaches followed by fig.
Name: Benessere 2013 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This starts to fall flat even as it hits the mouth. It's got some puckery citrus and apple fruit, then rolls into a thin finish. The aftertaste shows some slightly bitter skin flavors.
Name: Oak Knoll 2013 Sheppard Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: It's very clean and fresh in aroma, cool and clear in flavor and soft in texture. Vaguely pearlike aromas lead to more vivid and interesting canteloupe flavors on the finish.
Name: Bota Box 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Salty on the nose, this tropically rich and ripe wine has woody, herbal undertones.
Name: Muscardini 2012 Sole del Mattino Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very yeasty aromas of baking croissant and cooking omelette—more sparkling wine-like than still—emerge on this wine. The flavors suggest a strong pear cider, with more eggs, yeast and baked croutons.
Name: Redwood Ridge Estate 2013 Estate Pinot Grigio (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Grassy aromatically, this is a crisp, refreshing white that's slightly undefined in pear and melon. Light bodied and easy to quaff.
Name: Cline 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: This is blockbuster Pinot Gris, a big wine in all senses. It has weight, superrich fruit and wonderful spice. While it's superficially opulent, it also has great depth, bringing out the terroir of the Spiegel vineyard and allowing the flashy spice to become more sophisticated as it the wine ages. Drink now for its immediate attraction, but really wait until 2018.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2010 Spiegel Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This has a brighter yellow color than most of its peers, more body, riper fruit flavors and—unusual for this variety in America—probably some oak influence. Rather full bodied, but well-balanced and very smooth, it combines peach and pear flavors with a hefty mouthfeel.
Name: FEL 2013 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: A rich and medium sweet wine, full of spice, lychees and ripe fruits. There is a tangy texture, a strong sense of minerality as well as herb, yellow fruits and nutmeg flavors. It is still young and needs time. Drink from 2017.
Name: Boeckel 2012 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of orange blossom and lemon rind lend vibrancy to this rich, luxuriously textured Pinot Gris. Just off dry in style, it bursts with flavors of white peach showered in grapefruit acidity. Luscious and irresistibly clingy, it lingers long on the palate.
Name: Lakewood 2013 Gigliotti Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Fresh, crisp and uncomplicated, this offers aromas of honey and sliced peaches, with a lively texture and good balance. Medium-bodied, it makes a great wine for a picnic, before dinner or with seafood.
Name: Toulouse 2013 Helluva Vineyard Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: Intensely perfumed, this wine is also structured and fresh. Combining these elements gives a dense wine, firmly textured and with a dry core. Acidity gives the natural richness lift. It's meant for aging, drink from 2017.
Designation: Anne de K Schlossberg Grand Cru
Name: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2012 Anne de K Schlossberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A savory, mineral aspect makes this dry wine especially interesting. It has slightly herbal aromas, white peach flavors, rather full body that adds lushness, and a lingering finish.
Designation: McFadden Farm Made From Organically Grown Grapes
Name: Horse & Plow 2013 McFadden Farm Made From Organically Grown Grapes Pinot Gris (Mendocino)

Description: Smooth and spicy, this is a rich wine, not quite dry and full-bodied. It is right up front with its white fruits, nutmeg and lychee. The acidity just creeps in at the end. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Loew 2012 Bruderbach Le Menhir Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe and full, it offers great spice, yellow fruits and hints of tropical fruits. It has acidity and is dry, but it's delicious because of its rounded texture and generous body. Drink from 2015.
Name: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2012 Le Berger Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatically appealing wine with notes of star fruit, pear, citrus and mineral. It drinks just a hair off dry, with rich fruit flavors and a lingering finish that keep you coming back for more.
Name: Ross Andrew 2013 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Floral aromas of freesia and jasmine are dominant on the nose, while the fruit-driven palate shows flavors of green apple, Bartlett pear and white stone fruit.
Name: Cramele Halewood 2013 La Umbra Pinot Grigio (Colinele Dobrogei)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Orange blossoms perfume this voluptuous yet elegantly structured Pinot Gris. It's lush and ripe in white peach and pineapple flavors, but jolted by a stream of tart lemony acidity. Finishes moderately long.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2013 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Juicy pineapple, mango and citrus notes lend a tropical feel to this penetrating, yet light bodied, Pinot Gris. Off dry in style, it's dancingly light on its feet, with a revitalizing shower of acidity that lingers through the finish.
Name: Atwater 2013 White Birch Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Bready and yeasty, the wine is already moving past its fruity stage into a mature, character. Toast and butter flavors give a rich character, bringing out the spice and pepper. The wine could develop, but it probably needs drinking now.
Name: Domaine Loew 2011 Bruderbach Le Menhir Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Brisk nectarine and just a touch of apple frame the nose, and warmer, expressive flavors of peach make for a perfect poolside beverage.
Name: La Crema 2013 Pinot Gris (Monterey)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While the nose is restrained, hinting at aromas of pressed apple and pear, the palate is luscious and concentrated, boasting sunny pineapple and tangerine flavors. Off dry in style, this balanced wine boasts lemon-lime acidity and a refreshing mineral finish.
Name: Atwater 2013 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Old vines give some extra concentration and allow ripe spice to show strongly. It makes for a rich wine that is packed with lychee and mangos. The wine doesn't allow much room for acidity but makes up for that with a lightly dry, textured aftertaste.
Designation: Anne de K Altenbourg Old Vines
Name: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2012 Anne de K Altenbourg Old Vines Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Initially, the wine is only lightly spicy. Then, as it opens up, exotic spices play on the freshness of the palate, the pear and yellow plum fruits crispened with acidity. It's a rich wine without feeling in any way over the top.
Name: Domaine Zinck 2012 Portrait Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an aromatic offering with notes of pineapple, kiwi and pear. It drinks toward medium sweet—9 g/L residual sugar—with abundant tropical flavors that help it go down easy.
Name: Waterbrook 2013 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Light and attractively spicy, the wine is off dry, with a touch of honey, apricots and dried fruits. The texture, soft and tangy, is peppery while the acidity is already well integrated. It's an attractive, ready to drink wine.
Name: Helfrich 2011 Steinklotz Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Medium straw in color, this wine boasts aroms of lemon meringue pie and orange preserve, and a creamy palate with a balanced finish.
Name: Cramele Recas 2013 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: With vibrant aromas of green apple and lemon, this seemingly delicate Pinot Grigio turns out surprisingly brawny and bold. Apple and pear flavors are fresh on the palate, finishing moderately long with a hint of alcoholic warmth and a lingering bitter-almond note.
Name: Damiani 2013 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Description: This lightly spicy wine has soft fruitiness, a touch of pepper and ripe pear flavors. It's easy, gentle and with just enough fresh acidity. The wine is very ready to drink.
Name: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2012 Anne de K Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Straightforward but well made, this has a pretty fragrance of white spring flowers. The juicy palate offers tart Granny Smith apple and white peach alongside crisp acidity. Pair this with fresh pasta salads.
Name: Goretti 2012 Pinot Grigio (Umbria)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Dusty mineral notes pepper this dry, medium-bodied Pinot Gris, lending a savoriness to flavors of pressed apple and pear. Soft, lemony acidity brightens the midpalate, mingling with hints of oyster shell and sea breeze. Finishes briskly.
Name: Heron Hill 2013 Reserve Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Spicy and with refreshing acidity, this is a light and fruity wine for early drinking. Apricot and lychee flavors are cut by a fresher note and a soft aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Helfrich 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The wine is rich with touches of spice and open, generous apple and pear flavors. It's a warm wine, ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Hugel 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Not quite dry, this lightly perfumed wine has fresh apricot and white peach flavors. It is poised with acidity and a soft texture. Drink now.
Name: Vieil Armand 2013 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A spicy wine that is soft and light. Its texture gives a touch of acidity to the ripe lychee and apple flavors. It's a wine to drink young, fruity and easy.
Name: Wunsch & Mann 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose is weak, with just slight pear and fleeting wet rocks, and the flavors aren't powerful either: apples, pears, lime pith and barely ripe peach. It's an easy-to-drink summer wine, good with a crab louie.
Name: La Merika 2013 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

Description: Very mild but pleasant tasting, this offers virtually no aroma, light herbal flavors and a crisp-enough balance. It is almost clear in color, light in body, and brings a slight melon flavor on the finish.
Name: Double Decker 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intense notes of saffron and pollen lend spice to pretty blossom aromas on this fragrant Pinot Grigio. Flavors of pressed apples on the palate seem savory and subdued by comparison, but lemon-lime acidity brightens the finish.
Name: Seneca Shore NV Amulet Pinot Grigio (Seneca Lake)

Description: Refreshing but very reserved in flavor, this wine is clean and basic. With a watery color, neutral aromas and flavors, and medium body, the effect is unassuming.
Name: Entwine 2012 Pinot Gris (California)

Description: This almost colorless wine has a slight aroma of bananas and roses, and a very light flavor of cucumbers. It's light-bodied, soft in texture and short on the finish.
Name: Ironstone 2013 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: Here's a clean, dry, light-bodied white wine with green-apple and celery aromas and flavors that are very mild. The first sip is crisp and refreshing, and it turns softer and leaner on the finish.
Name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: It doesn't seem to be a sin for Pinot Grigio to be a simple refreshment. This pleasant, mild-mannered white wine tastes like mixed fruit cocktail, is medium- bodied and rather soft in texture.
Name: Belle Ambiance 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lush and creamy, this is loaded with seductive flavors of ripe pear, melon and sweet apple. There's a hint of whipped cream and a dash of vanilla, but not overbearing or in any way artificial. It's simply delicious.
Name: Panther Creek 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A terrific value in a benchmark Oregon Pinot Gris, this is bright and refreshing, with the palate-cleansing minerality that characterizes all of the Adelsheim white wines. Jicama and melon and pear fruits mingle seamlessly, and the wine's texture and length are impressive.
Name: Adelsheim 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a good, rich, leesy and immediately appealing wine, with great texture and a fine mix of melon, apricot and peach flavors. For the price, it's hard to find a better Pinot Gris.
Name: Redhawk 2013 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Considerably lighter than the previous vintage of Pinot Gris, this mixes cucumber, gooseberry and grapefruit flavors, with bracing acidity behind the fruit. It's a rather delicate wine, with a balanced palate of fruit flesh, skin and mineral.
Name: Sokol Blosser 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Still young and lightly spritzy, this fruity and well-rounded take on Pinot Gris seems to have more than a subtle hint of sweetness. The pretty pear and apple fruit is lightly spicy and spent four months sur lie, all stainless.
Name: Lujon 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Pinot Gris makes a Crémant that is not quite dry, with spicy intensity and delicious acidity. It's rich, with almond and buttery flavors that are followed by a crisp, fragrant aftertaste.
Name: Wolfberger NV Brut Pinot Gris (Crémant d'Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: An aromatically reserved wine with notes of apple and melon. It's medium bodied and drinks dry, losing some of its concentration in the middle.
Name: Foris 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This Pinot Gris has a lot of character. The color shows a slight suggestion of pink (it comes from a gris or semi-colored grape after all), the flavors are like white peach, the balance is fresh and crisp, and the aftertaste is tangy. It's a very versatile lunch or dinner wine.
Name: McFadden 2013 Blue Quail Organically Grown Grapes Pinot Gris (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A return to 100% varietal Pinot Gris, this is done in a vivid, leesy style, with excellent texture and depth of flavor. Clean and fresh herb, celery, jicama and melon flavors abound, just hinting at white peach at the far end of its gentle ripeness. The flavor penetration and overall crisp definition are very fine.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lightly aromatic with notes of yellow apple, pear and melon. It drinks off dry, with the sugar seeming out of place but followed by an extended finish with clarifying acidity.
Name: Tsillan 2013 Estate Pinot Grigio (Lake Chelan)

Description: Accented by notes of apple and melon, it's lightly spritzy with a textured feel and a touch of sugar.
Name: 6 Under 2013 Pinot Gris (Washington)

Description: Lots of fresh apple and tangy white peach flavor make this light-bodied wine attractive and appetizing. The flavors have great focus, the balance is bright and the alcohol is low.
Name: McManis 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With its tight focus and concentrated flavors of apple, pear and melon, this is a textbook style for Washington Pinot Gris. The fruit is immaculate, the acidity right in proportion, and there's a palate-tickling dash of cinnamon wrapped into the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2012 Grand Estates Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty, tan-blush color, this refreshing wine was fermented in stainless steel. Flavors of peach and melon are in play, and the wine has excellent definition and length, with ample acidity and modest alcohol.
Name: Milbrandt 2013 Traditions Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this light, crisp, easy-drinking wine, cool cucumber and melon flavors run into green apple, with a dash of white pepper for extra credit.
Name: 14 Hands 2013 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Forward and lightly spicy, this is a good, all-purpose white wine, with bright flavors of apple and pear. It's not a big wine in any way, but perfectly quaffable and right for a wide variety of noodle dishes.
Name: Maryhill 2013 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This makes a nice choice for your house white wine to buy by the case. Attractively rich, it seems to be all about the fruit flavor. It brings ripe pear and peach notes, an opulent texture and lingering fruity finish. It is medium-bodied, smooth and complete.
Name: Twisted 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Lots of Anjou pear and Fuji apple flavors enrich this medium-bodied and refreshing wine. It has a light straw color and open flavors of ripe fruit and citrus. The texture is very smooth, and the finish has a touch of ripe-fruit sweetness.
Name: Mirassou 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lightly spicy and quite refreshing, this is a gentle wine, with a mix of melon and white peach fruit. Simple but perfect for every day.
Name: Mercer 2013 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: This perennial Best Buy is one of the richer, more expressive styles of Pinot Grigio. It combines a ripe pear aroma and tangy apple flavors in a smooth texture that stays crisp enough to linger on the finish.
Name: Domino 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pleasant, easy drinker with notes of red apple, melon and jasmine. It's fleshy in feel with some residual sugar sweetening the finish.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2013 Destiny Ridge Vineyard Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lightly aromatic with notes of apple and pear. It's medium bodied, off dry (9g/L residual sugar) and straightforward while still providing drinking pleasure.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2013 Expedition Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sweet aromas of almond paste and stone fruit, as well as green apple, mark this wine fermented in stainless steel tanks. It has a slight effervescence and a hint of lime and Asian pear on the finish.
Name: River Road 2013 Reserve Unoaked Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Distinctive, artisanal and sourced from a spectacular site, this was fermented in oak and barrel aged. The hock bottle indicates the Alsatian style, and the wine inside is both powerful and  sturdy, with supple, generous flavors of stone fruits running into light tropicality.
Name: Aubichon Cellars 2012 Vista Hills Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This full-bodied, lightly spiced wine seduces with fresh fruit flavors of pear, apple, kiwi and melon. Polished and bracing, it finishes with a lick of wet stone.
Name: Elk Cove 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Entirely fermented in neutral puncheons, this new release shows some extra depth and roundness, with a clean, leesy and mineral underpinning. Fresh cut pear and a hint of orange peel highlight the core fruit flavors.
Name: Lange 2013 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lightly blushed, it's fresh and refreshing. Flavors of perfectly ripened pear explode from the glass, with generous fruit and a palate-pleasing sprinkle of cinnamon.
Name: Coeur de Terre 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sourced from the Hop Kiln Vineyard on Westside Road, this crisp, creamy white is seductive and balanced, a refreshing sip of white peach and almond. Aromatic in honeysuckle and orange blossom, it leaves a suggestion of exotic spice on the finish.
Name: Landmark 2013 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: There's extra richness across the palate of perfectly ripened apple, pear and melon fruit. The weight of the wine in the mouth is substantial but maintains a sense of lightness and proportion, and the finish extends out gracefully as long as you can wait for that next sip.
Name: King Estate 2013 Signature Collection Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pinot Gris from 2013 is looking very good in the Willamette, with crisp, concise, complex flavors. Here it's a mix of lemon, lime and pineapple, with refreshing minerality.
Name: Lange 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A double bonus here—a price drop and what is certainly the best vintage yet for this widely available Pinot Gris. Outstanding depth of flavor focuses on apple, pear and melon fruits. There's an appealing streak of vanilla custard, with a lush mouthfeel and plenty of detail  right on through the generous finish.
Name: Acrobat 2013 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A new label for MacMurray Ranch, this Pinot Gris is stony in fresh nectarine, pear and mango, wrapped in a creamy texture that develops fleshy flavors of fig in the glass. The fruit is sourced from both MacMurray Ranch and Gallo's cooler Russian River Valley outpost, Two Rock, near Petaluma.
Name: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2013 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: Finished (apparently) off-dry, this seems to show some residual sugar in a leesy, yeasty style. The fruit suggests pears and cotton candy, with juicy acidity supporting the sweetness. Don't look for your standard dry Pinot Gris, but what's here is generous and enjoyable.
Name: Maysara 2013 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All stainless fermented, this seems to show some residual sugar, perhaps in order to round out the austere acidity. Lemon and tangerine fruit—all with plenty of acid—are annotated with highlights of fresh cilantro. It would be a fine match for simple, white fish.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a great sunny day wine, starting with aromas of honeydew melon, ripe nectarine and lemongrass. There is a slightly peachy, bubblegum character once sipped, with lemon-lime soda in the midpalate and a flinty, gunmetal finish.
Name: Bargetto 2013 Pinot Grigio (Monterey County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is aggressively tart and herbal, but shows good density and concentration. Flavors of lemon verbena mixed with lime-ade run true and full on through an extended, focused finish.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Aged in neutral oak barrels with malolactic fermentation, this medium yellow-colored wine brings notes of wheat cereal, peach and lees. It's dry and broad in feel with tart acidity, seeming slightly advanced for its age.
Name: River's Edge 2011 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is searingly tart, with more lemon juice than pear fruit, and suggestions of unripe pineapple. On the plus side, it's bright, vivid and strongly acidic.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2013 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Young and spicy, this easy-drinking Pinot Gris still shows some bite and some bitterness, perhaps from skin contact. Give it a little more bottle age, and drink it chilled, to bring out the tart fruit and cut the phenolics.
Name: Corvallis Cellars 2013 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine shows apparent barrel aging on the nose, with vanilla bean and coconut oil alongside caramelized apricot aromas. There is a very ripe papaya and guava tropicality on the palate, with a slight finish of iodine.
Name: Still Waters 2013 Pinot Gris (Paso Robles)

Description: This young sparkler is bracingly tart, and seems to have zero dosage. Flavors are simple, fruity and fresh, and the wine works well as a base for cocktails.
Name: Kramer 2013 Celebrate Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The low alcohol suggests fruit that was minimally ripened, and the flavors seem closer to fresh greens than ripe fruit. There's a splash of gooseberry, again quite tart, and a leesy texture. Drink chilled with a fresh salad.
Name: Château Bianca 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a slightly pink hue to this wine from Lompoc's Norman Yost. The nose is bright and minerally, with strawberry, apple cider and slight watermelon aromas. There's even more going on once sipped, with pear spritzer and citrus zest playing along with gray rocks and elements both bitter and sour. It's a refreshing take on a grape that doesn't always get the rock star treatment.
Name: Flying Goat Cellars 2013 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine has unusual, penetrating, floral aromatics and a liqueur-like character. It was fermented in a mix of new and neutral French oak, and a caramel character comes in as the wine breathes open. Citrus peel and floral flavors remain through an extended finish.
Name: Gård 2012 Lawrence Vineyards Grand Klasse Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale salmon in color, it brings notes of melon and apple. The palate drinks close to bone dry with a rich feel to the generous fruit flavors, showing a bit of the warmth of the vintage on the finish.
Name: Julia's Dazzle 2013 Pinot Grigio (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite ripe and phenolic, this herbal, peppery wine seems to have had a lot of skin contact. The fruit flavors are as expected—apples and white peaches. The finish carries some bitterness.
Name: Gård 2012 Lawrence Vineyards Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Waxy white florals perfume fresh lemons and apples on this dry Pinot Grigio. It's not deeply concentrated with fruit flavor, but the rich mouthfeel is balanced nicely with streaks of zippy lime and lemon acidity.
Name: Goose Watch 2012 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The previous vintage of this sweet Pinot Gris was finished at 30 g/L residual sugar; this drops it down to half that. It's a sugary, spritzy wine that has not quite jelled the way the 2012 did, though time may help to pull it together. Right now it's just simple and sweet.
Name: Convergence Zone 2013 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Drizzle Pinot Gris (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of fresh apricots and pears meld with lavish florals on this off-dry Pinot Gris. The palate is textured and bold with flavors of pressed apple that linger on the finish.
Name: Heron Hill 2012 Reserve Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced entirely from the Benches vineyard, this screw-capped wine shows a lot of SO2 when first opened, so plan on decanting if at all possible. Once it clears up it's a leesy, fresh white wine with flavors of apples and pears, lightly dusted with cinnamon spice.
Name: Nine Hats 2013 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a soft, somewhat dilute and simple white wine. Delicate suggestions of white peach and pear carry the bulk of the flavor.
Name: Lone Birch 2013 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Scents of waxy honeycomb and crushed minerals waft from this off-dry Pinot Gris. On the palate, lush, ripe peach and melon flavors penetrate. It's unabashedly fruity and forward with a bold, heavy mouthfeel.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2012 Curry Creek Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a straightforward white wine, with clean flavors of apple and a very light hint of butterscotch. The flavors fade quickly.
Name: Girly Girl 2011 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: These “Original Vines” are in fact the oldest Pinot Gris vines in the country. They deliver exquisite details of earth and stone around a solid core of apple and Asian pear. It's bone dry, with exceptional depth.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2012 Original Vines Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a powerful wine, with intense scents of pineapple leading a lively interplay of citrus, stone, Asian pear and spices. Thrilling texture, balance and length make this a standout, even in this outstanding vintage for all Pinot Gris.
Name: Sokol Blosser 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Floral scents greet you at first, a beguiling mix of clover and apple blossom. Pineapple, tangerine and nectarine fruit flavors follow, big and full, finishing with an interesting whiff of almond.
Name: King Estate 2012 Pfeiffer Vineyards Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Succulent and leesy, it blends juice from five different sites, including the King Estate vineyard. Soaked in minerals and alive with pretty fruit flavors of citrus, pink grapefruit and Key lime, this reserve-level bottling is one of several limited offerings by the leader in Oregon Pinot Gris.
Name: King Estate 2012 Backbone Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This is a block selection from the principal estate vineyard. At first flavors of soda cracker, with a saline edge, fill the palate. Then apple, pear and melon fruit come in, with excellent concentration and refreshing acidity.
Name: King Estate 2012 Three Bees Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Along with a gorgeous blend of ripe fruits—apple, pear, and a bit of tangy pineapple—this wine carries a streak of wet stone into a full-bodied, lingering finish.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2012 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Fresh, tart pineapple and apple aromas seem touched with honey and wax on this dry, boldly structured wine. Slightly viscous in texture, it balances intensely concentrated flavors of pear and apple with swathes of fresh green herbs and a bright, sunny acidity. Powerful yet elegant.
Name: Thörle 2012 Trocken Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Rich and ripe, with some Chardonnay-like power, it's a lush mix of tropical fruit flavors—guava and banana and more. A lovely vein of caramel runs across the palate, and makes this simply irresistible.
Name: Coelho 2013 Renovação Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This leesy and creamy yet bracing wine reveals abundant melon, citrus and pear fruit flavors. Balance and finesse are on full display, as always the case in Luisa Ponzi's wines.
Name: Ponzi 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Here's a polished Pinot Grigio with character. It's loaded with creamy green apple, Bartlett pear and nectarine sensations accented with spicy notes of cinnamon and ginger that add depth. Crisp acidity generates freshness and it has a lingering finish.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Part of King Estate's ambitious Limited Edition program for Pinot Gris, this is packaged in a hock bottle with a label styled for a European look. Slightly off dry, with residual sugar just below one percent, it's lovely with honey, tea, lemon cake and ripe, semitropical fruit flavors. Great focus and balance are in play, with perfect acidity.
Name: King Estate 2011 Limited Edition Blend Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This structured Pinot Grigio shows the true potential of this popular grape. It opens with fragrances of pear, mineral, smoke and aromatic herbs. These carry over to the creamy palate, alongside juicy apple, white peach, lemon zest, pastry filling and clove. Crisp acidity keeps it fresh and balanced.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2012 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Rich but lively and dry, this wine packs a potpourri of spices and citrus fruits in its aromas and flavors, carrying them through to a lingering finish. Substantial and appetizing as an apéritif and excellent with seafood.
Name: Navarro 2012 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine has a crisp, breezy bouquet of salad greens, melon and pear. Fresh and textural, it's balanced with a lick of wet stone to wrap up.
Name: Portlandia 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Already showing good focus and pinpoint acidity, th is wine brings green berries, kiwi and lime fruit flavors to the front. The bracing acidity keeps it lively across the palate, and the extra depth of the finish rewards your attention.
Name: Lumos 2013 Temperance Hill Vineyard Julia Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Distinctive citrus and wild sage aromas and a dazzlingly crisp balance characterize this wine. Clean, bracing fruit flavors linger on the lively finish. Grown in a small organic vineyard, this brings authenticity at a very reasonable price.
Designation: Estate Grown Made With Organically Grown Grapes
Name: McFadden 2013 Estate Grown Made With Organically Grown Grapes Pinot Gris (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicious and full-bodied, it offers aromas of lemon blossom and pear. The round, savory palate delivers white peach, green apple and mineral alongside fresh acidity. An almond note signals the finish.
Name: Comelli 2012 Amplius Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: Whiffs of lemon and lime are subtly aromatic on this dry, full-bodied wine. The palate is bright and fresh with pear and apple flavors, but elevated by a penetrating sheen of minerality that lingers through the finish.
Name: Franz Keller 2012 Schwarzer Adler Pinot Gris (Baden)

Description: This vibrant Pinot Grigio opens with aromas of white flowers and white tree fruit. The round palate offers mature pear and green apple alongside bright acidity but the structure doesn't fully support the evident alcohol.
Name: Mario Schiopetto 2012 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Anderson Valley has always been a hospitable home to Pinot Gris and this 100% tank-fermented, no-malolactic-fermentation beauty is fragrant in orange blossom and honeysuckle, a tangible streak of wet stone zipping throughout. Steely, it settles into apricot and guava before ending with another bite of acidity. A perfect sipping wine, it's also ready for oysters.
Name: Philo Ridge 2012 Marguerite Vineyard Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: Streaks of wax and lanolin meld into tart pineapple and white peach notes in this dry, elegantly mineral Pinot Gris. The palate balances juicy, fresh fruit with a steely, focused acidity that's refreshing and invigorating.
Name: Oberbergen 2012 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Baden)

Description: Fragrant white lilies and stone fruit perfume this bold, big-bodied wine. Dry in style, with lush white peach and pear flavors, it's slightly heady and warm with alcohol. Steely, mineral tones and crisp lime acidity add elegance to the finish.
Name: Villa Wolf 2012 Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Description: This bold Pinot Grigio is a far cry from the many watered-down versions of this popular wine. It's loaded with creamy white peach, Bartlett pear and green apple accented with lemon zest and a hint of pastry filling. Crisp acidity brightens this up and it finishes clean and dry.
Name: Villa Russiz 2012 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A pleasing mix of grapefruit, green apple and melon fruit flavors highlights this fresh and appealing wine. Crisp acidity buoys up the fruit and ensures a clean exit.
Name: Spindrift Cellars 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Savory herbs like lovage and chervil and ripe pear fruit unite to produce a very appetizing, concentrated if uncomplicated wine. Sheer drinkability, spurred on by clean, racy acidity is its hallmark.
Name: Neumeister 2013 Grauburgunder (Südoststeiermark)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Opening aromas include green apple, Bartlett pear, white peach, mineral and lemon zest. The juicy palate is balanced with fresh acidity and it closes on a hint of white almond.
Name: Volpe Pasini 2012 Zuc di Volpe Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This very limited production reserve was fermented and aged sur lie in a concrete egg. Egg-zactly what that did for the flavor remains a mystery. It conveys crisp flavors of green berry, green apple and pear.
Name: Left Coast Cellars 2012 Orchards Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The aromas are subtle, but the palate is more expressive, with green apple, white peach and lemon zest taking the lead. Crisp acidity gives this a clean, refreshing finish. Sip as an apéritif or enjoy it with starters and lightly seasoned pasta dishes.
Name: Livio Felluga 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate fragrances recall white wild flowers and white tree fruit. The bright, medium-bodied palate delivers tart green apple, mature pear and a hint of lemon zest alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Colutta 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: Partly fermented in oak casks, this full-bodied Pinot Grigio opens with floral aromas of Spanish broom, white spring flowers, vanilla and apple. The palate offers pear, apple, lemon zest and a note of bread crust alongside bright acidity.
Name: Marco Felluga 2011 Mongris Riserva Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: A structured Pinot Grigio, it discloses aromas of fragrant white flowers, apple, pear and a hint of beeswax. The lively palate offers Granny Smith apple and citrus alongside zesty acidity. A subtle mineral note marks the close.
Name: Muri-Gries 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas recall exotic fruit, lemon blossom and slate. The crisp palate offers tart green apple, tangerine and lime zest alongside bright acidity.
Name: Dorigo 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: Subtle floral aromas include white spring flowers and citrus notes. The juicy palate delivers tart Granny Smith apple, Bartlett pear and lime zest alongside crisp acidity that gives it a crystal clean finish.
Name: Conti Formentini 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: This fresh young wine brings lively, tart fruit flavors of pineapple and grapefruit, with a crisp, wet stone finish. A lick of lime keeps you coming back for more.
Name: Eola Hills 2013 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This single-vineyard Pinot Gris is smooth as silk, loaded with fresh, well-defined flavors of melon. A touch of spring herb is delicately applied. Not a big, fruity wine, but delicious in a rather quiet way.
Name: Lumos 2013 Logsdon Ridge Vineyard Rudolfo Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Philo Ridge continues its Pinot Gris explorations here, made in a similar style to the Marguerite Vineyard version, seeing no oak. The orange blossom aromas are fuller, with a bolt of vanilla, the texture light and crisp. A tad heavier on the palate, it'll still work with oysters, but could also do justice to heartier shellfish dripping in butter.
Name: Philo Ridge 2012 Klindt Vineyard Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: Blended from Umpqua Valley and Eola Hills grapes, this is forward and fruit-driven, with a pleasant mix of apple and pear. Along with the fruit comes a base of minerality and an unusual streak of spearmint.
Name: Seven Hills 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This soft and fruity wine offers pleasant flavors of apple and melon. It's smooth and approachable, lightly buttery, and ready to go.
Name: A to Z 2013 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Opening aromas of wildflowers and pears lead to a subtle palate offering tart green apple, juicy nectarine and Barltett pear alongside crisp acidity. Pair this with appetizers and light first courses or sip as an apéritif.
Name: La Tunella 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Juicy Granny Smith apple and ripe pear take center stage, along with notes of nectarine, lemon zest and a hint of bitter almond. Fresh acidity brightens up the finish.
Name: Petrucco 2012 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: It opens with fragrances of white spring flowers and mature pear. The bright palate delivers Granny Smith apple, tangerine and lemon zest alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Poggiobello 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: This lively wine is loaded with sensations of spring wildflowers, tart green apple, pear and nectarine. Crisp acidity gives a refreshing finish. Enjoy this as an apéritif or pair it with summer salads.
Name: Collavini 2013 Villa Canlungo Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Intense aromas of mature pear and Granny Smith apples carry over to the palate along with lemon-lime and honey dew melon. Crisp acidity gives this a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Sirch 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: Round and fruity, it has flavors of ripe Bartlett pear, creamy green apple, white peach and apricot. It's perfect to pour as an apéritif or pair it with starters and light first courses.
Name: La Vis 2013 Ritratti Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Young and fresh, it has excellent minerality. The fruit is light and lively, leaning toward grapefruit, green apple and a smidge of just-ripe melon. It's a lovely summer sipper, with a few good years of life ahead.
Name: Hawkins Cellars 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Leading with a slightly sour smell of tart apple and lime rind, the aromas from this single-vineyard Pinot Gris also pick up a wet rock minerality. Upon sipping, flavors of apple pie and peach emerge on the backdrop of a light, vibrant mouthfeel thanks to the stainless-steel processing, making this an excellent companion for fruit-topped salads or spicy food.
Name: Carr 2013 Turner Vineyard Pinot Gris (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: Straightforward and enjoyable, it delivers aromas of peach blossom and citrus. The juicy palate offers white peach, green apple and banana peel. Sip this as an apéritif or pair with light first courses.
Name: Cormòns 2013 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Herbal savoriness and hints of green pear on an otherwise neutral and clean nose promise sleek but uncomplicated refreshment. Ideal for entertaining.
Name: Kracher 2013 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a pleasant wine, with grapefruit and nectarine fruit, fresh but just a little flat through the midpalate. A good sipping wine, it's best served chilled and enjoyed while young.
Name: Left Coast Cellars 2013 The Orchards Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This substantial wine is replete with apricot and a faint lurking of herb. The acidity is there, just faintly, racing through to the finish.
Name: Las Positas 2012 Buttner Sunol Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Livermore Valley)

Description: Smooth and appealing, with ample fresh citrus flavors and a supple mouthfeel, this isn't so assertive that it gets in the way of the conversation or the food. Sourcing good quality grapes from non-premier regions keeps the price down.
Name: Cookies & Cream 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: A sharp entry brings a clear-cut diesel component into focus. The golden apple fruit is penetrating and ripe, with some bitterness in the follow-through.
Name: Yamhill Valley 2012 Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Stainless steel-fermented and kept on the lees for two months, this new vintage still feels a bit dilute—a function of the low brix and difficult vintage. Pungent with scents and flavors of rosemary and citrus, it is best drunk chilled and young.
Name: Walnut City WineWorks 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pungent jasmine and orange blossom take hold of the nose right away, ensuring that this won't be one of those flavorless Pinot Grigios to forget. On the palate, roasted pear and slight toffee tones mingle with lemon-lime acidity, making this wine a nice fit for backyard gatherings featuring shrimp on the barbie.
Name: Castle Rock 2012 Pinot Grigio (Monterey County)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Green apple, Bartlett pear, and nectarine sensations are brightened by lively acidity. Sip this an apéritif or pair it with appetizers or grilled vegetables.
Name: Torre Rosazza 2013 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: Richness and fruitiness combine in this medium-bodied, uncomplicated wine. It brings fresh citrus and pear aromas, ample apple and pear flavors, a smooth texture and a clean finish.
Name: Stomping Ground 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This lively Pinot Grigio from northern Italy has green apple, ripe pear and citrus sensations alongside fresh acidity. Sip as an apéritif or pair it with summer salads.
Name: La Vis 2013 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: This light, crisp quaff is made from 75% Pinot Grigio and 25% Vermentino, a white that's found a happy home in Lodi. It shows green apple, apricot and fig around a core of fresh citrus, finished by a polishing of vanilla.
Name: Peltier 2012 Hybrid Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: An easygoing, casual wine with melon and marshmallow flavors and a soft texture. It's cleanly made, light on the palate and almost sweet going down.
Name: Insomnia 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This sour, beery wine is for those who like a high acid flush with their meal. The very tart flavors focus on lemon and green apple.
Name: Redgate 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Rich, full bodied and medium dry, it is powered by ripe fruits, lychees and pomegranates. A spicy undertow brings along some acidity to this concentrated wine. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2010 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tranche does an excellent job with this grape; here the palate-filling flavors are round and fleshy, with peach and pear fruit. Short-term neutral-barrel aging has further smoothed out the mouthfeel, and it finishes delightfully with just a hint of butter.
Name: Tranche 2012 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A medium sweet wine, it is full of ripe tropical fruits. It has a rounded texture, generous and opulent in feel with an intense, concentrated structure. Spicy and warm, it needs several years to rdevelop. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2010 Hengst Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Pretty honeysuckle and freesia notes lend a blossomy feel to this supple, impeccably balanced wine. Tart white peach, quince and pineapple flavors are juicy yet bracing on the palate. It ends briskly with a shower of crushed minerals.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2012 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: This single-vineyard wine, rounded and rich, is smooth, spicy and full of quince and lychee flavors that are developing well. Concentrated and dense, it will be best in late 2014.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2011 Schofweg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A sweet Gewurz, full of quince, lychee, honey, spice and a light touch of acidity. Ripe and full bodied, it shows tropical flavors, a touch of acidity and a full and rounded aftertaste. This wine will become richer as it ages; it's almost ready to drink, but will be better after 2015.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2011 Mambourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Sivi Pinot is the Slovenian name for Pinot Gris and this will delight oenophiles looking for a new orange wine. It's pinkish brown in color due to two years of barrel aging and has aromas of peach cobbler and freshly baked piecrust. Smooth in the mouth, it discloses pronounced flavors of custard and crème brûlée. Think about pairing it with some of your strongest and ripest cheeses.
Name: Kabaj 2011 Sivi Pinot Pinot Gris (Goriska Brda)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The light and mineral aromas belie the palate's full, rounded fruit flavors with some sugar sweetening the finish.
Name: Jones of Washington 2013 Pinot Gris (Ancient Lakes)

Description: Smooth and ripe, this is a concentrated while elegant wine. It has hints of fresh yellow fruits along with spiced raisins and a touch of cinnamon. Full in the mouth, it is ready to drink.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2011 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A big, ripe and spicy wine, it also has plenty of fruit to balance plus a drier structure at its center. Just a hint of lychee plus a rounded texture make it full bodied but never heavy. Drink from the end of 2014.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2012 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Deeply mineral in style with hints of waxy lemon and lime skin, this bold, full-bodied wine boasts rich honey-apple flavors and a juicy, rounded mouthfeel. The moderately long finish comes with a hint of savory herb.
Name: Lakewood 2012 Gigliotti Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: A spicy wine that unfolds with a gentle texture, touches of lychee and pear and fruitiness. It has richness rather than sweetness, finishing with a light touch of acidity.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2012 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Only lightly spicy, it has a smooth texture and a fruity peach character. It is off dry, but tastes drier because of the light spice. The acidity helps give freshness.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A warmly perfumed wine, it has all the aromatic characters of Pinot Gris, rounded and soft with only a few hints of acidity. Off-dry, it is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2011 Rosenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of freshly pressed apples and peaches entice on this brisk, easy-drinking wine. Refreshing on the palate, it has a hint of minerality that lingers on the finish.
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2012 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: This pretty wine from Sicily starts with white floral and citrus aromas. The fresh, fruity palate offers tart green apple, lemon zest and a hint of nectarine. Simple but well made, this wine would make a refreshing apéritif or try it with light pasta salads.
Name: Stemmari 2013 Pinot Grigio (Terre Siciliane)

Description: A light style of Pinot Gris it conveys as much fruit as spice. From the dry end of the spectrum, it shows light acidity, pear and quince fruits and a tight texture. Drink from 2015.
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2012 Cuvée de l'Ours Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A medium-dry wine that is soft, fresh and full of apple and peach fruits. The acidity, surprisingly strong for a Pinot Gris, gives a fruity feel, suggesting structure while keeping it light. Not for aging, drink now.
Name: Domaine Specht 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lemony fresh with touches of mineral and earth, this easy-quaffing wine conveys subtle flavors of apple, pear and lemon. Dry in style, the expansive, full-bodied mouthfeel is cut by brisk, lemony acidity.
Name: Hosmer 2012 Pinot Gris (Cayuga Lake)

Description: This is a sweet Pinot Gris (thankfully indicated on the back label). It is soft, gently fruity and spicy without great depth of flavor. The light acidity helps give shape to a wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2011 Holder Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A medium-sweet wine, it's honeyed with ripe yellow fruits. Soft and spicy, it's already attractive to drink, although waiting until late 2014 would make it better.
Name: Cave de Beblenheim 2012 Baron de Hoen Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A bit savory in style, it has hints of dried herb accenting flavors of pressed pear and apple. Cutting lemon acidity gives a refreshing mouthfeel.
Name: Pugliese 2011 Pinot Grigio (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Anyone who doubts the world-class potential of Oregon Pinot Gris need only sip this outstanding value from Elk Cove. Bright and spicy, it's a riot of tangy grapefruit, tangerine and Meyer lemon, enhanced aromatically by citrus blossoms.
Name: Elk Cove 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The Domaine bottling is a standout, not only for King Estate, but for all Oregon Pinot Gris. Vinified in stainless steel and left sur lie for five months, this classy effort features ripe, rich fruit flavors of pear, banana and light tropicality. Fleshy and full, yet never heavy or oppressive, it's delicious from first sniff to last sip.
Name: King Estate 2012 Domaine Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Intense aromas recall fragrant jasmine and honeysuckle alongside whiffs of exotic fruit. The round palate delivers juicy green apple, citrus and hints of yellow peach that end on a mineral note.
Name: Nals Margreid 2012 Punggl Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From the estate vineyard, this is thick with spicy flavors of fresh-cut pear. There's a hint of butter and a slightly minty aspect. All in all it's complex, rich and inviting, with penetrating acidity.
Name: Hawks View 2012 Oregon Hawks View Vineyard Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: Sourced from the Chalice (estate) vineyard, this aromatic and seductive wine presents a compelling mix of tree fruits, racy acidity, and a rich, textural, open mouthfeel. The flavors of pears, orange peel and snappy spices linger deliciously through a long finish.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This savory Pinot Grigio has a little weight on it thanks to grape selection and 20% aging in large barrels. It delivers classic Granny Smith apple, Bartlett pear, nutmeg and flint in a creamy texture brightened by fresh acidity.
Name: Colterenzio 2012 Puiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This structured Pinot Grigio boasts aromas of yellow spring flowers, exotic fruit, citrus and a hint of Alpine herbs. The juicy, vibrant palate delivers green apple, pear, white peach and citrus allied with fresh acidity.
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2012 Söll Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Structured and sophisticated, it offers creamy green apple, pear, citrus and white peach sensations. The juicy fruit palate is restrained by subtle notes of white pepper and mineral alongside fresh acidity that leaves a focused, lingering finish.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2012 Anger Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Here's a Pinot Grigio for grownups. It opens with aromas of white flowers, Granny Smith apple and a hint of flint. The palate delivers creamy peach, apple and melon alongside a touch of vanilla. It conveys wonderful depth and freshness.
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: An alluring fragrance of Spanish Broom and stone fruit leads off. The juicy palate delivers creamy green apple, white peach and citrus alongside bright acidity. Flinty mineral marks the dry, clean finish.
Name: Nals Margreid 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This full-bodied wine is loaded with sensations of fragrant white flowers, ripe tropical fruit, juicy yellow peach and tart green apple. The creamy palate is brightened by fresh acidity and energizing mineral notes. It's well balanced, with more depth than most other Pinot Grigios.
Name: St. Pauls 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This full-bodied Pinot Grigio opens with aromas of tropical fruit, melon and stone fruit. The concentrated palate delvers yellow peach, mature pear and juicy pineapple alongside notes of aromatic herbs.
Name: Cantina Terlano 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This structured wine has subtle aromas of apples, vanilla and toasted notes. These carry over to the linear palate together with pear, mineral, lemon zest and lively acidity. Pair it with baked pasta dishes or grilled chicken.
Name: Mezzacorona 2012 Riserva Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: This structured wine opens with aromas of green apple, pear, clove and a hint of nutmeg that all carry over to the palate along with a mineral note. The creamy texture has nice weight and is brightened by vibrant acidity. Oliver McCrum, T. Edward Wines.
Name: Erste Neue 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of freshly cut flowers, green apple, lime and white peach leap from the glass. The creamy texture is brightened by lively acidity. It's simple but well executed.
Name: Cantina Produttori Cortaccia 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: From grapes grown in the high altitude Castel Ringberg vineyard, Elena Walch delivers a vibrant, balanced wine that shows structure and finesse. It's loaded with sensations of Granny Smith apple, lemon zest, banana peel and an underlying mineral note that carries to the crisp finish.
Name: Elena Walch 2012 Castel Ringberg Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Young and snappy with crisp green apple fruit flavors, this racy and nicely textured Pinot Gris shows excellent balance, concentration and length. Delicious now and should improve through 2017.
Name: Sweet Cheeks 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Structured but elegant, it discloses delicate aromas of Spanish broom and Granny Smith apple. The savory, creamy palate delivers juicy Bartlett pear, citrus, nectarine and melon brightened by crisp acidity.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: White flower blossoms, green apple, lemon zest and mineral aromas take center stage. The juicy palate offers Granny Smith and creamy white peach brightened by crisp acidity.
Name: Cantina Valle Isarco 2012 Aristos Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: A structured Pinot Grigio with character, it opens with aromas of Spanish broom, white peach and a graphite note. The juicy fruit palate delivers green apple, pear and creamy peach with a note of Alpine herbs, along with bright acidity.
Name: Kössler 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: A full-bodied Pinot Grigio aged in large casks, it starts with aromas of yellow flowers, golden apples, oak and vanilla. The structured palate offers toasted oak and hints of butterscotch alongside ripe pear, lemon drop and mineral.
Name: Tramin 2012 Unterebner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Savory and medium-bodied, it's loaded with sensations of juicy green apple, Bartlett pear, Spanish broom, almond and citrus peel. The creamy palate is brightened with crisp acidity that give balance and a brisk finish.
Name: Andriano 2013 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This straightforward, medium-bodied Pinot Grigio opens with floral aromas and a whiff of tropical fruit. The round palate offers juicy Bartlett pear and green apple alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Elena Walch 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with aromas of canned pears packed in syrup, lemon peel and mineral. The palate suggests sweet golden apple and lemon drop balanced by fresh acidity. It closes on a dry note.
Name: Castelfeder 2012 15 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This estate-grown Pinot Gris is all about ripe, round, forward fruit. A juicy mix of apple and pear hits home, with just a hint of cinnamon. A good sipping wine.
Name: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2012 Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of green apples, peach and citrus carry over to palate. The juicy flavors are accompanied by lively acidity that makes this wine very food friendly.
Name: Mezzacorona 2013 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: It's loaded with juicy green apple, white peach and lemon sensations accompanied by a light mineral note. Crisp acidity gives a clean, quenching finish.
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2012 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Pretty fragrances of white spring flowers and pears lead to a lively palate that offers white peach and green apple alongside bright acidity. It finishes clean and crisp.
Name: Tolloy 2013 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Pretty fragrances recall white spring flowers and white fruit. The bright palate offers juicy Granny Smith, yellow peaches and citrus alongside crisp acidity that leaves a clean, dry finish.
Name: Kris 2013 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: A full-bodied white, it leads with aromas of jasmine, honeysuckle and stone fruit. The linear palate offers ripe golden apple, white peach and a mineral note alongside fresh acidity. Bitter almond marks the finish.
Name: Niedermayr Josef 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: It offers linear apple, pear and juicy white fruit flavors alongside a subtle smoky note. Crisp acidity leaves a refreshing finish.
Name: Tommasi 2012 Le Rosse Pinot Grigio (Venezie)

Description: This wine opens with aromas of toasted oak, butterscotch and vanilla. The palate delivers toast, oak extract and mineral, but it lacks fruit richness to fully balance the dominant wood. It ends on a bitter coffee bean note.
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2011 Sanct Valentin Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Right out of the chute this is a fresh, lively with scented with fresh cut pears. It's balanced and crisp, with subtle hints of cinnamon spice. A good spring/summer quaffer.
Name: Duck Pond 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A medium-bodied wine, it delivers sensations of Alpine wild flowers and Granny Smith apple. The round palate is brightened by fresh acidity but you'll also feel the warmth of evident alcohol.
Name: Girlan 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Here's a pretty, easy-drinking wine that reveals aromas of Granny Smith apple, hay and hints of exotic fruit that carry over to the palate. The ripe fruit is brightened by fresh acidity that leaves a clean finish.
Name: Franz Haas 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Subtle aromas of smoke, Bartlett pear and Granny Smith apple carry over to the palate along with a citrusy note and a hint of raw almond.
Name: Peter Zemmer 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This copper-colored Pinot Grigio opens with aromas of green apples and whiffs of tropical fruit. The slightly sweet palate offers juicy pink grapefruit, ripe pear and peach alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Casata Monfort 2013 Rosé Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Subdued aromas include white spring flowers, pear and apple. The palate delivers green apple along with a hint of lemon peel and almond. You'll notice the warmth of alcohol on the close.
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2012 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This Pinot Grigio from Trentino—part of which is barrel aged—offers aromas of pear, apple, oak and flint. The linear palate delivers restrained lemon peel, apple and oak sensations in a lean but elegant style.
Name: Maso Poli 2012 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Pretty fragrances include white flowers and green apple. The fresh, linear palate offers pear and Granny Smith apple with a hint of lemon zest. Pair with light pasta dishes or sip as an apéritif.
Name: Lechthaler 2012 Torrediluna Pinot Grigio (Venezie)

Description: This simple Pinot Grigio has aromas of pears and yellow spring flowers. The palate offers tart green apple and a hint of unripened yellow peach along with fresh acidity. Pair this with light pasta dishes or pizzas.
Name: Castel Sallegg 2012 Pulvernai Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this is a direct and appealing wine that brings notes of freshly cut red apple and peach, with a dash of Muscat Blanc (1%) lifting the aromatics. It's medium bodied with a pleasing interplay of citrus and stone fruit flavors throughout.
Name: Sawtooth 2012 Estate Grown Pinot Gris

Description: Light, citrusy aromas also are suggestive of bath soap. The feel is juicy yet innocuous, while flavors of tropical fruits finish mild and simple. This is the definition of a quaffing wine.
Name: Callia 2013 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

Description: Aromas of white fruits and apple are slightly mealy and set up flavors of melon and tangy but pithy citrus. The finish is even more pithy. Overall this wine feels like it's starting to fade.
Name: Santa Julia 2013 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: Gold in color, with oxidized aromas of straw, almond skins, butterscotch and baked apple, this PG is fading fast. Flavors of apple and briny stone fruits finish with almondy notes and bitterness.
Name: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2012 Tolentino Winemaker's Selection Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: An astonishing Pinot Gris, certainly among the best ever made in Oregon, this rich, luscious, mouthcoating wine is totally irresistible. Chardonnay-like unctuousness, ripe pear and apple fruit, plus hints of honey, butter and spice make it practically a meal in itself.
Name: Rex Hill 2012 Jacob-Hart Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The Ab Ovo is principally fermented in a concrete egg, as students of Latin might easily surmise. Richly detailed and layered, the wine displays impeccable balance, ripe citrus and tropical fruit flavors and countering acidity. The egg seems to bring out some additional minerality also.
Name: Archery Summit 2012 Ab Ovo Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe, round and fleshy, this brings generous tree fruits annotated with bright spices. It's clean, fresh and has a hint of mint in the finish.
Name: Vista Hills 2012 Treehouse Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy pear and yellow-apple fruit flavors roll through this well-structured Pinot Gris. The relatively low alcohol, high acidity and threshhold-level residual sugar give it both texture and tangy vitality.
Name: Oak Knoll 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A straw yellow color, with pink tinges, this bright wine is zesty and juicy at the same time. It has a round body and full mouthfeel, with flavors of green apple, Bartlett pear and citrus blossoms. There's bracing lime-juice acidity on the finish.
Name: Giocato 2012 Pinot Grigio (Primorska)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
