Description: Young and yeasty, this attractive Pinot Gris is beautifully textured and deliciously flavored. Scents of lemon verbena, a wisp of honey, and ripe fruit flavors of apple and pear combine in a fully satisfying, fruit-driven, ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Terrapin Cellars 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is pale blush colored, with aromas of rose petal, jasmine blossom and fresh picked strawberry that continue seamlessly onto the palate. It's got a great strawberry zing on the finish, with bright, balanced acidity.
Name: Pullus 2012 Dry White Pinot Grigio (Štajerska)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: An interesting experiment, this Pinot Gris is fermented on the skins, then aged in neutral oak for six months. It's a pale rose color, and the skin contact has resulted in some quite puckery phenolics. The barrel aging helps round it out, though it remains almost sour, with light, astringent strawberry fruit.
Name: Vista Hills 2012 Orange Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Creamy aromas of vanilla cookies and melon lead to a plump palate with just enough vital acidity to keep things fresh. Citrusy flavors lean toward clementines and grapefruit, while the finish is peachy but  also pithy in flavor.
Name: Alma Andina 2013 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: Characteristically perfumed, this Pinot Gris is full bodied with a richness of texture. It is complex on the palate with notes of nuts, spice and an edge of citrus fruit. Age this wine and don't drink before 2016.
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2011 Cuvée Ste Catherine Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This wine is medium sweet in style with a rich, complex character. It has notes of spice and honey that accent ripe peach and apricot flavors. The richness of the wine comes from it's dense texture. It is ready to drink now, but will also age well.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2010 Kessler Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gold in color and unctuously sweet, this is a dense wine. The sweetness is cut with a dry edge and some fresh acidity. It tastes delicious now with flavors of wild honey and apricot skins, but it will certainly age well. Drink until 2024.
Name: Rieflé 2011 Zinnkoepflé Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a medium-sweet wine that's warm and rich due to the ripening abilities of the Spiegel vineyard. It is spiced, concentrated and full of a smoky character that contrasts with its fruitiness. It's ready to drink now, although it will certainly age well. Drink until 2019.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2007 Spiegel Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a textured wine with ripe and perfumed fruitiness. Honeyed in style and medium-sweet on the palate, it's a complex, rich wine that's ready to drink now, but could also improve with age.
Name: Rieflé 2010 Steinert Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Richly sweet, this is a wine that has traded primary fruitiness with deliciously balanced honey flavor and lively citrus acidity. It's a wine that has richness, intense flavor and the ability to age further.
Name: Rieflé 2010 Zinnkoepflé Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: While this wine does have sweetness, its great character comes from its structure and spiciness. It is rich, full in the mouth, ripe and concentrated. Even at four years old, it is youthful and closed still, and needs some time in the cellar. Drink from 2015.
Name: Bott Frères 2009 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a full, perfumed wine that's medium sweet in flavor. It is rich in spice, packed with honey and lychees, and well balanced with light acidity. The wine has an opulence and a warming aftertaste. Drink until 2022.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2011 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Although the producer indicates that this is a medium-sweet wine, it does seem to be sweeter than that. The concentration of berry, raisin and dried apricot flavors, and the layers of honey accentuate the sweetness. It's a wine to be drunk now, although it will age well until 2020.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2009 Vendanges Tardive Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a rich, opulent wine with ripe lychee flavors. Forward and spicy, it is showing its flashy youth at the moment. While it will always be ripe in style, as it develops, it will become more sophisticated and complex. Drink until 2022.
Name: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2011 Schlossberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a sweet Pinot Gris that is honeyed and very rich. Light spice notes are buoyed by explosive apricot and pineapple flavors, yielding a wine that's great for capping off a meal.
Name: Wolfberger 2008 Rangen Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: More than just rich and sweet, this wine shows intense, complex flavors. It is full of ripe lychee and spice flavors, and boasts a rich, creamy texture with a finish that hints of dryness. It is maturing well and already ready to drink, but it will also hold for several more years.
Name: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2009 Late Harvest Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This rich, boldy alcoholic wine has a pepper character that dominates fragrant fruit and spice notes. It should age well, so drink until 2020.
Name: Rieflé 2011 Côte de Rouffach Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a rich wine that has flavors of spice, apricot and almond, along with a touch of honey. Rich and full on the palate, it's a meal in itself, but finely balanced with intense fruitiness and light acidity. Drink now.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2011 Trois Châteaux Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a rich, full wine that is spiced but retains remarkable freshness. Crisp citrus and acidity gives it a fine sweet-and-sour character that mingles with flavors of warm apricot and lychee fruits. Drink now.
Name: Trimbach 2010 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There is an attractive spiciness here, yielding a wine that is warm and rich. It has flavors of tropical fruits, lychees and rosewater. It's full bodied, concentrated and dense in texture, but maintains a freshness through the finish. Drink now.
Name: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2011 Exception Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: On the sweet side, this is a soft, fruity, perfumed wine packed with flavors of baked apples, red currants and spiced pears. Bright acidity gives it a lift on the finish. It is now ready to drink.
Name: Bott Frères 2009 Réserve Personnelle Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a light, fruity wine that's ripe with perfumed quince and tropical fruit flavors. The palate is satisfyingly balanced with tight, bright acidity. This is wine that is not for aging, and ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Pfister 2011 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Quite tart, this mouth-puckering Pinot Gris brings bright, fresh flavors of lemon, lime and grapefruit to the front. It's a high acid effort, shellfish-friendly, with a good bite to the finish.
Name: Boomtown 2012 Pinot Gris (Washington)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A hint of smoke mingles with fresh apple and pear aromas on this delicate, but silky and textured Pinot Gris. It's slightly off-dry in style, with concentrated apple and apricot flavors touched by a hint of honey. Tart lemon acidity adds balance and vibe.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2011 Curry Creek Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Ripe apples and pears dominate this rich, lightly spicy wine. It has a fresh element that contrasts with its richness,yielding a wine with some weight but also delicate poise and step. Screwcap.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2012 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is an open, soft, warm wine. It has some spice, although never excessive, along with gentle acidity and touches of hazelnuts. There are apricot and dried banana flavors and a fine, lifted aftertaste.
Name: Wolfberger 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lifted by notes of pear, petroleum jelly and apricot, it's medium bodied and drinks off dry (6 g/L residual sugar) with a tart, lingering finish.
Name: Willow Crest 2012 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lovely and fresh, this piles on flavors of Bosc pear, with the texture to match. It's a wonderful expression of the grape coming from the eastern Washington region, accented with lovely, delicate baking spices.
Name: 14 Hands 2012 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a ripe and spicy wine that is full of almond and tropical fruit flavors. It has a sense of richness and texture, along with a kick of pepper. The acidity is a touch light here, but there's just enough to keep it fresh.
Name: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2011 Anne de K Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Medium sweet in style, this is spicy, fragrant wine with honeyed lychee and pear flavors. It's warm and rich with nicely lifted acidity on the finish.
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2011 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A wisp of smoke mingles with blossom, apple and pear flavors in this lively, fresh Pinot Gris. It's quite tart with acidity, but pleasantly fruity with a subtle hint of minerality on the finish.
Name: Ventosa 2011 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: This is a softly spicy wine that is understated and light. With its brisk acidity and flavors of citrus and lychee, it is an easy, gentle wine that is ready to drink now.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2012 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a light and open wine, showing more fruitiness characteristic spice of Pinot Gris. It does have almond and green herb flavors, along with a touch of pepper and bitterness. Drink now.
Name: Frédéric Mallo 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Fresh apple and pear aromas are accented with notes of white flowers on this delicate Pinot Grigio. It's bristling with lemon-lime acidity, but pleasantly concentrated citrus flavors, and just a hint of reeds on the finish.
Name: Damiani 2011 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Prominent on the nose with scents of apple and pear, this is a dry, medium-bodied Pinot Grigio with subtle nectarine and citrus flavor. It's puckery from acidity, but refreshing with a clean, brisk finish.
Name: Belhurst 2011 Pinot Grigio (New York)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While unusually perfumey, this dry, full-bodied Pinot Gris balances pleasant apple and pear flavors with a striking lemon acidity. Robustly structured, a slight warming sensation adds to the finish.
Name: Hosmer 2011 Pinot Gris (Cayuga Lake)

Description: Just lightly spicy, this is a simple, gentle wine. It is on the dry side, and hints at apple and pear flavors. There's a light acidity on the finish. Screwcap.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2012 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: McManis's affordable, widely distributed Pinot Grigio is fermented in stainless steel, light in texture and fairly one-dimensional in flavor. It's crisp and clean with a sour lemon note. It'll work for large parties and get togethers.
Name: McManis 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This is a light, steely white with more honeysuckle and floral characteristics than fruit. It's light in alcohol and texture, and especially good for the wine drinker looking for something subtle.
Name: The White Knight 2012 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: Just off dry, this is a ripe and full-bodied wine that's balanced with acidity. Touched with delicate spice, it has an attractive, open feel that makes it very drinkable now.
Name: Willm 2012 Cuvée Famille Willm Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: An aromatic offering with notes of tropical fruit, flowers, petroleum jelly and hazelnut. At 30 g/L residual sugar, it's sweet but could use a bit more acidic lift.
Name: B. Lovely 2012 Pinot Gris (Washington)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Chestnut Hill is the winery's highest-elevation vineyard, and in a fine vintage such as this, it merits reserve-level treatment. It would be wonderful if more Oregon wineries made Pinot Gris of this caliber, and could sell it at an approachable price, but it's a tough category. Latch onto this rich and concentrated gem if you can; it's a gorgeous mix of apple, pear, chalk and lightly toasted almonds.
Name: Lemelson 2012 Chestnut Hill Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is a classic vintage for Oregon Pinot Gris, and King Estate sets the benchmark. Lovely texture, structure and minerality are on display, along with rich pear and apple flavors sculpted by balancing acidity. The well-defined finish continues smoothly with a streak of fresh lime.
Name: King Estate 2012 Signature Collection Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Lime and pink grapefruit flavors are etched with refreshing minerality, and the leesy, textural mouthfeel keeps this wine feeling light, despite alcohol over 14%. Drink now and over the next five years.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2012 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Low-yielding vines cropped down to 1.5 tons/acre contribute to the length and power of this tart, lip-smacking Pinot Gris. There's a delicious mineral underpinning to the subtle flavor mix of Asian pear, apple and lemon. A nice hint of tarragon also comes into focus.
Name: Lemelson 2012 Tikka's Run Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Bright, polished and fleshy pear flavors hold center court here, supported with a light sprinkling of peppery herb. Proportionate acids keep the wine crisp and clean through the finish.
Name: Erath 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tart and puckery, this is for acid-lovers. The aromas carry accents of pine needles, while the fruit is headlined with grapefruit and tangy citrus. Very refreshing.
Name: Arbor Brook 2012 Croft Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Softly aromatic of lemon and vanilla, this is a mid-weight Pinot Gris with a whisper of oak and ripe pear. On the finish it gets slightly richer, along with an herbal undertone that begs for fresh goat cheese or oysters on the half shell with a citrus vinaigrette.
Name: McFadden 2012 Pinot Gris (Potter Valley)

Description: Ripe fruit takes center stage in this tasty Pinot Gris loaded with fresh apple, pear and peach flavor. It's full bodied, round in the mouth, ready to drink and flavorful through the mouthfilling finish.
Name: Acrobat 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a rock solid Pinot Gris, chunky and fleshy and loaded with ripe fruit flavors. Melon and pear provide the guts, with a lighter streak of jicama and a clean, green finish. There's good concentration in this ready-to-go, all-purpose white for winter.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is a softly perfumed wine that has spice as well as ripe apple and pear flavors. Gently textured, it hints at tropical fruits balanced out with fine acidity. This is an attractive wine for drinking now.
Name: Kracher 2012 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Description: Subtle and steely, this Pinot Gris is crisp and lemony. It has plenty of citrus amidst a core of herbs and flowers. The grapes are sourced from the organic vineyards of Guinness McFadden in the Potter Valley area of Mendocino County.
Name: Horse & Plow 2012 McFadden Farm Pinot Gris (Mendocino)

Description: A perfumed wine with crisp, tight acidity, this is vibrant with light pear flavor and a delicious, refreshing aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Wohlmuth 2012 Gola Pinot Gris (Südsteiermark)

Description: For fans of Pinot Grigio, this copper-hued wine—the natural color yielded by Pinot Grigio grapes—is a must try. It delivers juicy pear and apple flavors, along with spice and mineral notes and crisp, quenching acidity.
Name: Palazzone 2012 TIXE Pinot Grigio (Umbria)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The unusual aromas on this wine are a confounding mix of fusel oil and grass, much like a Sauvignon Blanc. The wine has noticeable residual sugar as well. This seems way out of any varietal norm for Oregon Pinot Gris, but other than that, it's perfectly quaffable.
Name: Château Bianca 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Crisp, steely and linear with grapefruit and pineapple flavors, this is a refreshing Pinot Gris from one of Lake County's newer sub-appellations. It's an interesting contrast to the winery's upfront and fruity Pinot Grigio. On the finish there's a hint of tree nuts.
Name: Brassfield 2012 High Serenity Ranch Pinot Gris (High Valley)

Description: Here's a pretty Pinot Grigio that offers a heady fragrance of white flowers and Granny Smith apple. On the palate, this offers creamy green apple and pear flavors, uplifted by fresh acidity.
Name: Lungarotti 2012 Pinot Grigio (Umbria)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a moderately aromatic wine with notes of pear, flowers and applesauce. It drinks a hair off dry (4 g/L residual sugar), finishing on a bitter note.
Name: Del Rio 2012 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: There is a bitter, metallic flavor that sticks in the mouth here, long after the fresh green-apple flavor has faded. This is sealed with a screwcap, so there is no suspect cork. Basically, it's a simple, generic white wine.
Name: Portlandia 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: About 5% Viognier is blended into this spicy, round and fruity Pinot Gris. Complex and lively flavors suggest lemon and orange peel, melon, pear, and a hint of vanilla.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This pretty Pinot Grigio from northern Italy has and apple and citrus fragrance. The palate offers tart green apple and creamy lemon along with nice weight and crisp acidity. This finishes dry and is perfect as an apéritif or pair it with light pasta dishes or seafood.
Name: Tenuta Luisa 2012 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spice and a whiff of diesel hit the nose, followed by soft, intense flavors of fresh pear and highlights of lime skin. It's well balanced, with sharpness and lift, and will be most enjoyable consumed now, while still young and fresh.
Name: Milbrandt 2012 Traditions Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Here's a lovely Pinot Grigio with aromas of pear and white peach. The palate delivers green apple and pear flavors in a creamy texture supported by citrus notes and crisp acidity. It has a clean finish and is perfect as an apéritif or with seafood.
Name: Zenato 2012 Pinot Grigio (Venezie)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This spicy, lightly peppery Pinot Grigio has sharp edges while pleasant fruit flavors abound. Pear, apple and green berries dominate, with hints of bitter skin phenolics in the finish.
Name: Thorny Rose 2012 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a simple Pinot Grigio from Abruzzo with pretty aromas of white flowers. The palate offers bright green apple and pear flavors with a crisp and refreshing finish. Pair this with light pasta salads.
Name: Spinelli 2012 STLTO Pinot Grigio (Terre di Chieti)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though no residual sugar is listed, this appears to have a hint of sweetness, along with light fruit flavors of strawberry and candied cherries.
Name: Goose Ridge 2012 Rosé de Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Here's a fun sparkler made from Pinot Grigio that offers a delicate floral fragrance of white spring flowers and hints of tropical fruit. It has a quenching palate , with green apple and tangerine flavors along with a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Piera Martellozzo 2012 075 Carati Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

Description: Here's an inviting Pinot Grigio that has a lovely fragrance of white peach and flowers. The palate delivers green apple along with crisp acidity that leaves a clean finish. Pair this with pastas or pizza.
Name: Allegrini 2012 Corte Giara Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this pretty Pinot Grigio offers floral aromas of white spring flowers along with creamy green apple and citrus notes. It has crisp, clean finish. Sip as an apéritif or pair with lightly seasoned fish dishes.
Name: Pizzolato 2012 Pinot Grigio (Venezia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatically pleasing wine with notes of pear, apple and petroleum jelly. It's almost frizzante in feel and drinks dry with just a touch of residual sugar (3.6 g/L) sweetening the finish.
Name: Sockeye 2012 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Plump aromas of melon and almond candy announce a chunky palate with citric acidity. Pithy orange and melon flavors are straightforward, with some sweetness. Consider this a decent, generic white wine.
Name: Morandé 2012 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is as good a Pinot Gris as this producer has ever made. Apples and stone fruits contribute a fleshy, flavorful mid-palate. Peppery spice and a hint of brioche add complexity and interest. The wine is perfectly balanced and ready to drink immediately.
Name: Benton-Lane 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Quite tart when it hits the lips, this is nonetheless a dense, flavorful Pinot Gris, tasting of grapefruit, sour orange, apple and green banana. It shows lots of juice and powers through the mid-palate into a fruit-driven finish.
Name: Adelsheim 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This new vintage was barrel fermented, which fleshes out the flavors and brings some tropical notes along with the tart flavors of fresh pear. Young, sleek and showing a pleasing, wet stone minerality, this is styled for near-term enjoyment, perhaps with fresh halibut, swordfish or white salmon.
Name: Illahe 2012 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe pear fruit introduces a full-bodied Pinot Gris, and carries it through a satisfying finish. It's fruit all the way, dusted with a little taste of cinnamon spice.
Name: Left Coast Cellars 2012 The Orchards Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a palate-pleasing, low alcohol Pinot Gris, just lightly grassy and showing balanced flavors of fresh cut pear and melon. The crisp acidity leaves an impression of wet stone, refreshing the palate and setting you up for another glass.
Name: Bell 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Mostly Washington Sauvignon Blanc, with a 15% splash of Oregon Müller-Thurgau also in the blend, this dry, sippable, low-alcohol white wine has European finesse. Flavors of green berries and yellow fruits abound, along with melon and grapefruit. The bracing acidity fits the style beautifully.
Name: ENSO NV Resonate White #5 Pinot Gris (Washington-Oregon)

Description: An enjoyable easy drinker with notes of pear, mineral and a whiff of tropical fruit. It's broad in feel with a touch of sugar to sweeten the finish.
Name: Sawtooth 2012 Estate Grown Pinot Gris

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A significant price drop and a riper vintage make this a fine, every day go-to Pinot Gris. Apple and pear fruit, spiced up with cinnamon highlights, lead into a clean finish. Drink it young.
Name: Kudos 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: It clocks in at an astonishing 15% alcohol, but does not show it in terms of flavor. The fruit is plenty ripe and a bit thick, but well-supported with acidity. Nonetheless the wine seems heavy and monolithic, having lost some of the vivid freshness of the other Chehalem white wines from this vintage.
Name: Chehalem 2012 Three Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This fruit-driven Pinot Gris blends green apple, melon and pear, with a hint of celery suggesting some less-than-ripe fruit in the mix also. The finish turns a little bitter.
Name: Kings Ridge 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Ripe and spicy, this is an opulent wine, showing great swathes of tropical fruits as well as pepper and just the right amount of acidity. The wine is rich, intense, concentrated and needs to age. Drink from 2016.
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2011 Cuvée Particulière Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Here's a Pinot Grigio with structure and personality, proving why Friuli is Italy's white wine capital. It's loaded with creamy green apple and pear sensations uplifted by energizing mineral notes. The finish is crisp and clean.
Name: Mario Schiopetto 2011 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Well balanced between fruitiness and spice, this is a young, crisp wine. Its apricot and pear flavors are lighted by fragrant acidity and considerable freshness for a Pinot Gris. It is ready to drink, but will be better in 1–2 years.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2012 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is old reliable as far as Washington Pinot Gris is concerned. Mouth-filling flavors of tart apple, citrus and pineapple are set in juicy acids. The addition of small amounts of Sauvignon Blanc and Gewürztraminer heighten the aromatics.
Name: Hogue 2012 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Richly warm wine, spicy and very fruity. Seville orange and citrus combine with tropical fruits to give a wine that is full in the mouth and concentrated while ready to drink. Drink until 2018.
Name: Pierre and Charles Sparr 2011 Cuvée Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy and fresh, this clean and fruity wine displays flavors of jicama, melon and pear. It's a simple, straightforward, well made, fruit-driven wine for every day enjoyment.
Name: Mercer 2012 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: This charming Pinot Grigio has a pretty nose of pear and white peach that carries through to the palate alongside lively citrus notes. This is simple but delicious, with crisp acidity that leaves a clean, dry finish. A perfect partner for pastas or grilled fish dishes.
Name: Lechthaler 2012 Drago Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% Pinot Gris is sourced from The Benches vineyard in the Horse Heaven Hills. It's fruity, offering notes of apple, mandarin orange and flowers. It drinks dry and is broad in feel, finishing a bit short.
Name: Waterbrook 2012 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An enjoyable, easy drinker with notes of ripe red apple, apricot and granulated sugar. It's broad in feel, drinking a touch off dry.
Name: WildHaven 2012 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from the newly minted Ancient Lakes appellation, it's a jumble of apple and tropical notes. It leans toward medium sweet with tart acids pulling it back on the finish.
Name: Jones of Washington 2012 Pinot Gris (Ancient Lakes)

Description: Here's a pretty and bright Pinot Grigio with sensations of green apple and pear. This is simple but well made, and while it makes a refreshing apéritif, it will also pair nicely with pasta al pomodoro or lightly seasoned fish dishes.
Name: Canaletto 2012 Pinot Grigio (Venezie)

Description: This Pinot Grigio has an intriguing copper color thanks to prolonged skin contact. It's dominated by assertive oak notes, with light fruit flavors that take second stage to the astringent wood sensations.
Name: Vie di Romans 2011 Dessimis Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With 7% Muscat Canelli boosting the aromas, it has notes of flowers and apple skins. It drinks dry with an oily, rich feel and a bitter note that distracts on the finish.
Name: Hyatt 2012 Pinot Gris (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: A light style of Pinot Gris, softly ripe and rounded. There are touches of spice, peach and peppered apples, an attractive balance of acidity to finish.
Name: Jean Becker 2011 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Although Argentina is hardly Pinot Grigio country, this is a tropical-style quaffer with good balance and enough acidity to avoid coming across heavy. Creamy aromas of melon and lychee set up flavors of nectarine and tangerine. A lasting but modest finish is fair and appropriate.
Name: Trapiche 2012 Oak Cask Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 15% Riesling and fermented and aged in stainless steel, it's lightly aromatic with notes of stone fruit and macerated grape skins. It drinks off-dry with the flavor concentration a bit wanting.
Name: Gecko 2012 Pinot Grigio (Snipes Mountain)

Description: Soft fruit and lightly spicy, the wine has a touch of acidity, lychee and ripe apple flavors. It is ready to drink, a full and gently rich wine.
Name: Cave de Cleebourg 2011 Prestige Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a simple Pinot Grigio, with aromas of white spring flowers and green apple. The palate is slightly round, with a ripe pear flavor lifted by tart Granny Smith apple accents.
Name: Gaierhof 2012 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: A beautiful wine, fully mature and wonderfully ripe. It has all the elements of mature Pinot Gris: great swathes of spice, almonds, a good slash of acidity and honeyed sweetness. It's not going to improve but could stay at this level for three to five years.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2008 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Mango aromas and flavors give a sense of the sweetness of the wine. It is rich and full bodied, with spice and pepper notes just hinting at acidity. Keep the wine for 3–5 years.
Name: Domaine Ehrhart 2010 Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is slightly smoky on the nose, offering scents of toasted almonds that neatly accent pear and kumquat aromas. It's richly textured on the palate, where the pear and almond notes pick up zesty citrus overtones that allow them to finish clean and fresh. Drink now.
Name: Carrick 2011 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Struck flint and slightly smoky aromas give way to flavors of honeyed peaches and toasted nuts—not full on, like a Chardonnay might be, but restrained yet lush at the same time. In only a few years, this has quickly become one of New Zealand's best Pinot Gris.
Name: Greywacke 2011 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: A warm, opulent wine from the southernmost Grand Cru of Alsace. It has richness, ripe peach and pear fruits, a hint of maturity bringing out spice. There's a tang of orange giving freshness to this serious, complex wine. Drink now and until 2020
Designation: Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Clos Saint-Théobald
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2010 Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Clos Saint-Théobald Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Yellow fruits, rich spice and an intense aromatic character come together to produce this ripe, full-bodied wine. It's not overblown, though, offering a contrast of acidity to freshen it up. It's ready to drink, although it can be kept until 2016.
Name: Domaine Zinck 2011 Terroir Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This excellent Pinot Gris is barrel fermented in neutral French oak, and is still young enough to show a yeasty freshness to the aromas and in the mouth. There seems to be a touch of residual sugar, or at least a generous fruity sweetness to the palate. Apple and cinnamon flavors complete the picture.
Name: Lange 2012 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A fine effort in 2012, this clean and fresh Pinot Gris impresses with crisply defined flavors of jicama, white peach, pineapple and honeydew melon. Flavors are persistent and lightly kissed with vanilla through a lingering, lively finish.
Name: Ponzi 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Made in a convincingly dry style, this wine's nectarine and lime notes are joined on the palate by hints of almond. It's mouthfilling without being fat or blowsy, ending on a bright note of citrus.
Name: Woollaston 2011 Pinot Gris (Nelson)

Description: Lightly smoky wine, with spice and rounded white fruits with tropical highlights. It's full and rich, not quite dry but with a pepper character that makes it seem drier than it is. Ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Moltès 2012 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Very spicy, full-in-the-mouth wine. It has just the right amount of acidity to keep it fresh, but its main thrust is towards rich pepper and weight. At the end, a tighter mineral character appears. Keep for 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2012 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Spicy and intense, this excellent Pinot Gris is loaded with Gravenstein apple, cut pear, and a taste of orange peel. Surprising length and power for a Euro-styled wine with modest alcohol.
Name: Rainstorm 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This fruit-forward Pinot Gris is dominated by pear and pineapple notes. Some custardy richness adds to the mouthfeel, while bright citrus sparks the finish. Drink now.
Name: Peregrine 2011 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A new cuvée for Apolloni, this is a rich reserve wine that's loaded with mouth-coating flavors of lanolin, lemon curd, candied orange peel and ripe pear. A pleasant streak of vanilla adds interest to the finish.
Name: Apolloni 2012 L Cuvée Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All-stainless fermented, this flavorful Pinot Gris displays fleshy, ripe pear flavors, with a light dusting of cinnamon spice. Simply delicious, and ready right now.
Name: Walnut City WineWorks 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Off dry, this rich and spicy wine has a fine, creamy texture, ripe yellow fruits and a mango juice flavor. It's full-bodied and generous yet with a fine, crisp aftertaste to balance.
Name: Domaine Jean-Luc Mader 2011 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A very ripe feeling wine, with tropical fruit notes. Mango and spice combine with a touch of acidity to give a full, balanced wine. Hinting at mushrooms at the end, it is ready to drink.
Name: Louis Sipp 2010 Nature'S Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Just spicy, this wine draws its strength from its rich texture, warm apricot fruit flavors and complex balance between acidity and ripeness. It makes for a generous wine that will certainly age a few years.
Name: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2011 Le Berger Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Floral on the nose, this is lighter and more refreshing than many of its peers on the palate. It's dry or nearly dry, offering peach, pear and apple notes.
Name: Eradus 2011 Pinot Gris (Awatere Valley)

Description: A fine effort, this has juicy flavors of apple and pear, lightly dusted with cinnamon spice. An astonishing 46,000 cases are made, which must be second only to King Estate for Oregon Pinot Gris production.
Name: A to Z 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Meyer lemon and a hint of fresh herbs—lemon verbena, tarragon and cilantro—elevate this polished and textural effort. There's a nice long finish; a fine bottle, especially at this price.
Name: Lujon 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A ripe and creamy, this is a concentrated wine, with depth of pear and peach flavors along with just a touch of spice. It's broad, smooth and young; it will need at least a year to open out fully.
Name: René Sparr 2011 Excellence Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Very lightly golden in color, this perfumy wine has fine ripe tropical fruits with a touch of honey and spice. Rounded, full bodied, pepper and acidity at the end. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine Zinck 2011 Portrait Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Another fantastic bargain wine from Cramele Recas, the Dreambird is a delightfully fresh, floral Pinot Grigio that's zesty with lemon and just a hint of steely minerality on the finish. Bright, clean and refreshingly easy quaffing.
Name: Cramele Recas 2012 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)

Description: Full of spice and ripe yellow fruits, it has a dense and concentrated character. Honey and nutmeg are in the foreground, while acidity is in the background. Age for 2–3 years.
Name: André Blanck et ses Fils 2011 Clos Schwende Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A ripe, very spicy wine, full of melon and peach fruit flavors but light on the acidity. It's generous with an opulent character that is balanced by a pepper and spice edge. Ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Ehrhart 2011 Domaine Saint-Rémy Im Berg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: With pink hints from the skins of the Pinot Gris this wine has honey and canned apricot syrup flavors. The spice and acidity complement each other at the end of this attractive wine.
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2012 Cuvée Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Very ripe and full of honey and tropical fruit flavors. A warm wine, it's richly textured, with a bite of peppery spice and lightly lifted by final acidity.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2010 Terroirs Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This new venture of Erica and Kim Crawford has turned out a charming, medium-bodied Pinot Gris that Goldilocks would undoubtedly call, “just right.” Mixed stone-fruit flavors end on a citrusy, refreshing note.
Name: Loveblock 2011 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: A spicy wine, full of ripe fruit and softly textured. Its pear and mango fruits are balanced by a tender touch of acidity. The wine can be aged a year or two but can also be drunk now.
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2011 Cuvée Engel Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There's an intriguing hint of white pepper on the nose of this medium-bodied wine. Nectarine and citrus fruit dominate, finishing with a refreshing squirt of lime. Drink now.
Name: Brancott 2011 Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)

Description: A simple, spicy wine, it is rounded and creamy. It tastes of pepper and lychee fruits, with a soft, full character. The richness is well balanced with the acidity. A wine that can be drunk now.
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2011 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This young wine emulates the style of Northeast Italy in its tart, grassy flavors. The fruit treads toward light melon and green apple. It's crisp and refreshing.
Name: Apolloni 2012 Estate Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)

Description: This full-bodied Pinot Gris is admirably concentrated, boasting an almost pulpy texture and ample pear, peach and pineapple fruit. The only quibble is that it shows a touch of warmth on the finish.
Name: Mt. Difficulty 2011 Bannockburn Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: A forward, rich wine, full of ripe fruits, peaches and honey. It has weight while also keeping a fine sense of fresh acidity that cuts the full-bodied character of the wine. It's not for long-term aging.
Name: Willm 2012 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The full, rich nature of Alsace Pinot Gris is perfectly—and simply—expressed in this full wine. With its exotic fruits, rounded texture and perfumed spice, it has just an edge of sweetness that turns it into a great wine for Thai or Chinese food. Screwcap.
Name: René Sparr 2011 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Coming from the warm, dry 2012 vintage, this is straight down the fairway with notes of apple, pear and herbs, with the alcohol providing some distraction on the finish.
Name: Foris 2012 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: With light, tropical aromas of melon and mango combined with a juicy, clean palate, this is a good PG. Peach, nectarine, melon and papaya flavors finish with citrus notes. Drink this patio white as soon as possible.
Name: François Lurton 2013 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Pinot Gris (Uco Valley)

Description: While there is some spice here, the wine is more dominated by its acidity, fresh pear and crisp texture. It's lively, fragrant and probably best as an apéritif.
Name: Cave de Cleebourg NV Clérotstein Brut Pinot Gris (Crémant d'Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a sharp, grassy Pinot Gris, which does more than a gentle bow in the direction of Sauvignon Blanc. Herbaceous, peppery and penetrating, it's green and acidic, yet flavorful and a resonant food wine also.
Name: Emerson 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A soft, rounded, spicy wine with ripe flavors, light on the acidity, generous with the lychee and mango fruit. Full and rounded and ready to drink now.
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2011 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Very soft wine, with honeyed apples and light acidity. The wine is already showing signs of maturity, with an opulent texture and only a hint of perfumed acidity.
Name: Frey-Sohler 2011 Rittersberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This would seem to reflect a fairly significant stylistic shift from previous vintages. Here the influence of malolactic fermentation yields a soft, buttery wine with aromas of microwave popcorn. This is a winemaker choice, but yields a Pinot Gris that has lost much of its typical pear and apple fruit, and carries some bitterness in the finish.
Name: Coelho 2012 Renovação Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is a bit funky for a New Zealand Pinot Gris, offering hints of onion on the nose and some earthy notes to go with its melon and citrus flavors. The mouthfeel is rather full and rich, but there's a hint of nut-skin bitterness on the finish.
Name: Marisco Vineyards 2011 The King's Thorn Waihopai Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Nobody ever said Argentina was Pinot Grigio country. This wine is yellow in color, with aromas of haystack and wheat. There's acidity to keep it upright, but flavors of briny citrus do little to bring it around.
Name: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2012 Lote 44 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brief skin contact during fermentation gives this appropriately named, single-vineyard (The Benches) rosé it's pretty pale-salmon color. It's immediately appealing, with notes of melon and strawberry, and just a hair off-dry, with a rich, textured feel.
Name: Julia's Dazzle 2012 Rosé Pinot Grigio (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Certainly among the most unusual wines from this vineyard, here is a Pinot Gris with 30 g/L residual sugar and alcohol under 11%. There is sufficient acidity—along with the minerality that the vineyard is known for—to keep the flavors of citrus rind and flesh well rounded and buoyant. Sweet enough to pair with a fruity dessert.
Name: Convergence Zone 2012 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Drizzle Pinot Gris (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's plenty of fresh, ripe tree fruit goodness here, along with citrus streaks of lemon, lime and grapefruit. The acidity is what gives the wine its lift and verve.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2012 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Pinot Gris, given 20 hours of skin contact, resulting in a “Gris de Gris” style of blush wine. It's light and dry, with strong scents and flavors of grapefruit.
Name: Castillo de Feliciana 2012 Vino Verano Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, with light citrus fruit flavors along with sliced pear. The wine is a bit of a featherweight; even the label describes it as “lemon chiffon,” which is entirely accurate.
Name: Wind Rose 2012 Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An appealing, medium sweet Pinot Gris with notes of red apple and spice with a medium-bodied, oily feel.
Name: Summit Estates 2012 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Coming mostly from 1975 plantings of Pinot Gris at Celilo Vineyard, it's light and lively with notes of apple and pear. Though it has just over 2 g/L of residual sugar, it drinks bone dry—it's almost austere—with Celilo's steely acidity.
Name: Ross Andrew 2011 Celilo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Slightly sweet, with strong pineapple flavors, this lightly candied style brings in streaks of apricot and orange also. It's penetrating and distinctive, with lush fruit flavors that set it apart from most other Oregon Pinot Gris.
Name: David Hill 2012 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Coeur de Terre consistently offers a  Pinot Gris that is fine-tuned, aromatic and elegant. The fruit is ripe enough, but remains tart and spicy, with bracing texture and fine focus. Crisp apple, pear and citrus is given a bit of a ginger/cinnamon snap through the finish, with highlights of cotton candy and orange peel.
Name: Coeur de Terre 2012 Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Done in a racy, high acid style, this flavorful Pinot Gris offers melon and white peach fruit, with highlights of gin-like botanicals. It's textural and gently ripe, but delivers a lot of complexity.
Name: Hawks View 2011 Hawks View Vineyard Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Loaded with scents and flavors of grapefruit, this leesy, textural Pinot Gris is bracing and mouth-filling. It's definitely on the tart side, but could be paired with a wide variety of fish and poultry dishes.
Name: Raptor Ridge 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: An aromatically distinctive wine, with notes of peanut shells, dried apricot, and lees. A hair off dry, it's broad and textured, with vibrant acidity, finishing just a touch bitter.
Name: Sineann 2012 Wy'East Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: This is a young, yeasty wine with a scent of fresh citrus. Lemon and grapefruit are the main flavors, with a textural, refreshing mouthfeel and a hint of minerality.
Name: Anne Amie 2012 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: An elegant wine with low alcohol yet clean, crisp, persistent flavors, this captures both melon and pear fruit, with peach blossom highlights. Call it a Euro style; it's fresh and subtle.
Name: Vista Hills 2011 Treehouse Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fragrant in fruity melon, fig and lime, La Folia's done a nice job with this Pinot Grigio, producing something that's crisp yet full, integrated, round and lush yet zippy in acidity. Pair with pasta, salads and veggies of all kinds.
Name: La Folia Winery 2012 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This pleasant Pinot Gris has melon fruit flavors with a hint of kiwi. Fresh, and ready for near-term enjoyment.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This is a clean, steady, tropical style of Pinot Grigio that offers basic apple and peach aromas. The palate feels citrusy but mild, with fresh but simple flavors of orange and vanilla.
Name: Argento 2012 Cool Climate Selection Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: Minerally melon and citrus aromas are good and lead to a nice, creamy feeling palate with a full mix of lime, melon, apple, green herb and spice flavors. This is round and lightly citric on the finish. Drink immediately.
Name: François Lurton 2012 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Pinot Gris (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Aromatically awash with apple and melon aromas, this Parducci Pinot Gris is fleshy and creamy with a nice stone-tinged finish and priced quite nicely to boot.
Name: Parducci 2012 Small Lot Blend Pinot Gris (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Unique in style and sourced—these are the oldest Pinot Gris vines in the country—this young, yeasty, textural wine will surely continue to improve in the bottle. Give it a lot of breathing time, and complex layers of rock and fruit unfold. Jicama, cucumber, daikon radish...You get the idea. It tastes as clean and fresh as a mountain spring.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2011 Original Vines Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely tree fruits and a hint of honeycomb come through in this well-balanced Pinot Gris. It offers both easy drinkability and surprising depth of flavor, with a lingering finish that should cost you significantly more.
Name: Château Bianca 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Grauburgunder, aka Pinot Gris from warm vineyards, giving a rich, unctuous texture, a lightly perfumed character that also maintains freshness and attractive acidity. Keep for six months. Screwcap.
Name: Neumeister 2011 Steirische Klassik Grauburgunder (Südoststeiermark)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pretty aromas of citrus blossom and rind lead into puckery fruit flavors. There's a finishing twist of grapefruit and orange peel, good balance, and a bit more acidity than is customary even for this producer.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2011 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this is a lightly aromatic Gris with red apple and apple blossom. It's full bodied with a touch of residual sugar and a zip of acidity. A light ale note makes it seem not entirely finished.
Name: Wy'East Vineyards 2012 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is straight down the fairway, clean and simple with medium to full bodied yellow apple notes and a touch of residual sugar.
Name: Canoe Ridge 2012 The Expedition Pinot Gris Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: An aromatically reticent wine with notes of mineral, apple, and spice. It drinks just a hair off-dry with tart green apple flavors and sharp edged acids making for a pleasant summer afternoon sipper.
Name: Pyrenees 2011 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: A soapy scent marks the entry, and it is followed by a simple, fruity wine, that retains a slightly soapy aspect through the palate. There's a floral finish also; perhaps a splash of Gewürztraminer was added to the blend?
Name: Hedgeline 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Thin and sour, this offers little enjoyment. Lemon juice flavors lack flesh and substance. Best for shellfish or perhaps a mussel stew.
Name: Torii Mor 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lightly spritzy, and still showing a hint of yeast, though it's from the 2010 vintage, this is a light, lively, bright and spicy Pinot Gris. It's wonderfully fresh and versatile, with flavors of tree fruits and brioche, nicely melded and proportionate.
Name: Wine o'Clock 2010 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Not noticeably sweet, despite its low alcohol, this is a bowl full of crisp, green apple fruit. Clean and simple.
Name: Lazy River 2011 Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Much as with the winery's Sauvignon Blanc, the searing, almost sour acidity is the hallmark of this wine. Here it turns so lemony and simple that it loses a bit of varietal character.
Name: Carlton Cellars 2011 Cannon Beach Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The added Viognier (9%) lifts the notes of pear, apple, and peach on this medium-bodied, flavorful Pinot Gris. Finishes with a touch bitter.
Name: RoxyAnn 2011 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this Pinot Gris—a blend of Henry Estate and Westbrook Vineyard—has light notes of yellow and red apple. It drinks just a touch off dry with a lemon-pith note on the finish.
Name: Henry Estate 2010 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Crisp and very floral, this is a beautiful showcase of Anderson Valley's cool climate and commitment to Alsatian varieties. There's a great depth of flavor here—fig, grapefruit, lime and orange peel—not to mention tremendous minerality. This is a wine that can be sipped all day long or enjoyed with fish, poultry or an onion tart.
Name: Handley 2011 Helluva Vineyard Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: This bracing, minerally Pinot Gris is perfect for hot weather; racy and crisp citrus rind and fresh grapefruit flavors abound. It's made with organically grown grapes from the estate vineyard.
Name: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2011 Pinot Gris

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With fruit sources split between Wallula and Canyon Vineyard Ranch vineyards, this off-dry (3.6 g/L residual sugar), enjoyable Pinot Gris is medium bodied with notes of lime, pineapple and petroleum jelly.
Name: Blue Pirate 2011 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A stylistic offering of Pinot Gris with notes of spice, marzipan and lees along with lemony, sharp-edged acids. Not for everyone, but has much to enjoy.
Name: Vin du Lac 2010 LEHM Pinot Gris (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an aromatic offering of Pinot Grigio with generous notes of freshly cut red and green apple along with pear. Medium bodied, it drinks just a touch off dry with mouthwatering acidity and a real sense of freshness.
Name: Sockeye 2011 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of matchstick, tropical fruits and stalkiness are a bit challenging. In the mouth, things feel solid and fresh, while flavors of sweet pear, melon, vanilla and apricot settle on mildly bitter come finishing time.
Name: Argento 2011 Cool Climate Selection Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: This Grigio opens with mild lemon and apple aromas that transition into a flabby palate and dull flavors of buttercup, banana and apple.
Name: Trapiche 2011 Reserve Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: Notes of musk, baked apple, citrus and spice are warm and mysterious on the nose of this penetrating Slovenian Pinot Grigio. Intense and fruity on the palate, this has ripe apple and pear flavors, with layers of honey, dark flower, caramel and tea that add complexity.
Name: Movia 2008 Pinot Grigio (Brda)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A musky perfume note is sultry and exotic in this rich, textured Pinot Grigio, which was fermented on its skins and matured in oak. The fruity palate offers penetrating dried-pear, nut oil and apple flavors, which are layered with citrusy acids and soft, tea-leaf-like tannins that linger on the finish.
Name: Channing Daughters 2011 Ramato Pinot Grigio (Long Island)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This cool-climate Pinot Gris is balanced and light, and it offers refreshing layers of citrus, almond and peach. It will pair with goat cheese and seafood-based appetizers, and it will also be enjoyed on its own
Name: Navarro 2011 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Ste. Michelle's reliable Pinot Gris has lively, crisp and spritzy qualities, and it boasts flavors of melon and pear. There was 4% Viognier added to the mix, which has contributed a pleasing floral aroma.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2011 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A darker expression of Pinot Gris than the winery's new Marguerite Vineyard bottling, this wine, which is made from fruit grown at lower elevation, sees no oak, and it's crafted without malolactic fermentation. Pronounced notes of almond and vanilla are layered over touches of peach and melon.
Name: Philo Ridge 2010 Klindt Vineyard Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A cool-climate Pinot Gris, this is a finely tuned citrusy white, with crisp notes of peach and apricot. This is the winery's first release that's made from Marguerite Vineyard fruit. It spent no time in oak and malolactic fermentation was blocked, which helped to preserve an impressive amount of acidity.
Name: Philo Ridge 2010 Marguerite Vineyard Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aroma of fresh-cut pear introduces this clean, tart, fresh Pinot Gris. There is little in the way of complexity, but the purity of the fruit is impressive.
Name: Mercer 2011 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: The fruit that was used to make this Pinot Grigio was sourced from a High Valley vineyard situated at an elevation of 2,000 feet. The resulting wine is full of citrus and green apple aromas and flavors. The finish shows a touch of sweetness.
Name: Ramspeck 2011 Sassolini Pinot Grigio (Lake County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Creamy and leesy, with a complex mix of mineral, fresh herb, citrus rind and pungent botanicals, this is an interesting and refreshing style of Pinot Gris. Give it a good chill and watch it open as it warms.
Name: Spindrift Cellars 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bright and spicy, this has flavors of melon and pear. Balanced throughout, it finishes with a lightly toasty accent. Superb winemaking shines here.
Name: Adelsheim 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Hibiscus and honeysuckle scents highlight the bouquet, while the palate bears flavors of pears and spices, buoyed by natural acidity. Aging in 30% (neutral) barrels puts some extra flesh on its bones.
Name: Carabella 2011 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tart and tangy, with cleansing acidity, this is a Pinot Gris ready for fresh shellfish, oysters, and mussels. The lemony fruit is marked by a touch of pineapple, showing good focus, concentration and length.
Name: Westrey 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This delivers a bit of extra grip and weight compared to the widely-available Three Vineyard bottling. Pear and peach fruit flavors are lightly toasty, leading into a full-flavored midpalate and a medium-long finish.
Name: Chehalem 2010 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is appealing for its flavors of fresh-sliced Bosch pear, plus a pear-like graininess on the palate. It has some residual sugar, just enough to round out the acids, and overall it's a nicely balanced wine drinking very well right now.
Name: Redhawk 2011 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Although the 2011 vintage was difficult, Foris did particularly well with this lightly spicy, fruit-laden Pinot Gris. True varietal flavors of pear and apple are perfectly set against vivid acidity.
Name: Foris 2011 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Clean and easy drinking, this is created using a fruit from all three estate vineyards. Lightly spicy apple, pear and peach flavors combine gracefully, giving the wine a solid and appealingly fruity core.
Name: Chehalem 2011 Three Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The same Bell as the well-known Napa Valley winery, Bell extends its reach into Oregon to make this lip-smackingly good Pinot Gris. Gooseberry, melon, kiwi and grapefruit flavors swirl across the tongue, leaving a clean, fresh and very fruity wake. The moderate alcohol is an added bonus.
Name: Bell 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Lovely notes of fresh-cut pear, pear skin and a bit of melon highlight this nicely defined wine. It's a showcase for an emerging style of Pinot Gris, which Oregon has made its own.
Name: Erath 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This bears clean and crisp pear flavors, along with notes of jicama, green apple and lemon rind. It offers good detail in an elegant, unassuming style.
Name: Melrose 2010 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Stainless fermented and aged, this tart, apple-flavored Pinot Gris is close to fresh cider in flavor. The alcohol is low enough that it is almost invisible. Just pure, juicy, clean fruit comes through.
Name: Illahe 2011 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fruity and tasting of lemon, melon and pineapple, this clean and fresh Pinot Gris offers fair value for the price. It tastes slightly off dry.
Name: Abiqua Wind 2011 Caleb Knorr Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This has lemony and slightly bitter citrus-skin flavors that are made for fresh seafood and shellfish. Notes of tart lemon and green pineapple are matched by the substantial acids.
Name: Winter's Hill 2011 Estate Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: It's difficult to understand what this is trying to be. Pinot Gris can show some light blush color, but this wine is almost pink. The result is tannic and tart, with a rhubarb-like flavor.
Name: Erath 2011 Dion Vineyard Rosé Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This seems to have some residual sugar, as there is a grainy, sugary aspect to the light pear and melon flavors. It doesn't quite come together.
Name: Deer Creek 2011 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Crisp and bright, this fruit-driven, estate-grown Pinot Gris is still showing some youthful yeastiness, but the fresh flavors of apple and pear shine through. A fine example of an emerging Washington style for this variety.
Name: Kestrel 2011 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: This impressively rich wine, with impeccable balance, has acidity and ripe, spicy fruit in great accord. It's dry, with its acidity cutting through the complex texture. It should certainly age over several years.
Name: René Muré 2010 Clos Saint-Landelin Vorbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This ripe, full, almost toasty wine tastes of tropical fruit and spice, giving it an exotic feel. At the same time, the right amount of acidity acts as a fine balance. This concentrated wine, medium-sweet in style, should be aged for 2–3 years.
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2010 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Though not indicated as such on its label, this is a sweet wine. It has spiced, ripe fruit flavors, notably pear, which are deliciously laced with honey and cinnamon notes. There is also a fine streak of lively acidity that keeps this very fresh.
Name: Château d'Orschwihr 2008 Zinnkoepflé Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A rich, sweet, honeyed wine, this is full and ripe. It has a style to it, its sweetness and acidity in balance. There is just a hint of dry spice complementing the apricot and lemon flavors. Ready to drink.
Name: Rieflé 2009 Zinnkoepflé Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A ripe melon aroma follows through to a wine that is rich, open and generous. While it misses some freshness and acidity, its ripe, rounded fruit flavors are an enjoyable compensation. For short-term aging.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2010 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The Adam family has been producing wine since 1674, a legacy that is distilled into this delicate, ripe, and fruity wine. It has an elegant balance between its acidity and its dried apricot flavor. Give this attractive wine a few months more in bottle.
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2011 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This dry, spicy wine has its white fruit flavor layered over attractive acidity. It feels firm, and its flavors of almond and lychee are balanced with an austere structure. Give this wine at least three years.
Name: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar 2009 Hengst Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Winery: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar

Description: This rich, sweet wine is honeyed, with a crisp, balancing lemon character. It is full and rich, touched by spice as well as mango and yellow peach. A delicious dessert wine, this is now ready to drink.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2007 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In 2007, this was produced as a late-harvest wine. In 2010, by contrast, it is a crisp, apple- and pear-flavored wine. It has bright fruit, lively acidity and just an edge of sweetness.
Name: Emile Beyer 2010 Lieu dit Hohrain Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a rich, intense wine, its spice and pepper characters mingling with ripe tangerine and peach notes. It is full, round and concentrated. The pure fruit character is delicious, though it could age a year.
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2010 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a delicate Pinot Gris, medium-sweet in style, taking its cue from the baked apple flavor and fragrant acidity. A touch of spice gives a counterpoint to the refreshing aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2008 Marckrain Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Showing dryness in its pepper and spice characters, this is a full-bodied, weighty wine. Dried fruit and lychee combine with a toasty, almond-flavored edge. Worth aging a year.
Name: André Kientzler 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Here's a wine that is rich and full bodied, tending toward dryness while still retaining all the ripe, spicy Pinot Gris character. It has apple, lychee and mango flavors, nicely mingling together, leaving a fresh, crisp finish.
Name: Emile Beyer 2010 L'Hostellerie Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This medium-dry wine is rich and rounded. It has concentrated flavors of spice, mango, crisp lime and ripe apple. Full-bodied and rounded, it has a good shot of acidity.
Name: Meyer-Fonné 2011 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Finely balanced, this has attractively honeyed aromas that lead to apricot, honey, lemon and light spice flavors. The wine is warm, yet with just the right acidity to keep it fresh.
Name: André Blanck et ses Fils 2010 Clos Schwendi Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This dry Pinot Gris relies on its richness for power and concentration. From the steep, hillside Schlumberger Vineyards, this is dense and spicy; its acidity and minerality are essential to its character. Age for a year, or drink now.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2009 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This takes a while to open up and fully convey its rich, sweet fruit. Then the honey and rosewater flavors emerge, along with a note of peppered spice. It is rich and relatively dry—very much a food wine.
Name: Domaine Ehrhart 2010 Im Berg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Dry, spicy and rich, this is a pepper- and nutmeg-flavored wine. The ripe pear and melon flavors are concentrated and dense; the structure taut and minerally in character. It's a wine to age for 1–2 years.
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2009 Rosenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clean and leesy, this estate-grown Pinot Gris has a crisp mineral underpinning. Light celery and green melon flavors are balanced, showing good length and some finishing complexity.
Name: Gård 2011 Lawrence Vineyards Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This dry Pinot Gris is lightly smoky, with fine acidity and rich, spicy fruit. It has a dense texture and full mouthfeel, with a concentrated finish that's marked by passion fruit and lychee notes.
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2009 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In the dry Léon Beyer style, this is a dense, spice and lychee-flavored wine. It has richness, elegance and a deliciously pure acidity that cuts the ripeness.
Name: Leon Beyer 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rich, soft and spicy, here is a warm, now-mature style of Pinot Gris. Its ripe melon and peach flavors complement the lychee note. There is a touch of pepper that gives an edge to this rounded wine.
Name: Hugel 2008 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though listed at a rather potent 13.8% alcohol, this can only be called delicate, with flavors reminiscent of Pinot Blanc as much as Pinot Gris. Pleasing apple and pear flavors show excellent concentration and balance, with just a faint tinge of finishing heat.
Name: Wapato Point Cellars 2011 Pinot Grigio (Lake Chelan)

Description: This smooth, rounded Pinot Gris has just the right spice, acidity and warm, rich texture. Drink now for both freshness and richness.
Name: Trimbach 2008 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fine, vivid, crystal-clear Pinot Gris, this offers cool cucumber and melon flavors first and foremost. It's a refreshing addition to the white wine lineup at H3.
Name: Columbia Crest 2010 H3 Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Intense, complex and full-bodied, this is a powerful Pinot Gris. It has weight and richness, providing both fruitiness and a ripe texture. Ready to drink, with the acidity lifting the finish.
Name: Rieflé 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Delicate on the attack, with gentle orange blossom and honeyed lemon flavors, this mineral-driven Pinot Grigio builds in intensity and tangerine fruitiness on the palate. It finishes crisp, with tonic lime pith and herb notes.
Name: Sivi 2011 Pinot Populus Pinot Grigio (Vipavska Dolina)

Description: This lightly perfumed wine is full bodied and packed with ripe quince and mango flavors. There is just a touch of pepper, which is balanced by the acidity and edgy texture. Give the wine a year to age further, or drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine Zinck 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is an attractive, fruity wine, expressing the spice and ripe fruit character of Pinot Gris. It is rich and full bodied, its white fruit mingles with notes of mango and ginger.
Name: Hugel 2009 Classic Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Toward the dry end of the spectrum, this is a wine that contrasts rich, spicy fruit with lively acidity. Ripe and crisp, very fruity, it is ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2009 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a medium-sweet style of Pinot Gris from the Beblenheim cooperative. It is fruity, with a touch of spice complementing the creamed pear and lychee flavors. On the finish, acidity mingles with a honey note. Screwcap.
Name: Cave de Beblenheim 2010 Baron de Hoen Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of honey and yellow fruit give this wine both sweetness and softness. It has weight and a rich mouthfeel, powered by a warm and rounded texture. There is just a touch of dryness at the heart of what is otherwise a medium-sweet wine.
Name: Willm 2011 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This Pinot Gris is on the dry side, but it still retains a spice note and a rich, fruity texture. It has weight and concentrated white fruit, needing a few months to develop and round out further. Screwcap.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2011 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A tasty mix of fresh fruit flavors—including melon, peach and nectarine—this is sourced in part from Snipes Mountain's excellent Upland Vineyard. Aged in 100% stainless steel, it's balanced and tight, with good snap to the finish.
Name: Vin du Lac 2011 Grisant! Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This ripe, fruity wine has just the right touches of acidity and spice. Made by the cooperative of Eguisheim, this is crisp and fragrant. It's ready to drink now, but could age for a year.
Name: Wolfberger 2011 Signature Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This sweet wine, almost gold in color, is ripe and round. Honey and peach notes complement spice and white pepper flavors. It is soft, rich and ready to drink. Its label does not warn of its sweetness.
Name: Domaine Ernest Burn 2009 Le Dauphin Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rich, ripe and medium sweet, this is characterized by its pure fruit flavors, which are dominated by notes of orange zest, honey and crisp lime. It has a tight, bright texture, leading to a fine, fragrant and spicy finish.
Name: Cave de Hunawihr 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The name of this wine playfully refers to the fact that storks still nest in the chimneys of Alsace. It is rich, full, soft, with notes of pepper and dried apricot, plus ample sweetness. The acidity helps to cut the richness, making it food friendly.
Name: Frédéric Mallo 2009 Special Delivery Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: While the back label suggests that this wine is dry, it seems to taste sweet. It has honey and ripe apricot flavors that are lifted by the fresh acidity. The wine is all fruitiness—ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2010 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A medium-bodied, middle-of-the-road Pinot Grigio, this has lemon-tinged acidity and a bit of barrel weight in its texture. It's floral, with almond and pear notes on the palate. This is a simple, worthy alternative to Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Monte Volpe 2011 Pinot Grigio (Mendocino County)

Description: This is fresh and fruity, with hints of spice and pear, plus an attractive layer of crisp acidity. Ready to drink.
Name: Jean Becker 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a wine that seems to veer between sweetness and dryness. It has spice and a dry, peppery edge, as well as an underlying character that's marked by rich, sweet, honeyed fruit. At this stage, it should be showing more balance.
Name: Martin Schaetzel 2009 Kaefferkopf Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Right on the border of being a dessert wine, this unusual Pinot Gris has 2.8% residual sugar. It's betwixt and between—not really sweet enough for dessert, but too sweet for most other food. A simple sipping wine, perhaps?
Name: Goose Ridge 2011 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Sweet and soft, this is full of tropical fruit, with attractive, accessible acidity adding a crisp touch.
Name: Ruhlmann 2010 Tête de Cuvée Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a soft, simple and fruity wine. Round and gently boosted by the final acidity, it tastes of pear.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2011 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is unbalanced, with its acidity giving a sharp edge to the ripe fruit. Its character is curiosly both sweet and dry. Made from selected parcels around Ribeauvillé.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2010 Comtes by Hubert Keller Terroirs Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The spice and fruit of this wine fall subordinate to a stale almond flavor. The acidity is the saving grace.
Name: Wunsch & Mann 2009 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There's a stunning mineral-driven edge to this concentrated Pinot Grigio. Full bodied yet elegant, it boasts fresh pear and melon flavors and a bristling lime-juice acidity.
Name: Giocato 2011 Pinot Grigio (Primorska)

Description: This runs to the tart, lemony style of Pinot Gris, common in cool vintages. Citrus and gooseberry flavors are balanced against refreshing minerality, and the acidity is neither harsh nor simply sour.
Name: Acrobat 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Flavors of fresh apple and pear appear among light dusting of cinnamon spice. This makes for a wonderful quaffer.
Name: Seven of Hearts 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Savory notes of hazelnut skin and smoke are countered by crisp white-peach and tangerine flavors on this brisk, refreshing Pinot Gris. Dry in style with zesty acidity, it finishes on a faintly astringent note of lemon skin. Drink now.
Name: Szoke Matyás 2011 Pinot Gris (Mátra)

Description: A straightforward, subtle version of Pinot Grigio, light in alcohol, a good choice as an apéritif or as an accompaniment to a light lunch. A lean lemon quality dominates its flavors and aromas.
Name: Sorelle Winery 2010 Grazia Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: Notes of sun-dried hay and green flower highlight the nose and palate of this fresh, easy-quaffing wine. Concentrated tangerine and pineapple flavors are brisk and tasty.
Name: Cramele Recas 2011 UnWineD Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
