Description: Soft and lightly oaky, this barrel-fermented wine has a lightly honeyed element, perhaps an indication of botrytis. The wine should be consumed young, as it is already showing signs of age in both color and mouthfeel.
Name: Methven Family Vineyards 2011 Barrel Fermented Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This well-priced, light-bodied Pinot Grigio provides flavors of stone fruit—mostly apricot—with a tiny trace of petrol. It would make a fine apéritif, particularly alongside oysters or shrimp.
Name: Villa Toscano 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A light lime flavor comes with a pleasing hint of tangerine in this wine. It becomes quite slender as it rapidly runs into a slightly metallic finish.
Name: Benton-Lane 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Minerally and neutral on the nose, this tastes fresh and crisp like a green apple, with dry flavors of white fruit and bitter almond. It retains that almond character on the finish, which turns even drier and more bitter.
Name: Arauco 2011 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Central Valley)

Description: The nose introduces aromas of vanilla wafer and vegetable. This wine feels flabby and uncommitted, with bitter flavors of white fruit, green banana and white pepper. It is neither interesting nor exciting.
Name: Cremaschi Furlotti 2010 Reserva Pinot Grigio (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Herbal and grassy, with lots of juicy apple and lemon flavors, this is a dry, yet round and supple Pinot Gris. Effortlessly enjoyable, this finishes quite floral, with just a hint of savory nut skin and smoke.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2010 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With balance and grip, this lightly effervescent wine rolls from a pretty pear flavor into a light tropical fruit note. It's hard to beat at this price.
Name: Lone Birch 2011 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of honeycomb and beeswax add heft to the notes of fresh green flower and sweet citrus. Ripe yet elegantly composed, this has concentrated fruit flavors that extend onto a long, honeysuckle-kissed finish.
Name: Penguin Bay 2011 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy and herbal, with a palate reminiscent of Sauvignon Blanc, this blends a grassy aroma with a mix of citrus, apple and pear notes. It has excellent concentration through the midpalate, with a clean, fresh finish.
Name: Waterbrook 2011 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sweet-pea vines and green herbs add freshness to the perfumed flower and luscious peach-nectar notes. A classically-styled Pinot Gris, this is dry yet mouthfilling and rich. It finishes long, with notes of stone fruit and black tea leaves.
Name: Lakewood 2011 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Just a prickle of effervescence on the attack braces the palate for a shower of sweet lemon and apple flavors, with hints of fresh dill, white blossom and lime skin. Dry, lean and effortlessly elegant. Drink now.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2011 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe notes of stone fruit and apple blossom lend a lavish air to this dry yet penetrating Pinot Gris. It's big and voluptuous, but it finishes clean, with lingering minerality and a flash of green flower.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2010 Curry Creek Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This has concentrated apple, mango and lime skin notes that are shaded with tones of smoke, crushed chalk and white pepper. Round and rich on the palate, with a mouthfilling viscosity, it's balanced with a flash of lemony acidity and a tingling tea-leaf astringency.
Name: Inspire Moore 2011 Peace Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is a sweet streak running through the fleshy fruit flavors of pear and peach. This is pure Pinot Gris, balanced with high acidity, sweet fruit and slightly bitter flavors of skin and rind.
Name: Airfield Estates 2011 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly austere, this Pinot Gris is marked by aromas of orange blossom and cheese rind, with a crispness on the finish that resembles a ripe, green apple.
Name: Occasio 2011 Del Arroyo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Glimmers of saline, nuts and smoke add dimension to the sweet apple and lemon flavors. Brisk with acidity, it has a bright, refreshing profile overall. Drink now.
Name: Hosmer 2010 Pinot Gris (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Cool, crisp and tonic from start to finish, this is an easy-drinking wine with ample sweet apple and wildflower notes, with shades of smoke, hazelnut skins and delicate lime-juice acidity. Drink now.
Name: Belhurst 2010 Pinot Grigio (New York)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Dry yet lusciously mouth filling, this is subtly floral, with a hefty dose of fresh apple flavor. It's straightforward but pleasantly quaffable. Drink now.
Name: Goose Watch 2011 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a lean, tart, high-acid vintage for Washington State white wines. Hogue's reliable Pinot Grigio is herbaceous and clean, fresh and tangy.
Name: Hogue 2011 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A simple Pinot Grigio with a soft, fruity nose, this has a tropical and seemingly sweet personality. It's fresh tasting and fine for a party.
Name: Cable Car 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Savory in style, with a dusty, chalky minerality, this dry Pinot Gris is crisp and easygoing, with a freshly pressed apple flavor that's marked by whiffs of nut skin and smoke.
Name: Hector Wine Company 2011 Pinot Gris (Seneca Lake)

Description: This blend of 75% Pinot Grigio and 15% Vermentino is a light, simple quaff with some snap to it and not much on the finish.
Name: Peltier 2011 Hybrid Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fragrant with floral notes, lemony fruit and hints of apricot, this is a tangy, textural take on Pinot Gris. Fermented in stainless steel and released young, it retains a bright and stylish profile right through a lingering finish, with a touch of sweetness.
Name: Ponzi 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A glorious, grapefruity, lusciously fresh Pinot Gris, this new vintage from Seven Hills is made for a summer afternoon. This has notes of citrus and melon, with highlights of mint and a hint of pepper, keeping it lively and interesting all through the refreshing finish.
Name: Seven Hills 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though low in alcohol even by David Hill standards, this excellent Pinot Gris does not lack fruit or flavor. Ripe and tasting of pretty pear and orange fruit, it shows evidence of some well-balanced residual sugar. Vivid acidity cuts through to a satisfying finish.
Name: David Hill 2011 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This light and leesy wine has excellent focus and refreshing minerality. Flavors of melon and kiwi highlight a complex but delicate wine, with lingering flavors and refreshing crispness.
Name: Terrapin Cellars 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Aged in neutral French oak, this Pinot Gris retains a lively, palate-cleansing acidity. It's consistent in style and flavor with the regular bottling, but this has added depth and richness. Fruit flavors of sweet Macintosh apples give it a pretty finish.
Name: Lange 2011 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is a benchmark rendition of Pinot Gris. The flavors are fruit driven, with lime, apple and pear notes combining on the smooth, relatively soft midpalate. This is a consistent wine, even with its production level of 100,000 cases.
Name: King Estate 2011 Signature Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Tart and racy, this is a European-style, aromatic and elegant take on Pinot Gris. Whiffs of celery, apple and citrus rind lead into flavors of grapefruit and lychee. This is definitely a great apéritif wine to enjoy chilled.
Name: Coeur de Terre 2011 Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a brisk, minerally, quite fresh white wine. The cool vintage and low alcohol sets the flavors in the cucumber and apple corridor. Acids are firm but not sour; it's a fine white wine for summer sipping.
Name: Lange 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Bright, tangy flavors of grapefruit and pear are mixed with skin tannins and a hint of minerality. There's a slightly herbal edge, but this wine delivers a lot of flavor for the modest price.
Name: A to Z 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This is tart and steely, with a flavor of pear skin rather than pear flesh, along with a green apple note and a whiff of grapefruit. Sharply acidic, it's a wine that should pair well with spicy Asian cuisine.
Name: Kings Ridge 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Gin-like botanical nuances in the nose introduce a sharp, rather stiff and hard Pinot Gris. Grapefruit and lemon rind flavors, along with plenty of acidity, seem less ripe than the 14.3% alcohol would suggest.
Name: RoxyAnn 2010 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the best Pinot Gris yet from Jones; the grapes were sourced from the 2 Gun Vineyard in the upcoming Ancient Lakes region—a future American Viticultural Area. Leesy and creamy, it seduces with a layer of rich cream wrapped around bright orange and semitropical fruit flavors. It's full and fresh, and it lingers.
Name: Jones of Washington 2011 Estate Vineyards Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of melon and pear run into a smooth, full-bodied core of lovely fruit that's highlighted with a hint of fresh cream. Broad and mouthfilling, with excellent concentration, this is a fine example of Washington State Pinot Gris.
Name: Mercer 2010 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a well-made, delicately floral style of Pinot Grigio, with notes of apple blossoms, crisp tree fruits and bracing minerals that add length and texture.
Name: Wind Rose 2011 Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This excellent Pinot Gris balances aromas and flavors of citrus blossom and tart apple. Fermented in stainless steel, it retains firm acidity and a pleasing, textural finish.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2011 A Squared Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Steely and creamy at the same time, this is no shy Pinot Gris. It's got body and heft from its time spent in 100% French oak (none of it new), and tastes perfectly in balance, with delightful notes of honeysuckle, apricot and honey. This is a small production made from certified-organic grapes.
Name: Horse & Plow 2011 McFadden Farm Pinot Gris (Mendocino)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Lusciously textured and bursting with citrusy acidity, this combines savory tones of burnt sugar and apple cider with hints of fresh orange peel and white flower. Crushed stone and a tea leaf astringency linger on the finish.
Name: Channing Daughters 2010 Pinot Grigio (Long Island)

Description: With an opening whiff of peach fuzz, this is a full-bodied yet crisp Pinot Gris with tons of personaliy. A liquid version of ripe pear and vanilla crème brûlée, this is an impressive, easy and pleasing wine.
Name: Three Pears 2011 Pinot Gris (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a straightforward Pinot Gris with a handful of Muscat Canelli, which lends it some sweetness. There are pleasant notes of stone fruit throughout. This would be thoroughly enjoyable on a summer afternoon—either on its own or with crudités.
Name: Parducci 2010 Small Lot Blend Pinot Gris (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pleasant quaff displays flavors of mixed apple and crisp pear, with a suggestion of cucumber and green melon. A great summer sipper.
Name: Blue Pirate 2010 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is crisp and tangy, with a slightly beer-accented nose. Cucumber and apple flavors are found, with a touch of canned asparagus.
Name: Boomtown 2011 Pinot Gris (Washington)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The grapes used for this wine are from the original vines, planted almost 50 years ago by David Lett. Rich, sleek and textural, this thrilling effort sets a new standard for Oregon Pinot Gris. Grassy notes are married to lush citrus and apple fruit. The flavors go deep and long, the finish is immaculate and brings a palate-refreshing minerality.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2010 Estate Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Sweet, rich and beautifully rounded, this opulent and mature, with lychee and apricot flavors all tinged by acidity. It feels powerful and dense while remaining supremely elegant.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2007 Kitterlé Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A lovely example of dry Marlborough Pinot Gris, with plenty of weight and a round, creamy texture that sets it apart. Pear and melon notes on the nose and palate blend with hints of honey, clove and plenty of indefinable spice. It's ready to drink now, but should hold for 2–3 years.
Name: Huia 2010 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The pretty nose is richly scented with fresh, crisp grapefruit. There is also a hint of petrol and a peppery, rye-seed component. This is stylish and long, and the fruit is clean and deep. The spicy finish leaves you longing for another sip.
Name: Eight Bells 2010 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Ripe, spicy and honeyed, this has an almost-sweet character that just remains dry. Its concentrated lychee, apricot and sultana flavors meld into the rich, dense texture. Age for 3–4 years.
Name: Domaine Mersiol 2008 Les Pierres Franches Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rich and perfumed, this is a rotund and smooth wine. It has light spice, followed by ripe flavors of tropical fruit and almond, with a crisp layer of acidity. The finish has a full mouthfeel, with a spice note.
Name: Vignoble des 2 Lunes 2009 Sélénite Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Since this wine weighs in at 14% abv and still retains more than 17 g/L of residual sugar, the fruit was clearly very ripe. That ripeness is reflected in the flavors as well, which feature nectarine and honey accented by hints of white pepper. It's full bodied and lush, with a long finish that mingles the sensations of sweet and spicy. Drink now.
Name: Forrest 2010 Tatty Bogler Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: This is the first release from Rainstorm, part of the expanding Mariani Family presence in the Pacific Northwest. It's bone dry, immaculately fresh, and lees-aged, with lovely depth and finesse. Flavors of melon and cucumber dominate, and the crisp acidity offers bracing minerality.
Name: Rainstorm 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: A full-bodied, lushly textured wine with aromas and flavors that hint at peach or nectarine, honey and vanilla. This is just slightly off dry (8 g/L residual sugar), but that sweetness is balanced with a bit of tartness and a dash of white pepper on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Greywacke 2010 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: With its gold color, this looks like an opulent wine—a fact confirmed on the palate. It remains essentially dry; its opulence translated into great swathes of perfumed tropical fruits. It has weight, the sort of wine to go with rich sauces—or even by itself.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2007 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A full-bodied and fruity wine that's packed with acidity as well as smooth, creamy tropical fruits. It is ripe and accessible now, yet with its drier structure it is likely to age for several years.
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2010 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Marked by a slight effervescence, this clean and refreshing wine is perfect for warm weather. Light citrus, cucumber and melon flavors mingle in a balanced wine that has excellent structure and length.
Name: Raptor Ridge 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Spicy, with a creamy texture, this has richness without being overwhelming. The acidity cuts through the wine, lending a combination of richness and excellent crispness.
Designation: Domaine du Château de Riquewihr Les Maquisards
Name: Dopff & Irion 2008 Domaine du Château de Riquewihr Les Maquisards Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Although this is dry, the wine's honey aromas and opulent texture point to richness. It's smooth, with weight and peach flavor. On the finish, all of the richness is balanced by refreshing acidity.
Name: Domaine Mersiol 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This full-bodied, off-dry wine represents a pretty good value in the current market. The flavors hint at peach, melon and citrus but finish clean and refreshing despite evident sweetness.
Name: Seifried 2010 Pinot Gris (Nelson)

Description: This offers quality that's almost the equal of Seifried's primary label Pinot Gris for a couple dollars less. Melon rind, pineapple and cinnamon notes are pervasive. This is plump and expansive on the palate, yet remains focused through the soft, elegant finish.
Name: Seifried 2010 Old Coach Road Pinot Gris (Nelson)

Description: This dry style of Pinot Gris has a rich character, which allows the spice to come through strongly—the acidity lingering behind. Flavors of tropical fruits are allied to the smooth, ripe finish.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2010 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Loaded with fruit—apricot, pineapple and passion fruit—this is an attractive, medium-bodied Pinot Gris with just a hint of sweetness. Enjoy it over the next year.
Name: Mt. Difficulty 2011 Roaring Meg Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: This is a full-bodied, soft and round style of Pinot Gris that's almost completely dry. Understated pear and melon aromas combine with hints of fern fronds to create an enchanting bouquet, while the flavors are more straightforward and fruity. Drink now.
Name: Jules Taylor 2011 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Soft and attractively spicy, this has flavors of fresh apple, exotic mango and kiwi. Along with this fruitiness is a perfumed character that rounds out the finish. Screwcap.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2010 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Aromas of green apple, melon, pear and a hint of Meyer lemon introduce this tart and flavorful Pinot Gris. It's lightly spiced, fruity and compact.
Name: Coelho 2011 Estate Renovação Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Rich and spicy wine, this has a smooth character. Just beginning to soften, it feels ripe and full, bearing a white currant flavor, with a pinch of nutmeg.
Name: Bott Frères 2010 Cuvée Particulière Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This weaves spicy melon and pear flavors into a soft, smooth, fleshy and fruity core. Forward and accessible, it's best served chilled.
Name: Grandmaster 2011 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: A smooth, just-spicy wine that has some light acidity to go with its tropical fruit character. While it is rich, it also has a light touch, finishing with attractive crispness.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2010 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A wine that hints at spice, this is mainly floral, with a yellow fruit flavor and a ripe, full-bodied feel.
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2011 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a straightforward, clean, fruity wine, with a green apple flavor.
Name: Eola Hills 2010 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Fresh, with an attractive line of acidity that complements the spice and rich texture. It's dry on the finish, remaining crisp and ripe. This is a real food wine.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2010 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Dry and medium bodied, this features ample apple and citrus notes, accented by hints of chalk dust and spice. Drink it over the next six months.
Name: Lake Chalice 2010 Eyrie Vineyard Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: The Hawke's Bay region isn't known for its Pinot Gris, but this is a solid example at a very reasonable price. It's citrusy and very nearly dry, giving an overall impression that's a bit lean. Probably best with seafood dishes. Drink now.
Name: Sileni 2011 Cellar Selection Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: With a mix of melon and cucumber flavors, this is not-quite-ripe tasting. Clean and quaffable, it has a hint of alcoholic warmth on the palate.
Name: Agate Ridge 2010 Estate Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Yeasty, with beery aromatics, this has slightly sweet, tangy flavors of grapefruit and soda pop. Give it more time in the bottle to meld together.
Name: LaVelle 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied Pinot Gris is nearly dry in style, with crisp acids that give it a somewhat angular feel. Melon and citrus notes finish with a slightly bitter hint of orange pith. Drink now.
Name: Maude 2010 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Quite light and tart, this has simple fruit flavors of light citrus and melon. The finish turns a bit plastic tasting.
Name: Siltstone 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is gorgeous, with flavors of hazelnut, pear and ripe green apple. It's crisp, balanced and perfectly sweetened. Mixed with vodka and fresh fruit juices, it also makes a fine cocktail.
Name: Occasio 2010 Angelica Pinot Gris (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A beautiful, minerally Pinot Grigio just faintly sweet but entirely refreshing. It tastes of barely ripe apricot, lemon and grapefruit rind. Aged entirely in stainless steel.
Name: Forenzo 2010 Pinot Grigio (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pretty wine, with flavors of flowers and cream that have some heft. The finish is austere yet refreshing, with a lemony note. Easy drinking, this is a Pinot Gris that would pair well with tangy seafood.
Name: Fenestra 2010 Pinot Gris (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Delicate, but nicely concentrated, with flower and fruit nicely integrated. Meyer lemon, tangerine, pear and even a hint of candied papaya mingle beautifully, set in a fine-tuned frame of acid and mineral.
Name: Oak Knoll 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Zippy and fruity, bursting with bright, palate-cleansing grapefruit and citrus, this excellent effort is further bolstered by bracing minerality and a barely perceptible hint of sweetness. All in all a thrilling ride on the Oregon Pinot Gris roller coaster.
Name: Soléna 2010 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A tart and beautifully-defined mix of apple and pear fruit, with a steely spine and dappled baking spices. Excellent balance and mouthfeel, with a finishing mineral note.
Name: Cristom 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This elegant and detailed Pinot Gris offers fresh floral accents around spicy, toasty, well-mixed fruit. Pear and orange fruit flavors carry just a slight hint of honey, and the concentrated finish extends into a long, clean fade-out.
Name: Carabella 2010 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The fruit shines here—pears and apples aplenty—with textural notes of citrus rind. Balanced, with medium length, it's a young, clean, lip-smacking style, with more density than most Oregon Pinot Gris.
Name: Adelsheim 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Some spritzy bubbles and a yeasty flavor confirm that this is quite young and fresh, certainly the best time to enjoy it. The color is almost translucent, the flavors running lightly from celery to apple to melon, but this 100% varietal wine is quite well made and nicely defined.
Name: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2010 Pinot Gris

Description: Tart apple and pear fruit, accented with light green herbs and underscored with vivid acidity mark this wine. The finish is lightly spicy, and it goes down easily.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pear and peach fruit flavors are front and center, highlighted with lemon oil and a hint of honey. It's not sweet, just imparts a honeyed sensation. Medium long, a flash of citrus rind adds to the finish.
Name: Methven Family Vineyards 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp scents of rind and perfume seem almost Viognier-like. The bright flavors echo the aromas, with citrus rind, oranges and apples. Nicely focused.
Name: Del Rio 2010 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fruity, tart and blocky, this delivers bold flavors of lemon and apple. There is plenty of acid under the tangy fruit, and medium persistence. A good quaffer.
Name: Kudos 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Clean, crisply defined green apple and pear fruit flavors anchor this high-acid Pinot Gris. A fine choice with cream-based sauces or seafood that needs something to cut through the flavor. More bottle age could round it out.
Name: Lemelson 2010 Tikka's Run Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Much like this producer's Pinot Blanc, this wine offers apple and pear fruit, with just a little more flesh and a hint of cinnamon.
Name: Wine by Joe 2010 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This is a very light, rather modest wine. Hints of pear and apple show some varietal character, but the flavors are quite mild.
Name: Jovino 2010 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Nicely rounded in texture without being flabby, this is a lively, crisp white wine, well endowed with flavors reminiscent of melon, pear and lime. Perfect to drink now with most seafood dishes, or as an apéritif.
Name: Zonte's Footstep 2010 Doctoressa di Lago Single Site Pinot Grigio (Fleurieu Peninsula)

Description: Spice and cream combine in a rounded, soft, very ripe wine. It has intense flavors of lychee and white peach with a refreshing amount of acidity. The wine is dry, but rich from the ginger and with a peppery final bite.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2010 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This wine almost quivers with freshness when first sniffed, it's so vibrant and citrusy. Then it broadens out nicely on the palate, delivering ripe melon and apple flavors and ample weight. Drink it now and over the next few months.
Name: Hazyblur 2010 Pinot Gris (Kangaroo Island)

Description: This medium-bodied dry white is notable for its balance and harmony. Citrus, wet stone and green apple aromas and flavors all come into play, none of them dominant, then end on a bright, grapefruity note. Drink now.
Name: Sidewood 2010 Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)

Description: This Pinot Grigio is faintly coppery in color (trendy in some circles), with slightly floral and citrus overtones. It's modest in alcohol, but reasonably plump on the midpalate, delivering melon and apple-skin flavors before finishing crisp and refreshing. Drink now.
Name: Robert Oatley 2010 Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)

Description: With a light touch of spice and some richness, this is a dry style of Pinot Gris. It has a kiwi fruit flavor along with white fruits, and finishes with pepper. Screwcap.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Another faintly copper-hued Pinot Grigio from the Oatley family, this one offers modest apple, melon and citrus notes, medium body and a slightly tannic edge to the tart, lemony finish. Drink now.
Name: James Oatley 2010 Tic Tok Pinot Grigio (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The best yet in a series of superb vintages for this unique Washington Pinot Gris, sourced from a cool site in the Columbia Gorge. Luscious fruit cascades across the palate, filling the mouth with juicy, textural flavors of grapefruit, Meyer lemon, orange, orange peel and pear. Deeply concentrated and flat out delicious, this performs way above its price point.
Name: Tranche 2009 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The first Washington wine to be released from the 2011 vintage hits the ground running, with ripe, round, rich flavors of honeyed pears and peaches. Succulent and fruity, it cuts its sharp acidity with 2% residual sugar, making for a wine with fine concentration and length.
Name: Convergence Zone 2011 Drizzle Pinot Gris (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As with all the Milbrandt whites, this young wine retains exceptional freshness, and lifts the palate with lively acidity. Ripe pear and fig flavors are laced with streaks of vanilla bean and coconut flakes. A hint of fresh brioche gives the finish an extra dimension.
Name: Milbrandt 2010 Traditions Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consistent with the past couple of vintages, this lively, racy take on Pinot Gris comes with delicate spritz, dotting the edges of the glass and tickling the palate. Grapefruit and lime are showcased by bracing acidity, and a mouth-cleansing minerality.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2010 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pure, lively scent of fresh apricots introduces this crisply defined Pinot Gris. The rich, full midpalate brings in further fruit notes of apple and pear, with a vivid and bracing acid foundation. Long and refreshing.
Name: Columbia Crest 2010 Grand Estates Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Estate grown and seeming to hint at some time in oak, this dry and lightly spicy wine features apple and pear fruit, already smooth and rounded and ready to drink. More in the style of Oregon Pinot Gris than Italian Pinot Grigio.
Name: Locati Cellars 2009 Pinot Grigio (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Hints of exotic spice—black pepper and curry leaf—accentuate concentrated floral and stone-fruit nectar notes on the nose and palate of this semidry Pinot Gris. While voluptuous in body, it's balanced by a delicately sugar-laced midpalate and a bracing hit of tea leaf astringency on the finish.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2010 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: While savory on the nose, with hints of mealy apple and chalk dust, the palate of this vibrant, light-bodied Pinot Gris exposes a range of delicate wildflower and lime zest notes, punctuated by snappy acidity and a brisk, clean mouthfeel. Drink now.
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2010 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of sweet white peach and melon agua fresca on this unabashedly fruity Pinot Gris are a delightful reminder of warm summer days. Semidry in style, it's quite rich on the palate, with concentrated fruit flavors accented by a touch of tart lemon. Drink now.
Name: Atwater 2009 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Earthy tones of smoke and hazelnuts give way to bright white peach and grapefruit notes on the nose and palate of this fruitful Pinot Gris. Off dry in style, it's a tad sugary on the midpalate, but finishes fairly dry with a refreshing shower of lemony acidity. Drink now.
Name: Billsboro 2010 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Tonic and refreshing, with hints of fresh florals and apple skins, this light bodied Pinot Grigio is a pleasant aperitif. Airy and brisk, with a just a touch of astringency on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Mazza Chautauqua Cellars 2010 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Subdued florals and apple scents have a slightly dusty, chemical edge on the nose of Mazza's Reserve Pinot Grigio. Slight in body but it finishes briskly on the palate. Drink now.
Name: Mazza Chautauqua Cellars 2010 Reserve Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This very limited, concrete-egg-fermented, and thoroughly splendid Pinot Gris is a good indication of the potential for PG in Oregon if the price limitations are lifted. Stunningly rich with citrus, lemon curd, ripe apple and light tropical fruits, this concentrated, deeply driven wine is both roundly full and amazingly dense. Certainly the best Oregon Pinot Gris in memory.
Name: Archery Summit 2010 AB OVO Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Absorbingly complex with racy, textural, mineral-driven flavors, this excellent wine features fleshy apple and pear fruit, crisply defined and extended. The low alcohol—just a tad over 13%—keeps the acids front and center; the wine is immaculately fresh, with just a touch (0.7%) of residual sugar.
Name: Lujon 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Soft and slightly buttery, this smooth-drinking Pinot Gris deftly mixes spiced pear fruit with a pat of butter and a whiff of resin. It's at a perfect point of drinkability right now.
Name: Firesteed 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: John Kinney is one of the Livermore Valley's finest winemakers and with this Pinot Gris he shows his deft ability to blend crispness with richness for an elegant version of this variety.It's rounded by lemon and tart apple flavors, and is extremely dry, with no oak influence whatsoever.
Name: Occasio 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The strong fruit impression here is of tangerine, with tart side notes of apple and pear. Mild and crisply defined, this is an excellent match to roasted poultry.
Name: Vista Hills 2010 Treehouse Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Ripe and floral, full of lemon, honey and pear, this Mendocino-grown Pinot Grigio is refreshing and bright with an underlying layer of sweet anise on the finish. Made from organically grown grapes, this light-drinking wine spent no time in oak.
Name: Forenzo 2009 Pinot Grigio (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Nicely done in an Alsatian style, this Pinot Gris has subtle aromatics that blossom in due time into lemon, pear and tart apple, the whole richly layered and ideal for pairing with rich wintertime foods.
Name: McFadden 2010 Pinot Gris (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Golden honey in color, the Ramspeck Sassolini is lush with lemon flavor and high acidity that lingers on the palate, crisp and tart. Sourced from Lake County fruit, a fine place for crisp whites, this wine is balanced in alcohol and richness too.
Name: Ramspeck 2010 Sassolini Pinot Grigio (Lake County)

Description: An estate-grown Pinot Gris, barrel fermented, with aromas of lime, tangerine and black tea. It's a somewhat delicate, pleasing style that thins out quickly.
Name: Illahe 2010 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All stainless steel barrel-fermented, this is already a rich gold color and showing soft, quickly maturing apple fruit flavors. The finish carries a hint of toast, and the wine makes a graceful, soft landing. Drink up.
Name: Coelho 2010 Estate Renovação Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Clean and light, with a mix of lime, citrus and melon, this falls into the Alsatian-style camp of Oregon Pinot Gris. Lightly spicy and quite tart, it will show best with spicy—not sweet—Asian dishes.
Name: Kings Ridge 2010 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Salty is not a common descriptor for Pinot Gris, but appropriate here. Crisp apple, Asian pear, unripe peach, a dusting of cinnamon, and some slightly bitter skin flavors combine here; the acids rule.
Name: Foris 2010 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Light and clean, which compared to other Argentine Pinot Grigios is not something to dismiss. Feels solid and punchy, with orange and mango flavors. Has nice overall clarity and balance, with a citrusy finish.
Name: Santa Julia 2011 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This quickly veers from being delicately light into simply sour and grassy. Cucumber- and tart melon-flavored fruit fades into a short finish.
Name: LaVelle 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Sharp-toned aromas push the volatility a bit too far for anyone sensitive to nail polish scents. Consequently, the light, stainless steel fermented fruit flavors turn thin and slightly bitter.
Name: Erath 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Hard and like a match on the nose, with sulfur and peach pit aromas. Has a good mouthfeel to support pithy peach and green melon flavors. Finishes creamy, but with a mild bitterness.
Name: François Lurton 2011 Pinot Gris (Mendoza)

Description: This inexpensive Pinot Grigio is perfectly fine for sipping, with decent acidity but not a lot of length on the finish and an interesting baked fig aroma.
Name: Redtree 2010 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Oily, with a peach-pit bitterness to the nose. Feels citrusy but dilute, with lemony flavors that fold in green apple. Wet but bland on the finish. An extremely simple wine.
Name: Graffigna 2011 Centenario Reserve Pinot Grigio (San Juan)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: The acidity on this Pinot Grigio is almost bracing, so sour lemon in overall character as to be nearly puckering. A rich seafood pairing might help steer it right.
Name: Middle Ridge 2010 Blue's Creek Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Temecula Valley)

Description: Gassy smelling and just not that fresh from head to toe. Feels fleshy but clumsy, with bland melon and almond skin flavors. Narrows on the finish and teeters on bitter, with a lemony wash.
Name: Pulenta 2011 XIV Alto Agrelo Pinot Gris (Mendoza)

Description: Sweet, mushy and yeasty smelling, and never is this wine convincingly balanced. Tastes heavy, like canned fruit. Finishes bitter, with a banana-like flavor.
Name: Callia 2011 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fine value, with fresh and crisp citrus fruit flavors along with apples and pears. Good complexity, with added spice notes and a well-defined finish.
Name: Hogue 2010 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Savory apple scents dominate on the nose with hints of lanolin and sea air. While watery and dilute on entry, there's a pleasant nut oil and nut skin character on the palate. Somewhat clumsy in style with a bit of heat on the finish.
Name: Pinot Evil NV Pinot Grigio (Hungary)

Description: Initially, the acidity shoots through this wine. Then it reveals equally intense honey and spice flavors. The wine is complex, with yellow fruits laced with nutmeg and finished with a tender, crisp aftertaste. It is never too sweet, a beautifully balanced wine in which all the elements play their part.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Turckheim Clos Jebsal Vendanges Tardive Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This ultrarich, opulent wine has such purity of fruit. With its pepper and spice flavors layered over mango and ripe nectarine, it is a straight line of pure flavor, rich and complex.
Designation: Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A hugely rich wine with opulent sweetness, honey and ripe sweet sultanas. It has a wonderful intensity of flavor, just hinting at acidity. It is beautiful to drink now, but will surely age.
Designation: Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Sélection de Grains Nobles
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Sélection de Grains Nobles Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The Clos Windsbuhl produces an opulently rich and sweet wine, gorgeously ripe and packed with tropical fruits. It is dense and powerfully concentrated, intense and very ageworthy.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Clos Windsbuhl Hunawihr Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Richly textured wine, full of ripe and spicy fruit, the acidity just a hint behind the dried honey and watermelon flavors. It is full-bodied, ripe, packed with intense fruit flavors. A wine for aging over 3–4 years.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2009 Hatschbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In the Zind-Humbrecht sweeter style, the wine brings out the intense, spicy side of Pinot Gris. It is beautifully balanced, with its richness combined with quince and nectarine flavors. Age the wine for 3–4 years.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Wintzenheim Rotenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gold in color, the wine has honeyed botrytis aromas that translate to the superrich palate. It is very concentrated, full-bodied, the weight of the fruit bursting out into a seductive opulence. Acidity only shows through at the end.
Name: Emile Beyer 2007 Lieu Dit Hochrain Vendandes Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: With its greater acidity, this is less of a dessert Pinot Gris than others in the Zind-Humbrecht range. It has a mineral note to go with the floral character and exotic perfumes. The balance, though, is just right, a fine mix of richness and acidity.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Turckheim Heimbourg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A botrytis-driven wine, sweet while also balanced with honey and lemon acidity. The spicy character of Pinot Gris is overtaken by this sweetness, giving a textured wine with a final burst of richness.
Name: Joseph Cattin 2007 Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The Zind-Humbrecht Pinot Gris style brings out the richness of the variety. This wine is all spice, and intense flavors of pepper and lychee. The acidity creeps in making an impact on the initial mouthfeel. Very rich, concentrated.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: As much sweet as rich, this is a fruity, red currant-driven wine that intriguingly brings out a more fresh side of Pinot Gris. It is lively as well as sweet, finely balanced, a great wine for smoked meats or pâtés, or just by itself.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2009 Cuvée Caroline Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Showing as much richness as sweetness, this poised wine has fresh fruit acidity combined with dried apricot and spice flavors. It is balanced, delicious now, ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Seilly 2007 Schenkenberg Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A great partner for rich sauced fish or pâté, this beautiful wine is relatively sweet, full of gently honeyed fruit, naturally full-bodied. The acidity is a light addition to the weighty texture.
Name: Wolfberger 2009 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Done in 100% stainless steel and left sur lie for eight months, this intensely fruity, spicy Pinot Gris could be the archetype for the Oregon style. Bold pear fruit is set in citrusy acids and dotted with cinnamon spice. Fresh, crisp and full-bodied.
Name: King Estate 2009 Domaine Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This slightly sweet, rich and complex wine has spice, a touch of honey and is balanced by intense lime acidity. The wine is full-bodied, bursting with fruit, ready to drink.
Name: Willm 2009 Cuvée Emile Willm Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There is good balanced intensity here. The varietal character shows through in the lychee and white peach flavors, with sufficient acidity lacing through. It is rich, packed with ripe flavors, hinting at a terroir-driven mineral character.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2008 Steinert Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Beyer's winery is situated in a 16th-century coaching inn, hence the name of this range of wines. This Pinot Gris has power and intensity, showing very ripe tropical fruits and some acidity. There is a definite sweet, spicy edge here.
Name: Emile Beyer 2009 Cuvée de l'Hostellerie Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bright with scents and flavors of apples and pears, this fresh and spicy young wine is bone dry, moderately low in alcohol and utterly delicious. It couldn't be more refreshing.
Name: Ponzi 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This full, soft, rich and spicy wine shows off the intensity of Pinot Gris. There is an essential amount of acidity lacing around the complex, ripe texture.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2009 Trois Châteaux Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: There is good weight and richness in this impressive Pinot Gris. The wine is full of pineapple, tropical fruits and raisins, allied to just the right balance of acidity. The finish is refreshing as well as ripe.
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2009 Cuvée Cécile Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From Rex Hill's oldest estate vineyard, this single-source Pinot Gris is rich and fruity. The full-bodied, fruit-driven flavors carry a hint of botrytis; honeysuckle, bee pollen, peach and papaya.
Name: Rex Hill 2009 Jacob-Hart Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A pleasing mix of fresh-cut pear, white peach and light tropical fruits, this crisp and well-defined Pinot Gris has plenty of natural acidity and full-bodied flavor.
Name: Arbor Brook 2010 Croft Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A balanced wine that showcases the ripe fruit while preserving freshness and layers of melon and spiced pear flavors. It has some concentration, leaving a final rich texture.
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2007 Pfingstberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: All richness, with concentrated spice and fruit ripeness as much as sweetness. Flavors of lychee, white figs show under light acidity. Ready to drink.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2008 Vorbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Spicy pear fruit is amplified with nuanced flavors of cracker and caramel. Though vinified in stainless steel, the impression of light barrel aging lingers. Barrels or not, the wine benefits.
Name: Yamhill Valley 2009 Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Description: An intensely rich wine from vines planted on chalk soil. There is a spicy, smooth texture, with a bitter almond and cinnamon edge. The alcohol does leave a burning sensation, which detracts from the overall feel.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Calcaire Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is a lovely bottle, with pure pear fruit flavor front and center. It's clean, ripe and fresh, with plenty of substance and a fresh, crisp finish.
Name: Acrobat 2010 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This begins well, with full-flavored mixed stone fruits. Then it dips into a bit of a midpalate trough, climbing back out into a lightly toasty finish. Perhaps decanting would help to fill out the middle.
Name: Daedalus 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Dry Pinot Gris, perfumed with kiwi and star fruit. It has great acidity as well, preserving its freshness right through to the attractive crisp and green aftertaste.
Name: Robert Klingenfus 2010 Signature Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: With light spiciness, this is a full-bodied wine, dominated by tropical fruits. It is rich, rounded, soft, with touches of honey.
Name: Jean Albrecht 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Named for Romanus Albrecht, the founder of the winery in the 15th century, this is a lightly spiced wine. Its round fruit is given an edge by pepper and light acidity. The aftertaste confirms it as a bone-dry wine.
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2010 Cuvée Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Full-bodied, smooth-textured Pinot Gris, the off-dry character laced with dried apricot fruit and a smoky edge. The wine seems rich, while retaining poise from its acidity.
Name: Emile Beyer 2010 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: From an Umpqua Valley vineyard, this solid and fruit-driven Pinot Gris needs a little more bottle age to come together. The pear fruit flavor is there in abundance, but some off-notes creep in, damping the finish.
Name: Seven Hills 2010 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This big bottle of Pinot Grigio has strong aromas of peach and is pretty full in flavor though not in finish. Not a lot of acidity here, but the wine is fine for the price and volume. No problem next to a plate of spicy paella.
Name: Glen Ellen 2010 Proprietor's Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Simple, attractive wine. It has some spice, with hints of vanilla in a light texture offering some final acidity.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2009 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Lightly spiced wine, with a fat texture, soft and rounded, just seasoned with pepper.
Name: Domaine Specht 2009 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Soft, rather unfocused wine, its spice and yellow fruit flavors creating a rounded warm cushion of texture. The acidity is light, a shadow behind the wine.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2009 Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Despite its youth, this is a deep gold, almost to the point of being tawny, brown. Oxidized certainly, though not undrinkable if you jump on it quickly. Dry and dusty with hints of pear fruit.
Name: Château Bianca 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Either something got away from the winemaker or this wine simply missed the mark. But a dry Pinot Gris closing in on 16% alcohol is a difficult wine to enjoy. It's hot, bitter, overripe and surprisingly flat; all the life has been burned out of it.
Name: Seven of Hearts 2010 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A strong spice scent comes with a hint of vanilla bean. Fruit flavors of lime and fresh-cut pear are framed by an underlying minerality. As always with Willow Crest Pinot Gris, there is good penetration and length.
Name: Willow Crest 2010 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clean, complex aromatics offer elegant notes of jasmine, cucumber and melon. This is an interesting Pinot Gris, light but not simple, with lingering floral/apple flavors and impeccable balance.
Name: Waterbrook 2010 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Round and floral, with melon and other simple, clean aromas. Good mouthfeel, proper acidity and basic, likable flavors of citrus, green apple, green banana and tropical fruits make it a good quaffer and a good value.
Name: Callia 2010 Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

Description: Salinic and minerally on the nose, with a hint of peach. The palate is wet and light, however the flavors run stalky and tart, with green banana and bitterness leading to a chalky finish. Quaffable.
Name: Montepio 2010 Pinot Gris (San Juan)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Intensely aromatic, with lovely accents of pine needle, grapefruit and mint. An elegant, complex and vividly spicy wine, with all elements proportionate, and showing excellent depth and structure. The flavors of fruit and forest just keep unfolding through a lingering finish.
Name: David Hill 2010 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy, sharp, tart and deep. A compact mix of melon, pear, green apple and gooseberry fruit. This has exceptional structure and density for a wine listing such low alcohol, yet no hint of sweetness.
Name: Wy'East Vineyards 2010 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Young, frizzante and clean as a whistle, with a mix of celery, apple and melon fruit. The alcohol is listed at just 12.5% yet delivers plenty of flavor—is this the Holy Grail grape that ripens at lower alcohol? A delicious, zesty, complex wine with all the right stuff—crisp fruits, zippy acids, refreshing minerality, and midpalate concentration.
Name: Pudding River 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Leesy, textural, a rich mix of spring herbs, celery, lime, green fruits and melon. Though relatively low alcohol it has a lovely mix of flavors. Bracing but not at all sour. Good winemaking.
Name: Lange 2010 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fruit-driven, with pear and apple, but an interesting streak of licorice running down the spine of the wine. It has depth and good structure, so the now-dominant young fruit will have support as it ages. Worth sitting on for a couple more years.
Name: Lange 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp and spicy, with pleasing focus and minerality. Flavors mix tart, racy green fruits with a bracing acidity and suggestions of chalk. Excellent structure; best to decant it first.
Name: Terrapin Cellars 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Consistent with past vintages, this still-young wine has a yeasty nose, textural mouthfeel and light pear fruit flavors, gently dappled with cinnamon spice. There is just a hint of sweatiness in the finish.
Name: Left Coast Cellars 2009 The Orchards Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A nice mix of tart green apple, fresh-cut pear, spring herbs and lemony acids. Vivid and refreshing, with good concentration and length.
Name: Provincial Vineyards 2010 Single Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A single-vineyard Pinot Gris, focused and tart, with flavors as fresh as can be. Sharp and yeasty, but with good grip and substance through the middle, and a flash of heat in the finish. This will benefit from another year or so of bottle age.
Name: Lumos 2010 Rudolfo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This first Pinot Gris from this small grower shows plenty of pear flavors, with some astringent skin flavors huddled around the core fruit. It holds there consistently, but does not move; it's a bit monolithic.
Name: Dion 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Oak Knoll's Pinot Gris is a sturdy, steady expression of the grape's main strengths. Vintage in and vintage out, the wine has plenty of ripe apple and pear fruit flavors, with citrusy highlights and a splash of refreshing acidity.
Name: Oak Knoll 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp and yeasty, this tastes as if it jumped straight out of the fermenter. It's got a natural tang and tart citrus fruits. Drink it over the next couple of years while the freshness remains.
Name: Lumos 2010 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There's an odd smell of roasted peanuts under the citrusy fruit aromas, but once in the mouth the fruit takes over big time. It bursts forth, apples and lemons, and stays solid and unchanging into the tart finish.
Name: Van Duzer 2010 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and clean, with very tart and herbal flavors, and lighter suggestions of pear and lime fruit. The zippy acidity defines the wine; it's clean and bracing.
Name: Spindrift Cellars 2010 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A dry, late-harvest wine from 20-year-old vines. Floral with a subtle honey note, more like pollen; lemon and orange candy, sleek and deep.
Name: pb 2010 Heritage Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Crisp and bright, with a detailed mix of spring herbs and citrus fruits. The powerful acidity and a hint of mineral running through the finish adds to the depth. This just keeps on going, clean and satisfying.
Name: Tranche 2008 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Made from organic grapes, Horse & Plow's Pinot Gris is earthy and austere, with finely honed acidity and lovely hints of apricot. Very balanced, dry, a tremendous version of this white wine.
Name: Horse & Plow 2010 Filigreen Farm Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The alcohol is listed at just 12.3%, with residual sugar under 1%, but noticeable. The overall balance is excellent, with a fruit-forward appeal built upon clean, crisp layers of citrus and stone fruits. What surprises is the persistence; the score reflects both the breadth and length of this wine.
Name: Jones of Washington 2009 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A bracing, mouth-cleansing style, 100% varietal. Ultracrisp fruit mixes apple, melon and cucumber, then fills out in the middle with pretty herb and grass. The wine resonates, refreshing and textural, begging for food, or at least another glass.
Name: Boomtown 2010 Pinot Gris (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just a hint of sweetness (residual sugar is under 1%) cuts through the biting acidity, creating a fine-tuned sense of balance and adding depth and body to the overall structure. Grapefruit, pear and nectarine flavors showcase the intense fruit character.
Name: Jones of Washington 2010 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lightly spritzy and bone dry, this almost-ephemeral wine lists the alcohol at 13%, but tastes more like 12%. Light is not thin, however; it offers delicate flavors of melon, celery and crisp green apple.
Name: RiverAerie 2009 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With an intensity of almond paste and charcuterie at first sniff, this nice Pinot Grigio from the Sangiovese specialists at Vino Noceto is light in color but rich in mouthfeel, with a flowery, apricot flavor. Its finish is smooth and a smidge sweet.
Name: Noceto 2010 Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light, clean, gently spicy pear and apple fruit flavors are set in a crisp white wine with fine acidity. The hints of white pepper give it detail and interest; the fresh acidity encourages that second and third glass. Drink this chilled.
Name: Mercer 2009 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: Crisp and fruity though a little woody and austere on the nose, too, this Lodi Pinot Grigio is unoaked and not for everyone, but well made.
Name: Grands Amis Winery 2009 Mokelumne River Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: Pale salmon in color, this Pinot Grigio is almost rosé-like. Bursting with sweet red strawberries, cherries and watermelon on the nose and palate, it's wonderfully refreshing with just a hint of soft tannins on the finish.
Name: Pullus 2009 Pinot Grigio (Štajerska)

Description: Appley and fresh with hints of white peach and blossoms on the nose and palate, this is a straightforward yet well-made Pinot Grigio that's hard to resist for under $10. Snappy and clean with brisk acidity and a pretty green floral finish.
Name: Cramele Recas 2009 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Viile Timisului)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A delightful, simple sipper with apricot, peach and pepper with a touch of honey that finishes a bit sweet.
Name: Fenestra 2009 Pinot Gris (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy and showing some sweetness around the edges, presumably from a bit of residual sugar. Lovely fruit is the highlight here, textural and luscious with flavors of pears and apricots. Vivid acidity cuts through the fleshy core.
Name: David Hill 2009 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Just a whiff of nail polish in the fruit-driven aromas, introducing a textural, fleshy style with underlying minerality. White peach and Bartlett pear fruit brings weight to the midpalate; the finish continues clean and fruity all the way through.
Name: Methven Family Vineyards 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Melon, spice and a suggestion of papaya wrap into a medium-weight wine with a solid fruit core. A streak of vanilla and some slightly bitter phenolics finish it nicely.
Name: Highland Springs 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp and driven with spicy pear and pineapple fruit, this challenging Pinot Gris is distinctive and tailored for food. The flavors seem to come from the grape skins more than the pulp, and there is no new oak to intercede. Fermented and aged in steel, put through malolactic, still showing plenty of acidity and spice.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2008 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A fresh, mineral-driven white wine, this offers light fruit flavors of green apple and gooseberry. What gives it lift and life are the vivacious acids and the mouth-coating minerality.
Name: Airlie 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Quite dry, nicely structured, and sporting generous, fresh acidity, this food-friendly Pinot Gris has moderately ripe fruit flavors that emphasis citrus and lemon rind. The alcohol is just 13.5%.
Name: Tyee 2009 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A firm, just-ripe-enough fruit core brings flavors of pear skin, citrus rind and apple. Basically it's a tart, crisp white wine, without distinguishing varietal character.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fruit flavors of pear and peach roll into a soft, spongy midpalate. The finish brings in fermentation flavors of cracker and sweet grain, with some skin phenolics.
Name: Belle Vallée 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Spicy, floral aromas announce a dry Pinot Gris, bringing in crisp acidity as well as a richer fruit texture. The fruit is attractive, with pear and mango flavors, finishing with a lift. Screwcap.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2009 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A Washington Pinot Gris that has some of the flesh and texture of a fine Oregon version, yet brings the spice and verve of bright Washington fruit into play. Pear, apple, acacia, orange candy, even a bit of pineapple combine into a fruity and delicious wine. All stainless, no malolactic.
Name: Waterbrook 2009 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Lovely scents suggest citrus rind, lemon cake, honeycomb, candied orange and more. Substantial fruit flavors run from lime on through ripe pineapple, and the supporting structure offers a firm foundation of acid and extract, with a pleasingly long finish.
Name: Lachini 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: The only trouble with this bargain-priced version of a vendange tardive Pinot Gris will be finding some, as only 40 cases were imported. At only 11.6% alcohol, there's plenty of sugar left in the wine (67 g/l), concentrated and enriched by the inclusion of 50% botrytis-affected fruit. The impressions are of honeyed pineapple, ripe melon and peach preserves, finishing long and sweet. Delicious now, but should still be good 5–6 years down the road.
Name: Mountford 2008 Estate Pinot Gris (Waipara)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Foris has Pinot Gris dialed in, showcasing the subtle, delicate flavors perhaps closer to Italian Pinot Grigio than other, big, fruity domestic bottlings. The winery location,— in the cool Illinois Valley of southwest Oregon, puts an Alpine twist on the flavors—lemon peel, pineapple, lime, and just a touch of honey.
Name: Foris 2009 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe and fruity, the 2009 echoes the flavors of the previous vintage, bringing in suggestions of pear, pineapple, green banana and papaya. It's all wrapped in a bit of alcoholic heat, but not so much as to detract from the rich fruit flavors. A solid base of acid and skin tannins gives the wine the support it needs.
Name: Brandborg 2009 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: The Brajkovich family's 2009 Pinot Gris finds a fine balance between sweetness, acidity and alcohol, offering just enough of each. Melon flavors are tinged with almondskin and a lingering touch of musky spice on the finish. Fine on its own, or pair it with dishes that are slightly sweet (shrimp) or spicy.
Name: Kumeu River 2009 Pinot Gris (Kumeu)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Estate-grown and fruit-driven, this lush, pear-flavored Pinot Gris is dotted with pretty cinnamon and allspice highlights. Forward and nicely balanced, it has the texture and weight to handle rich sauces, much like a big Chardonnay, but without all the new oak.
Name: Melrose 2009 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: A decent value in New Zealand Pinot Gris, Roaring Meg's 2010 is eminently drinkable, balancing bright, vibrant passion fruit and nectarine flavors against hints of sugar and spice. It's off dry in style at 11 g/l residual sugar, giving it a little extra heft on the palate.
Name: Mt. Difficulty 2010 Roaring Meg Pinot Grigio (Central Otago)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Crisp and palate-cleansing, this southern Oregon Pinot Gris shows a nice mix of green berries, tree fruit and even some unripe banana. Good concentration and length, with a finish that invites the next sip immediately.
Name: Del Rio 2009 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Nearly dry, this is a full-bodied, slightly creamy-textured Pinot Gris. It's a bit shy on the nose, offering only modest melon and citrus notes, then closes with hints of nuts and spice. Drink now.
Name: Mt. Difficulty 2009 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Pretty typical New Zealand Pinot Gris, featuring a fair bit of residual sweetness. There's plenty of weight and density in the mouth, but less intensity of flavor and aroma, only hinting at almond, honey and melon.
Name: Chasing Venus 2009 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Here is a rarity among rarities—a Washington Pinot Gris from old vines dating back to the 1970s. Spicy and tart, with New World fruit flavors of melon and pear set in a wine with Old World craftsmanship and sensibilities it's just 12.5% alcohol, bone dry, fully ripened, laden with minerality. Vivid and long, it's a gem that would be a perfect start to any holiday feast.
Name: Ross Andrew 2009 Celilo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Full and fleshy, this spicy, fruity Pinot Gris offers fresh fruit and citrus peel flavors, balanced against tangy acidity. The fruit is a mix of interesting flavors – grapefruit, apple and white peach. Good length and a fine value.
Name: Hyatt 2009 Pinot Gris (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: From a producer better known for its red wines, this is a notable white—although there is a slight coppery tinge to the wine's hue. Melon and herbal notes are true to the variety, as is the broad mouthfeel and faint tactile dustiness on the finish. Drink now.
Designation: Mount Crawford Estate Grown Single Vineyard
Name: Thorn Clarke 2010 Mount Crawford Estate Grown Single Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Eden Valley)

Description: This appealing wine's melon and pear aromas and flavors might seem a little simple at first, but there's an appealing hint of white pepper chasing through it that adds dimension to the fruit. Broad on the palate, with soft acids. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2010 The Y Series Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This faintly copper-tinged Pinot Grigio offers ripe melon and apple aromas and flavors. It's medium-bodied, with a refreshing crispness to the finish. Drink now.
Name: James Oatley 2009 Tic Tok Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Like its stablemate Pinot Grigio from producer Thorne Clark, this Pinot Gris carries a faint copper-pink cast to its hue, and it also has a fairly broad mouthfeel. The pear and melon flavors are pleasant, making it an easy-drinking medium-bodied white with wide appeal.
Name: Cool Woods 2009 Pinot Gris (Eden Valley)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This Pinot Grigio is ripe and round without being overly heavy, marrying muskmelon and nectarine flavors to a cool, refreshing finish. Drink now.
Name: Yellow Tail 2009 Reserve Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Description: This medium-bodied Pinot Grigio blends underripe pear notes with hints of nasturtium and flintiness, while a hint of bitterness emerges on the finish. Overall, it's clean, correct and refreshing.
Name: Oxford Landing 2010 Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: At first sharp and focused, with sharp aromas of pine and citrus rind, this broadens out and thins quickly once in the mouth. Fresh green apple fruit fades into a smooth, plain, slightly watery finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2009 Grand Estates Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Medium in weight, with modest pear and melon aromas and flavors. It's clean and fresh, finishing with a delicate touch of citrus. Drink now.
Name: De Bortoli 2010 DB Family Selection Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Description: The first-ever Pinot Gris from this pioneering Spokane winery has a crisp entry, with flavors of jicama and celery and hints of Asian pear. It's light and stylish, a fine apéritif to accompany appetizers or raw oysters.
Name: Latah Creek 2008 Pinot Gris (Washington)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From a Snipes Mountain vineyard, this dense and rich take on Viognier has sharp edges around spicy lemon and pineapple fruit. The phenolic “bite” (from skin contact?) powers the finish, slightly bitter but defining and expressive.
Name: Northwest Cellars 2009 Upland Vineyard Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Clean and refreshing with an abundance of sweet Meyer lemon and pommelo notes on the nose and palate, this is another great example of Finger Lakes Pinot Gris. Medium-bodied with a luscious, mouth-quenching quality, it's carried from start to finish by a lingering white floral note and pleasant grapefruit pith astringency.
Name: Imagine Moore 2009 Peace Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Textural and deep rather than overtly fruity, this single-vineyard Pinot Gris leads with a mix of dried herbs, citrus and melon flavors. It's an interesting wine, with depth and persistence, more like an Italian Pinot Grigio than a West Coast Pinot Gris.
Name: Northwest Cellars 2009 Goose Ridge Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Beautifully perfumed with ripe pommelo, orange blossoms and a spray of fresh lemon zest. A rich, luscious mouthfeel on the palate is balanced with bright grapefruit acidity and a refreshing minerality. Finishes dry with a zesty lemon rind astringency.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2007 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A spray of sweet stone fruit, white florals and fresh, clean herbs, this is is gorgeously aromatic. While lush and full- bodied in style, there's an elegance to the pristine white grapefruit and peach flavors that combine seamlessly with a refereshing minerality and puckery grapefruit pith finish.
Name: Hosmer 2009 Pinot Gris (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sweet scents of powdered sugar and guava juice waft ebulliently from this full-bodied Pinot Gris. The palate is soft with luscious, ripe pommelo and white peach flavors but balanced by a dry finish with a refreshingly astringent note.
Name: Ventosa 2009 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Freshly squeezed lemons, lime and pretty white florals perfume this dry, medium-bodied Pinot Grigio. The palate is clean with juicy white grapefruit flavors and some interesting minerality, but it's a bit lacking in concentration.
Name: Raffaldini 2009 Pinot Grigio (Swan Creek)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: The nose is somewhat off-putting with some sharp, acrid notes, but the dry palate is palate is sunny with hints of ripe tangerines and marmalade flavors.
Name: Suhru 2009 Pinot Grigio (New York)

Description: Although its fresh lemon and savory apple flavors are pleasant, this is clumsy and disjointed with a soapy, floral nose and shriekingly high acidity levels.
Name: Chaddsford 2009 Pinot Grigio (Pennsylvania)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bright and spicy, this is Pinot Gris with a bit of the grassy bite of a Loire Valley Sauvignon Blanc. Racy and loaded with grapefruit and pineapple flavors, this lingers lazily through a refreshing, acid-driven finish that invites further sipping.
Name: Arbor Brook 2009 Croft Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Balanced and fresh, with a mix of pear, quince, melon and apple, lightly dusted with baking spices, this appealing Pinot Gris is a fine match for salmon, halibut, and other Northwest seafood. Textural, laced with refreshing minerality, and persistent into a long finish, this is Oregon PG at its best.
Name: Rex Hill 2008 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This estate-bottled Pinot Gris, from a vineyard planted in 1983, shows some definite residual sugar, despite its alcohol rating of 14.4%. Plenty ripe all right, and plenty tasty, too. This has the body and balance to match up with a fat cut of salmon, perhaps in a semisweet tamari sauce, or a grilled pork roast with a fruit dressing.
Name: Anindor 2009 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Estate grown, crisp and nicely defined, with a pretty mix of apple, pear, peach and apricot flavors. The fruit is framed with citrus rind (orange and grapefruit) and keeps the wine tight and focused through a clean, lingering finish.
Name: Hawks View 2009 Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine immediately wows the palate, bursting into full flavor with an explosion of apple and pear fruit. There's a light yeastiness as well, just enough to suggest a young, fresh, exuberant wine, and it simply grabs hold of your taste buds and never lets go.
Name: Left Coast Cellars 2008 The Orchards Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Full-bodied, fruity and loaded with ripe peach and pear flavors, this lively and refreshing wine is drinking beautifully. There's a bit of fruit sweetness set against the natural acidity, keeping the wine poised and balanced.
Name: Soléna 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: An interesting wine, somewhat sharp and yeasty upon entry, but also showing a creamy, textural midpalate with a streak of honey down the fruit flavors of pear and apple. It's dry, persistent, and distinctive, though not typical for Oregon Pinot Gris.
Name: Lumos 2009 Rudolfo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A very tasty wine, loaded with fleshy, fruity flavor. The dominant note is fresh cut pear, dappled with cinnamon spice. Round and balanced, it's a delicious bottle with just a slight hint of residual sweetness.
Name: Carabella 2008 Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
