Description: With alcohol of just 12% the suspicion is that this wine has significant residual sugar; but once you taste it, you realize it's actually finished dry. Despite the delicate fruit flavors—melon and white grape—it does not seem underripe; it's quite Euro in style, and delightful as an apéritif.
Name: Airlie 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This affordable Pinot Gris seems to have a little residual sugar; the flavors are rounded out with a hint of sweetness, much like a California Chardonnay. The spicy pear fruit is full-bodied and varietally correct. Not a complex wine, but fine for everyday enjoyment.
Name: Redhawk 2009 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Modest, minerally and clean, with mild dusty apple aromas. The palate is pillowy and comfortable, with just enough acidity to push up the apple, green grape and white plum flavors. Finishes similarly, with a sweet lasting impression.
Name: Argento 2010 Cool Climate Selection Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: Clean, timid and melony on the nose, with an emphasis on clean. Fresh and light in the mouth, and tasty despite being 100% uncomplicated. Flavors of sweet apple, pear and citrus are pleasant and should carry mass appeal. Good for an everyday white quaffer.
Name: Funky Llama 2010 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: Smells a bit waxy and grassy, with mild, distant white-fruit aromas. The palate feels pithy and chalky, with generic citrus flavors and then citrus pith on the back end. Finishes with more pithiness and white grapefruit.
Name: Alma Mora 2009 Pinot Grigio (San Juan)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Firm and fleshy, with sharply accented tart fruit and other scents and flavors that suggest pungent pine needles, diesel and catbox. It would seem that there is a fair amount of Sauvignon Blanc in here, but apparently not.
Name: Castle Rock 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Simple pear and vanilla flavors fill a thick, blocky midpalate. There's no lift to the flavors; they are clean but not fresh, fruity but without any zip. Perhaps just a dull bottle?
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Neutral smelling with a hint of lemon-lime and children's vitamin. The palate is wet but doesn't bring much more in the way of feel, while the flavors are flat, melony and hint at apple. This wine is old by PG standards but not yet dead. It's hanging in there.
Name: Condor's Summit 2008 Pinot Grigio (Famatina Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The first impression is of Bosc pear, quickly followed by a lingering sweaty, plastic note on the finish.
Name: Del Rio 2009 Estate Reserve Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Rich and sweet wine in character with a Vendange Tardive. It is gorgeous and opulent, while balanced and elegant. The acidity is in wonderful contrast to the smoky honey and orange zest flavors. A hint of bitterness suggests, for sure, that this wine will be even more wonderful when aged.
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2008 Altenbourg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The concentration and richness of old-vine Pinot Gris is all here. This is definitely a wine on the sweet side, going for superripe peaches, white apricots, gorgeous spice and not much in the way of acidity. Revel in this wine for its opulence.
Name: Rieflé 2004 Grand Cru Steinert Pinot Gris Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This is certainly rich, but that's not what is so important. What gives this wine its style is the balance between the cantaloup and mango flavors and the layers of acidity and spice. Fine and elegant, this should develop well over several years.
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2004 Le Moine Moenchberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The Rieflé style of Pinot Gris is to emphasize the ripe apricot flavors. This wine does that, but adds an extra complexity with its smoky aromas, and its dense spice and tropical fruit character. It isn't sweet, but it is certainly rich.
Name: Rieflé 2005 Côte de Rouffach Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rich and medium dry, presenting considerable freshness as well as spice, tropical fruits and intense acidity. The texture is dense and concentrated, full and fruity, just showing signs of maturity.
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2006 Pfingstberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Full and attractively spicy, this is also elegant even in its richness. There is weighty lychee, Chinese gooseberries and softness rather than sweetness. It feels rich and full in the mouth.
Name: Mittnacht Frères 2009 Les Petits Grains Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Black currant and white plums give this wine its fresh edge and its richness. It has an opulent feel to it, with concentrated spice inside the round texture. The end brings out the relief of crisp acidity.
Name: Willm 2008 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Named after Romanus Albrecht who started the family wine business in 1425, this is a finely perfumed wine, with spice, a rich, soft texture and flavors of pineapple and quince.
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2009 Cuvée Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A smoothly rich wine, dry but rounded with tropical peach and apricot flavors that roll off the tongue. There's a smoky character, while the acidity only shows through in the aftertaste. Richness pervades throughout.
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2005 Clos Rebberg Aix Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With about 6% Viognier in the blend, this tart, dry, racy take on Pinot Gris has unusual complexity. Crisp citrus and pear skin, green apple and lemon verbena roll across the palate. There's a crisp minerality to the acids, and a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2009 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Another fine effort in a continuing series of outstanding PGs from Hogue. This is tart and stylish, loaded with citrus and bracingly acidic. Flavors meld lemon, lime, lemon verbena, orange peel and a slice of pear.
Name: Hogue 2009 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Rich and spicy, this is a fine, dry, peppery Pinot Gris. In the mouth there's weight and ripeness, as well as some fat, yellow fruits. There's a touch of lychee as well, giving an exotic edge to the finish.
Name: Rieflé 2006 Pinot Gris Bonheur Convivial Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rieflé is one of the rare Alsace producers who indicates the sweetness and richness levels of their wine. This wine rates a level just below the median of the chart, a fair assessment of the medium-sweet taste, emphasizing the richness of the grape and giving flavors of lychee and spice.
Name: Rieflé 2005 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This feels light and rather dilute. It has varietal pepper and some spice, but the main effect is one of acidity, crispness and freshness. The lychee tropical fruit element is underplayed in favor of crispness. It should certainly work with food.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2004 Les Maquisards Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Big, fat Pinot Gris, with the typical spice and ripe fruit. The wine is full and round, attractively filled with peach fruits and a hint of fine acidity. Screw cap.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2009 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Another fine success for Adelsheim, a founding Oregon winery currently on a quality roll. Elegant and crisply defined, this textbook Pinot Gris begins with a mix of fresh pear, honeydew and gooseberry, then refreshes the palate with juicy acids and some light citrus skin flavors.
Name: Adelsheim 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A textbook example of Oregon Pinot Gris, this is bursting with citrus and pear fruit. Immaculately clean and crisp, the bright fruit and lively mouthfeel continue into a lingering, satisfying, tangy finish. All stainless- steel fermented.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2008 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Yakima Valley bottling highlights fresh herbs and sharp, juicy pear and apple fruit flavors. The vivid fruit is racy and tightly defined, and seems to gather strength and focus as it sits in the mouth. A splendid effort that really sets the standard for Washington Pinot Gris.
Name: Willow Crest 2009 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: Spicy scents introduce a fresh and fleshy pear-flavored Pinot Gris, with a crisp underpinning of wet stone and medium acids. Citrus peel, light orange and pineapple weave into the midpalate, and the wine fills the mouth without being heavy.
Name: King Estate 2009 Signature Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Benton-Lane makes quite a lot of Pinot Gris, stainless-steel fermented and whole cluster pressed, yielding a soft, fragrant, fruity wine with plenty of fresh pear flavor. It flattens out broadly across the palate, full-bodied and lightly spicy. Just a bit more focus would really elevate this wine to the top ranks.
Name: Benton-Lane 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: High-toned and sharp, this has a mix of pear, tropical fruit, banana, and juicy fruit gum. It's a fruit salad wine, full-bodied and exceptionally flavorful. There's a streak of butterscotch running through the finish, from fermentation in “neutral” oak. Drink up!
Name: Ancient Cellars 2008 Gilt Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Fresh and spritzy, this is almost like drinking the wine straight from the winemaker's fermentation tank—it's that juicy and delicious. Flavors of apple and pear, lightly dusted with cinnamon, are elevated with a zesty, mineral-driven acidity.
Name: Dusted Valley 2009 Boomtown Pinot Gris (Washington)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This estate-grown Pinot Gris has a pleasing delicacy, balancing light citrus with whiffs of pine and a base of pear and cucumber. Just 13% alcohol, it might strike some tasters as a little thin, but it would make a fine accompaniment to a course of soft, creamy cheeses.
Name: Winter's Hill 2009 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vivid and snappy, this was fermented in stainless steel, with a small percentage aged in neutral barrels to soften the mouthfeel. It's spicy and fresh, with a mix of fruit flavors including grapefruit and pineapple. A touch of vanilla enlivens the aromas.
Name: Columbia Crest 2009 H3 Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: De Bortoli's Emeri line of sparkling wines are not conventional Pinot Noir-Chardonnay blends. This one is Pinot Grigio with bubbles, the usually muted aromas of the variety perked up to show grapefruit and fig notes. The wine is soft and fullish in body, with hints of fig coming through on the palate.
Name: De Bortoli NV Emeri Sparkling Pinot Grigio (Australia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just 730 cases were made of this dry, lightly fruity offering. Melon and white peach flavors seem to be dusted with powdered sugar, though there is no sweetness in the finish, just dry flavors of wet stone. A good, every day, all-purpose white.
Name: Covey Run 2008 Quail Series Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A mild, softly fruity wine, with unusual grace notes of sandalwood and incense. The fruit suggests cinnamon-sprinkled pears, and the acidity has been cut and softened. A little bit of a plastic, Band-Aid flavor infuses the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2009 Two Vines Pinot Grigio (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pear-flavored Pinot Gris from Yakima valley fruit. The fruit is limned with well-defined skin flavors, and the wine has a light tawny color. It starts off well, then stops short with a plastic, Band-Aid finish.
Name: Silver Lake 2008 Girly Girl Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pinot Gris is a fast-rising grape in Washington, but most plantings are young, and prone to being a bit over-cropped. Whatever the case, this is sharp and acidic and does not have the concentration of fruit it needs. Green apples and celery flavors lead into a short, sharp finish.
Name: Apex II 2008 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Grauburgunder (Pinot Gris) has become popular in Styria because of its ability to ripen easily. The wine has a touch of spice to go with a complex blend of ripe peach, white berries and final intense, almost cool acidity.
Name: Neumeister 2009 Grauburgunder Klassik Grauburgunder (Südoststeiermark)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is quite light and lemony, closer to an Italian Pinot Grigio than to an Oregon Pinot Gris. What it lacks in flesh it compensates for in freshness and vitality; the subtle fruit flavors suggest Asian pear, jicama and cucumber. It would be a lovely match for a light fish such as rainbow trout or Dover sole.
Name: Milbrandt 2009 Traditions Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made in Dry River's hallmark Pinot Gris style of ripeness and lush fruit, this is a broad, fairly sweet wine that suggests honey, ripe melon and peach. The richness on the palate shows ample concentration, while the finish lingers, long and sweet, hinting at cinnamon and clove. 15 cases imported.
Name: Dry River 2009 Pinot Gris (Martinborough)

Description: Marked by modest apple and pear fruit on the nose, this is a fairly richly textured but dry example of Pinot Gris. It's not the most complex wine, but it fills the mouth with ripe tree fruits and a slightly warm finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.
Name: Innocent Bystander 2009 Pinot Gris (Victoria)

Description: Shows a lifted, herbal edge to the aromas of ripe pear and melon, making it fairly aromatic for NZ Pinot Gris. It's medium-bodied, soft and lush on the palate, with the right balance between sugar and acids so that it doesn't come across as being too sweet.
Name: Villa Maria 2009 Private Bin Pinot Gris (East Coast)

Description: Delivers scents of melon, herb and underripe peach. This is plump and textural without being particularly concentrated or rich, fading a bit rapidly on the finish.
Name: Zonte's Footstep 2009 Doctoressa di Largo Single Site Pinot Grigio (Langhorne Creek)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: A plump, medium-bodied rendition of Pinot Grigio, this is driven by tropical fruit reminiscent of pineapple, tinged with guava. It's a simple, fruit-cocktail of a wine.
Name: Yellow Tail 2008 Reserve Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Rich and sweet, very soft in texture, a wine that is beautifully ripe and broad. It has a dry core of toast, pepper, with raisins and a final hint of acidity.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2006 Kessler Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Sweet and rich wine, preserving some exciting acidity. That makes the currant and fig flavors well in balance with a smoky character, touched by toast. A very elegant wine that also projects concentration.
Designation: Kitterlé Grand Cru Le Brise Mollets
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2007 Kitterlé Grand Cru Le Brise Mollets Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: With its pale gold color, this is obviously a sweet wine. Raisins, bold acidity and spiced mango blend well together in a wine that is maturing well. It is good to drink now, but worth aging.
Name: Château d'Orschwihr 2008 Zinnkoepfle Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Strikingly spicy, with the scents and flavors of Bosch pears, this textural, racy wine has a bit of refreshing effervescence as well. Subtle traces of citrus, pineapple and Asian pear are woven through, and the bracing acidity sets it up well for richly sauced poultry or pasta dishes.
Name: Ponzi 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Another fine estate-grown Pinot Gris from Vista Hills, with plenty of green apple and Bosch pear fruit, along with some light cinnamon spice. There is also a suggestion of flower in both the nose and the mouth, but overall it's a bigger wine than that, with the fruit front and center.
Name: Vista Hills 2008 Flagler Estate Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Lightly herbal, scented with tart pear and tasting the same, this organically grown estate wine is King Estate's best Pinot Gris. Their signature bottling sets a good standard for the grape in Oregon; this elevates it with more detail, density and personality. The alcohol is a sensible 13%, allowing subtle green fruit and herb grace notes to emerge.
Name: King Estate 2008 Domaine Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: A fragrant burst of pear blossom, citrus, melon and green apple aromas lead into similar flavors. Elegant and spicy, this nicely captures the fleshiness of Oregon Pinot Gris. About 10% was finished in oak barrels, the rest in stainless.
Name: Seven Hills 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Sweet, rich wine, powerful ripe pear and melon flavors spiced with ginger and an opulent full texture. The wine lets its perfumed character get away with itself, but it's exuberant for a moment.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2005 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From organically grown grapes, this is for acid lovers. Tart to the point of sour, with lemony fruit and a mouth-puckering presence, it rocks with goat cheeses, and cuts through cream sauces. Super penetration and length.
Name: Thistle 2009 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A beautifully rendered, light and detailed Oregon Pinot Gris, this is redolent of spring flowers and citrus peel, flavored with an elegant blend of pineapple, Asian pear, jicama and white pepper. Very fresh and spicy.
Name: Rex Hill 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A light, almost delicate wine, with pretty pear fruit and a hint of sweetness. The balance is just right, and the wine shows some added flair as it wraps into a finish that seems to gather strength while adding floral and lightly honeyed highlights.
Name: LaVelle 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Even better than the excellent 2008 Acrobat, this ups the alcohol to about 13% and gives the impression of dryness, though there might be a trace of residual sugar. In any event, it's loaded with pretty pear fruit flavor, lightly dusted with cinnamon spice, and fills the mouth with its body and gentle hint of spritz. A fine summer sipper.
Name: Acrobat 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented in a mix of stainless steel barrels and neutral oak barrels, this was fermented with native yeast and given sur lie aging. It went through 100% malolactic fermentation, which has softened the mid-palate, a mix of lemon, grapefruit and Satsuma orange. There are still traces of phenolic bite, but those citrus rind flavors have been well rounded also, though this carries some heat in the finish.
Name: Coelho 2009 Renovação Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Already showing some tawny color, this is a drink-up-quickly bottle. Softly fruity, it also carries a hint of residual sweetness, honeysuckle and Earl Grey tea. Right now it is drinking nicely, with pear tart, brioche and a little honey and vanilla crème running through the finish.
Name: Coeur de Terre 2009 Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Old vine Pinot Gris? Sourced from the Jacob Hart vineyard, it's about 20 years old. Lightly beery, yeasty, with Asian pear and buttered apple providing the main flavor interest. This is an elegant, nicely balanced wine, with fruit and acid in perfect proportion.
Name: Boedecker Cellars 2008 Old Vine Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The current downturn in demand for both grapes and expensive wines only helps A to Z; there is more good fruit to purchase, and plenty of demand at a $12 price point. This new Pinot Gris is fresh and racy, with a mineral-driven acidity underlying the clean fruit, tasting of pears and pear skin.
Name: A to Z 2009 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Smoky, dried fruit-flavored wine. There is some sweetness, its ripe currant flavors boosted by a broad texture and some spice. The acidity seems to be missing.
Name: Helfrich 2008 Steinklotz Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Broad and ripe fruit, hinting at spice. There is weight, pear and peach flavors balanced by a good element of acidity. The final flavors continue the broad texture.
Name: Domaine Specht 2008 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Soft-textured wine, open to spiced pear and apricots with kiwi fruit acidity. It takes a while before the bite of pepper and the richness come through. There is weight and intensity on the finish.
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2008 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bold and fruity, this runs through a spectrum from tart lemon to ripe pineapple to hints of something riper and sweeter, like banana or papaya. A good alternative to Chardonnay for those who favor fruit over oak.
Name: Waterbrook 2008 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A solid, straightforward, all-purpose Pinot Gris, this offers firm and spicy pear and apple fruit, some crisp phenolics giving it a racy edge, and a little bite to the back of the palate. It has the acidity to stand up to creamy pasta sauces or soft cheeses.
Name: Evergreen Vineyards 2008 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lightly spritzy, sharp and focused, this Pinot Gris brings in apples and pears, fruit skin and wet stone. It's nicely balanced and ready for food.
Name: Milbrandt 2008 Traditions Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Light and juicy, with fresh apple flavors and good acidity. A good wine for serving chilled and enjoying outdoors.
Name: Buried Cane 2008 Pinot Grigio (Washington)

Description: Rich, spicy wine, layers of pepper and soft fruits. The flavors show smoky peach and pear, with some weight behind the texture. It finishes well with a light layer of acidity.
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2007 Schofweg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Whole cluster fermented in stainless steel, this is big and spicy, with a lovely textural impact. The aromas and flavors run to honeyed pears and very ripe apples; the finish is resonant and surprisingly mature for a 2009. Drink up.
Name: Spindrift Cellars 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and straightforward, this stainless steel-fermented Pinot Gris has simple, pleasant pear fruit flavors, and just a suggestion of caramel running through it. Perfectly suited for every day quaffing.
Name: Illahe 2009 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Easy-drinking and varietal, this displays fresh pear fruit cut with pineapple. It's forward and juicy, a wine to drink chilled with picnic foods.
Name: Kramer 2008 Pinot Gris (Yamhill-Carlton)

Description: Soft wine, light in texture, some spice and tropical fruits. There is freshness, well integrated into an attractive, ready-to-drink wine. Screwcap.
Name: Helfrich 2008 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Soft and flat in texture with a toffee character and a touch of spice. It tastes old before its time.
Name: Domaine Specht 2007 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Light and lemony, this simple, tangy white wine has some pretty, fresh baked bread scents, but inviting as they are, the wine feels acidic and one dimensional in the mouth. Lemon/lime is the prevailing flavor.
Name: Agate Ridge 2008 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Quite thin, as if over-cropped, turning the fruit generic. Then it brings in a honey character, as if it were botrytis-affected. But it is not a sweet or late harvest wine; it's quite dry.
Name: Château Bianca 2008 Wetzel Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A mix of disjointed impressions. Some floral notes collide with sour acids, then lead into a confected, candied finish.
Name: Château Bianca 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Pinot Gris is trendy in Australia, which to date hasn't meant great things in terms of home-grown quality. This is a pretty good example, offering a broad, thick texture balanced on the finish by peppery spice, while melon and apricot flavors carry the midpalate. Drink it over the next 6–9 months.
Name: Sidewood 2009 Pinot Gris (Adelaide Hills)

Description: Made with a bit of skin contact, this pale copper-hued wine boasts scents of dusty earth and cantaloupe. Melon and apple-skin flavors mingle easily on the palate, ending with some light tannins and mouthwatering acids. Drink now–2011.
Name: Robert Oatley 2009 Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Slightly chunky in texture, this value-priced Pinot Grigio offers up a mouthful of pulpy apple and pear fruit, but not a lot of nuance or sophistication. Fine as a weeknight apéritif or alongside grilled chicken.
Name: Oxford Landing 2009 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Exotic to the point that one wonders whether other varieties have been blended in, with spicy hints of cardamom, cinnamon and clove, followed by ripe melon flavors. At least this is not a bland, neutral effort, although it may have a touch of residual sugar. Drink now.
Name: Black Swan 2009 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This seems to be an attempt at an Italianate style, with modest alcohol levels (11%) and the accompanying lack of fruit expression. It's largely neutral, with hints of underripe pear and white pepper that combine with chalky notes on the finish.
Name: Jacob's Creek 2009 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fragrant, inviting, this lovely Pinot Gris bursts out with fresh cut pear flavors so crisp you want to bite it rather than sip it. Lovely perfumed highlights of clover and sweet blossom add interest. There is just enough phenolic bite to give the finish further definition.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2009 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firm and full of fresh pear and apple and white peach fruit flavors. A clever blend that includes Muscat, Viognier and Riesling. Crisp and full-bodied, with a very clean and refreshing mouthfeel that extends into a bright, satisfying finish.
Name: Hyatt Vineyards 2008 Pinot Gris (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Easy drinking, fresh white wine with grapefruit and pear flavors front and center. There is a pleasing tartness, and a suggestion of balancing fruit sugar that plays well against the acidity.
Name: Ciao Bella 2009 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Grisant Pinot Gris is more full and fleshy than the winery's LEHM bottling, but still a bit one dimensional. Pleasant flavors of pear fruit, skin phenolics and light suggestions of cinnamon.
Name: Vin du Lac 2008 Grisant! Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chelan County, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This could be Chardonnay, or any light white wine. Fruit flavors are apple and pear; there's lots of acidity. A simple, pleasant, everyday style.
Name: Vin du Lac 2008 LEHM Pinot Gris (Chelan County)

Description: For Argentine PG it's attractive. The nose is clean but simple, while the palate is fresh and easy, with driving pineapple and lemon flavors being pushed along by good acidity. Juicy and wet on the finish, and overall it ranks as a nice, fruity wash.
Name: Callia 2009 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fruit-forward, high-toned Pinot Gris, with straightforward pear fruit flavors.
Name: Mount Baker Vineyards 2008 Barrel Select Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: Dull and dilute, but painless. The palate is chunky but with enough acids to stay lively, and the flavors of green apple, lemon and pineapple are decent enough. Tangy and slightly bitter on the finish.
Name: Graffigna 2009 Centenario Reserve Pinot Grigio (San Juan)

Description: Flat on the nose, with neutral, slightly floral aromas. The palate is zesty and tart, with midland flavors of lemon, sour apple and lime. Chalky but o.k. on the finish. A one-dimensional white with hardly any lasting potential.
Name: Odyssea 2009 Pinot Gris (Mendoza)

Description: Dusty, flat and cidery on the nose, and then heavy and clunky in the mouth, with flat, bland mildly bitter citrus and apple flavors. Finishes broad and pithy, and maybe a bit oxidized as well.
Name: François Lurton 2009 Pinot Gris (Uco Valley)

Description: Light, tropical but ultimately dilute, with chalky, drying, tart flavors that run toward lemon and underripe pineapple. Lemony on the finish and monotone.
Name: Funky Llama 2009 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: As classy a bottle as you might expect from veteran winemaker Laurent Montalieu. Once again the fruit is crystal clear, setting up fresh pear, green apple and pink grapefruit flavors against crisp, juicy acidity. The finish is lively and spicy.
Name: Soléna 2008 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Dry River's 2008 Pinot Gris is a lush, creamy-textured off-dry wine that pairs bold fruit elements of pear and melon with hints of peach leaf and gingery spice. Long on the finish, with absolutely no trace of bitterness. Drink now–2015.
Name: Dry River 2008 Pinot Gris (Martinborough)

Description: A broad, richly textured wine made in a dry style, this packs in the pear, nectarine and melon flavors, then wraps them up with touches of spice on a harmonious, long finish. Drink now.
Name: Kawarau Estate 2008 Vineyard Reserve Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: With only 6.5 g/l of residual sugar, this weighty wine comes across as almost dry, allowing the emphasis to be on the bold notes of melon, pear and citrus. It's rich without being overtly sweet, then finishes clean, adding a touch of white pepper to the mix. Drink now–2012.
Name: Lawson's Dry Hills 2008 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is fermented in neutral barrels, so it is a rounder, more open style than Pinot Gris done in stainless steel. It is therefore more approachable at a young age, and also tastes leesy and creamy—a treat for the palate. The fruit is lean and fresh, and a bracing minerality infuses the finish.
Name: Chehalem 2008 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Spy Valley's upmarket Pinot Gris is vendange tardive in style, made in an old oak oval with plenty of residual sugar (39 g/l) and a rich, unctuous texture. Bold honey and melon notes are accented by hints of ginger and white pepper, leading to a mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2015.
Name: Spy Valley 2008 Envoy Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tightly wound and spicy, this elegant wine captures the varietal character with crisp pear fruit, annotated with minty anise. It's tangy, sleek, fine-boned and tart, fading gracefully as it winds into a clean finish.
Name: Methven Family Vineyards 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Spy Valley is a pretty consistent Marlborough source for aromatic whites, and this may be their best Pinot Gris to date. It starts off with spicy notes reminiscent of ginger and white pepper, then delivers a broad, concentrated mouthfeel and a richly textured finish. Drink now–2011.
Name: Spy Valley 2009 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A bit of a fruit salad of a Pinot Gris, with pineapple, banana, mango, white peach and jicama all in the mix. There is an underlying, bracing minerality that keeps the wine focused and firm, and leads into suggestions of toasted almond in the finish. Delicious, yet quite different from most other Oregon versions.
Name: Brandborg 2008 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: There's a slight coppery tinge to this wine's hue, which can't help but influence perceptions of aroma and flavor. With 7 g/l of residual sugar, this is off-dry in style, with strawberry, apple and melon flavors. Like an alcohol-infused fruit cocktail with a sense of balance and proportion.
Name: Awatere River 2009 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Clean and fresh, this food-friendly wine tastes of pear, jicama and celery. It's light and balanced, and would make a fine accompaniment to a springtime salad or a simple fish course.
Name: Del Rio 2008 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Virtually dry, the 2008 Nautilus Pinot Gris is also lighter and leaner than many of its competitors. Pineapple and melon aromas and flavors finish crisply, buoyed by a dash of white pepper. Drink now–2011.
Name: Nautilus 2008 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Very tart and acidic, this is a wine that cries out for oysters. The lemony fruit is highlighted with notes of ginger, celery and a broad mineral streak. Nice complexity for such a low-alcohol (12.4%), high-acid bottle.
Name: Ross Andrew 2008 Celilo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: This off-dry Pinot Gris starts off with a touch of passionfruit and spice on the nose, then adds honeyed melon and pear flavors on the palate. The finish lingers, prolonged by pineapple-citrus notes. Drink now.
Name: Omaka Springs 2009 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: The 2008 vintage in Central Otago didn't yield the power or concentration of 2007, and this wine's performance reflects that. It's a slender, off-dry wine, with pineapple and pear fruit and a hint of coffee on the finish.
Name: Peregrine 2008 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: This is a slightly simple but clean and precise example of Pinot Gris, with melon and pear notes upfront, followed by a touch of apple on the finish. Lots of fruit, finishing crisp and refreshing.
Name: Jules Taylor 2008 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Off-dry in style, with forward aromas of fresh pineapple and a touch of chalk dust, this is a medium-bodied Pinot Gris with plenty of ripe melon and red currant flavors balanced by a touch of apple skin on the finish.
Name: Waimea 2009 Pinot Gris (Nelson)

Description: Sweet and soft, with ripe melon and pear flavors that somehow never seem cloying, instead remaining harmonious through the finish. Drink now.
Name: Woollaston 2008 Pinot Gris (Nelson)

Description: This is an acid-lover's Pinot Gris, quite tart and lemony. The lightly ripened fruit hints at green apples and pears, with nicely managed phenolics that put an edge on the finish.
Name: Cloudline 2008 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Made in a soft, off-dry style, this Pinot Gris features apple and pear flavors underscored by modest citrusy notes and a bit of gingery spice on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Freefall 2008 Pinot Gris (Waipara)

Description: A hint of flintiness adds a touch of austerity to the nose, which otherwise features pineapple and quince. This off-dry wine is on the tart side; citrus and melon notes pick up a trace of bitterness on the finish.
Name: Maude 2008 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is Pinot Gris that tastes quite a bit like Sauvignon Blanc: grassy and herbaceous, but with a little more flesh, less acidity. Match it with shellfish and light seafoods and it will do the trick; it's fresh and bracing.
Name: Kathken Vineyards 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied Pinot Gris turns a bit skinny on the finish, but offers a decent mouthful of apple, pear and citrus flavors. Drink now.
Name: Lobster Reef 2008 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Some initial rubbery notes blow off to reveal pear and citrus fruit. This is an off-dry wine, balanced by really crisp acids that seem a little metallic on the finish.
Name: Mohua 2009 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Although this wine has performed better in past vintages, the 2007 attempts to marry buttery notes with melon fruit and the result is not entirely pleasant. It does show decent weight, concentration and length.
Name: Escarpment 2007 Station Bush Vineyard Pinot Gris (Martinborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A new varietal for Lone Canary, this is exceptionally ripe and full-bodied. Sweet grain, lemon oil, pineapple and a whiff of petrol mark a rich wine with fine acidity. The skin flavors put a little bite into the finish.
Name: Lone Canary 2008 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, from Evergreen and Ancient Lakes, two of Washington's best white wine vineyards. Quite lemony and tart, it has a refreshing minerality underscoring cool-climate fruit flavors that just barely touch upon melon, with food-friendly acidity.
Name: Boomtown 2008 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hogue is making a lot of Pinot Grigio, maybe the most in the state, done in a tart, high acid style with emphasis on fruit skin flavors—lemon zest, orange peel, pear skin and green apples. A fine food wine.
Name: Hogue 2008 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Adelsheim lays claim to being the third winery in the country to make Pinot Gris; this is their 25th vintage. It's a fine effort, beautifully rendered with crisp, spicy pear and melon fruit. Medium-bodied, focused and long.
Name: Adelsheim 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fruit is sourced from a 23–year-old, organically farmed vineyard. With wonderful texture and mouthfeel, it offers a luscious mix of pear, pear skin, and grapefruit—tangy and refreshing. Such a juicy, spicy, lip-licking wine, you can't wait for the next sip.
Name: Arbor Brook 2008 Croft Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and satisfying, with flavors of apples and pears, brioche and vanilla cream. What stands out is the full, round midpalate, and the way the wine keeps resonating through an extended finish.
Name: David Hill 2008 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: With alcohol under 13%, this spicy, well-constructed Pinot Gris is decidedly cut in a European mold. Grapefruit and fiddlehead fern flavors combine, with surprising concentration and length. For food matches think along the lines of what goes best with a spicy, grassy Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Coeur de Terre 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A big, juicy, fruit-bomb of a rosé, this Knight's Gambit from Erath mixes flavors of rosewater, watermelon, strawberries and cocoa in a big, broad, forward, palate-pleasing wine. The pretty pink color is from skin contact with the Pinot Gris—no red wine was added.
Name: Erath 2008 Knight's Gambit Rosé Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Crisp and acidic, with distinct scents and flavors of juicy pear and melon. The sharp acidity and pear skin phenolics place it squarely in the Pinot Grigio (hence Italian) camp.
Name: Apolloni 2008 Estate Pinot Grigio (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This limited-edition Pinot Gris was barrel-fermented and aged sur lie. It broadens out the palate and adds layers of buttered popcorn, caramel and toasted hazelnuts to the apple and pear fruit flavors.
Name: Erath 2008 Knight's Gambit Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: This is Erath's big production white wine. It's well-balanced, with moderately ripe apple and pear flavors, some noticeable tannins, and firm acids. A solid, middle-of-the-road effort.
Name: Erath 2008 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Light pear and apple flavors, with a dash of melon, comprise this simple, pleasantly acidic white wine. Though it does not have the density of many other Oregon Pinot Gris bottlings, it is reliable and fresh, with a screwcap for good measure.
Name: Duck Pond 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A little sweaty in the nose, this moves ahead with pineapple and grapefruit flavors, finishing with slightly bitter citrus rind flavors. It's more of a food wine than a sipping wine.
Name: Kings Ridge 2008 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Very tart, almost sour, this high-acid wine just might be a good match for fresh oysters, but on its own it is slightly bitter and barely ripe.
Name: Tyee Wine Cellars 2008 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Thin tasting, like apple cider, with high acidity and a slight scent of animal.
Name: Tyee Wine Cellars 2007 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The opening aromas carry an impression of some overripe fruit, like papaya past its prime. Oddly, the flavors are sour and plain, with a bitter finish.
Name: Van Duzer 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is mostly Evergreen vineyard, and includes 10% Viognier. Good, juicy, loaded with melon and citrus. The Viognier gives the wine some lift and brightness, and the tartness adds even more liveliness to the finish.
Name: Chatter Creek 2008 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A light, elegant nose of almonds, apple and honeysuckle, followed by fresh flavors of nuts, apple and flowers on the palate. Pretty, balanced and lingering in the finish. A great food wine.
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2007 Curry Creek Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: The Wolffer Pinot Gris has an attractive, zesty character from the start, with its nose of melon, pear, citrus and spice followed by a fun, lively array of lemon, toast and pear. Pretty and an enjoyable drink on its own, or with delicate foods.
Name: Wölffer 2008 Pinot Gris (Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: The nose on this Pinot Gris—full of nutty spice and minerals—has instant appeal. On the palate, it offers a combination of subtle spice and fresh fruit, a delicate balance. The wine has curve but is overall clean and spicy. Poised but approachable.
Name: Hunt Country Vineyards 2008 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: In 1970, David Lett made Pinot Gris for the first time – the first time anywhere in America. This, his 38th and final vintage, runs the flavor gamut from citrus to stone fruit to tropical. There's a deep straw color, a flash of honey, and a substantial, almost weighty midpalate. Light toast adds further flavor interest to the finish.
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2007 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The unusually cool vintage seems to have heightened and focused the white wines. This stainless steel-fermented wine is vivid and fresh, with complex fruits, orange peel, citrus, suggestions of ginger and even (as the winery points out) sea spray, this has it all.
Name: Chehalem 2008 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A nicely textured, lightly spicy wine with round, fleshy, apple and pear fruit. Hints of orange blossom lead into a streak of orange candy, then a strong finish with mineral accents.
Name: Lemelson 2008 Tikka's Run Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The estate Pinot Gris from Vista Hills shows a streak of pine resin that enlivens the naturally juicy pear and gooseberry fruit. It's spicy and strong, crisp and clean— just right for a pesto dish.
Name: Vista Hills 2007 Flagler Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Oregon Pinot Gris doesn't get more fresh and refreshing than this zippy number from Vista Hills. With alcohol at just 13.2%, it is truly food-friendly, with elegant and light herbal notes across fresh apple and pear.
Name: Vista Hills 2007 Treehouse Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: WillaKenzie's Pinot Gris is fleshier and rounder than the elegant, delicious Pinot Blanc, and makes a fine companion wine. The soft entry tastes of Asian pear, yellow apple and a bit of green pineapple. It firms up as it rolls across the palate, with excellent concentration and focus.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A fragrant, forward wine with a palate-cleansing mix of citrus, pear and white peach. The wine has a spicy lift to the midpalate, and lingers deliciously through a long finish.
Name: Benton-Lane 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Juicy and tart, this is a glorious match for spicy chicken dishes. The Crawford-Beck vineyard is just over an acre, with volcanic and sedimentary soils that preserve acidity over a lengthy ripening cycle. Packed with fresh apple, guava and pear fruit, and loaded with natural acidity.
Name: Owen Roe 2008 Crawford-Beck Vineyard Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and spicy, this has classic Oregon Pinot Gris pear-flavored fruit. It's lifted by natural acids and highlighted with not-too-sweet baking spice.
Name: Illahe 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This straightforward, fruity effort is bright, tart, and full of lemon and melon flavors, with a touch of spice for added interest.
Name: Elk Cove 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pineapples and pears fill out this tart, juicy, high-acid effort. Though it does not quite have the flesh of the 2007 it's a fine food wine, clean, crisp and varietal.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This pleasant Pinot Gris is value priced, and has slightly more residual sugar (.66 percent) and less alcohol (12.2%) than the King Estate bottling. With ripe, fresh, spicy pear flavors and crisp natural acids, it's a sure-fire food wine.
Name: Acrobat 2008 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a new offering from this recently introduced Columbia Crest tier. The fruit is a tangy mix of green apple and citrus, along with some orange peel, and a slight whiff of leather.
Name: Columbia Crest 2008 H3 Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: If America has a signature Pinot Gris, this is it—widely available, crisply varietal, and now named “Signature Collection.” Fleshy pear and stone fruits form the central core; with some suggestions of tannin and light herb finishing up, along with a bit of vanilla wafer.
Name: King Estate 2008 Signature Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Given that the number of good Argentine PGs can be counted on one hand, this one distinguishes itself. The nose is a touch sweaty and prickly, but the fresh palate, sporty acidity and solid flavors of lime, tangerine and nectarine are nice. Drink now.
Name: Pulenta 2008 XIV Pinot Gris (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A sharp, lean Pinot Gris. With alcohol just under 14%, it still tilts toward the green side, with cucumber and Asian pear flavors, plenty of acid and sharpness in the finish.
Name: Anne Amie 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The barest hint of copper marks this white wine, which offers up aromas of peach and cantaloupe—or perhaps they're just suggested by the wine's color? Flavors are a bit musky, showing berry flavors before some tannins come in on the lengthy finish.
Name: Robert Oatley 2008 Pinot Grigio (South Australia)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Crisp and edged with citrus rind skin flavors, this light take on Pinot Gris mixes melon, white peach and Asian pear. It's pleasant and balanced, but without the extra snap and layering of the best Pinot Gris from Oregon; this just falls a bit flat.
Name: Rex Hill 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a fully ripe, sweetly tropical style that will most likely provoke strong opinions. For this taster, the high-toned aromas and baking spices interfered with the varietal rather than adding to it.
Name: Johan Vineyards 2008 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A pleasant, fruit-forward Pinot Gris, with citrus and green apple flavors. It falls a bit flat in the mouth; not exactly tired, but lacking a little freshness.
Name: Maysara 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pinot Grigio has yet to find a distinguishing style in Washington State. This is borderline generic, almost beery, a plain, pleasant, fairly neutral white wine with a mix of white peaches and green apples.
Name: Columbia Crest 2008 Grand Estates Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Sweetly fragrant, with hints of pear and melon. The palate is wet, lean and acidic, which helps push the lychee and melon flavors. A clean, light, mild refresher with sharper-than-expected acids. Nothing more than that.
Name: Callia 2008 Alta Pinot Grigio (Tulum Valley)

Description: If you catch this wine soon, meaning before it goes belly up, you may like its peachy simplicity and ample palate weight. Lychee, melon and spiced-meat flavors are interesting up to a point, and the finish is generic, soft and clean. Drink immediately.
Name: Graffigna 2008 Centenario Pinot Grigio (San Juan)

Description: Scented candle, green herbs, mushroom and anonymous white fruit aromas lead to a cidery, fairly thin palate of melony flavors. Finishes plump but slightly pickled. Not bad for $7.
Name: Pampano 2008 Pinot Grigio (San Juan)

Description: The funky stable welcomes a new breed of llama: Pinot Grigio. And like most of the other FL wines, it's acceptable to o.k. but not showing much in the way of quality. The nose is mealy and flat, while the palate has roundness and soft flavors of orange, grapefruit and white pepper.
Name: Funky Llama 2008 Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: A nose with apples, vanilla and pear, and flavors of flowers and pears are found in this delicate Pinot Grigio. Spicy but floral, with a quaffable character.
Name: Cramele Recas 2008 Alb Sec Pinot Grigio (Viile Timis)

Description: A medium-bodied, creamy-textured Pinot Gris, filled to the brim with pear, melon and jasmine notes. Elegant and harmonious, it should prove versatile with food.
Name: Borthwick Vineyard 2008 Paper Road Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Although boasting slightly honeyed aromas of pear and melon, this is a dry wine, just fully ripe. It's medium in body, with a dusting of gingery spice that gives it extra interest on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Mount Grey Estate 2008 Pinot Gris (Waipara)

Description: This wine starts off showing one of Pinot Gris' less admirable qualities—its often neutral aromas. Hints of citrus and apple eventually come through on the palate, finishing simple, dry and fresh. This crisp, neutral white should prove versatile at the table, even if it doesn't steal the limelight.
Name: Chasing Venus 2008 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Just a touch off-dry, the Nautilus Pinot Gris features only moderately intense aromas and flavors of honey, apple and citrus. It's light to medium in body, rounded out by three months on the lees. Drink now.
Name: Nautilus 2008 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Promising baked pear aromas lead the way, but this tart, citrusy wine comes across as not quite completely harmonious. The ripe pear competes with the lime-juice notes rather than being accented or framed by them. Still, there's decent concentration and the citrusy finish is refreshing.
Name: Curious Cove 2008 Pinot Gris (East Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From estate fruit, this is a cut above most similarly priced Oregon Pinot Gris. The nose sends up a lively mix of cilantro and other sweet herbs, leading into ripe pear-flavored fruit. Flavors meld and linger, acids refresh, and the wine takes a lovely, lazy stroll down your palate, inviting another sip.
Name: Methven Family Vineyards 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Once again Sineann has produced a marvelous, delicate and fascinating Pinot Gris. Less audaciously fruity than in the past, it more than makes up for it with details of dust and pollen and sweet straw that might almost come from a Loire Valley Savennières. Tucked away in the light herbal scents are streaks of melon, apple and pear.
Name: Sineann 2008 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: A to Z puts out a lot of Pinot Gris—more than 32,000 cases of this 2008—but the quality is consistently fine. Lovely spices wrap around fresh citrus and pear, then move into a smooth midpalate that lingers gracefully through a clean and very refreshing finish.
Name: A to Z 2008 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Once again, Luisa Ponzi has crafted a delightful, palate-lifting Pinot Gris, with tangy acids and a lovely mix of apple, pear, lemon/lime and grapefruit flavors. The alcohol is just over 13%, and yet it is perfectly ripe, balanced and inviting.
Name: Ponzi 2008 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Light and fruity, with a fresh mix of melon and apple, this is a pleasant, simple, fruity, summer-weight white wine.
Name: Arcane Cellars 2008 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Oak Knoll is a value producer, sourcing its fruit close to the winery, and emphasizing that fruit in simple, pleasant wines such as this Pinot Gris. Citrus and melon flavors, light and rather delicate, make this a good choice for a simple mid-week meal. Best Buy.
Name: Oak Knoll 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas of fresh cut apples are so strong that this could easily pass for apple cider in a blind tasting. It's low alcohol, high acid, and quite unusual.
Name: Girardet 2007 Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)

Description: From the warmer Bendigo subregion of Central Otago, this is a rather broad, full-bodied rendition of Pinot Gris, with ample melon flavors forming the wine's base. Embellishments of cinnamon and almond add complexity, lingering through the long finish. Drink now.
Name: Lamont 2006 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rounder and more fruity than the inaugural 2007 Pinot Gris, this has succulent green apple and Bosch pear flavors balanced against crisp, refreshing acids.
Name: Mercer 2008 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: An intriguing Marlborough Pinot Gris, incorporating some Viognier-like scents of spice and apricot to go along with fig and pear flavors. It's medium in body, with threshold levels of residual sugar that come across as additional weight rather than sweetness. Drink now.
Name: Cape Campbell 2008 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Made in a rather soft, off-dry style, this wine boasts amply concentrated fruit that runs along nectarine, plum and citrus lines, but could use more zip to balance its broad, honeyed flavors. As things stand, it's good, but for the price it needs to be better.
Name: Te Mara 2007 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: Comes across as a bit overly sweet, but cleanly made and with nicely delineated notes of honey, pear, melon and citrus. Try with mildly spicy curries and the like.
Name: Omaka Springs 2008 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Almost pale coppery in color, Isabel's 2007 Pinot Gris is made in an off-dry style that's presumably meant to buffer the wine's crisp acids and cool, minerally personality. Instead, the honeyed notes clash somewhat with the hardness of the finish.
Name: Isabel Estate 2007 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Starts with aromas of minerals, pear and apple, and on the palate, offers an elegant balance of taut acidity and rounded honey flavors. Refreshing but rich. An appealing white with a unique character.
Name: Mme Aly Duhr et Fils 2007 Domaine et Tradition Machtum Hohfels Pinot Gris (Moselle Luxembourgeoise)

Description: Offers aromas of honey, almond and white fruit, followed by a racy array of mineral and fruit flavors. The wine has a rich, creamy element that gives it complexity. Elegant and versatile.
Name: Mme Aly Duhr et Fils 2007 Ahn Hohfels Grand Premier Cru Pinot Gris (Moselle Luxembourgeoise)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This easygoing, fruit-forward take on Pinot Gris is styled for immediate enjoyment. The fruit is ripe and flavorful—a nice mix of fresh cut pear and apple, with a hint of orange peel giving it a little stiffness and tannin. The blend includes Siegerrebe, Gewürztraminer and Viognier, and the alcohol is listed at just over 13%, so this is a perfect wine for a spring picnic.
Name: Mount Baker Vineyards 2007 Barrel Select Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Old vine is a loose term; here it signifies vines about 20 years of age. Considering that Pinot Gris has been planted in Oregon for almost twice that long, that seems like a bit of a stretch. Nonetheless, a fine effort, mixing pear-flavored fruit with baking spices and brioche, giving it a pastry-like set of flavors. Deep and penetrating, with a long and lively finish.
Name: Boedecker Cellars 2007 Old Vine Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Delicate and poised, this unusual Pinot Gris was fermented half in stainless and half in neutral oak, then kept on the lees for an extended period before bottling. The wine reveals itself gracefully with mixed green apple and white peach; hints of baking spice and a wash of vanilla wafer appear right at the finish line.
Name: Daedalus Cellars 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is Pinot Gris under its German name, a vital, pure, green- and white-fruited wine, very fresh with a strong pineapple, lime and grapefruit element. The fruit, biodynamically grown, is very straight, crisp, with intense acidity that needs a year to calm down.
Name: Michlits 2008 Meinklang Graupert Grauburgunder (Burgenland)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Like biting right into a crisp Asian pear, this clean and brightly fruity wine accents the fresh flavors with just a hint of nutmeg and sweet spice.
Name: RoxyAnn 2007 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bright and tasting of ripe pear, this is a textural, tart, tangy wine nicely set up for pastas, light seafood and poultry. Despite the nominal residual sugar, it comes across as almost entirely dry, with just a hint of fruit sweetness.
Name: Château Bianca 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: It's difficult to see what qualifies this as a reserve bottling. It's a light, simple, rather generically fruity white wine, with some melon and pineapple flavors and moderate acids.
Name: Cooper Mountain 2007 20th Anniversary Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Villa Wolf, Ernst Loosen's Pfalz venture, had several hits in 2007, including this medium-bodied, dry Pinot Gris. Orange and tangerine notes marry easily on the palate with stony notes of crushed rock. Falls somewhere between Alsace and Italy in style and weight—an attractive combination at a realistic price.
Name: Villa Wolf 2007 Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Not up to recent standards, this light, thin offering tastes like pear-flavored lemon water. Where's the beef?
Name: Covey Run 2007 Quail Series Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made in a soft, creamy-textured off-dry style, Spy Valley's 2007 Pinot Gris features a lightly spicy, musky note on the nose, then clean, fruit-driven flavors of pineapple, guava and melon. Simply fruity, but satisfying. Drink now.
Name: Spy Valley 2007 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All Evergreen vineyard fruit showcasing luscious, fresh- cut pear fruit flavors, along with hints of mint and spice. Acids are pure and firm, and there is also an underlying minerality that is clean and refreshing. Better yet, the alcohol is kept under 13%.
Name: Boomtown 2007 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This fresh, clean, subtle wine offers green apple, melon and light citrus fruit, snappy acids and mouth-refreshing texture, all in a very light and moderately low-alcohol style.
Name: Milbrandt 2007 Traditions Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is nearly dry—increasingly rare for NZ Pinot Gris—with aromas of slightly stewed fruit: white grapes and pears with sprinklings of clove and cinnamon. It's only medium weight, with a finish reminiscent of canned pears and a hint of tangerine. Drink now.
Name: Seifried 2007 Pinot Gris (Nelson)

Description: Despite sufficient residual sugar to render it off-dry, this Pinot Gris retains a slightly tart, lean character. Underripe stone fruit and pineapple flavors lack richness and generosity, ending on a tart, citrusy note.
Name: Kumeu River 2007 Pinot Gris (Kumeu)

Description: The deep gold color with a hint of copper suggests some skin contact. The attractive melon, lychee and spice aromas quickly dissipate with air, leaving mot much more than a slight astringency on the finish. Sourced from Nelson.
Name: Crowded House 2007 Pinot Gris (New Zealand)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Carabella's tasty, toasty take on Pinot Gris is a blend of two clones, mostly fermented in stainless steel, but with a third of it fermented in neutral oak. The resulting wine is elegant and complex, a mix of white peach and pear, toasted hazelnuts and butterscotch. Simply delicious.
Name: Carabella 2007 Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: In much the same style as Brandborg's Riesling, this creamy Pinot Gris has a rich, leesy texture, here augmented with streaks of vanilla and toasted almond. The fruit is tangy and refreshing, tasting of ripe lemons and limes, and the balance and full midpalate show a fine winemaker at work.
Name: Brandborg 2007 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Whether or not you like the orange and blue packaging, the screwcap and the cutesy story about bluebirds stealing hazelnuts, the Blue Pirate is a wine worth exploring. This is juicy, fleshy, tangy Pinot Gris, loaded with flavors of just-ripe pears and hints of citrus rind, pineapple and vanilla. Big and relatively high in alcohol, this can take on major seafood, such as swordfish, sea bass or halibut.
Name: Blue Pirate 2007 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A welcome renaissance in low-alcohol white wines from Oregon may be more a function of the wet 2007 harvest than any genuine dedication to revealing lost, subtle flavors, but in any event, it is a boon for any consumer who likes a Euro style. This could be Italian or French; it could be Portuguese (where Coelho's owners trace their ancestry). It's very tart and elegant, loaded with mineral and citrus, Asian pear and hints of grapefruit.
Name: Coelho 2007 Renovação Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lemon oil and pear skin scents introduce this light white, along with hints of diesel and earth. The fruit is delicate and acidic, bringing in tart citrus—grapefruit, lime and gooseberry —plus some light spice.
Name: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A honeyed spice and lemon nose and flavors of crisp citrus give this PG a classic, food-friendly edge. The wine offers more complex fruit and spice flavors than a typical Pinot Grigio, with a weightier midpalate and clean finish. An elegant wine with character.
Name: Chaddsford 2007 Pinot Grigio (Pennsylvania)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Elegant fruit and spice aromas are followed by a clean, crisp blend of citrus and flowers. The wine is delicate and balanced but full of flavor. Pair with cheeses, grilled seafood or Indian cuisine.
Name: Penguin Bay 2007 Pinot Grigio (New York)

Description: This inexpensive Pinot Gris has pear fruit with spicy highlights that somehow conjure up caraway. It's wrapped in yeasty flavors of fresh-baked bread and plenty of lemony acid.
Name: Cloudline 2007 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a fresh and friendly white with a floral nose and crisp flavors of pear and lemon. Overall, the wine has body and a dry, elegant character. Pair with seafood or Asian cuisine.
Name: Goose Watch 2007 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is an exemplary, dependable Pinot Gris, with its fresh lemon and citrus aromas and spicy citrus and fruit flavors. Dry and zesty, it will pair well with grilled seafood and Asian cuisine.
Name: Ravines 2007 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: From estate-grown fruit on the Oregon side of the Columbia Gorge AVA, this light and lemony wine seems to show some lees contact and just a hint of toasted cracker. It's simple and easy drinking, but lacks real depth.
Name: Wy'East Vineyards 2007 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: Crisp grapefruit and lemon aromas and simple, fresh citrus flavors give this white a fun, easygoing appeal. Balanced acid and fruit and a spicy finish add to the package. A good go-to white.
Name: Messina Hof 2007 Pinot Grigio (Texas)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A spicy, lemony nose with a touch of sweetness leads this PG from New York. The fresh fruit and pert citrus-lemon flavors are clean and fresh, and the wine offers a good fruit and acid balance. A great wine for seafood and salads.
Name: Damiani 2007 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This wine has a lush nose—vanilla, spice—but its flavor is refreshing and crisp. Waves of spice and citrus are well balanced and elegant. A simple but food-friendly sip.
Name: Billsboro 2007 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Zippy, fresh citrus aromas lead on this Pinot Gris from Hazlitt. Flavors of white pepper, apple and lemon are carried on a lively, spritzy backbone. A bit lean, but will be enjoyable with foods to balance: think creamier dishes and cheese.
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2007 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Refreshing, lively, this Pinot Gris starts with aromas of grapefruit and lemon and leads into zesty flavors of white pepper, lemon and grapefruit. A touch acidic, the wine could use more fruit balance, but overall an enjoyable dry white choice.
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2007 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Slightly stony upfront, then adds modest apple and melon flavors. It's a dry, medium-bodied wine with a tart-apple finish.
Name: Goose Bay 2007 Kosher Pinot Gris (East Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light pear flavors, along with green apple, constitute the fruit, varietal but a little on the plain Jane side. It's tart and racy, with hints of lime rind. The finish falls off and leaves a slight impression of plastic or band-aid.
Name: Chatter Creek 2007 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: After the massive Pinot Gris bottlings from Chehalem in 2006, these much lighter 2007 wines are a delight. Both the regular and this reserve offerings live up to the winery's professed Alsatian model, with rich textural flavors that bind lightly tropical fruits to searing minerality. Concentrated and complex, this young wine is still quite tight and will need decanting to show its best.
Name: Chehalem 2007 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Another exceptional effort from Chehalem in 2007, this stainless steel-fermented wine offers crisp, clean and racy flavors of fresh cut pear, lime skin, hints of apricot and a thrilling minerality. As it rounds off a bit in midpalate, it introduces hints of honey that continue into a finish that demands another pour. Alcohol clocks in at a sensible 13.6%.
Name: Chehalem 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This reserve Pinot Gris does not come from the estate vines that gave us the luscious regular bottling; here the AVA is Dundee Hills and the flavors are more austere, textural and mineral-laced. Bone dry and a full percentage point higher in alcohol, this wine has a steely spine, and its citrus fruit shows more of the skin and less of the sweet juice. It's delightful to find two quite different offerings that are so well made from a new and value-oriented producer.
Name: Arcane Cellars 2007 Reserve Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Nothing arcane here; this is a gem of a Pinot Gris. The fruit salad flavors run the gamut of citrus, from orange to grapefruit and on into fresh cut pear. Acids are sharp and give the wine clean, crisp definition, enhanced with a little spritz. The alcohol, just under 13%, makes this especially food friendly. It's got Italian styling with the richer fruit flavors of the American west coast.
Name: Arcane Cellars 2007 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is a classic, high-acid vintage. The strength is fruit, and it's a mix of citrus and light pineapple; all stainless fermented and finished at moderate alcohol. Quite different in style from the '06, but well-made.
Name: Lachini 2007 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Rich in the mouth, this creamy and textural wine mixes fruit flavors of peach, apple and pear in equal proportion. It's a bit heavier than the previous vintage, with less of the floral character, but it offers, instead, a richness that lingers into a satisfying finish.
Name: The Four Graces 2007 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Ripe, tropical flavors of pear, peach and banana mingle in this blend of five vineyards. It's fleshy and ripe.
Name: Lachini 2006 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A little dull and disappointing given this winery's excellent track record with Pinot Gris, this wine may reflect the difficult, wet 2007 vintage. It's crisp and balanced, but does not show the ripe fruit flavors of previous vintages. Tart green berries, green apple and grapefruit flavors dominate, bone dry and high acid. A slightly metallic note creeps into the finish.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is delicious, from 28-year-old vines at the exceptional Celilo Vineyard in Washington's Columbia Gorge AVA. Bone dry and dappled with spice, this elegant wine has exceptional mouthfeel and length. It's crisp, subtle and distinctive.
Name: Ross Andrew 2007 Celilo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: A to Z can honestly lay claim to making Oregon's best budget Pinot Gris. Their inexpensive, widely available bottlings consistently offer fresh, varietal scents of citrus and pear, with nuances of acacia flowers and honeysuckle. Production has ramped up to 31,000 cases, with no diminution of quality.
Name: A to Z 2007 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The winery calls the 2007 Tikka's “less exuberant” than previous vintages; that is not necessarily a bad thing. The fruit is crisp and powerfully focused; layered with flavors of melon, green apple, Asian pear and fresh peas. Whole cluster pressed and fermented in a combination of tank and neutral barrels, this textural wine finishes with crisp, mineral accents.
Name: Lemelson 2007 Tikka's Run Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: David Hill's new Pinot Gris is spicy with the sharp scents and flavors of pineapple. Much drier than the 2006 version, it's more suited to food. The herbal, spicy character, reminiscent of Sauvignon Blanc, suggests that the more adventurous might wish to try it with an array of farm cheeses,   especially goat.
Name: David Hill 2007 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pinot Gris can often show a little bit of a tawny blush, as it's a fairly dark-skinned white grape, but this is downright coppery, like a French Rosé. It's closer to an Oregon style than to other Washington Pinot Gris, with fleshy pear-flavored fruit and light hints of cinnamon and baking spices. Gets off to a good start, then falls away quite rapidly into a quick, generic finish.
Name: Maryhill 2007 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Erath's white wines are crisp and clean, if a bit simple. Light fruit flavors suggest apple more than pear, set against tart acids. This is a lean style, all stainless, perfectly drinkable but undistinguished.
Name: Erath 2007 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Though better than the 2006, this shows no varietal character; it's charmless and empty. Acid and alcohol, with a lightly lemony middle; it could be anything.
Name: Firesteed 2007 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has appealing lightness and clarity; crisp and varietally defined fruit that is elegant and focuses. Flavors of beeswax, lemon, lime and honey are pure and lingering, yet the wine feels light as a feather. It suggests that this will become a very important source for lighter, European-style white wines from Washington.
Name: Tsillan Cellars 2007 Estate Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This affordable, straightforward white wine is fresh and crisp, buoyed up with tart acids and flavors of citrus rind, pears, and green apples. It has a bit more concentration than its budget-priced Washington competitors, and the vibrant, clean fruit flavors match well with a wide variety of summer dishes.
Name: Hogue 2007 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is quite crisp and clean, with fairly typical flavors for Washington Pinot Gris. Which is to say, not nearly as fleshy as the wines from Oregon, with less of the juicy pear character. There's plenty of acid, more like green apple than ripe pear. It's a soundly made wine, clean and fresh, but less varietally distinctive than one would hope for.
Name: Mercer 2007 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Just recently bottled, this young Pinot Gris needs airing out. As it breathes the scents of cut pear and apple come out from under their blanket of SO2. It's crisp, fresh and flavored with not-quite-ripe melon and green fruits.
Name: Columbia Winery 2007 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Nicely made, this enters the palate with confidence and strikes a juicy pose, layered with white peach, apricot and pear. The fruit flavors gather strength in the midpalate, dappling in bits of baking spice, cinnamon and custard, and then gently fading into a smooth, supple finish. Classy winemaking here; this is a lovely, fruit-driven bottle with extra dimensions of texture and spice.
Name: Rex Hill 2006 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A Pinot Gris that goes the extra mile, with good definition of flavors, notably lots of spice and citrus rind. Edgy, tart and racy, yet also full-bodied, it shows good persistence and a sense of layers, not just length.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
