Description: Boasts some interesting flavors of graphite or slate, and mineral oil, which complement its pear and kumquat aromas. Could use more focus and length, but certainly pleasant; chilling it well will make it seem firmer.
Name: Bolla 2001 Arcale Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Rather simple but cleanly made, with pear and pineapple fruit in a medium-bodied format. Not for wine-geek contemplation, rather for casual drinking with grilled fish or chicken.
Name: Villa Sandi 2001 Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Description: Aging, with shellac and mineral-spirits aromas and flavors creeping in over the pear and mint. Drink up.
Name: Furlan 2000 Castelcosa Pinot Grigio (Friuli)

Description: A bit rough and rustic, but packs in plenty of sweet pear-nectar flavors dusted with dried spices.
Name: Gaierhof 2001 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: A minty nose blends in some floral and citrus scents as well, giving this light-bodied wine some interest. Flavors are minty, too, verging on wintergreen, and finishing clean and fresh.
Name: Nando 2001 Pinot Grigio (Isonzo del Friuli)

Description: Light but clean, with aromas of anise, pears and green apples and modest flavors of pear, watermelon rind and lime.
Name: Soldo 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Description: Smells strongly of lemongrass, and this character carries over onto the palate, which is flavored by lemon, pear and herbs. Feels a bit heavy in the mouth, but finishes clean and lemony.
Name: La Villa Veneta 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Description: Yes, it's light, but it's also clean and fresh, blending pear and lime flavors pleasantly into a decent apéritif.
Name: Fontana Candida 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Description: Light and lean pear fruit, with subtle lime notes and a hint of sweetness appearing on the finish.
Name: San Giuseppe 2002 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Description: While there's a decent amount of weight to this wine—enough to stand up to food—the flavors seem a bit dilute, showing only hints of almond and melon.
Name: Lagaria 2001 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: The color is very light, and so are the flavors. Although it lacks intensity, this faintly lemony wine is crisp, clean and moderately refreshing.
Name: Torresella 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Description: Just what consumers expect at this level of Pinot Grigio: a light, refreshing wine with pear, apple and citrus aromas and flavors.
Name: Cielo 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Description: Shows the ill effects of age on this style of wine already. The vibrant, fresh fruit is fading, being replaced by some dusty spice notes.
Name: Santi 2001 Sortesele Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: A deep gold color sends up warning flags, and the flavors bear that out. Has simple apple flavors with a touch of shellac and no depth. Kosher.
Name: Bartenura 2000 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Description: A bizarre blend of lime, unipe pineapple, banana and tropical fruit marks this clumsy, disjointed wine. It's not bad, but it's all elbows, with hard edges sticking out all over.
Name: San Giuseppe 2001 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

Description: Tired and fading, this wine's better days are already behind it. Stewed apples turn lemony on the finish.
Name: Bolla 2001 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: With flavors of unripe pineapple and a jarringly tart finish, you might not object if a friend handed you a plastic cup of this at a poolside party, but you probably wouldn't search out the label either.
Name: Sartori 2002 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Appellation: Friuli Venezia Giulia, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: How can a wine that smells so citrusy seem so low in acidity? Some pleasantly zesty aromas of lemons and unripe pears turn into fat, low-acid flavors.
Name: Candoni 2001 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Venezia Giulia)

Description: The tint is gold but browning, indicating that this may already be fading. The cinnamon-and-apples nose with hints of shoe leather requires patience if you are to enjoy it, while the palate of sweet applesauce, honey and dried apricot is intriguing if not overly fresh. Drink now for the rich flavors; but even current drinking will reveal a low-acid flatness that negates balance.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2000 Sparr Prestige Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of petrol adds a rawness to the basic apple and pear aromas on the bouquet. Flavors of apple and pear follow the nose's lead, while the finish is lean and tart. This is basic Pinot Gris with a good mouthfeel and adequate freshness, but not much resounding character.
Name: Josmeyer 2000 Le Fromenteau Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of applesauce and cheddar cheese kick things off. The next phase is some tangy apple flavors, which carry over onto the finish. This is an ordinary wine that lacks definition. Which doesn't mean that it's bad; just basic.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2001 Reserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of apples and little else comprise the bouquet. Some dry apple flavor carries the palate prior to a tangy, citrusy finish that runs fast due to powerful acidity. While the mouthfeel is fine, there is little character or complexity to take it any further.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2001 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This precision-crafted pinot Gris is a blend of grapes from three excellent vineyards, all cropped down to about two tons per acre, what the winemaker rightly calls “ridiculously low for Pinot Gris.” Flavors are pineapple and pear, proportionately balanced against just-right natural acids and tannins. Hints of honey, caramel and spice complete the show. Best Buy. —P.G.
Name: Sineann 2001 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Here is a solid, Oregon style Pinot Gris, with lots of rich, ripe pear and apple-flavored fruit. There is a sweet butterscotch tilt to the back end, making for an unusually rich, almost tropical finish. Best Buy. —P.G.
Name: Chehalem 2001 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Rob Stuart, formerly with Erath vineyards, is the winemaker. The first release for this new brand recalls his Erath days with its fleshy, ripe pear flavors. Some cinnamon spice adds interest. The wine is open and rich; solidly made. —P.G.
Name: Big Fire 2001 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: A fresh, clean and very satisfying effort from this value brand. A pale bronze blush color sets off a pear fruit explosion, ripe and well made.
Name: Stone Wolf 2001 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Name: Ponzi 2001 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Once you get past the tanky scents and let the wine breathe, it is a perfectly fine, simple bottle of fruit-forward Pinot Gris. One-dimensional, but sound.
Name: Château Bianca 2001 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The opening of ripe pears and apples seems right on the money, however, the palate is a bit overzealous and spritzy, with sharper than expected orange, grapefruit and lemon flavors. This wine exemplifies the overt, lively style of Pinot Gris, but it's one-dimensional and lacks subtlety. —M.S.
Name: Sokol Blosser 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The sweet, pleasant nose has plenty of citrus and tropical fruit. One whiff gets you excited. But the palate is nonexpressive, offering just the basics in terms of apples and spice. The finish, meanwhile, turns round and heavy, with no acid backbone to speak of. In the end you wind up wondering what happened to the promise of the bouquet. —M.S.
Name: Hinman 2001 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: At first the nose is innocuous, but with patience you get some pear and vanilla. But with this wine first impressions are correct; the palate is flat as a board with only distant dried stone-fruit flavors. There's just no life or zip to speak of. Maybe it's too warm for Pinot Gris in southern Oregon. —M.S.
Name: Griffin Creek 2001 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: . The wine's pale translucence is a fair indicator of what's coming next, which is not much. Light citrus and canned-fruit aromas portend a dilute palate. The finish is mildly bitter, with little more than white pepper. Oregon has proven itself capable of producing Pinot Gris with more guts than this. —M.S.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2001 Founders' Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A wine full of spicy aromas, along with lemon sorbet. The palate is crisp, quite green, with high acidity. A crisply refreshing, simple wine that leaves a fine, clean aftertaste.
Name: Weinbau Zahel 2001 Trocken Pinot Grigio Pinot Grigio (Weinviertel)

Designation: Selection des Grains Nobles Clos Jebsal
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2000 Selection des Grains Nobles Clos Jebsal Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2000 Vendange Tardive Clos Windsbuhl Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2000 Selection des Grains Nobles Heimbourg Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2000 Vendange Tardive Clos Jebsal Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2000 Selection des Grains Nobles Rotenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2000 Grand Cru Clos Saint Urbain Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2000 Clos Windsbuhl Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2000 Vendange Tardive Herrenweg de Turckheim Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2000 Vielles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the newest wine in the Chateau's ever-expanding lineup, and it shows the rising importance of Pinot Gris in Washington. Perfect varietal flavors set on the border of apple and pear, along with fresh acids and a nice lift from the natural spice of the grape.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2001 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pinot Gris is starting to have a presence in Washington, and the straightforward, citrus-flavored fruit shown here suggests a middle-of-the-road style. It's a tart, palate-cleaning wine with a hint of citrus-rind bitterness in the finish.
Name: Columbia Winery 2000 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are clean and varietal, and the fruit follows along with pleasant, light pear and apple flavors, buoyed by tangy acids.
Name: Pontin del Roza 2000 Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)

Description: I don't know anyone making better Pinot Gris in Oregon than this premiere property. Rich, ripe, round and sensuous, this lush and textured wine unwraps its ripe fruit in layers of pear/apricot flavor, enhanced with bright spice and finished with flavors of vanilla cream.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2001 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This is the first reserve for Bridgeview. It's a block selection, treated the same as their regular bottling; i.e., all stainless, no malolactic. That said, it has an extra dimension, good texture, more elegance and lovely fruit.
Name: Bridgeview 2000 Reserve Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A really nice wine, refreshing and light, with delicate lemon-grapefruit flavors complexed with creamy lees. The acidity is very crisp and assertive. No discernible oak at all, and with this pretty fruit and structure, it doesn't need any.
Name: Oak Knoll 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The treatment here is fermentation in stainless steel, and the wine shows ripe, tart, tangy fruit. Mostly melon and kiwi flavors, good weight on the palate, and little if any oak.
Name: Torii Mor 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The fruit shows pears, some high tones, some bitter rind. The style is fruit forward, with flavors of pears and citrus, leading to a light, toasty finish.
Name: Valley View 1999 Anna Maria Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: Smells very bright, with alluring lemon, cocoa and grass aromas. The flavors veer to citrus fruits, apricots and sweet white chocolate, and linger through the longish finish. Yet it's basically a dry wine.
Name: Dundee Springs 1999 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Crisp and clean, stainless steel-fermented, yet showing a lot of tropical fruit in the nose, and a touch (half a percent) of residual sugar. Banana, mango and citrus flavors are there, along with plenty of acidity. Interesting, but not particularly varietal.
Name: Girardet 2000 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Smells white peppery and oily—like canola oil. Flavors are honey and diesel oil, but it's not sweet, just thick and full-bodied. Finishes with some alcoholic warmth and peppery spice.
Name: Canterbury House 2000 Pinot Gris (Waipara)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A tawny-blush color, a prettily-scented wine redolent of apples and pears, this is a tasty, no-frills bottle of slightly spicy, tart white wine perfect for the deck or porch. Best Buy.
Name: Willow Crest 2000 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: A winning effort from this budget producer. It starts with a fine-tuned, lightly spicy bouquet, leading into appealing apple/pear flavors. Crisp and spicy, with good fleshy fruit and a lingering flavor of cinnamon, nicely set off with just the right amount of acid. Best Buy. —P.G
Name: Erath 2000 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There is an attractive, creamy mouthfeel to this Pinot Gris, which showcases fresh citrus fruit with spicy vanilla flavors coming from the barrel aging. It's a beautifully balanced, precision-tooled effort that is big but avoids palate fatigue by staying light on its feet. —P.G.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2000 Founder's Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Cooper Mountain grows organic grapes and does well by them, as this fresh, ripe Pinot Gris shows. There's a hint of vitamin pill and waxy lemon in the bouquet, then it's all about vivid pear and green apple fruit. Plenty of weight and texture fill the mouth, and acid buoys the finish. —P.G.
Name: Cooper Mountain 2000 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Here is a straightforward rendering of Pinot Gris, with tart, tangy citrus fruit leading to a clean, crisp finish. Solid and flavorful, though completely one dimensional. —P.G.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There is good, solid fruit here, as can be expected from this quality producer, but the problem seems to be an excess of sulfur, and it spoils the nose. It also bleeds into the palate, with harsh burnt match flavors overriding the fleshy fruit and citrus components. Swirl it, decant it, anything to let it breathe, and you'll be rewarded. —P.G.
Name: Bethel Heights 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The nose lifts off with unusual scents of pears, brown sugar and graham crackers. The wine is crisp and full-bodied, and the ripe, tropical fruits carry a slight impression of canned syrup, making it all taste a bit like fruit salad. —P.G.
Name: Adelsheim 2000 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There's a distinctly tawny shade to this wine, a scent of beer, and the flavors show a bit of oxidation. Simple and somewhat watery, it finishes with the tastes of apple and pear tarts, a hint of honey, and a good bit of acid. —P.G
Name: Montinore 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Whatever magic Foris works with its Pinot Gris is wonderfully captured in this near-perfect effort. Vibrant and fruity, clean and forward, it is softly scented with fragrant pears and citrus zest. Somehow it is both big and rich, yet still elegant and balanced, with true varietal character. Best Buy.
Name: Foris 2000 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: This excellent property has been a leader in Oregon Pinot Gris and Pinot Blanc since its inception. The new Gris is a delicious and spicy bottling, with tart, vivid fruit that leaves a clean, racy impression in the mouth. Lean and inviting.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 2000 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Okay class, all together now, a vireton is “the feather on an arrow that causes it to spin in flight.” A Pinot Gris dominated blended white that also includes some Chardonnay (12%) and Pinot Blanc (8%). Rich and lush with peachy/apricot flavors, this is a ripe, tropical wine, well-made with a complexity more characteristic of Chardonnay.
Name: Archery Summit 2000 Vireton Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Chehalem aims for a crisp, Alsatian style of Pinot Gris, blending fruit from all three estate vineyards, then fermenting in stainless steel. There's an elegant balance here, with palate-refreshing acid. A natural fit with food.
Name: Chehalem 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Here is a fine effort, widely available (12,000 cases) and well-priced. Stainless steel fermented, it shows crisp, varietal flavors of ripe pear, augmented with a hint of cinnamon. Good focus and length. Best Buy.
Name: Firesteed 2000 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Henry Estate is not known for its Pinot Gris because this is only the second year they have produced any significant quantity. It's a light blush-colored, musk-scented wine, with plenty of pear fruit and spice, good flesh and a crisp follow-through.
Name: Henry Estate 1999 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Though it was barrel-fermented in previously used Burgundian barrels, the flavor of expensive new oak dominates this buttery effort. If rich and toasty is what you want, this is for you. It's well-made, but it could just as easily be a Chardonnay.
Name: Lemelson 1999 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A huge improvement over their previous vintage, this Pinot Gris feels good and fleshy in the mouth, smells of citrus rind and herbs. It has plenty of lively fruit, and a pleasant hint of sweetness in the finish.
Name: Winter's Hill 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Nice effort, with fresh, snappy stone fruits, augmented with a bit of spice and a hint of honey. This is a firm, tart, food-friendly wine, with a clean, lemony finish. Best Buy.
Name: Hogue 2000 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: An unusual style, with light scents of fennel leading into intriguing flavors of caraway, arugula and pear. However, after a promising start, the wine fades quickly into a light, tart finish.
Name: Carabella 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Elk Cove wines usually lead with the fruit, and this is no exception. Fleshy and ripe, there is an unusual, pine-scented edge that gives it definition in the mouth, though it adds some nonvarietal flavors to the mix.
Name: Elk Cove 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All from a single vineyard, this very tart wine shows green apple fruit, hints of coconut, and a bit of toast on the finish. Just 205 cases were produced.
Name: Adea 1999 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Light and refreshing, this no-frills version offers crisp, neutral flavors of green apples and melon. Despite the fact that Bridgeview is in hot-climate southern Oregon, their style of Pinot Gris is considerably leaner than those from up north.
Name: Bridgeview 2000 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There are scents of fresh pears in the nose, along with a Riesling-like whiff of kerosene. The color suggests that this is maturing rapidly, and should be consumed quickly. The finish shows plenty of heat, and a somewhat chemical taste.
Name: Whidbey Island Winery 2000 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: It is too bad that the winery seems to have overloaded this wine with sulfites; it's pleasant enough otherwise, and sells for less than most Oregon Pinot Gris. But the scent and taste of burnt match gives a bitter edge to the fruit, and buries the nose.
Name: Ashland Vineyards 1999 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This starts off with a creamy, spicy mouthfeel, but leads to somewhat bitter fruit. Once swallowed, the flavors become somewhat chemical, and the wine feels flat and out of balance. Perhaps a bad bottle?
Name: Paschal 1999 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Duck Pond produces inexpensive wines that are generally estate grown. This is a simple, tart Pinot Gris, with a sugary nose, and it falls a bit flat in the mouth. Though the wine is made quite dry, there is an impression of sweetness in the finish.
Name: Duck Pond 2000 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Granville has missed the mark with this ultralight effort, which is not just thin, but feels dead flat in the mouth, and bitter to boot. What happened?
Name: Granville 2000 Holstein Vineyard Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: For a crisp, fresh white that dances with fish or shrimp, look no further. The wine saw some malolactic fermentation and even less barrel fermentation, but both are noticeable in the round body. As far as aromas and flavors, it's citrusy, emphasizing grapefruit and orange rind. In many ways it's akin to Sauvignon Blanc; steely and lean, but hardly weak.
Name: Mt. Difficulty 2000 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Description: About 22% of the fruit is from the Celilo vineyard in Washington, hence the dual appellation. Despite the carpetbagger grapes, or maybe because of them, this is superb wine. Intense, ripe and concentrated with a beautiful blend of citrus and mineral elements. The finish, which adds nuts and smoke to the above, is a dead ringer for good French Chablis, and the finish goes on for miles. Editors' Choice.
Name: Cristom 1998 Oregon/Washington Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Umbrian Pinot Grigio may not be as well known as the crisp, elegant (and pricey) wines from veneto, but for six bucks you get a plump, round, fruity dleight, with true varietal character.  Its fresh, sweet pears, weightier and less steely thatn the versions from norther Italy, end in a clean, full finish.
Name: Stella 2000 Pinot Grigio (Umbria)

Description: Pinot Gris has really caught on with consumers, because it can be delicious with so many different foods, but particularly with Pacific Northwest halibut and salmon. This is a well-crafted, straightforward version, with the characteristic pear fruit and a certain “graininess” in the mouth. The price seems a little ambitious, given the competition.
Name: Eugene Wine Cellars 1999 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Washington Pinot Gris is seldom seen — the bragging rights having been claimed by Oregon — but this appealing wine makes a good argument for more. Full, fleshy, pear-flavored fruit is perfectly balanced with refreshing acids. It's a big, bold style that finishes with a hint of bitter rind.
Name: Chatter Creek 2000 Pinot Gris (Washington)

Description: A luscious wine with considerable residual sugar that manages to stay balanced because of its healthy acid levels. The rich pear and citrus flavors are thick in texture. Stylistically, this is reminiscent of Zind-Humbrecht's vieilles vignes bottling from Alsace.
Name: Dry River 1999 Pinot Gris (New Zealand)

Description: An impressive debut release for this bottling, which boasts juicy ripe-peach aromas. The cantaloupe-like palate is soft and smooth and the wine goes down easy, with just enough acidity on the finish to keep it fresh.
Name: Selaks 2000 Drylands Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Mild aromas of peaches and nectarines lead into a fairly full-bodied wine that ends with notes of grapefruit and lemon.
Name: Kim Crawford 2000 Boyzown Vineyard Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This single-vineyard wine captures plenty of varietal character in its waxy pear and melon aromas. A medium-bodied wine, with a crisp, slightly spicy-bitter finish, it should prove versatile with food or as an apéritif.
Name: Fairhall Downs 2000 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: Hard to believe that first-crop fruit went into this wine. Peaches, honey, nuts on the nose; lime and white stone fruits on the palate. Good acidity and a bit of black pepper on the finish. Limited availability.
Name: Isabel Estate 2000 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: A unique-tasting wine that mixes minty herbs with nectarines, oranges and red appleskin. It's off-dry, and in no need of aging. 400 cases imported.
Name: Grove Mill 2000 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: A bit muted on the nose, but this wine scores points for its bold flavors of peach and citrus and oily texture. Flirts with sweetness, with 8g/L (0.8%) residual sugar.
Name: Kumeu River 2000 Pinot Gris (Kumeu)

Description: Starts out soft, with warm peach and nectarine notes that turn leaner and more citric on the finish, even folding in a touch of green pepper.
Name: Palliser Estate 2000 Pinot Gris (Martinborough)

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Something of a misnomer, as this wine tastes more like many Alsatian Pinot Gris than the often-insipid Grigios of Italy. Honey and apricot aromas, big and buttery on the palate; the only drawback is the lack of length to the finish, possibly a function of young vines.
Name: Duck Walk 1998 Pinot Grigio (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A clean, crisp, citrusy wine that lacks the rich texture found in the best Alsatian Pinot Gris, but still packs in a lot of tart, lemony flavors. Good shellfish wine.
Name: Lenz 1998 Pinot Gris (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: There's a funky, waxy edge to this wine that adds complexity to its honeyed melon, lime and pear aromas and flavors. It's quite full-bodied, and carries a bit of residual sugar as well, making it a prime candidate to match with mild curries and the like.
Name: Rieflé 1996 Steinert Tokay Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Honey and pears on the nose. Bone dry, this wine offers bracing acidity, a crisp fruity core, good focus, and a hint of vanilla on the finish. Very pretty nose; fine food wine.
Name: Seven Hills 1999 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Features honeyed, overripe melons that carry only a hint of botrytis. Quite sweet and rich, it's forward, showing plenty of charm while lacking the depth and backbone to improve. Drink now.
Name: Rieflé 1996 Selection de Grains Nobles Tokay Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light and grapefruity, without much Pinot Gris character. An innocuous, fairly generic white wine.
Name: Columbia Winery 1998 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: Vintage after vintage this exciting winery nails it with its Gris, which captures aromas of pear and ripe melon, infuses them with cloves and spice, and freshens the palate with a zesty, leesy texture. Low yields, great soil and long, slow fermentation are the keys to its success.
Name: WillaKenzie Estate 1999 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Friuli Venezia Giulia, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Unlike a transluscent soda-style P.G., this one has some gray color and immediately shows richness in the nose. Peach and apricot flavors are clean and supported by butter and vanilla bean. Lime and slate work nicely together on the finish. Overall it's smooth and stylish, and earns its stripes. Pricey by Pinot Grigio standards, but worth it.
Name: Livio Felluga 1999 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Venezia Giulia)

Description: The watery color belies this wine's pure fragrance of Anjou pears and citrus fruits. Fresh and clean, this simple light white is perfect for serving on the patio.
Name: Carlo Boscaini 1999 La Cros Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

Description: Lanolin, pineapple and honeysuckle aromas. Pretty full-bodied, with some strength and warmth on the palate. Focused and sound on the finish, with lemon-lime present. A worthy alternative white, it'll do best with chicken dishes and appetizers.
Name: Alois Lageder 1998 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Lemons, figs and a creamy banana element are all over the nose and palate. Just the right charge of acidity keeps it spry. There's good viscosity and it goes nicely with a sandwich of country ham, greens and Dijon mustard. Full and long in the mouth, this is a nice California white, but with limits.
Name: Morgan 1998 Pinot Gris (Monterey)

Description: Brings back fond (really) memories of canned pears in heavy syrup. Sweet, and not particularly acidic for an ice wine. Well made, just lacking a bit of complexity. Should work well with almond-based desserts.
Name: King Estate 1998 Vin Glace Pinot Gris (California)

Appellation: Yamhill County, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: An excellent wine from the excellent 1998 vintage in Oregon. Fresh-cut hay, honey, a whiff of mint and some green herbs on the nose will raise your curiosity. Plenty of force and body; it straddles the line between the steely Italian style and the more exotic Alsatian style.
Name: Torii Mor 1998 Pinot Gris (Yamhill County)

Description: Zesty and zippy. Absent are the lean grapefruit and bitter-almond flavors common to this varietal; they've been benched for a fuller-bodied style with texture and orange and tangerine qualities. Best lightly chilled, it's the perfect foil for cheese.
Name: La Famiglia di Robert Mondavi 1997 Pinot Grigio (California)
